title: Designer Graphique
description:
Client ID: 5211

Designer Graphique

Dans le cadre de ses ententes avec ses différents clients, Procom est actuellement à la recherche d’un Designer Graphique pour une entreprise dans le domaine bancaire. Notre client est situé à Montréal.


Description des tâches et responsabilités – Designer Graphique

Les responsabilités du poste incluent :

- Concevoir et décliner des concepts visuels (campagnes publicitaires et promotionnelles ou autres initiatives) adaptés à différents supports numériques et imprimés (bannières Web, médias sociaux, brochures, etc.);
- Produire des pièces de contenu marketing selon les gabarits et grilles graphiques établis (livres électroniques, infographies, études etc.);
- Concevoir ou produire des outils de communication ou du matériel promotionnel en utilisant les divers gabarits établis (présentations PPT, brochures, formulaires, etc.);
- Participer aux séances de remue-méninges pour développer des concepts précis et faire évoluer la marque;
- Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les autres membres de l'équipe créative et les différentes équipes internes.


Exigences du poste – Designer Graphique

- Minimum de trois années d’expérience pertinente en agence ou en entreprise;
- Excellente maîtrise d’In Design, de Photoshop et d’Illustrator;
- Connaissance des meilleure pratiques médias sociaux et publicités;
- DEC en graphisme ou en infographie OU expérience équivalente;
- Connaissance de html5 ou de l’animation graphique (un atout);
- Rigueur et rapidité d'exécution;
- Créativité, sens de l'esthétisme et dynamisme;
- Grand souci du détail;
- Capacité à gérer plusieurs projets en même temps, le tout en établissant l’ordre de priorité de la charge de travail pour respecter des échéanciers serrés;
- Capacité à travailler sous pression;
- Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais.


Type de poste
Contractuel 12 mois avec de fortes possibilités de renouvellement.

Date de début
Immédiatement

Numéro de référence
BH338286

title: 7294 - Painters
description:
7294 - Painters

title: Painter
description:
Responsibilities:

  • Perform all functions pertaining to the painting of valves as per the production standards or work instructions provided.
  • Participate in coordinating work schedule for Paint and Prep area.

 Duties Include:

  • Prepare products for painting and paint products as per applicable Production standards and Work Instructions.
  • Sandblast product as required.
  • Ensure adherence to quality control standards.
  • Maintain cleanliness of painting and blasting area.
  • Maintenance of equipment.
  • Perform other duties as required.

Qualifications:

  • Two or more years of industrial painting experience (manufacturing environment preferred)
  • Experience using Epoxy coatings
  • WHIMS knowledge and training
  • Forklift and Crane Training
  • Strong interpersonal skills and capable of working with minimal supervision
  • Solid work ethic and the ability to work effectively in a team environment
  • A commitment to workplace health and safety and quality policy and objectives

Master Flo offers a competitive salary, profit sharing and a comprehensive benefit program to prospective employees, as well as the opportunity to work in an entrepreneurial environment, characterized by continued growth and strong business results.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However only those candidates identified for further consideration will be contacted.

title: Illustrator
description:
Secret Location's Digital Preschool division is an empowered product team which values communication, collaboration, and fun. Our primary goal and purpose is to create preschool apps that boost meaningful screen time for children, parents, and caregivers. As part of the larger eOne and Hasbro family, our digital brand portfolio includes the widely popular preschool app World of Peppa Pig, which has claimed the #1 spot in its category in over 20 countries since launch, as well as superhero hit PJ Masks: Hero Academy.  

About the job  

Secret Location is hiring a 2D Illustrator / Animator who will work closely with product teams on numerous mobile apps to assist and develop digital learning experiences for preschoolers. Using your solid knowledge of illustration and animation and your ability to adapt to different artistic styles, you will be instrumental in delivering outstanding preschool games and apps.  

Working with the Creative Director on the creative team, the role will collaborate with other team members to craft and deliver amazing mobile application experiences.  

Why would you want to work with us? 

We are going to have a whole lot of fun! As a 2D Illustrator / Animator, you'll become an integral member of the creative team crafting games and activities with a hardworking group. You'll be empowered to turn the creative strategy into fun, engaging, and relevant games for preschoolers! 

Responsibilities: 

  • Create visual designs and illustrations for content and align to brand style guides. 
  • Work with the team to create age-appropriate game-based experiences. 
  • Work cross-functionally with product design to create a seamless and pleasant and age-appropriate user experience 
  • Collaborate with the product team to develop/plan and implement engaging learning experiences that align with business and product objectives. 
  • Create 2D animations for games and activities. 
  • Perform visual design audits, as needed. 
  • Stay current on trends and methodologies designing for children, as well as relevant competitors' products. 
  • Outstanding communication skills, especially in writing, with an emphasis on clarity, organization, and precision 

Required Qualifications 

  • Bachelor's degree or College diploma in design or related field (or sufficient professional experience). 
  • Portfolio that includes animation samples and illustrations and design samples from web or mobile games. 
  • Experience using a variety of design tools and principles. 

You get a gold star if you... 

  • Have experience designing for preschool-aged children at different developmental stages. 

Secret Location is committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment. We are committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, or any other legally protected status. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodation needed to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process. 

We thank everyone for their interest but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. 

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Materials Artist
description:
Company Description

Created in 2008, DONTNOD is an independent French studio which creates and develop AA games in various genres : adventure (Life is Strange, Tell Me Why, Twin Mirror), action (Remember Me) and RPG (Vampyr). Each new game is an original creation with unique narrative gameplay experience and game mechanics.

In 2020, DONTNOD expanded internationally by creating its first branch in Montreal.

Job Description

Why join us?

  • You're interested in participating in the creation of a Substance team within DONTNOD whose objective will be to improve the efficiency of our production chain and the graphic quality of our games;
  • You want to join a diverse and committed team, both in its culture and in the content of the games it creates;
  • You're looking for an opportunity to work directly with all production teams in Paris and Montreal;
  • You want to join an innovative studio with a rich and unique management structure.

What you'll be doing?

As part of the development of one of our projects, DONTNOD is looking for a Materials Artist to strengthen the Substance team present in Paris and Montreal.

Under the Substance Lead, your role will be to create the materials for all of our games through Substance suite.

Your mission will be to :

  • work closely with the Substance Lead and Art Leads of each project;
  • create and maintain libraries of high-quality PBR materials;
  • ensure that materials respect the artistic style and technical specificities of each project;
  • be responsible for quality control of textures between projects;
  • collaborate with the project artists to understand their needs, suggest textures, participate in their integration into the game engine and their application on 3D models;
  • understand and assist in the development and implementation of textures production pipelines;
  • find creative solutions to production challenges related to the creation of materials;
  • participate in the research and development of new technologies;
  • document and share knowledge about best practices.
Qualifications

The must-have skills we're looking for

  • At least 1 year of experience as a Texture Artist / Materials Artist having used Substance Designer and Substance Painter on a daily basis;
  • A strong understanding of creating realistic textures under Substance Designer, Painter and Zbrush;
  • A solid understanding of artistic fundamentals and a strong attention to detail and form;
  • A mastery of PBR artistic pipelines and real-time constraints;
  • Skills in UVs unfolding and baking high-resolution models;
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills (English and French);
  • Ability to collaborate iteratively and constructively as a team;
  • The ability to be proactive and autonomous;
  • Creative, curious and versatile, you like to vary between several texture styles (stylized, realistic, etc.)

What would set you apart?

  • A mastery of Zbrush and good sculpting skills;
  • Experience with Unreal 4 or 5;
  • Mastery of 3DS max, Maya or Blender;
  • Proficiency in Photoshop.


Additional Information

At DONTNOD, we celebrate diversity and inclusivity within our games as well as our teams. We commit to equal opportunities and non-discrimination in our hiring process. We are respectful of the principles of equal employment opportunities, and that is why we encourage women, people of all sexual orientations and gender identities, First Nations people, people living with a disability and/or part of any marginalized group to apply for our positions.

We build close-knit teams to encourage a fulfilling work environment for all our employees.

Here is a small overview of what we offer to our employees :

  • The possibility of working anywhere in Quebec;
  • Flexible schedules;
  • Free access to a brand new gym and group classes and to a multi-sports field in summer which becomes an ice rink in winter;
  • Partial refund of the STM/RTM card;
  • A complete group insurance plan and an integrated health platform.

title: $18- $26 per hour - Painters full time
description:
Painters needed for the Halifax- Dartmouth Area

Elite Trade Painting has been providing high quality painting services to thousands of customers throughout Halifax and the surrounding area since 1991. We are proud to be a company that homeowners and businesses trust and use as their preferred painting contractor. We are currently hiring full time Painters and Forepersons to join our growing team of skilled and knowledgeable staff. We are looking for:

• Painting’ experience 

• Positive attitudes

• Staff that can supply their own transportation

·   WHMIS 

·   Working at heights and safety training and experience is an asset

·   First aid knowledge and certification is an asset

 

As part of our production team, we offer you: 

• Competitive wages ranging from $18-$26 per hour 

·   Wages that are dependent on skill level

• The opportunity to work 40 plus hours per week 

Perks of the position include:

• Full time year round work

• Working in both commercial and residential projects

• Room for advancement and skill development


• Well organized work environment 

• Consistent reliable income

This is a great opportunity to become part of a well-structured and growing company!

We reward hard work and dedicated employees! 

Apply now!

title: Lighting Artist
description:
Company Description

At CD PROJEKT RED Vancouver, our mission is to create world-class interactive entertainment experiences. Located in one of the biggest video game hubs in the world, Vancouver, Canada, we are an inclusive, multicultural team of driven and talented professionals that fosters cross-disciplinary collaboration and honest conversations. We push gameplay boundaries. We build unforgettable narratives and stories. We make some of the best and most revered video games on the planet.

Job Description

CD PROJEKT RED is currently looking for a talented and experienced Lighting Artist who is ready to work on the cutting edge of game graphics technology. This position requires a high level of artistry and mastery of tools to achieve the best lighting results in an open world game. If you are equally at ease communicating with both people and tech, join us!

Daily responsibilities:

  • Creating dramatic and compelling lighting that supports photorealistic rendering
  • Deconstructing lighting and textures in a physically based renderer to establish appropriate colour correct values
  • Keeping artistic style consistent with defined visual style for the game
  • Collaborating and communicating constructively with Designers, Engineers and Technical Artists
  • Ensuring that all lighting deliverables are completed fully and in line with the production schedule.
Qualifications

  • At least 3 years experience in the role of Lighting / Environment Artist on AAA games or the CGI industry
  • Excellent knowledge of lighting tools and pipelines
  • Excellent knowledge of direct and indirect light, luminance and colour theory
  • Self-driven to complete assigned tasks in a timely manner while maintaining a high level of quality
  • Ability to define and meet a schedule
  • Strong attention to detail and quality
  • Work closely with other departments while creating and implementing assets
  • Excellent communication skills: We have a multilingual and multicultural working environment and the ability to communicate across language and time zone barriers is essential.


Additional Information

  • Competitive salary with project-based bonuses
  • Health benefits with an HSA account
  • Responsible work-life balance with flexible hours and paid overtime
  • 26 days of paid vacation per year
  • A modern indie-style studio with a relaxed atmosphere working on high-budget AAA Games
  • A chance to work in a booming industry within an international team
  • Office located near transit and bike routes.

title: Painter
description:
Cedar Gardens

The Painter will work closely with the Community Director and Service Manager to ensure that all the painting on the exterior walls and interior units is completed using the best product and in a timely manner.

Responsibilities include:
  • Painting interior make-ready units, an average of 6-8 per week
  • Paint exterior of building as needed
  • Respond to all service requests related to cosmetic painting repairs for occupied units in a timely manner
  • Keep paint department stocked with proper supplies at all times, while staying within budget
  • Perform daily inspection of property to ensure property upkeep and pristine curb appeal. Pick up and dispose of trash or litter as needed
  • Participate in an ongoing property improvement plan and preventive maintenance program
Qualifications:
  • Working knowledge of English, oral and written
  • Detail oriented, well organized and accurate
  • Requires a valid and current driver’s license and proof of insurance
  • Able to lift and carry (frequently) up to 45 pounds (paint, supplies)
  • Able to lift and carry (occasionally up to 80 pounds (freon recovery unit, freon tanks and other heavy equipment)
  • Able to push/pull up to 200 pounds, move appliances, use appliance dolly, move hot water tanks and other machinery and heavy equipment as needed
  • Able to work outdoors in all weather conditions

title: Painter
description:
Full/Part Time Spring and Summer Painting Positions

Looking for a summer job? Like working outdoors and staying active? Want a chance to earn $10,000 - $17,000 over the summer?We are looking for the hardest-working, most motivated students (or student-aged people) in Squamish who want to be a part of a very tight-knit group of awesome people who want to earn what they are worth.

 What will be expected of you: 

-Positive Attitude 

-Reliable Transportation 

-Ability to work from ladders 

-Ability to work with clients

 What benefits will you get? 

-Full training on how to paint the interior and exterior of homes/commercial buildings

- NO EXPERIENCE is required! We provide all the necessary training and equipment 

-Lots of $$$ to pay bills, tuition, etc. 

-Pay is +$20-$25/hour depending upon experience and efficiency

 You’d most likely start anytime mid-May to early June - perfect for college/university students after finals season! If this job sounds like the right fit for you then please email us and we will respond with you to set up an interview. 

Call or text me anytime @ 604-849-5558 for any questions you might have

Good Luck!!

title: Subway Sandwich Artist
description:
Company Description

Pilot Flying J is the 10th largest privately held company in North America with more than 28,000 team members. As the industry-leading network of travel centers, we have more than 950 retail and fueling locations in 44 states and six Canadian provinces. Our energy and logistics division is a top supplier of fuel, employing one of the largest tanker fleets and providing critical services to oil operations in our nation's busiest basins. Pilot Company supports a growing portfolio of brands with expertise in supply chain and retail operations, logistics and transportation, technology and digital innovation, construction, maintenance, human resources, finance, sales and marketing.

 

Founded in 1958, we are proud to be family owned and consider our team members to be part of the family. Our founding values, people-first culture and commitment to giving back remains true to us today. Whether we are serving guests, a fellow team member, or a trucking company, we are dedicated fueling people and keeping North America moving.

 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.


Pilot Flying J is part of the Pilot Company family of brands that keeps North America's drivers moving, including E-Z Trip, Mr. Fuel, One9 Fuel Stop, Pride, StaMart and Xpress Fuel.

Job Description

  • Provide guests fast, friendly, and clean service
  • Maintain inventory
  • Manage and prep food safely
  • Ensure top-notch quality in all our food products
  • Operate cash registers
  • Maintain the overall appearance and cleanliness of the restaurant
  • Provide excellent guest service

 

At Pilot Flying J, we fuel more than tanks – we fuel people. From our team members to our guests, we strive to make everyone’s journey better. As the largest travel center network and leading supplier of fuel, being part of the Pilot Flying J family means you are essential to keeping North America’s drivers moving.
What makes our travel centers a great place to work and shop? It starts with friendly people, a focus on teamwork and service, and a commitment to a safe and clean experience. Working together, we proudly provide the fuel, food and amenities that millions of travelers rely on to reach their destination. As a growth company, we are always looking for more incredible people to join our team. You bring the skills, drive to work hard and a friendly team spirit, and we’ll provide the training, benefits and opportunity to fuel your future.
We hope your next career stop is with us! Join our team and start your journey with Pilot Flying J. 

Pay Range: $15.00 up to $20.250000Qualifications

Required Qualifications

  • Incredible guest service skills and ability to maintain a guest focused culture
  • Ability to complete accurate sales transactions
  • Ability to cleanly and safely manage and prep food
  • Ability to maintain Subway processes and policies
  • Ability to use computers, telephones, and other equipment as needed
  • Ability to work as part of a team

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in a similar position
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule of nights, days, weekends, and holidays


Additional Information

  • Weekly Pay
  • RRSP (for Full Time Employees)
  • Extended Health Care Benefits (for Full Time Employees)
  • AD&D Insurance (for Full Time Employees)
  • Life Insurance (for Full Time Employees)
  • Adoption Assistance
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Extensive Training Program

title: Painter
description:
Love the outdoors and a job that changes from one day to the next? Hate it when you WORK HARD but make the same as the next guy? 

Then stop what you're doing, because we're hiring painters for 2022! This is a growing company based in the Georgian Bay/Muskoka region that is looking for painters to help complete projects.

Areas we Service: Penetanguishene, Midland, Tiny, Tay, Wasaga Beach, Collingwood, Parry Sound, Muskoka, Orillia, Port Severn, Shanty Bay, etc.

Benefits: The position is open to individuals who are hardworking, leader mentality and interested in the business world. There is an opportunity to learn the ins and outs of the business from a management level directly from the business owner throughout the year. 

  • The position includes:
    • Full-time hours
    • Bonus incentives
    • Autonomous work culture, with the ability for more responsibility/pay
    • Training and development will be provided as long as the candidate is coachable, hard-working and willing to learn. Trained to complete professional painting work for interior and exterior painting and staining
    • Teams bonding events (ex. paid dinners, cottage getaways, sports games, etc.)
    • Training, materials required to complete jobs, and shirts are supplied.

Requirements:

  • Valid driver’s license
  • Access to a vehicle to drive to and from sites
  • Reliable, flexible, dedicated, and possess a positive attitude
  • Ability to handle physical, labour intensive workload
  • Ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure
  • Willing to travel if required
  • Preferably some experience with hands-on work (No professional experience necessary), you will be trained on how to do paint/stain projects 
  • Full-time commitment (40-50 hours weekly)
  • Strong communication skills

Payment Structure:

  • We offer a base rate ranging from $16-30 /hour
  • High-performance bonuses available

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the overall completion of projects. Start to finish completion at a high standard of quality
  • Daily responsible for the cleanliness of site and project
  • Delivering quality and satisfaction through constant communication with homeowners and business owner
  • Manage day to day project tasks for properly providing services to clients 

Lakeridge Painting Muskoka provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Lakeridge Painting Muskoka complies with applicable provincial and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

title: Painter
description:
Our Painting Team is looking for highly motivated individuals to join our team this summer!

 

We are looking for the hardest-working, most efficient people in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, who want to join a family of awesome staff and team culture, who are looking to earn what they're worth, and have a great cash flow. The painter role is a fun and challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to get hands-on work experience. The ideal individual is hard-working, coachable, and has effective communication skills. 

Compensation: Top painters can make 20- 27$/hour; average rate is 18$/hour. Starting Rate is based on experience. Raises are based on proven skills after the start date.

About the position:

  • Fast-paced, fun environment
  • Training is provided; therefore, no experience is necessary
  • Hands-on experience in customer service and communication
  • Work outdoors with a crew of 2-3 like-minded people
  • This can lead to future promotion opportunities within the company. Leadership roles can be discussed if you feel like you would be a good fit.

What will be expected of you:

  • A great attitude ( we hire for attitude and train for skill )
  • Reliable Transportation ( job sites change frequently and can happen mid-day, you must be able to get around )
  • Motivation for money ( you truly get what you put into this company, we use a piece-rate system of pay which will be explained in the interview )
  • Ability to work from Ladders ( if heights are a problem for you, this job will not be a good fit for you )
  • Ability to work with Clients and represent our company responsibly
  • Ability to complete and provide certifications for training provided
  • Ability to ensure proper time management and punctuality ( lateness is not tolerated )

How does this position benefit me?:

  • Top-Notch Safety Training
  • Excellent Training on how to paint Interiors, Exteriors, Fences, and Decks
  • Plenty of opportunities to earn more by becoming a more efficient painter and through bonuses and prizes through the summer
  • Pay Exceeding 20$/hr for exemplary painters ( Starting rate is based on your experience, Raises are based on proven skill after start date ) 
  • Working with like-minded individuals
  • Mentorship during P.A.D. Meetings ( Performance, Availability, and Discussion ) 
  • A Great Reference to put on your resume

 

Roles Available:

  • Painter
    • This role is a fun but incredibly challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to get hands-on work experience and make money reflective of their efforts.
    • The ideal person for this role is Coachable, hardworking, and has effective communication skills.
    • Sometimes required to work long hours or at heights. Weather can be very warm during the summer, endurance is an asset
  • Crew Chief
    • In addition to painter responsibilities, you would gain experience in your leadership and management skills.
    • Additional Responsibilities would, of course, result in extra pay ( can be discussed upon an offer )
    • Additional Responsibilities include:
      • Moving Ladders and Equipment
      • Trips to the Paint Store
      • Motivating your team
      • Solving Client concerns
      • Training additional Painters
      • Managing other Job Sites
    • Bonuses and Incentives as well as pay increases provided for people in this position
    • If you're interested in a leadership role, please ask to be considered

If the position sounds like a good fit for you please apply, I can't wait to hear from you.

Working with friends is encouraged, so apply together if you wish!

title: Concept Artist - Generalist
description:
Yo!

We're a small team with big dreams - building an upcoming Battle Royale game aimed at casual players.

We're looking for a full-time generalist concept artist to join us. If you're someone who loves to work in a small team and want to have a big influence on the final game, then this opportunity is perfect for you.

We move fast and get sh*t done. Come join us before we get bought out by Tencent ;)

Check out the game we're building at https://bapbap.gg

Responsibilities

  • Create 2D mockups for environments
  • Create 2D concepts for characters
  • Assist in promotional art
  • Maintaining a style guide and visual library
  • Extremely self-motivated
  • Kickass portfolio
  • Passion for stylized art
  • Comfortable wearing multiple hats
  • Gamer with knowledge of multiplayer games (MOBAs, Battle Royales, etc)

title: Lookdev Artist
description:
Company Description

As a company founded and run by an artist, it's our mission to provide talented artists with the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.

Job Description

Only applicants located in the Vancouver or willing to relocate before their start date will be considered.

The Lookdev Artist creates shading to ensure that models and textures are combined into hyper-realistic assets, ensuring to meet the high quality standards of Rodeo FX.

Main responsibilities:

  • Develop looks to ensure assets can be properly lit and are technically correct to help create hyper-realistic passes;
  • Take assets from the texturing department and push surface qualities further in terms of realism;
  • Finalize assets technically and artistically, validating work with turntables and various tech checks;
  • Create lighting setups that become reference shots for sequences;
  • Set up Nuke scripts that will be used by the compositing and lighting department;
  • Set up and maintain a preset shader bank for different surface qualities;
  • Work closely with the CG and Asset Supervisor to find creative and technical solutions and approaches that enhance assets and shots, while meeting project specifications and deadlines;
  • May participate in the development of tools and techniques for the department;
  • Perform quality control on assets before they are submitted for review/approval, ensuring all technical and creative standards are met, and promptly apply notes received;
  • Keep Production and the project team informed of the status of work, issues to be resolved, ramifications of problems encountered and recommend potential solutions;
  • Ensure deadlines are met, advising the project team promptly if delays could be expected.
Qualifications

  • Experience in a similar position, within the VFX industry;
  • Excellent knowledge of Katana software and Nuke;
  • Good knowledge of Arnold; 
  • Excellent sense of prioritization and respect of deadlines.


Additional Information

  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Painter
description:
Are you a versatile Painter looking for a variety of different projects to keep you busy? Are you detail-oriented always holding yourself to a high standard? If you are someone who fits these traits and values quality and efficiency, we have an opportunity for you!

Broadstreet Properties Ltd. is looking to add a Painter to our team in Regina! As a Painter, you will be responsible for maintaining all aspects of the perception and appearance of our apartment and townhome properties. You will own the painting standards in all vacated apartments and other areas of our buildings and see that they are painted to "market ready" status in a timely manner.

Your contributions to the team include:

  • Inspecting and painting vacated apartments and completing required paperwork
  • Completing major repaint projects as directed by the Specialty Teams Supervisor including hallways, common areas and office space
  • Communicating with your supervisor concerning particular apartments that need painting in order of priority
  • Repairing all damages incurred in walls, caulks tubs and ceramic tile
  • Performing all tasks in a neat and efficient manner including cleaning all brushes, rollers and equipment and returning equipment to their designated storage facility at the end of each day
  • Performing other duties as required

What you need to be successful:

  • 2 yearsâ€™ experience in the painting trade
  • Knowledge of the tools, equipment, materials, and application techniques common to the painting trade
  • Skilled in the preparation and application of paints, stains, and surface preparation materials to a wide variety of surfaces
  • In good physical condition with mobility and flexibility to use ladders, access work in confined spaces, and lift up to 50 lbs
  • Well organized and work with a sense of urgency
  • Work well under pressure and maintain a pleasant demeanor under stress
  • Maintain a high standard of safety and cleanliness
  • Possess good communication skills and be able to accurately read and act on instructions
  • Willing and able to travel between sites
  • Proof of COVID-19 vaccination

The perks:

  • Employer paid extended health, vision, and dental coverage (including family)
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Yearly health and wellness benefit
  • RPP eligibility after one year
  • Employee recognition program

Why Broadstreet?

Broadstreet Properties is a family owned and operated property management company partnered with Seymour Pacific Developments to build apartment and townhome communities. We are a growing organization made up of diverse team members who are motivated to continuously innovate our approach to asset management. We consider employee wellbeing a priority and are dedicated to protecting the health and safety of our teams while ensuring a workplace that is respectful of everyone. Broadstreet Properties Ltd. practices equal opportunity hiring and onboarding processes and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees irrespective of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other status protected by law.

title: CFX Artist
description:
Job Title: CFX Artist

Department: CFX

Location: Work from Home/ 1179 King St. West, Suite 302               

Reports To:CFX Lead

                                            

 

THE COMPANY:

Sinking Ship Entertainment is a multiple award-winning production, distribution, and interactive company specializing in family and kidsâ€™ live action and CGI blended content. The company has earned a worldwide reputation for creating high-quality, groundbreaking original series and companion interactive experiences.

THE OPPORTUNITY:

Sinking Ship Entertainment is looking for a dynamic Character FX Artist. This position will allow for a passionate, creative, and innovative individual who loves creating high-quality character effects and Dynamic Simulations. Reporting directly to the Character FX Lead, this position requires an understanding of Cloth and Hair Simulation, general dynamics, and an Artistic eye for Human and Animal motion. Key to this role is the ability to cultivate an environment of trust and collaboration with the demand of hiring the best.

 WHAT WE NEED YOU TO DO

  • Simulate Hair/Fur using Houdini Vellum or Maya nHair
  • Simulate cloth using Houdini Vellum or Maya nCloth
  • Fix undesirable shapes and artifacts in shots
  • Attend reviews to obtain feedback from supervisors
  • Deliver work on time, according to agreed schedules and specifications
  • Troubleshoot technical issues as they arise

ABOUT YOU

  • Education in this field (Animation, Cinema, Arts) would be preferred
  • 2 to 3 years of experience in CFX preferred
  • Experience using Maya and Houdini
  • Experience using nCloth and nHair simulations
  • Experience using Houdini Vellum, on Cloth and Hair simulations
  • Ability to troubleshoot and solve problems
  • Solid understanding of production pipelines
  • Good artistic eye and skills
  • Good communication skills
  • Experience with Ziva VFX Muscle System is a Plus
  • Experience with Peregrine Labs Yeti fur system is a Plus
  • Knowledge of Houdini Hair/Fur system is a Plus
  • Python scripting experience is a Plus

Sinking Ship Entertainment would like to thank all applicants. Due to the anticipated high volume of applications, only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Please no phone calls.

Sinking Ship Entertainment is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity in the workplace. We would be happy to accommodate individual needs in keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you require accommodation in order to participate in our recruitment process, please contact us to make your needs known in advance.

title: Painter
description:
We are looking for motivated individuals to join our painting team! The painter role is a fun and challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to get hands-on outdoor work experience. The ideal individual is hard working, coachable, and has effective communication skills. 

Compensation: Average rate is $19-25/hr for painters and $21-28/hr for crew managers

About the position:

  • Training is provided; therefore, no experience is necessary
  • Fast paced, fun environment
  • Hands on experience in customer service and communication
  • Work outdoors with a crew of 2-3 people
  • Can lead to future managment promotion opportunities within the company

Position Descriptions

Painter: This role is a fun and challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to get hands-on work experience and make money over the summer while working mainly outdoors. The ideal individual is hard working, coachable and has effective communication skills.

Crew Manager: In addition to painting, in this role you would gain experience in leadership and would run a crew of 2-3 people. Ask to be considered for this if you feel you may be a good fit.

Seeking candidates who are:

  • Incentive driven
  • Easy going with positive attitude
  • Committed to employment
  • Good problem-solvers
  • Hard working, independent, and take direction well
  • NOT afraid of heights
  • Open to instruction (coachable)
  • Asset: have your own vehicle

Requirements:

  • Able to work full-time throughout the majority of the summer
  • Must have own transportation (job site locations change frequently)
  • Manual labor and ladder work required

Benefits:

  • Work in a fun team environment!
  • We have numerous team events planned for this summer.
  • Numerous bonuses plus tips available from clients.
  • Learn a valuable trade. 
  • Starting rate dependent on experience. Raises based on proven skill after start date.

    • Training and development will be provided as long as the candidate is coachable, hard-working and willing to learn. Trained to complete professional painting work for interior and exterior painting and staining

Requirements:

  • Valid driver’s license
  • Access to a vehicle
  • Preferably some experience with hands-on work (No professional experience necessary), you will be trained on how to do paint/stain projects and will be a pro in no time!
  • Full-time commitment (40-50 hours weekly)
  • Strong communication skills
  • Coachable

Payment Structure:

  • We offer a base rate ranging from $18-22 /hour
  • High-performance bonuses available

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the overall completion of projects. Start to finish completion at a high standard of quality
  • Daily responsible for the cleanliness of site and project
  • Delivering quality and satisfaction through constant communication with homeowners and business owner
  • Manage day to day project tasks for properly providing services to clients

title: Lead Level Artist
description:
Company Description

People Can Fly is one of the leading independent AAA games development studios with an international team of hundreds of talented individuals working from offices located in Poland, UK, US, and Canada, and from all over the world thanks to our remote work programs.

Founded in 2002, we made our mark on the shooter genre with titles such as Painkiller, Bulletstorm, Gears of War: Judgment, and Outriders. We are one of the most experienced Unreal Engine studios in the industry and we are expanding it with in-house solutions called PCF Framework.

Our creative teams are currently working on several exciting AAA projects with the top publishers in the industry: Project Gemini with Square Enix and Project Dagger with Take-Two (2K), in addition to a new IP to be self-published and two other games in a concept phase. One of our IPs is also being adapted for VR technology.

With over 20 years of experience, PCF sets out to explore new horizons. We aim to combine our expertise with creativity of the best and most forward-thinking talents in the industry to work together on the new generation of action games for the global gaming community.

If you decide to accompany us on this journey, you’ll have a chance to perfect your craft and expand your knowledge, working alongside leaders in the industry on bringing a brand-new unique experience to the players worldwide.

If you feel yourself able to deliver as nobody else, take ownership of your projects, and are ready to leave a mark on a game you work on, apply now!

Job Description

  • Creating world geometry and composition for levels in Unreal Engine
  • Working with LD to terraform the world to create worlds that are both fun to play and fits the artistic vision of the game
  • Effectively producing playable levels based on Art directors vision and Level design needs with lead cooperation
  • Working with Producer to manage LA team's schedule and give feedback on world art
Qualifications

  • 8 years of experience in creating world geometry for levels
  • Experienced leading and developing teams
  • Experience working with Unreal Engine
  • Experience with designing layout, asset breakdown, terraforming and set dressing
  • Experience creating high quality creative/visual aesthetics as well as technical knowledge
  • Ability to adapt with guidance and improve, new styles, techniques, and workflows
  • Basic understanding of the color theory
  • Good verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Open-minded team player attitude
  • Strong work ethic and self-motivated
  • Passionate about playing and making video games


Additional Information

What we offer:

U.S.

  • 100% group health insurance benefit premiums paid by PCF (Medical, Dental, Vision, Group Life, and Supplemental Live) and start on day 1 of employment.
  • 401K with 100% match, up to 3% of employee salary, and vested immediately.
  • Paid week off during Winter Holidays.
  • 20 paid vacation days and 5 paid sick days.
  • Free virtual health and mental wellbeing sessions included in the plan for members and their dependents.
  • A competitive salary and performance-based annual bonuses.
  • Personal development opportunities and ability to work in a global environment.
  • Work in a creative team with people full of passion for what they do.
  • Long term disability, short term disability, travel insurance, as well as other benefits provided. 

Canada

  • Benefit package 100% paid by PCF. Insurance company reimburses 100% of claims (Up to $500 per service a year, as well as individual family coverage).
  • Full Dental coverage, including major dental and orthodontics.
  • 4% RRSP matching before tax deductions, 100% vested on day 1.
  • Paid week off during Winter Holidays.
  • 20 paid vacation days and 5 paid sick days.
  • Free virtual health and mental wellbeing sessions included in the plan for members and their dependents.
  • A competitive salary and performance-based annual bonuses.
  • Personal development opportunities and ability to work in a global environment.
  • Work in a creative team with people full of passion for what they do.
  • Long term disability, short term disability, travel insurance, as well as other benefits provided.

title: Painters Needed for the Summer!
description:
We’re hiring full time painters for the summer!

We are looking for individuals who want to be a part of a fun, high energy team and who love being outdoors!

Why is this the perfect summer position?

  • Work with your friends and roommates.
  • 40 PLUS hours available per week, earn $11,000- $14,000 this summer!
  • Work outside and get into shape.
  • Room to advance throughout the season to crew foreman or production manager.

Duties include:

  • Preparing, cleaning and repairing interior and exterior surfaces.
  • Applying paint, stains and other finishes using brushes, rollers and spray equipment.
  • Use of ladders, must not be afraid of heights!

Previous painting experience is an asset, but not required! If you have a can-do attitude and great work ethic, we will provide all training. Labour experience such as landscaping, warehouse and heavy equipment work, grounds crew and athletics are also considered assets.

 Apply now!

title: Painter
description:
We are looking for motivated individuals to join our painting team! The painter role is a fun and challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to get hands-on work experience. The ideal individual is hard working, coachable, and has effective communication skills. 

Compensation: Top painters can make $22-$26/hour; average rate is 20$/hour.

Working with friends is encouraged, so apply together if you wish!

About the position:

  • Fast paced, fun environment
  • Work consistent and steady hours Monday-Friday (40 hours/week)
  • Hands on experience in customer service and communication
  • Work outdoors with a crew of 2-3 people
  • Working with friends is encouraged, so apply together if you wish
  • Training is provided; therefore, no experience is necessary!

We are currently hiring Painters and Crew Managers for 2022. Both positions are full-time jobs and can lead to future promotion opportunities within the company.


Position Descriptions

 

Painter: This role is a fun and challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to get hands-on work experience and make money over the summer. The ideal individual is hard working, coachable and has effective communication skills.

 

Crew Manager: In addition to painting, in this role you would gain experience in leadership and would run a crew of 2-3 people. Ask to be considered for this if you
feel you may be a good fit.

 

We look for positive attitude and good character above all else! We provide all training on site, if you are someone that is willing to work very hard, learn a new skill, and be paid for their hard work, this IS a good job for you! 

 

Requirements:

  • Able to work full-time
  • Must have own transportation (job site locations change frequently)
  • Manual labor and ladder work required, can not be afraid of heights
  • must be able to lift 50 lbs 

Benefits:

  • Starting rate dependent on experience. Raises based on proven skill after start date.
  • Bonuses will depend on performance and the criteria established by the Manager.

title: Painter
description:
FULL/PART TIME PAINTING POSITIONS AVAILABLE

Our painting team is looking for a highly-motivated individual to join us.

We are looking for a hard-working and efficient person in Courtenay, British Columbia who wants to join a family of awesome staff and team culture, who are also looking to earn what they are worth and optimize their cash flow.

This past year alone, our team provided 75+ top quality paint jobs in the Comox Valley area, with one strategy in mind: satisfied clients, which created a happy work atmosphere and rewarded employees. 


For 2022 we are hoping to provide an even better service and employ, train and optimize an even stronger team
We are looking to hire our team member, starting in May of 2022

What benefits will you get? 
-Full training on how to paint the interior and exterior of homes/commercial buildings as well as top notch safety training. 
-Lots of opportunity to earn more with greater efficiency, as well as company offered prizes and incentives.
 -Pay exceeding $20/hr for exemplary painter (Starting rate dependent on experience. Raises based on proven skill after start date. (Bonuses will depend on performance and the criteria established by the business Owner/Operator.) 
-Working with other like-minded and fun individuals. 
-Excellent training and strong mentorship provided during P.A.D (performance, availability and discussion) meetings. 
-Working outside in the fresh air! 
-A glowing reference to help really beef up your resume!

About this job:
*Fast paced, fun environment with incentivized pay scale.
*Hands on experience in customer service and communication
*Working outdoors with a crew of other like-minded people
*Working with friends is encouraged, so apply together and note this in your application
*Training is provided; therefore, no experience is necessary! We teach everyone how to paint!
*This position is a full-time jobs and can lead to future promotion opportunities within the company for those with the right attitude!

What will be expected of you: 
-Positive Attitude (My team hires for attitude and trains for skill)
-Reliable Transportation (As we will be working at many different job sites you must 100% be capable of getting around town. The team may be required to move job sites mid-day and you must be able to accommodate this, no exceptions!) 
-Motivation for $$$ (With this company you truly get out what you put in) 
-Ability to work from ladders (if you are afraid of heights, this job is not for you)
-Ability to work with clients and always represent our company respectably
-Ability to complete and provide certifications for required training provided
-Ability to ensure proper time management and punctuality (lateness is not tolerated)

Position Description

Painter: This role is a fun but challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to get hands-on work experience and make money reflective of their efforts. The ideal individual is hard working, coachable and has effective communication skills. You will be sometimes required to work at heights and in warm weather so needless to say endurance is also an asset. 
 

We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment. We employ without regard to race, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, and local laws.

If this job sounds like the right fit for you then please get in contact with us!
We would love to hear from you and set up an interview.  
Please submit your RESUME and COVER LETTER

title: Painter
description:
Looking for an experienced Painter. The ideal person will be able to lead a crew or work alone with little or no supervision.

Painted to Perfection is an expanding company offering a great work environment, weekends off to enjoy, and competitive wages based on experience.

About the job:
  • Experience with brush and roller.
  • Patching and repairing holes in drywall, caulking around windows, doors and trim.
  • Spray painting experiences are an asset.
  • comfortable on ladders and at heights.

Must have transportation as work is around Simcoe county.

title: Crowd Artist
description:
At Stellar Creative Lab we live, breathe and love animation. A culture that is creative. A home for your talent. We hire stars â€“ work with the best in the industry. Work with Us.

Do you love, live and breathe Marvel? 

Stellar Creative Lab is hiring top talent for a New Streaming Series for Marvel Studios. 

We are looking for a Crowd Artist who is a self-starter and problem solver. Someone who gets excited bringing scenes alive.

Our ideal candidate is a team player that thrives in a smaller team and has a passion for creating great looking crowds by using technical skills.

Your Main Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with our FX department, Animation department and CG-Supervisor for implementing ways to bring sets and shots alive
  • Setup crowd assets
  • Use simulation techniques to populate characters and other assets 
  • Evaluate any issues that may arise in the setup of crowds, and test new procedures and workflows within the pipeline 
  • Create Houdini or Golaem / Atoms simulations for more complex behaviors, if required
  • Work with the other departments on solutions, workflows and deadlines.
  • Work with your CG Supervisor to have a clear understanding of deadlines and task assignments. 
  • Meet deadlines and task assignments. 

Experience, Talents and Abilities weâ€™re looking for:

  • 2 years experience on feature films, TV and/or animated feature, with a focus in Houdini Crowds, Golaem or Atoms
  • Experience building Houdini, Golaem or Atoms digital assets
  • A strong understanding of Linux based operating systems is a plus 
  • Experience with background crowd simulation methods is a plus 
  • Experience with additional software is a plus: Shotgun
  • Eligible to work in Canada

Live in B.C? Alberta? Ontario? Somewhere in Canada with a great internet connection? We can work with that! Stellar Creative Lab encourages artists to work where they live and love where they work.  Join us - we have some amazing opportunities.

 

In response to the COVID - 19 pandemic, Stellar Creative Lab is able to offer the following benefits:

  • the option to work at the studio as well as remotely across British Columbia
  • ongoing health and safety training
  • support for your ergonomic workspace at home

Powered by JazzHR

title: Technical Artist (Unreal Engine)
description:
Company Description

Playhybrid helps brands break through the media clutter and create authentic and lasting emotional connections with customers through Extended Reality (XR) experiences that drive engagement. Our creative service and technology provides brands with a cinematic, Extended Reality (XR) experience cohesively distributed across multiple platforms and devices.

Job Description

We are looking for a UE technical artist to help create visually stunning real-time content. The UE Tech artist will work closely with performance capture team to create high quality animated characters, fully developed environments and optimized real-time rendering setup. You will have the opportunity to create experiences that will reach millions of users on our family of brands (Huffpost, TechCrunch, AOL, Yahoo, etc) and to create project partnerships with brands such as Google, Apple, Samsung, Unity, etc. 

Responsibilities

●      Develop Unreal scenes using in-house and third party digital assets

●      Create blueprints and install plugins to combine various real-time technologies within UE

●      Import character animation assets from standard packages such as Maya and Motionbuilder

●      Leverage performance capture technologies such as Motion Capture, Facial Capture and camera compositing

●      Optimize UE scenes for latest and greatest GPU, CPU and cloud rendering technologies

Minimum Qualifications

●      Bachelor’s degree in computer related field or equivalent experience

●      2 years experience in Unreal Engine or Unity building games or VR experiences

●      Expertise in UE engine featuresets such as decision tree, collisions, apex, baked lighting, surfacing, animation, sequencer

●      Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and choices to our team as well as internal and external clients.

●      An aptitude for collaboration with an array of artistic and technical talents

●      Independent contributor mindset with minimal need for directions

Preferred Qualifications

●      Experience with raytracing rendering technology

●      Familiarity with coding in C, Python

Qualifications

●      Bachelor’s degree in computer related field or equivalent experience

●      2 years experience in Unreal Engine or Unity building games or VR experiences

●      Expertise in UE engine featuresets such as decision tree, collisions, apex, baked lighting, surfacing, animation, sequencer

●      Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and choices to our team as well as internal and external clients.

●      An aptitude for collaboration with an array of artistic and technical talents

●      Independent contributor mindset with minimal need for directions

Preferred Qualifications

●      Experience with raytracing rendering technology

●      Familiarity with coding in C, Python



Additional Information

Competitive compensation and benefits, amazing projects, Innovation, creative environment and state-of-the-art technologies.  

Don't miss your chance to join the best worldwide AR company!

title: Painters
description:
• Don't miss this opportunity to take on a pivotal role with a rapidly growing organization
  • Receive a highly competitive salary of $21-$28/hr based on skills and experience
  • Enjoy working in a collaborative and supportive team environment

About Vogue Painting

What makes us different from other painting companies? At Vogue Painting, we are a tight-knit and well-organized team focused on quality, collaboration, and meeting client needs. We live and breathe painting. We love the look on our client's faces after they see their newly painted space! What else is amazing about us? Our team is highly diverse. We are proud that at Vogue Painting, our team is made up of members of all genders and ages. We are also focused on creating a safe space and sense of belonging for everyone, including our LGBTQ employees. We feel diversity makes us strong, and we look forward to continuing to foster an inclusive workplace.
 
When you join our fun Vogue Painting family, you can expect consistent work, the feeling of being cared for, plus a supportive boss and teammates. We set up all the work, provide the painting tools and empower you to organize your work while collaborating with your teammates, other trades, and our clients, all while adhering to our quality standards.

For more information, please visit our website.

About the Opportunity 

Currently, Vogue Painting is looking for multiple Painters to support various projects throughout the lower mainland on a full-time basis. This will be a temporary position until Fall/Winter 2022, with a possibility to extend into a permanent position. Shifts will be primarily 8am-4pm Monday-Friday, with occasional weekends or nights pre-scheduled as needed.

As one of our new Painters, you'll work in a variety of interior and exterior commercial and residential painting jobs throughout the lower mainland alongside the rest of our team. More specifically, your responsibilities will include: 

  • Applying paint, other materials, and finishes to both interior and exterior surfaces
  • Reading blueprints and instructions pertaining to the individual project in preparation for the job
  • Utilizing tools such as paint sprayer, and techniques such as drywalling, and patching
  • Planning out the execution of a painting job, in terms of maximizing efficiency and quality 
  • Operating a ladder and prioritizing safety while working in both indoor and outdoor conditions
  • Being committed to the continued improvement of performance, quality, and effort of the team

More About You

In order to qualify for this role, you will ideally have at least 1 year of demonstrated painting experience. Having access to a vehicle is useful, but not required. Experience hanging wallpaper is a strong asset.

As our ideal candidate, you'll be a highly motivated self-starter with excellent communication skills and a track record for punctuality, reliability, and facilitating collaboration. You take pride in your work, with high attention to detail. Your passion for the work that you do, your desire to continuously learn and grow, and your ability to build quality relationships with both colleagues and clients will set an example for those working with you and foster a positive and fun working environment. 

Above all, you'll be a dedicated painting professional that is passionate about creating a safe and productive work site. 

About the Benefits

In return for your hard work and dedication, you will be awarded highly competitive compensation of $21-$28/hr based on skills and qualifications along with a wide host of benefits including:

  • 4% vacation pay or paid time off
  • Working in an inclusive, fast-paced, and collaborative work environment
  • Uniforms and tools are provided
  • On-site training is provided 
  • Flexibility in shift scheduling for work-life balance
  • An opportunity to work with a growing company with a fun culture! 
We’d like to hear from all interested applicants. Based on our high-quality work standard, we are keenly interested in those applicants who have made or are wanting to make painting their career. We also welcome students with painting experience looking for work over the summer break.
 
Don't miss this unique opportunity to take on an exciting role with a rapidly growing organization - Apply Now!

title: Painter
description:
FULL/PART TIME PAINTING POSITIONS AVAILABLE!!!

 

*CURRENTLY HIRING FOR 2022*

 

ACT NOW TO SECURE YOUR POSITION IN ONE OF CANADA’S TOP  PAINTING FRANCHISES!

Our painting team is looking for highly-motivated individuals to join us!

We are looking for the absolute hardest-working, most efficient people in Abbotsford, British Columbia, who want to join a family of awesome staff and team culture, who are also looking to earn what they are worth and optimize their cash flow!

This past year alone, our team provided 75+ top quality paint jobs in the Abbotsford area, with one strategy in mind: satisfied clients, which created a happy work atmosphere and rewarded employees. 

For 2022 we are hoping to provide an even better service and employ, train and optimize an even stronger team!

We are looking to hire our team, starting in the early spring of 2022!

What benefits will you get? 

-Full training on how to paint the interior and exterior of homes/commercial buildings as well as top notch safety training. 

-Lots of opportunity to earn more with greater efficiency, as well as company offered prizes and incentives.

 -Pay exceeding $20/hr for exemplary painters (Starting rate dependent on experience. Raises based on proven skill after start date. (Bonuses will depend on performance and the criteria established by the business Owner/Operator.) 

-Working with other like-minded and fun individuals. 

-Excellent training and strong mentorship provided during P.A.D (performance, availability and discussion) meetings. 

-Working outside in the fresh air!

About this job:

*Fast paced, fun environment with incentivized pay scale.

*Hands on experience in customer service and communication

*Working outdoors with a crew of other like-minded people

*Working with friends is encouraged, so apply together and note this in your application, we love hiring teams of Rockstar’s!

*Training is provided; therefore, no experience is necessary! We teach everyone how to paint!

*We are currently hiring Painters and Crew Managers for 2022. Both positions are full-time jobs and can lead to future promotion opportunities within the company for those with the right attitude!

*We are also hiring seasonal staff for those of you who are just looking for a summer job! Act quickly, our summer positions will fill up fast!

What will be expected of you: 

-Positive Attitude (My team hires for attitude and trains for skill)

-Reliable Transportation (As we will be working at many different job sites you must 100% be capable of getting around town. The team may be required to move job sites mid-day and you must be able to accommodate this, no exceptions!) 

-Motivation for $$$ (With this company you truly get out what you put in) 

-Ability to work from ladders (if you are afraid of heights, this job is not for you)

-Ability to work with clients and always represent our company respectably

-Ability to complete and provide certifications for required training provided

-Ability to ensure proper time management and punctuality (lateness is not tolerated)

-Referring our services to friends and family (this is not required but always appreciated)

-A strong mindset dedicated to learning and self improvement

title: Texture Artist
description:
Texture Artists are responsible for the creation of textures, colours and organic surface qualities required for computer-generated creatures and hard-surface models used in production. Texture Artists work closely with Modellers and Look Development Artists to create photo-real assets for high-end visual effects films.

Responsibilities:
  • Collaborate with the CG Supervisor and Lead Texture Artist to execute the required look of CG characters and objects
  • Continual and efficient communication with the Look Dev and Modelling departments
  • Quality control of texture maps prior to publishing to ensure consistency
  • Meeting schedules and set deadlines while maintaining the highest standards
  • Communicating with Production and Leads regarding schedules and deadlines
  • Sharing techniques, reference material and ideas with the team
  • Continuing to become familiar with new tools, software, data and other related technology




Essential Skills:

  • Extensive knowledge and production experience of Photoshop and Mari
  • Experience in a 3D paint package
  • The ability to work within a team of other Texture Artists or independently
  • A commitment to creative collaboration within the team and with other departments
  • Proactive and excellent communication, organisation and interpersonal skills
  • Creative problem-solving skills
  • The proven ability to work well under pressure
  • Open to direction and able to embrace change
  • Attention to detail
  • Reliable with good timekeeping and the ability to meet set deadlines

Desirable Skills:
  • A traditional arts background
  • Previous film experience
  • Modelling and look development skills or experience
  • Working knowledge of Nuke and/or modelling software

Framestore is proud to employ extraordinary talent across all genders, races, nationalities, religions, ages, abilities and sexual preferences. We aim to encourage and support all of our current and future employees to achieve their potential. No job applicant will receive less favourable treatment on any basis when applying for a career with us.

title: Lead Character Artist
description:
Company Description

Torn Banner studios recently launched Chivalry 2, the sequel to our multi-million copy selling original. We are a small independent video game studio of around 60 developers in Toronto and we love creating innovative new experiences that focus on challenge and fun.

Job Description

As Lead Character Artist at a small independent studio, you’ll have a wide range of responsibilities from creating art to organizing the department, communicating with production, facilitating feedback and working with other leads to execute the vision for the games we make.

Responsibilities

  • Organize, plan and lead the character art team
  • Continue to personally produce high-quality photorealistic art on a daily basis
  • Establishing a quality bar and direction for other artists on the team and being responsible for the team's ability to execute and reach that quality bar 
  • Execute creatively versed with Art Direction high level principals and creative guidelines 
Qualifications

Requirements

  • An exceptional portfolio of work that exemplifies the creation of high-quality photorealistic characters.
  • 6 years of professional game development experience
  • At least 3 shipped titles
  • Expert knowledge of game character development processes, from sculpting to retopo, baking, uvs, texturing, etc
  • Excellent communication, time-management, and organizational skills
  • Ability to provide an in-depth critique back with visual observation skills
  • Understanding of rigging and skinning for animation
  • Ability to work under tight deadlines
  • Personally motivated, constructive energy
  • Willingness to work in Toronto is preferred, but remote opportunities are available

Bonuses

  • Passion for the medieval era and melee combat
  • Experience with Unreal Engine
  • Familiarity working with version control (we use Perforce) and task-management software (we use Jira)
  • Background in traditional art
  • Concept Art skills


Additional Information

Benefits & Perks

  • 6.5 weeks Paid vacation
  • Game Launch Bonus Structure
  • Relocation assistance
  • Flexible schedule and work location
  • Healthcare & benefits

To see our team, our office and what we do as a company visit tornbanner.com/careers.

Torn Banner Studios welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Concept Artist
description:
Overview:

We are seeking an experienced concept artist that has concept experience with creating a diverse visual range of characters, environments, architecture, and related game assets. A solid grasp of form, structure, color, and light for 2D art assets is essential.

 

This is an exciting opportunity to work with some of the biggest IP in the industry using quantitative and qualitative data to drive success in F2P games and ensure a great experience for our players. By joining Alpha Dog Games, you are part of a growing studio that believes in work/life balance, equity and diversity.     Located on the East Coast in Canadaâ€™s ocean playground, Halifax is host to a thriving video game industry with affordable living and cultural amenities featuring sandy beaches, scenic coastal villages, and a bustling night life.   If you have a passion for mobile games, this job is for you.

 

This position located in Halifax, Nova Scotia. Will consider remote.

Responsibilities:
  • Create the look of the game by working with the Art Director to establish a consistent visual direction for mood, environments, characters, weapons, etc. by creating inspiring concept art that focuses on dynamic visual elements that maintain accurate scale, established architectural standards and character/creature anatomy that will be used to create in game content.
  • Collaborate with the Art Director to implement the vision for the game
  • Produce work in an efficient and timely manner, on schedule
  • Produce high quality 2D assets and textures in a variety of art styles from hand painted to photorealistic.
  • Assist in creating art style guides with the Art Director
  • Work closely with colleagues to foster a highly communicative, coordinated team effort
  • Ensure quality of related assets by maintaining responsibility over your work throughout the project's development
Preferred Skills:
  • Excellent traditional artistic skills with a strong grasp of composition, anatomy, color theory, perspective, lighting, environment, architectural, creature/character, costume and graphic design.
  • Proficiency in life drawing (drawing from life and reference) as well as a strong imagination and a willingness to push the envelope, to innovate within the parameters of the game's world.
  • Adapt to a variety of art styles ranging from lighter casual art to midcore to core games.
  • Strong communication, excellent visual storytelling and written skills.
  • Strong interpersonal skills-able to interact with team members of different disciplines.
  • Good positive attitude and outlook, self-motivated, and a great team-player.
  • Passion for playing video games across multiple platforms â€“ specifically mobile games and staying up to date on popular trends
  • Assistance in leadership skills and developing Junior Artists
Applicant Privacy Notice:

Applicant Privacy Notice

title: Artiste 3D
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Depuis notre fondation en 2015, nous misons sur une collaboration créative mettant l’emphase sur l’imagination et sur une exécution sans faille afin d’offrir des jeux de la plus haute qualité. Nos partenaires, tels que Tilting Point, Electronic Arts, Atari ou Hasbro, pour en nommer quelques-uns, sont parmi les entreprises de divertissement interactif les plus innovantes au monde et nous accompagnent dans nos conceptions ambitieuses.

Description du poste

Description:
L'Artiste 3D se concentrera sur la modélisation des environnements 3D et la création de textures de résolution basses et moyennes.

Tâches et responsabilités:
• Environnements de modélisation 3D optimisés pour les appareils mobiles
• Création de textures dans différentes résolutions pour des périphériques spécifiques
• Suivre les directives et l'art conceptuel fourni
• Appliquer et maintenir un style d'art cohérent dans l'ensemble des actifs de l'ensemble du projet
• Adaptation aux différents styles de jeu (réaliste, bande dessinée, pixel, etc.)
• Communiquer de façon technique pour la mise en œuvre du programmateur des actifs, des shaders et des éléments
• Travailler avec les programmeurs pour assurer que  la mise en œuvre corresponde à l'intention

Qualifications

Exigences:
• Connaissances de jeux vidéos mobile incluant l’expérience 3D (expérience de 6 mois minimum)
• Solides compétences en Maya ou 3DS Max, compétent avec Photoshop
• Compétences en illustration et dessin. Excellent oeil pour la couleur, la forme et la composition
• Compréhension du processus de développement de jeux
• Connaissance des techniques de l'art mobile pour une optimisation de pointe, des cartes de lumière personnalisées etc
• Passion pour l'industrie et une compréhension des tendances du marché et de styles
• Excellentes aptitudes en communication orale et écrite
• Capacité à travailler avec une équipe, de nature organisée et indépendante
• Capacité à comprendre les implémentations et les limitations techniques
• Capacité de travailler en suivant un calendrier et un budget
• Être capable d'auto-gestion, estimer avec précision le temps pour accomplir des tâches, les délais réalisables et gérer les priorités en respectant les délais
• Très motivé et passionné pour les conceptions d'interaction et de jeux
• Connaissance des médias (jeux, bandes dessinées, films, etc.)
• Compétences en programmation de base ou grâce à l’expérience avec la plate-forme Unity est un atout
• Expérience avec le développement de shader et les textures 
• Expérience avec des particules et des effets dans le jeu
• Autres compétences 3D, telles que l'expérience de personnages et l'animation
• Excellente maîtrise du français et de l'anglais écrit et parlé.



Informations complémentaires

Avantages de Nvizzio:

  • Excellents avantages pour les employés (assurance, jours de maladie, etc)
  • Possibilité de progression de carrière  
  • Environnement de travail dynamique et stimulant
  • Opportunités de formation
  • Culture du travail d’équipe
  • Événements sociaux
