title: Peintre
company: Centre de services scolaire des Grandes-Seigneuries
description:
Vous détenez un diplôme d’études professionnelles (DEP) en peinture en bâtiment ou en toute autre spécialité appropriée?

 

Le Centre de services scolaire des Grandes-Seigneuries (CSSDGS) à un poste régulier à temps plein de peintre à pourvoir à l’école des Timoniers située à Sainte-Catherine.

 

Apportez votre couleur au sein du Service des ressources matérielles et soutenez le milieu scolaire! Découvrez tous les avantages de vous joindre au CSSDGS.

 

 

Nature du travail

Le rôle principal du salarié de cette classe d’emploi est d’effectuer des travaux de peinture, de vernissage, de teinture et d’autres travaux sur les surfaces intérieures et extérieures des bâtiments ou encore sur des charpentes métalliques et des pièces d’ameublement.

                                                                                                                                                                       

Principales responsabilités

  • Réparer et préparer les surfaces à peindre;
  • Effectuer le remplissage des joints de planches murales;
  • Réparer des fissures présentes sur le plâtre;
  • Nettoyer et entretenir les outils de travail;
  • Dresser les échafaudages nécessaires à l’exécution de ses tâches selon les normes de sécurité;
  • Coordonner les travaux d’ouvriers moins expérimentés ou non spécialisés;
  • Accomplir toute autre tâche connexe.

 

Qualifications requises

  • Être titulaire d’un diplôme d'études professionnelles (DEP) en peinture en bâtiment ou toute autre spécialité appropriée à la classe d’emploi;

ou

  • Être titulaire d’un diplôme ou d’une attestation d’études dont l’équivalence est reconnue par l’autorité compétente et avoir trois (3) années d’expérience pertinente;

ou

  • Posséder une qualification officielle équivalente, appropriée à la classe d’emploi et délivrée par un organisme reconnu.

 

Durée de la semaine régulière de travail

38 h 45 / semaine.

 

LIEU DE TRAVAIL

École des Timoniers à Ste-Catherine.

 

Date d’entrée en fonction

Dès que possible.

 

Salaire

23,24 $ / heure selon la convention collective en vigueur.

 

POUR SOUMETTRE VOTRE CANDIDATURE

 

Postulez en ligne au plus le 31 mai 2022 avant 12h.

 

Le CSSDGS remercie tous les candidats et les candidates de leur intérêt, mais ne communiquera qu’avec les personnes retenues.

 

Le CSSDGS est engagé dans un programme d’accès à l’égalité en emploi et invite les femmes, les minorités visibles et ethniques, les autochtones et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature.

Découvrez tous les avantages de vous joindre au CSSDGS.', 'Vous détenez un diplôme d’études professionnelles (DEP) en peinture en bâtiment ou en toute autre spécialité appropriée?']

title: Senior Unreal Artist
description:
ABOUT US

We come from many different places, but what unites us is our passion. At Moment Factory, each new project is a blank page awaiting the creativity and talent of our whole team, no matter the individual responsibilities, roles, or fields. Our desire to innovate, to take risks, and to learn from our mistakes and from each other is what allows us to create collective projects that go above and beyond. Today, thanks to a team of 350 creative minds, we have been able to create immersive multimedia environments for artists, museums, airports, brands, theme parks and events, as well as our signature shows. No matter the canvas – be it film, lighting, multimedia architecture, sound design, special effects, or interactive projects – the thirst for experimentation and innovation is at the core of our DNA. Our Montreal, Paris, New York, and Singapour studios are always on the hunt for curious and inspired people. Find your niche on our team of passionate employees!

YOUR MISSION

The Senior Unreal Artist is part of the creative team responsible for the design, animation and production of animated visual content for permanent and temporary multimedia installations. He/she works as a Senior Unreal Artist with a remarkable artistic flair and advanced technical knowledge. In addition, he/she must be able to evaluate the resources needed to complete tasks and projects on time and on budget.
FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Be responsible for the production and delivery of real time or pre-render projects assigned to him/her in respect with schedules and deadlines;
Layout and environment creation;
Shader and lighting;
Asset optimization;
Creation of procedural tools via blueprint and/or python;
Scene optimization;
Perform all other responsibilities and/or tasks related to the position.
Participate in the creative process with the Director, Art Director and Project Manager by proposing concepts and technique ;
Work with the Director, Designer, Technicians and other departments to ensure synergy between the environment, its content and the technology used;
Be a resource for the team in his/her field of experience; assist, train and coach in relation to his/her acquired knowledge and skills;
Be constantly on the lookout for new developments in the field of real-time tools and workflows.


POSITION’S EXPECTATIONS

Bachelor's degree in 3D animation, graphic design or a related field;
Functional professional mastery of French and English, both oral and written;
More than 5 years of experience in real-time visual content creation;
Advanced knowledge of Unreal software;
Advanced knowledge of one of the content creation software such as Maya, 3ds Max, Cinema 4D (C4D);
Experience in creating integrated visuals in multimedia installation is also an asset.
A good knowledge of Houdini is an asset.

REQUIRED QUALITIES

Creative, inspired and inspiring vision;
Motivation, autonomy, initiative and good adaptability;
Passionate self-starter;
Autonomous, sense of initiative and adaptability.

SPECIAL WORK CONDITIONS
Occasional work outside office hours and occasional travels.


If you think this position is for you, we invite you to apply now. We will not be able to follow up with each candidate, so we will only contact the selected individuals.

Thank you for considering a career at Moment Factory. We are looking forward to meeting you!

title: Peintre
description:
Boni de rétention après 1 an - 2000$

500$ -  payable après 6 mois travaillés

1 500$ - payable après 1 an travaillé

À la recherche d'un emploi d’usine stimulant?

Tu souhaites avoir un impact positif sur l'environnement?

Tu désires travailler dans la plus belle usine moderne du Centre-Du-Québec?

Arrête de chercher, vient-en chez nous!

 

Fondée en 1998 à Drummondville, Annexair est un fabricant d’équipements de CVCA (HVAC) qui offre des solutions sur mesure et sert les marchés commerciaux, institutionnels et industriels. L’efficacité énergétique étant au coeur de notre conception, nos systèmes de ventilation grand format comptent de nombreuses technologies de récupération d’énergie. Nous investissons massivement en recherche et développement ce qui nous permet d'avoir les systèmes de ventilation parmi les plus avancés en Amérique du Nord.

 

Avantages d’être dans notre équipe

  • Bonus de rétention après 1 an 2000$
  • 2 semaines de fermeture durant l’été + congés payés à Noël!
  • Assurance collective
  • REER
  • Prime pour référence d’employés de 500$
  • Congés personnels
  • Vêtements (casquette, chandails et pantalons) sont fournis
  • Programme d’aide aux employés
  • Club social actif

PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS

  • Préparer le mélange de peinture selon l’unité à peinturer et les formules préétablies.
  • Inspecter l’unité de ventilation et corriger les imperfections avant d’appliquer la peinture.
  • Préparer les surfaces à peindre (laver, nettoyer, décaper, etc.).
  • Peinturer l’unité de ventilation et certaines composantes à l’aide des outils appropriés.
  • Vérifier l’épaisseur de la peinture à l’aide d’instruments de mesure spécifiques.
  • Valider l’inventaire et assurer le suivi de commande de peinture.
  • Peinturer certains détails d’unité sur la ligne de production.
  • Nettoyer et entretenir la chambre à peinture et les équipements.
  • Effectuer toute autre tâche connexe demandée par son superviseur immédiat.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUISES

  • AEP en peinture industrielle ou dans un domaine connexe;
  • Expériences pertinentes comme peintre
  • Être débrouillard, organisé, méthodique et avoir une bonne dextérité manuelle.

title: Peintre
description:
Tu es quelqu’un de minutie? Tu as de l’expérience dans la peinture au pistolet? Tu as de la facilité à effectuer le mélange des composantes de peinture? Voici une offre pour toi? 

Ta future équipe

Chez Premier Tech Systèmes Automatisés, nous optimisons les installations manufacturières de nos clients grâce à des systèmes novateurs à haute valeur ajoutée qui exploitent le plein potentiel de la robotique. Nous faisons partie des plus importants fournisseurs d’équipements automatisés de conditionnement, de manutention et d’emballage au monde – que ce soit pour des produits alimentaires, agricoles, organiques ou industriels.

Ton futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Enlever la rouille des surfaces métalliques
  • Aplanir les surfaces à peindre
  • Effectuer le lavage des surfaces à peinturer
  • Apprêter les surfaces et appliquer une couche protectrice de peinture à l’uréthane ou à l’époxy
  • Réaliser divers mélanges de composants  
  • Peinturer les surfaces selon les spécifications
  • Vérifier la qualité du travail réalisé et apporter les correctifs requis

Compétences requises

  • DEP en carrosserie ou toute autre combinaison de formation et d’expérience pertinente
  • Minutie
  • Excellent maniement du pistolet à peinture 
  • Expérience en usine – un atout 
  • Expérience en conduite de chariot élévateur et de pont roulant – un atout 

Ton futur environnement de travail

À la fine pointe de la technologie, nos usines sont pensées pour faciliter la collaboration et prioriser la santé, ainsi que la sécurité de nos équipiers. Travailler chez Premier Tech, c’est avoir la possibilité de toujours apprendre, d’améliorer ses compétences et de se spécialiser.

Ces mots te parlent?

minutie, peinture, pistolet à peinture

Envie d’en savoir plus? Postule dès maintenant, nous attendons ta candidature avec impatience!

title: Senior Web Visual Designer - Remote (US & CAD)
description:
This position is open to applicants in the US and Canada

ABOUT OUR COMPANY

Kanopi Studios is a Design, Development & Support Agency with a fully distributed team of people who are experts in Drupal & WordPress.

Our clients have a mission; we design, build and support websites that help their mission thrive.

But we want our employees to thrive as well. Because our team members do great work for great clients, Kanopi works hard to support them in their career as they continue to create a better web.

As a result, our business continues to grow, and so must our team. We’re excited to announce this opportunity to join our team as a Senior Web Visual Designer.

ABOUT THE JOB

We are seeking a talented Senior Web Visual Designer to join our Creative Services team. The role requires not only your impeccable design skills and passion for art & technology but also expertise in client management, problem-solving, and strategic thinking. This is a great opportunity for a creative, eloquent, and organized designer to make a large impact on a growing department, with plenty of independence and flexibility within the role.

This is a fully remote position and reports to the Manager of Creative Services.

RESPONSIBILITIES

You can expect to:

  • Generate end-to-end visual strategy and collateral for our clients including but not limited to: strategic direction, pattern libraries, mood boards, wireframes, UI visuals, and high fidelity prototypes.
  • Collaborate with our Content and UX Strategists to craft experiences that are not only visually appealing but effective at balancing user goals and business needs.
  • Assist our internal marketing team by providing design support to further our ongoing marketing objectives.
  • Be Kanopi’s advocate for design by articulating and defending your design rationale to both internal stakeholders and clients.
  • Work closely with our Project Management team to define project deliverables and delivery schedules.
  • Contribute to website visual design direction and collaboration with the creative services team.
  • Provide mentorship to intermediate and junior team members in the form of constructive feedback and recommendations on project deliverables.


ABOUT THE COMPENSATION & WORK REQUIREMENTS

This is a full-time position. The salary range for this position is $80-105k - base salary is commensurate with experience. This is a 100% remote role, but you must live and be able to work in the US or Canada.

NOW... LET'S TALK ABOUT YOU!

Requirements

We are looking for candidates who demonstrate the following skills and competencies:

  • A strong portfolio showcasing your understanding of user-centered, responsive website design.
  • 5+ years of professional experience designing responsive and mobile website products.
  • 3+ years of experience working within an agency setting.
  • Familiarity with design and communications tools including Figma, Adobe Creative Cloud, Slack, and Google suite of tools.
  • Capability to communicate ideas to a wide range of audiences while incorporating constructive feedback.
  • Comfortable working remotely within a distributed team.
  • Comfortable working in both waterfall and agile environments.
  • Able to manage multiple projects with evolving requirements.
  • Familiarity with front-end web design practices and coding is a plus but not required.
  • Experience with mission-driven and nonprofit clients is a plus.
  • Have a passion for the web, open-source development, and working with a community of fun, humorous folks!


At Kanopi, we believe a variety of backgrounds, experiences, and voices make for a better workplace. We strongly and enthusiastically encourage people of color, individuals who identify within and beyond the LGBTQ+ spectrum, women, and people with disabilities to apply.

NOW, WHAT?

If you think this post was written just for you, here’s what to do next:

  1. Submit your resume and a link to your portfolio.
  2. Answer the questions you see here on this page.
  3. Send us a cover letter.

Now… About that cover letter… This is VERY important!

Please include all of the typical reasons why you’d be an outstanding candidate for this position, plus answer this question: What is your favorite piece of technology?

Our screening process takes a bit of time because we like to ensure that you are the perfect fit for us, and we are the perfect fit for you! After we’ve taken a look at your application, we will send you a series of questions that will help us get to know you better. From there, you will engage in several interviews with members of our team. Some candidates may even do a skills assessment or paid mini-project, depending on the role you are interviewing for. We’ll be happy to explain a bit more once we’re in the interview stage.

Please note - we try to make an effort to contact every applicant to let you know the status of your application, but we are human, so if you don’t hear from us, drop us a line!

Benefits

Fully Remote: Work where and when you do your best. It’s about feeling connected to others, having a flexible schedule and staying healthy.

Top Talent: Since we are not limited by walls, our ability to hire the best is limitless. Collaborate, learn and surround yourself with a strongly skilled and diverse team.

This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by those assigned to this classification. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by those occupying this position. The job description and job functions described herein are subject to possible modification by Kanopi Studios in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

No agencies, recruiters or overseas applicants (for consideration, applicants must live in the US or Canada).


By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: Graphic Designer 2022 - Remote
description:
Graphic Designer - Remote   

This is a full time position.

You must apply using our easy-apply portal: https://ontariomusicians.easyapply.co/

Please note that aspects of this position are modified to ensure Health and Safety during the COVID-19 pandemic. This call for Graphic Designers is available Canada-wide.

Note: Emails regarding this position come from a "Get Hired" account, and may be delivered to your spam folder. If you haven't received a confirmation of your application within 72 hours, please email

jobs@canadianmusicians.coop

for support.

Graphic Designers are a part of the ‘Build Team’ within the Creative Services Department. Other team members include audio producers, video producers, and photographers. Members of the Build Team report to their Team Lead, the Creative Services Administrative Manager, and other members of leadership as needed. They work to create and edit graphic resources as needed for social media and marketing assets, internal and external-facing videos, and educational materials (print and digital).

Work assigned to Graphic Designers will be assigned based on each individual’s strengths, experiences, and interest, and consist of a mix of general branded design, motion graphic design, and art/illustration. Projects may include and are not limited to:

  • Flyers

  • Posters, banners, and signage (e.g. sandwich boards and freestanding banners)

  • Infographics

  • Brochures (print and digital)

  • Email marketing and newsletter templates

  • Social media ads, banners and graphics

  • Images for websites and content marketing posts

  • Graphics for written reports

  • T-shirts and other merchandise

  • Other promotional and education materials (print and digital)

 

Due to federal funding requirements for this program, successful applicants must be:

  • 15–30 years of age on their first day of work;

  • A Canadian citizen, have a permanent resident card, or be protected under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (there is no requirement to be a student); 

  • Residing in Canada during the length of the employment.

This program pays minimum wage for your province. The summer employment length is 7-16 weeks between May and September. 

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Consult with Corporate Services Officers and members of the Marketing and Communications Team to establish and create the overall look, graphic elements, and graphic content of communications materials to meet organizational and public relations needs.

  • Develop graphic elements that meet the objectives of requests submitted from other parts of the organization.

  • Prepare sketches, layouts, and graphic elements of the subjects to be rendered using traditional tools, multimedia software, and image processing, layout, and design software.

  • Estimate cost of materials and time to complete assigned works.

  • Use existing photo and illustration banks and typography guides to produce images that meet internal and external communications needs.

  • Consult on and follow guidelines established in the company branding guide.

  • Coordinate aspects of production for print, audio-visual or digital materials, such as web sites, brochures, company clothing, etc.

  • Work comfortably in a multidisciplinary environment, and communicate effectively and regularly.

  • Cooperate with other department workers and supervisors to achieve departmental and organizational goals.

  • Will be required to work alongside other graphic designers, graphic arts technicians, photographers, videos editors, and others as part of the Creative Services department.

  • Work comfortably in a multidisciplinary environment, and communicate effectively and regularly.

  • Attend daily team meetings, taking notes as needed.

  • Attend weekly staff meetings, taking notes as needed.

  • Perform other appropriate duties as assigned by management.


Education/experience requirements:

  • The ideal candidate will possess or be nearing completion of a post-secondary or post-graduate program in Graphic Design; or possess equivalent work experience and knowledge.

  • Experience creating and implementing strategies for an online work environment is an asset.

 

Key Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, and other characteristics: 

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Personable demeanor

  • Outstanding organization skills

  • Ability to collaborate with several teams at once, managing your work within multiple initiatives simultaneously

  • Prioritization

  • Meeting deadlines

  • Critical thinking skills

  • Active problem-solving skills

  • Accuracy in data entry

  • Intermediate computer literacy using the following systems and software:

    • Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)

    • Google Workspace (Gmail, Google Drive, Google Docs, Google Calendar, etc.)

    • Online communications platforms (Slack, Discord, Zoom, etc.)

    • Graphic design softwares (Canva, Adobe Illustrator, etc.)

     

    The Co-op seeks individuals who enjoy collaboration, creativity, learning new skills, and engaging with artists and the community. This position may involve working some evenings and weekends as needed for special events and items needed on an urgent basis.  


    Application Requirements:

    You must submit a link to your portfolio in the “pre-interview” questions in this application. Your portfolio should showcase examples of your own past projects or school assignments. It should be representative of your relevant skills and areas of expertise. Please utilize a website link or a Google Drive, Dropbox, or equivalent platform to link these files, and ensure that application screeners will be able to open the files without needing to log into that platform. 


    If you have any additional documentation that you would like to submit in addition to your portfolio, please do so in the pre-screening question that asks for “additional documentation.” Please utilize a Google Drive, Dropbox, or equivalent platform to link these files, and ensure that application screeners will be able to open the files without needing to log into that platform.

    To have your application considered by the Hiring Team, all pre-interview questions must be filled out completely. Please note that there are no part-time positions this year.

     

    If you are successful in our initial screening, you will be invited to a formal panel job interview.

    ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

    Membership is not required to participate in the competition for this position, and no preference is given to existing members in our ranking process, however, upon acceptance of an employment contract, all employees are required to join the co-operative.


    Those not selected as a Graphic Designer are still welcome to join The Co-op as members. Professional Creator members have access to the same live or digital resources, support and community as those in our musician programs.

     

    Canadian Musicians Cooperative welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please email

    jobs@canadianmusicians.coop

    if you have any questions or require accommodations.

    We thank you for your interest in Canadian Musicians Cooperative and for participating in our competition. Only those candidates selected for consideration will be contacted.

title: Senior Designer, Live Ops
description:
Company Overview
 

WarnerMedia showcases some of the most iconic and cherished entertainment, news and sports brands in the world, but we are much more than that. WarnerMedia is truly where art meets science. Our combination of cutting-edge technology and an unrivaled commitment to groundbreaking storytelling builds a sense of community and meaningful connection that is shaping the future of media. We create rewarding opportunities across our entire family of brands, while championing a spirit of inclusion, innovation, self-development and support. Join WarnerMedia as we think big, live true and make the stories that move the world.

The creative team that brought Mortal Kombat and Injustice to life is now NetherRealm Studios, part of the Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment family. With over 20 years of creation under our belts, NetherRealm’s mission remains the same: to create cutting edge entertainment and deliver industry leading tech, game art and overall gaming experiences. NetherRealm Studios is a collaborative and creative environment, constantly striving to up the ante on what is possible in interactive entertainment. Our team is comprised of dedicated professionals with years of experience who are at the forefront of the gaming industry. The passion and energy that made Mortal Kombat a reality is still on display every day in our offices, our hallways and most definitely the studio’s arcade room.

Netherrealm Studios seek a Senior Live Ops Designer to join our mobile team in creating immersive gaming experiences. Join a historic game studio working on legendary gaming IP’s Mortal Kombat and Injustice.

The Live Ops Designer focuses on all aspects of live events for our games, from design to analytics to community. They work with other groups to create gaming content for our fans after initial launch.

Seeking candidates that excel in planning, communication, creativity, and scheduling.  

The Daily

  • Help plan long term Live Ops roadmaps with Product Management, Community, and Development Leads
  • Schedule events on a weekly and monthly cadence
  • Design, document, and direct implementation of events with the Design team
  • Review performance of the events and changes in key metrics
  • Monitor the community response and sentiment
  • Be creative and deliver the core fantasy of the IP

The Essentials

  • Experience in running Live Ops for a successful mobile title
  • Experience in designing and creating game content including detailed documentation
  • Familiarity with free-to-play game economies and Product Management concepts
  • Proactive mindset

The Nice to Haves

  • Experience working with external, international partners
  • Experience with Community and Marketing
  • Familiarity with Mortal Kombat and the DC universe

The Perks

  • Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings
  • Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees
  • Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
  • Access to in-house learning and development resources
  • Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

WarnerMedia embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@warnermedia.com.

title: Graphic Designer (In Office and Remote Options)
description:
Position Location: London, Ontario

Voices is the world’s #1 creative services marketplace.


We’ve helped tens of thousands of marketers, producers, instructors, and creative directors at the world’s biggest and most beloved brands find the right talent for their creative projects. Headquartered in London, Canada, Voices matches clients with voice over, music, audio production, and translation professionals in over 160 countries.


Voices is looking for an enthusiastic individual to join the Voices Marketing team. We are looking for a creative and collaborative individual with a passion for great design and a desire to be part of a high-performing team. As Graphic Designer, you will support the marketing department in developing creative assets to be used as part of paid digital campaigns, web page wireframes, social efforts, new project designs, logos, slide deck templates and more.


The Graphic Designer reports to the Manager, Communications.


Responsibilities

  • Receive requests and design briefs, to determine requirements and develop creative assets
  • Meet and communicate with other stakeholders in marketing and beyond, to ideate creative solutions to visual challenges, to meet program objectives. 
  • Respond in a timely manner to creative needs, to ensure the overall project timeline is maintained
  • Make and confidently explain thoughtful design choices
  • Maintain a customer perspective, to view work from their eyes
  • Maintain an understanding of the creative landscape of competitors, and stay current with design trends. Make recommendations for updates of previous work which may now require a facelift.
  • Obtain feedback from stakeholders and amend design work where required
  • Balance work requests and deadlines, to ensure appropriate prioritization. Work with your Manager in instances where conflicts occur, and ensure open communication when deadlines need to be re-considered.
  • Leverage and maintain the existing organizational design system and standard as the basis for work, ensuring that all visual assets are consistent and recognizably Voices
  • Be a part of the organizational Design Guild, meeting periodically, to ensure a singular corporate design voice is maintained. 


Skills Required

  • Highly creative, high attention to detail, with an ability to meet tight turnarounds where required
  • Must be an Adobe Creative Cloud ninja, with knowledge in ideal file set-up for efficient work 
  • Excellent communications skills
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills


Employment Experience

  • At least 5 years previous experience in graphic design
  • Relevant educational background specifically in design


Additional Application Requirements

Please include a link or attachment to your portfolio with your resume and cover letter when applying. We look forward to reviewing your application!


Equal Employment Opportunities

Voices’ values diversity. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition or disability.


Accommodation

Voices is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities; please let us know if you require an accommodation during the recruitment process.


Application Process

Interested candidates are encouraged to send their cover letter and resume by completing the online application.  By doing so, your resume is guaranteed to be reviewed.




Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Innovatia is looking for an experienced eLearning Graphic Designer to help visualize and transform ideas into stunning eLearning content. Designs may be used on the web, or on mobile devices, as part of a learning curriculum or as a stand-alone output.

The perfect candidate must be innovative and creative, and able to work effectively with the Project Manager and Content Development team to create engaging interactive eLearning designs and video assets which may include photographs, illustrations, text, audio, custom animations, and custom interactivity.

Employment Type: Contract
Location: Work from home

Candidates must be able to provide a portfolio of work samples.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Minimum 5 years of experience designing for eLearning outputs
  • Able to work in a team environment and across multiple project teams as a creative partner
  • Ability to quickly determine customer needs and effectively represent customer brand
  • Experience with rapid development tools such as Articulate StoryLine and Vyond would be considered an asset
  • Proven record for on-time delivery, in a fast-paced environment with multiple priorities

GRAPHIC DESIGN REQUIREMENTS

Expertise using:

  • Adobe Creative Suite – Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign.
  • Powerpoint
  • MS Word
  • Web Design Tools

Capabilities include:

  • Follow client branding requirements.
  • Meet with Clients and Stakeholders.
  • Create mock-ups, design storyboards and content layouts ensuring visual continuity.
  • Develop digital graphics.
  • Produce task-based documentation, reference guides, support materials, infographics.
  • Process an in-depth understanding of visual design theory, and layout.

If you are creative, hardworking, passionate, and committed to excellence, we think you’ll fit in with us. To apply: www.innovatia.net/careers

We thank all candidates for your interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Innovatia is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Graphic Designer (12-month contract)
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">CaseWare is one of Canada's original Fintech companies, having led the global audit and accounting software industry for over 30 years, with more than 500,000 users across 130 countries and available in 16 different languages.

While you might not have heard of us (yet) over 36,000 accounting and audit professionals list CaseWare as a skill on their LinkedIn profiles!

The Graphic Designer at CaseWare is responsible for developing conceptual ideas and visuals for various in-house departments as well as our international partners and distributors. You will be a part of an in-house Creative Services team that is committed to the development and implementation of marketing campaigns and projects, ranging from digital/social content to website communication pieces to partnership promotions. This includes smart, cohesive visuals, clean layouts, and supporting design elements that reflect the CaseWare brand. You will be handling small-scale projects by yourself as well as making big contributions on bigger projects working with the Creative Services team within the Centre of Excellence Marketing function.




About CaseWare
With a head office in Toronto, CaseWare is one of Canada's original Fintech companies, having led the industry for over 30 years, with more than 500,000 users across 130 countries and available in 16 different languages.

While you might not have heard of us (yet) over 36,000 accounting and audit professionals list CaseWare as a skill on their LinkedIn profiles!

CaseWare's cutting-edge software products are meticulously designed for accounting firms, corporations and governments.Our teams are continually collaborating, innovating and building upon our existing suite of products. With a customer focused mindset we are building technology that is shaping what the future of audits, financial reporting and financial data analytics will look like.

With a recent strategic investment from Hg Capital in 2020, CaseWare is now in its next major growth phase as we double down on the people and products that have made CaseWare so successful to date.

One of CaseWare's core values is that we believe Our People Make Us Great and with that in mind, we're dedicated to building teams as diverse as our customers in an equitable and inclusive way. We welcome and encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply. Should you require accommodations or have any questions at any point during the application or interview process, please e-mail our People Operations team at careers@caseware.com.

Any candidates successful in obtaining an offer for a position will need to successfully complete a background check through Certn.co which typically includes an Identity Verification and Criminal Record Check. Executives and Senior Managers will undergo a Soft Credit Check as well.

title: Senior Graphic Designer - Remote, Canada
description:
Senior Graphic Designer

About the opportunity:

Successful, hard-working, fun, and dynamic is how Flight Centre describes its culture. We look for smart, savvy individuals – innovative creative people who bring a real passion to their work. We value our people and reward them with a supportive work environment and a real career path. If you can relate to our culture, then this is an opportunity you won’t want someone else to take!

The Senior Graphic Designer role sits within our Creative Studio team – a channel within our larger Marketing Americas team. We produce compelling, visual solutions which drive our key marketing objectives forward. You will work on multiple brands under the Flight Centre Travel Group umbrella for both Canada & the USA, as well as global initiatives. This is an amazing opportunity to join a vibrant and inspiring creative team.

Key Qualifications:

  • Creative thinker who can translate verbal or written instructions into beautiful & compelling designs
  • Remains well-informed of current graphic trends and stays up-to-date with industry developments & tools
  • Ability to self-manage from brief to final asset delivery, on multiple projects simultaneously
  • Delivers concept presentations to internal clients
  • Skilled in print production prepress, file output management and photo manipulation
  • Can liaise with internal key stakeholders as well as external vendors
  • Adheres to project deadlines maintaining high-quality work and great customer service
  • Ability to juggle competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
  • Highly detail-oriented and organized
  • Has a strong ability to present creative ideas while working within corporate brand guidelines
  • Experienced in an array of asset outputs: local store marketing collateral, web banners, digital ads, in-store graphics, event material, publications
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to liaise with a global network of contacts
  • Thrives in a team environment and appreciates constructive feedback and learning opportunities
  • An upbeat, pro-active, and enthusiastic approach to work, who can problem solve and offer solutions on the go

Experience & Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 5 years of graphic design experience. Experience within an in-house team is a bonus.
  • BA or Diploma in Design
  • Exceptional portfolio showcasing innovative design concepts, a strong understanding of working within brand guidelines, and highly considered visual executions
  • Proficiency in Mac with expert knowledge of Adobe CC: InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, Acrobat (After Effects or Premiere Pro a plus)
  • Experience working with a project management tool
  • Strong creative problem-solving skills
  • Preferred but not essential: video production capabilities

Benefits Include:

  • Generous remuneration structure
  • Travel perks/discounts.
  • Health & Wellness Programs and Employee Financial Wellness Services
  • Generous paid-time off policy
  • National/International Award Nights and Conferences
  • Diversity & Inclusion initiatives
  • Benefits including vision, medical, and dental
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • RRSP with matching
  • Employee Share Plan
  • Global career opportunities in a network of brands and businesses
  • Ongoing training and professional development
  • Fun and flexible work environment
  • Proud Corporate Social Responsibility platform through the Flight Centre Foundation and Brighter Futures program supporting nominated charities through Workplace Giving, Volunteering and Fundraising.
    • Employee giving program
    • Annual Charity Trip
    • Office Environmental Program
    • 1 Volunteer Day per Calendar Year

Location – Remote, Canada

If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for and you would like to be part of our award-winning culture then APPLY NOW.

** Please include a link to your digital portfolio or attach a design sample to your application**

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, priority will be given to those located in our corporate headquarter cities of: Toronto, Ontario and Vancouver, BC.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

Our promise is to provide an environment with equality of respect, dignity and opportunity for all our employees. We value an inclusive and supportive workplace which truly reflects the diversification of our society. Flight Centre Travel Group is committed to providing a barrier-free pathway throughout our recruitment selection process. If you require accommodation because of a disability at any stage of our hiring process, please let us know in advance by contacting our Recruitment Team at

fccareers@flightcentre.ca

title: Sr. Content Designer, Ad Formats (Remote - Canada)
description:
Twitter is what’s happening and what people are talking about right now. For us, life's not about a job, it's about purpose. We believe real change starts with conversation. Here, your voice matters. Come as you are and together we'll do what's right (not what's easy) to serve the public conversation.

Twitter is looking for an experienced Content Designer to join our Ad Formats team in creating industry-leading solutions that support ways for advertisers to uniquely express themselves and connect with their audiences on our platform.You’ll be working on user flows, new features, in-product messaging, content frameworks, navigation, product naming, and more. You’ll also manage feedback from cross functional partners, conduct content audits, write, edit, and pick just the right emoji.Throughout, you’ll champion and evangelize Content Design’s power throughout Twitter’s products and platforms.

Who we are:

In Content Design, we write the words and build strategies. If advertisers saw it in our products, we checked it against our style guide, developed the system, tested the messaging, and then collaborated across a number of teams to launch it into the world.

Who you are:

As a customer advocate

  • Learning is at the core of your content design strategy, and you approach problems with a curious and open mind.

  • You care deeply about our diverse customer audiences and recognize the importance of creating best-in-class experiences for them. 

  • You’re confident in advocating for customers — even when others disagree with your approach. 

  • You have a deep curiosity about problems or things that aren’t working effectively, can see hidden problems, look beyond the obvious, and don’t stop at first answers.

As a team member

  • You bring a strong sense of business acumen, relationship management, and superior analytical skills with a proven track record for identifying and solving problems.

  • You thrive in navigating fast-paced, complex environments and you can adapt to change and find the right path—even when you don’t have all the pieces of the puzzle.

  • You’re a detailed problem solver who confidently collaborates with a range of product and delivery-focused teams.

  • By default, you’re someone who always assumes positive intent and seeks out diverse perspectives. 

What you'll do:

  • Design, write, edit, test, and improve the content that makes our products easier to use. This includes end-to-end product flows, interface language, education materials, product names, navigational nomenclature, terminology, taxonomies, and other content across Twitter ads products and experiences.

  • Collaborate daily with peers in every discipline, including engineering, design, research, marketing, and data science, to take products from conception to launch and create #OnlyOnTwitter experiences.

  • Present your work and strategy to get buy-in from key stakeholders.

  • Boldly advocate for a healthy customer experience. 

  • Demonstrate sound judgment and influence product decisions, team direction, and strategy.

  • Partner with our internationalization and localization teams to ensure product experiences are of the highest quality in every language.

  • Plan how content varies based on customer needs and where each need arises in the customer journey.

  • Give and solicit feedback from your UX design peers to build the best products.

  • Edit and contribute to designs and content in Figma or other design tools.

  • Independently and proactively identify and work on projects that span multiple teams.

  • Help shape the internal Design community, provide mentorship, and develop skills of other content designers.

  • Ensure “Tweet” is capitalized—everywhere and always.

  • 6+ years in a writing capacity: content strategy, UX, or copywriting.

  • 3–5+ years’ experience writing and designing content for web or mobile.

  • Exceptional writing skills and unparalleled attention to detail.

  • Adept at simplifying and communicating complex ideas to broad audiences.

  • Ability to craft narratives and frameworks that guide people through a product experience.

  • Expert in translating technical capabilities into customer benefits.

  • Proven systems thinking, with aptitude for learning our technical systems.

  • Experience presenting designs and strategies to get buy-in from key stakeholders.

  • Comfortable working in ambiguous environments where there's not always a step-by-step guide to completing a project. 

  • Experience analyzing qualitative and quantitative data to inform content decisions.

  • Familiarity with mobile ad creation and digital marketing.

title: Graphic/Digital Designer - Production (Remote, Canada)
description:
We're seeking a motivated and high-energy Graphic/Digital Designer (Production) to work with some of the largest events in the world. 

Joining our Design Team, you’ll be responsible for applying brand guidelines, requirements, and assets to our Eventbase app platform—helping mobile apps take on the look and feel of each client’s brand. Graphic/Digital Designers (Production) are crucial to success at Eventbase, working within our Delivery teams to produce award-winning mobile apps for the largest companies in the world. 

This is a full-time remote position. Please note that we can only consider candidates who reside in Canada with valid working status and are looking for someone to work Eastern Standard Time (EST).

About Eventbase
Eventbase has set the gold standard for live event technology for more than a decade. We power mobile event apps for global brands including Salesforce, Cisco, SAP, Deloitte and Charles Schwab. We also build official mobile apps for massive events including South By Southwest (SXSW) and National Retail Federation Big Show, as well as three Olympic Games. Eventbase has been recognized with more awards than any other event app platform, including being named winner of “Best Event App” at the Event Technology Awards five times. 

We are driven by our mission: to bring people together for the magic of live events, and we’re proud that our industry-leading products have been at the heart of exceptional live events around the world since 2009. Millions of attendees across thousands of events have held Eventbase’s product in their hand as they walked the conference floor, participated in sessions and interacted with others onsite. Our team has a track record of pioneering breakthrough live event technology, and there are more exciting innovations to come. The event industry is being reinvented in the wake of Covid-19, and Eventbase is uniquely positioned to play a key role in this new world of events. We’re moving forward with our vision to shape the future of live event experiences.

Are you ready to join the industry leader in live event technology?

What You’ll Do

  • Work closely with Producers and Delivery Teams to adapt requirements and apply brand guidelines to mobile apps for client events
  • Work hands-on to implement visual design and graphics for iOS and Android platforms, coordinating with mobile developers as necessary
  • Promote the use of visual design principles within the company that reinforce accessibility and usability standards (Human Interface Guidelines, Material Design)
  • Contribute to the Eventbase Visual Design language through internal and external marketing initiatives

What You Bring

  • A portfolio showing a selection of previous projects
  • Degree in Design (Interactive, Graphic, Digital or a related field) preferred
  • 1+ years of interaction or graphic design, with experience creating visuals for mobile app interfaces
  • Excellent organizational, leadership, teamwork and communication (written / verbal) skills
  • Experience working in a rapidly changing environment
  • Proficiency with Figma and Adobe Creative Cloud
  • Working knowledge in development environment (Android Studio and XCode) and of front-end web development (HTML5, CSS3) is a huge plus
Why Join the Eventbase Team?
At Eventbase we value trust, respect and authenticity, and believe we are all better together. Joining the Eventbase team means you will enjoy a progressive work environment with some exceptional perks, including the option to go onsite at some of the largest events on the planet. We enjoy “No Meeting Fridays” and Eventbasers get every second Friday off, so you can have an extra 26 long weekends every year in addition to statutory holidays. We have a $1,250 annual professional development allocation and $1,000 per year to set up your home office. We also offer comprehensive benefits including extended health care from your first day, a $1000 flexible health/wellness spending account, paid parental leave for all new parents, and paid mental health days. And of course we offer competitive market salaries and employee stock options too.
 
At Eventbase we work hard and smart, and take time to celebrate our wins. We are a “remote-first” organization, so our team can work from anywhere in Canada. You will never be required to work out of an office if it doesn’t work for you.
 
We’re proud of our diverse team: Eventbasers hail from all over the world, with many different backgrounds, cultures and interests. We actively promote women working in technology both internally and by partnering with women in tech organizations externally. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national or ethnic origin, gender or gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital or family status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Senior Designer (Contract)
description:
Bounteous is looking for a Contract Senior Designer to join our fast-growing design practice. The Senior Designer designs and contributes to creative concepts, detailed design, enhancements, and execution of digital media (websites, mobile applications, social media assets, email templates, etc.) for a wide variety of clients. The ideal candidate must be able to design, develop, or enhance existing graphic/identity branding that meets marketing objectives, integrates customer usability best practices, and address client brand standards. This is a hands-on opportunity ideal for an organized and detail-oriented individual who can consistently deliver high quality, data-driven solutions. The ideal candidate is a naturally engaging storyteller who works closely with cross-disciplinary teams to further best practices at every opportunity.

Role and Responsibilities

  • Produce meticulous, beautiful experiences that take into account business and user objectives, brand guidelines, and channel specifications or requirements (websites, mobile applications, email, etc.)
  • Create and present design deliverables with limited oversight including design concepts, comps, experience strategy documentation, prototypes, style guides, pattern libraries, deliverable styling, etc.
  • Present design decisions to the internal and client teams and iterate and implement feedback
  • Work closely with Designers, UX Designers, Front- and Back-End Developers, Content Specialists, Business Analysts, and internal Project Managers to ensure all functionality and design is meeting client and user expectations
  • Participate in discovery activities such as design workshops, brand questionnaire and overviews, digital system/style audits, competitive analysis, etc.
  • Juggle multiple projects and clients simultaneously
  • Prototype complex interactions with high standards of usability in mind
  • Serves as a resident expert of digital tools and is skilled in developing digital design concepts. Is well-versed with web technology, usability, and core development tools; understands web design constraints, including a strong understanding of designing for a CMS.
  • Actively contributes to and/or leads our culture and atmosphere, quality of work, and growth into the next generation of experience designers
  • Responsible for giving continuous feedback to peers, completing self-review, inputting time consistently, and communicating deadline conflicts

Preferred Qualifications

  • 3-6 years of experience as a creative professional, with a focus on design, user experience, and storytelling. Consulting/Agency experience is a plus.
  • Background in responsive and mobile design
  • In depth knowledge / proficiency with Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator), Sketch, InVision, Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Experience in Adobe After Effects or similar motion graphics programs a plus
  • Impeccable understanding of typography, layout, color, and all other elements of design
  • Experience designing around data sets and reusable components/patterns
  • Ability to communicate effectively with colleagues and project team members
  • Excellent listener with a passion for human-centered design
  • Is proactive and has efficient time-management skills
  • B.S./B.A./B.F.A. in graphic design, digital design, visual communication, or other design-related fields or relevant experience
#LI-Remote

We invite you to subscribe to our monthly and quarterly newsletters to stay up to date with the latest job openings as well as resources and tips for job seekers here.

Research shows that women and other underrepresented groups apply only if they meet 100% of the criteria of a job posting. If you have passion and intelligence, and possess a technical knack (even if you’re missing some of the above), we encourage you to apply.

Bounteous is focused on promoting an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate the different viewpoints and experiences our diverse group of team members bring to Bounteous. Bounteous does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Bounteous is willing to sponsor eligible candidates for employment visas.

For employment opportunities based in Canada:
Bounteous is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace. In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, accommodation will be provided at any point throughout the hiring process, provided the candidate makes their accommodation needs known to Bounteous. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates. 

**Must be legally eligible to work in Canada.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
SPUD.cais looking for a Graphic Designerto join our growing team!


SPUD.ca is an online grocery delivery business in Western Canada. We are a passionate team who believe that food touches every aspect of our lives, so we are advocates forsustainable farming practices, sourcing locally, treating animals humanely, and reducing food waste. As a Certified B Corporation since 2013, we are committed to socially responsible business practices.


As a Graphic Designerwith SPUD.ca, you will be responsible for creatinginnovative and striking creative assets to support the SPUD.ca Marketing efforts and increase sales.


SPUD.ca is a subsidiary of Freshlocal Solutions (TSX: LOCL); a Vancouver-based leader in end-to-end grocery e-commerce solutions. Our mission is to leverage innovation and technology to create a sustainable and profitable food system for all. We have developed deep expertise across the farm-to-fork value chain, both digitally and physically. Combined with explosive growth in the industry, plus having gone public in April 2021, our business is at an exciting point in its journey.

Responsibilities:

  • Produce and maintain ads for publications across Blush Lane, SPUD & Be Fresh.

  • Ensure that design aligns with the established look and feel and stays fresh every week.

  • Ensure designs are consistent across all print ads and are in line with the current campaigns/themes Marketing is promoting.

  • Be part of the design team for all general design & print requests including supporting our office team, events team, community, warehouse, HR, Blush Lane, and keeping our brands consistent.

  • Maintain processes in regard to concept development, design, and delivery. This will mean working with a number of people to help you produce and meet your deadlines.

  • Support the team throughout the execution of campaigns and projects. This will include online and offline assets.

  • Share inspiration, discuss trends, and identify and address process improvements pertaining to creative tasks by participating in our weekly creative collaborations.

  • Help maintain design consistency by documenting, when appropriate, in a mini-creative guide.

  • Follow Brand Guide, but also able to inform and evolve our brand standards through a creative lens.

  • Stay on top of trends and innovations in design.

  • Keep on top of new tools in Adobe Creative suite.

  • Communicate with the Creative Director regarding any creative challenges and for feedback on new creative concepts for approvals.

  • Liaise effectively with clients and other team members on creative briefs.

  • Ensure all design produced meets the needs, requirements, and brand values. This may mean getting comfortable in questioning a brief and inputting/sharing ideas of ways to better meet the requirements outlined.

  • Be responsible for helping to keep the new design process in place.

  • Additional duties as required.


  • Completion of a formal graphic design program.

  • 2+ years of experience in graphic design for print and web.

  • Experience with producing simple animations is considered an asset.

  • You’re a rock star in Adobe Creative Suite primarily using Photoshop, Illustrator, XD and a bit of InDesign. Experience with Adobe Premiere is considered an asset.

  • Do you have a passion for food and photography? As a part of your job you may need to collaborate with our in-house photographer to create mood boards for custom photography for our campaign and marketing needs.

  • Some pre-press experience is valuable.

  • May require some collaboration with our UX designers.

  • Ability to manage your own workload and priorities to meet our deadlines.


What's in it for you?

  • Join now and receive an initial $250.00 of SPUD credit, and another $250.00 of SPUD credit after six months of employment ($500.00 total)
  • 20% discount on SPUD.CA purchases
  • Flexible health spending plan options and benefits available for all team members working more than 14 hours per week


SPUD's approach to inclusivehiring

Our team is committed to building relationships rooted in trust, integrity and respect. We believe in a growth mindset and support our team members' personal and professionalgrowthin a safe work environment. We know from experience that great talent comes in many forms and we want to meet you at your best. Please let us know if we can provide unique accommodations that will enable your equal participation!


Our Values

Our values are more than just words to us. Our values drive our success and guide our growth:

  • Create amazing customer experiences. We are passionate in our commitment to deliver for our customers.
  • Lead with sustainability and consider our impact.
  • Learn, grow and make time to celebrate wins together
  • We welcome different perspectives. Diversity makes us stronger.
  • Prioritize, work smart and deliver results for our stakeholders and each other.
  • We are committed to our mission and that requires resilience, persistence and grit to persevere and succeed.

title: Senior Graphic Designer
description:
Senior Graphic Designer

 

About the opportunity:

Successful, hard-working, fun, and dynamic is how Flight Centre describes its culture. We look for smart, savvy individuals – innovative creative people who bring a real passion to their work. We value our people and reward them with a supportive work environment and a real career path. If you can relate to our culture, then this is an opportunity you won’t want someone else to take!

The Senior Graphic Designer role sits within our Creative Studio team – a channel within our larger Marketing Americas team. We produce compelling, visual solutions which drive our key marketing objectives forward. You will work on multiple brands under the Flight Centre Travel Group umbrella for both Canada & the USA, as well as global initiatives. This is an amazing opportunity to join a vibrant and inspiring creative team.

Key Qualifications:

  • Creative thinker who can translate verbal or written instructions into beautiful & compelling designs
  • Remains well-informed of current graphic trends and stays up-to-date with industry developments & tools
  • Ability to self-manage from brief to final asset delivery, on multiple projects simultaneously
  • Delivers concept presentations to internal clients 
  • Skilled in print production prepress, file output management and photo manipulation 
  • Can liaise with internal key stakeholders as well as external vendors
  • Adheres to project deadlines maintaining high-quality work and great customer service
  • Ability to juggle competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
  • Highly detail-oriented and organized
  • Has a strong ability to present creative ideas while working within corporate brand guidelines 
  • Experienced in an array of asset outputs: local store marketing collateral, web banners, digital ads, in-store graphics, event material, publications
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to liaise with a global network of contacts
  • Thrives in a team environment and appreciates constructive feedback and learning opportunities
  • An upbeat, pro-active, and enthusiastic approach to work, who can problem solve and offer solutions on the go

Experience & Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 5 years of graphic design experience. Experience within an in-house team is a bonus.
  • BA or Diploma in Design
  • Exceptional portfolio showcasing innovative design concepts, a strong understanding of working within brand guidelines, and highly considered visual executions 
  • Proficiency in Mac with expert knowledge of Adobe CC: InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, Acrobat (After Effects or Premiere Pro a plus)
  • Experience working with a project management tool
  • Strong creative problem-solving skills
  • Preferred but not essential: video production capabilities

Benefits Include:

  • Generous remuneration structure
  • Travel perks/discounts.
  • Health & Wellness Programs and Employee Financial Wellness Services
  • Generous paid-time off policy
  • National/International Award Nights and Conferences
  • Diversity & Inclusion initiatives
  • Benefits including vision, medical, and dental
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • RRSP with matching
  • Employee Share Plan
  • Global career opportunities in a network of brands and businesses
  • Ongoing training and professional development
  • Fun and flexible work environment
  • Proud Corporate Social Responsibility platform through the Flight Centre Foundation and Brighter Futures program supporting nominated charities through Workplace Giving, Volunteering and Fundraising.
    • Employee giving program
    • Annual Charity Trip
    • Office Environmental Program
    • 1 Volunteer Day per Calendar Year

Location – Remote, Canada

If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for and you would like to be part of our award-winning culture then APPLY NOW. 

** Please include a link to your digital portfolio or attach a design sample to your application**

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, priority will be given to those located in our corporate headquarter cities of: Toronto, Ontario and Vancouver, BC.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

Our promise is to provide an environment with equality of respect, dignity and opportunity for all our employees.  We value an inclusive and supportive workplace which truly reflects the diversification of our society.  Flight Centre Travel Group is committed to providing a barrier-free pathway throughout our recruitment selection process.  If you require accommodation because of a disability at any stage of our hiring process, please let us know in advance by contacting our Recruitment Team at

fccareers@flightcentre.ca

title: Visual Designer
description:
Who we are

mobileLIVE is a full-service digital company obsessed with helping our clients make smart investments and reduce time-to-launch.

Our team hailing from 25 countries, specializes in designing experiences, building products, and scaling technology and is committed to helping our clients navigate the most demanding challenges, unlock the real potential, and drive transformative and scalable growth.

100% client retention and 20 notable industry recognition reflect our reliability in delivering what we promise and the quality we bring to every engagement.

Join our growth-driven culture and help us lead, innovate, and simplify. We are looking for team members who embody our values:
  • Empathetic - we listen, we understand, and are considerate of everyone
  • Persevering - we don’t give up on challenges or people and go all the way
  • Inclusive - we value everyone and their perspectives
  • Reliable - we deliver what we promise, and more
  • Innovative - we make things better than they were yesterday
The role

mobileLIVE is looking for a Graphic Designer for one of its clients (Lookout) focusing on corp website design, branding, campaign contents, promo screens. Mobile app design experience will be a bonus point but the above mentioned becomes the core part.

mobileLIVE is a technology solutions company that partners with its customers to co-invent the future and launch products, experiences, and technology platforms to accelerate digital transformation.

You will
  • Work on a wide range of projects and media, using various computer software to visualize and develop innovative graphic designs that meet business goals
  • Research, outline, design and edit new and existing content, working closely with various departments to understand project requirements
  • Obtain input from management, ensuring designs meet organizational standards and brand expectations, express ideas accurately, and represent the company or client appropriately
  • Work independently and cooperatively on multiple projects, meeting deadlines and budget constraints, and scheduling project implementation based on workload
  • Develop content in alternative media forms for maximum usability, with a consistent and cohesive voice across all documentation
  • Examine existing processes, identifying flaws, and creating solutions to improve design capabilities
  • Update and maintain internal databases of designs, photography, and video
  • Translate strategic direction into the high-quality design within an established brand identity
  • Develop concepts by hand or with software, and execute original content determining ideal usage of color, text, font style, imagery, and layout
  • Manage the design and uploading process of all project material, understanding best practices for using a content management system
Who you are
  • Bachelor’s degree in graphic design, art, or similar discipline
  • Exceptional creativity and innovative design skills
  • 2+ years experience (academic and professional) with design software, including Adobe Creative Cloud, Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, Dreamweaver, Articulate360 etc.
  • Proven experience with graphic design, with a strong portfolio of work
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Organizational and time-management skills for meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment
  • Knowledge of content management systems is a plus
  • Photography experience and proficiency with photo-editing software is a plus
  • Desire to continue to grow skill set with ongoing education and training
What to expect

Besides Competitive Salary and working for one of Canada’s Best Managed and Top 50 Technology Companies, you should expect:
  • Purposeful Work: autonomy, resources, and time you need to do what matters for our clients and most importantly - you
  • Positive Environment: recognition coupled with a flexible environment that celebrates diversity, inclusivity and encourages everyone to achieve their best
  • Growth & Development: opportunities to grow professionally and personally through mentorship, training, and development programs
  • Transparency & Trust: direction, purpose, mission, and expectations are never a secret; you’ll always know where you stand as well as where you’re going
  • Exclusive Perks: discounts on shopping, the gym, insurance, mobile phone plans, not to mention an office smoothie bar and enough coffee to make you vibrate
  • Meaningful Benefits: life happens. You’ll get health, dental, vision, disability, travel insurance, and much more all covered by us
  • Unforgettable Events: team bonding, BBQs, office lunches (pizza, always pizza), gala dinners, and any other excuse to have fun
Inclusion and equal opportunity employment

mobileLIVE is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status, or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodation during the application process is available upon request.

Are you ready to join the award-winning team and help us accelerate digital transformation?

title: Graphic Designer, Office and Retail
description:
The Opportunity

We are seeking a talented, creative and driven Graphic Designer to work within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. An individual who thrives on maintaining responsibility for the design and visual aspects of each assignment, working closely across a variety of divisions including Investment, Office Leasing, Industrial and Retail. You will be part of the world’s fastest-growing commercial real estate services firm market with an opportunity to work alongside and learn from some of the best in the industry in an open, collaborative culture of respect and professional growth.


Reporting to the Senior Marketing Manager, the Graphic Designer is required to perform a range of duties including, but not limited to:

Graphic Design

  • Manage the design and layout of various marketing materials in the office and retail division (flyers, surveys, brochures, sales advertisements, proposals, presentations) in line with brand purpose and messaging
  • Provide creative and innovative approaches to marketing programs for various sales teams and service lines
  • Manage and prepare email marketing campaigns using marketing automation platform (Buildout and Hubspot)
  • Thrive in a fast paced, dynamic and ever evolving real estate environment
  • Be solution focused and able to provide creative results to unique challenges
  • Other special projects as required or assigned

Administrative and Reception Duties (as required)

  • Provide administrative support to management and other staff
  • Handle sensitive and highly confidential information
  • Reception duties are minimal yet required for covering breaks and other duties:
  • Prepare and review correspondence, reports and presentations
  • Diploma or Post-Secondary education in Graphic Design or a minimum of 3 years’ professional work experience as a Graphic Designer is required.
  • Proficiency in the use of specific computer programs:
  • Advanced knowledge of InDesign
  • Intermediate knowledge of Photoshop and Illustrator
  • Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Outlook, Excel & PowerPoint)
  • Experience using marketing automation platforms is preferred, but not required
  • Experience using Hubspot is a plus
  • Experience in the design/printing/publishing industry is an asset
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Recognized ability to work as a collaborative team member and provide support an individual or team
  • Strong organizational skills, uncanny attention to detail and ability to prioritize
  • Ability to work well under pressure, handle multiple assignments and work efficiently to meet tight deadlines
  • Demonstrated problem solving and ability to use discretion


Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.

For those requiring assistance with disabilities, Information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

title: U.X. (User Experience) Designer
description:
Who we are: Amilia is more than just a tech company – we’re a close-knit family made up of caring, entrepreneurial-minded individuals. Our multi-disciplinary team members will challenge and support you on every project.

What we do: We provide online registration and digital management software solutions to recreation organizations, such as cheer gyms, gymnastics clubs, dance studios, and many more.

How we do what we do: We provide all our team members with the tools and flexibility they need to succeed every day. We also put an emphasis on collaboration and encourage everyone to bring new ideas to the table, even if it’s outside of your department.

Why we do what we do: We’re not just here to sell software – we want to revolutionize the way recreation organizations leverage technology. Every Amilian is incredibly invested in our mission to disrupt the status quo and help our clients achieve great things.


What to expect:

As a member of the product team, you will be responsible for designing and expressing ideas to solve market problems. With a passion for solving core product problems, you will also be developing a deep empathy and understanding of our users, producing exceptional experiences, and becoming their voice throughout Amilia.


You’ll be responsible for:

Iterative & Collaborative design

  • Conduct collaborative design sessions with colleagues and test designs and prototypes with users; 
  • Assist development teams by identifying objectives and overcoming constraints regarding the user experience & interface; 
  • Create flows, sketches, wireframes, low and high-fidelity mock-ups; 
  • Actively participates in Sprint Planning & Reviews; and 
  • Leverage existing user experience best practices to inform design. 

Research & User empathy

  • Meet & shadow customers to develop empathy and an understanding of market problems; 
  • Conduct user interviews, and user experience experiments; 
  • Aggregate and analyze data from market research and usability experiments to validate decision making; 
  • Balance usage of primary and secondary research; 
  • Shadow front-line Amilians as they interact with leads, and users; and 
  • Use designed solutions in applied situations with users. 

User Experience Advocacy

  • in our Design System; 
  • Promote design principles and user experience best practices; 
  • Share results from usability research through presentations and blogs; and 
  • Coach software developers to use U.X. resources and become autonomous. 


What we want from you:

  • From 1 to 3 years of experience in graphic or U.X. design (portfolio, consulting, hobby, previous job, etc.);
  • Comfortable using design software such as Figma, Adobe XD, Moqups, Balsamiq, etc.);
  • Bilingual (Great spoken English & French);
  • Invested in continuous improvement & learning opportunities;
  • Enthusiastic about change & experiments;
  • Methodic, organized and solution-oriented; and
  • Has a deep empathy for users.


What you’ll get from us:

  • Competitive salary & insurance package;
  • Group RRSP employer contribution up to 5%;
  • Wellness credit (500$ per year);
  • Flexible hybrid work model (home-office) and possibility to work from anywhere in Québec;
  • Dedicated Learning and Development Specialist committed to your personal and professional development;
  • Weekly Amilia fitness classes (Yoga and Bootcamp);
  • A strong work-life balance with paid vacation, personal days, and year-round mini-Fridays;
  • Monthly commuter discount of 25%;
  • Team bonding and social activities once a quarter;
  • Up to 15 hours of group volunteering paid per year;
  • Skill development opportunities through Lunch & Learn talks;
  • In-office snacks, including fresh fruit baskets, coffee, and free drinks.
