title: Sr. Designer (1 Year Contract)
description:
Overview

Recipe Unlimited Corporation is Canada’s leading full service restaurant company. Home to such iconic brands as Swiss Chalet, Harvey’s, St.Hubert, The Keg, Montana’s, Kelseys, Pubs, Bier Markt, East Side Mario’s, Landing Group, New York Fries, the Burger’s Priest, The Pickle Barrel & Catering, State and Main, Elephant and Castle and Original Joe’s. With this diverse portfolio of restaurants our Home Office Teammates have the opportunity to work on a wide variety of some of the most popular, well-loved brands in Canada. Variety isn’t the only thing we offer - we are passionate about our industry, we celebrate and support diversity of thought, we are innately curious and encourage our Teammates to take ownership. Above all else, we believe in doing the right thing for our people, our communities and our planet.

 

 

Reporting to the Design Manager, the purpose of this position is to lead and execute the creative designs and restaurant concept development including interiors, exterior design, space planning, 3D modelling, and graphic/signage design.  Success in this role requires partnering with key internal and external stakeholders, external consult teams to recommend, influence and lead restaurant designs that are efficient, sustainable, innovative, and attractive to Recipe brand’s current and future customer. May lead major initiatives and projects under limited supervision.

 

 

Role Responsibilities

 

  • Responsible for facilitating, protecting, and preserving the brand image as it relates to brand concept operational standards, and design specifications.
  • Working within the national framework for interior and architectural design with Brand and Construction teams to develop and maintain concept designs.
  • Responsible for leading the coordination, communication, and prioritizing brand initiatives as they relate to exterior and interior design of RECIPE brands.
  • Responsible for aligning design standards including layouts, finishes, and FF&E specifications to the Brand design intent, marketing, growth strategies, and safety criteria.
  • Prepare 3D renderings for exterior and interior concept designs with exterior building materials and interior finishes for evaluation of design concepts and presentation of proposed concepts to Brand leaders.
  • Reviews all design standards for overall impact to restaurant profitability and evaluates initial design concept development for décor and operational impact working with external and internal designers.
  • Coordinate the brand finishes schedules, design standards, and specifications.
  • Maintains knowledge of current and new code requirements, finishes, restaurant design, and interior design industry trends. 
  • Lead and coordinate brand space planning and service innovation; improve functional restaurant design and value engineering to reduce overall development costs and more sustainable buildings.
  • Responsible for maintaining knowledge of current and new finishes and lighting materials, equipment, code requirements and restaurant design industry trends.
  • Work in conjunction with Vendor management and Building standards teams to determine the best designs and finishes costs from the approved RECIPE supplier poolWork with Sustainability Manager to ensure sustainable design practices are being developed, specified, and followed. 

 

 

Skills & Education

  • University degree or Post-Secondary College Diploma required
  • Professional interior designer or equivalent restaurant design experience required
  • Architectural Technician or Technologist optional
  • Must be highly proficient in 3D modeling and renderings Sketchup (required), 3ds Max (optional), and fluent in Google Suite (Drive, Sheets, Docs, Slides), and MS Office.  
  • Minimum 5-7+ years of design experience working in Restaurant/Bar Interior Design / Hospitality Interior Design / Commercial retail  / Architectural knowledge required 
  • Design and functional knowledge of restaurant equipment and restaurant operations preferred
  • Demonstrated skills in design project management
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to meet deadlines and manage competing priorities
  • Highly organized, able to handle various types of projects, and prioritize accordingly
  • Valid driver's license and driving record within provincial guidelines.

 

What’s in it for you?

  • Flexible/Hybrid work environment
  • You’d be joining a close-knit, innovative team of creative and energetic go-getters
  • You’d be a part of Canada’s largest full-service restaurant company that leads the industry in size and innovation
  • 20% associate discount dining card and monthly dining allowance valid at participating Recipe brands
  • A welcoming, fun and safe work environment founded on respect
  • Career advancement opportunities with a company that owns some of Canada’s most iconic restaurant brands
  • Industry-leading benefits, wellness programs, and total rewards programs

 

Recipe is committed to providing a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. Celebrating people, being passionate and curious, owning it, and doing the right thing are the values that guide how we build our teams, support our franchisees and create a company that unlocks the full potential of everyone.

 

Recipe is dedicated to providing accommodations in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. For individuals that require accommodations please contact recruit@recipeunlimited.com.

title: Designer/designer

The reputation of this one, based on excellence, professional rigor as well as team spirit is already well rooted and continues to increase in the field, just like its ambitions.

your mission as designer/designer:

you will team up with the project manager and the engineer for the design of projects by coordinating their specific characteristics as well as production Technical drawings according to established standards.

  • Establish and carry out general concepts, studies, analyzes, expertise and respective reports to projects

title: Digital Production Artist
description:
BIMM is booming, so we're looking for a Digital Production Artist to join our team. 

WHO WE ARE

For over 30 years, weâ€™ve crafted flawless data driven creative solutions for some of the biggest brands in Canada and across the globe. Everything we do is guided by a simple philosophy: marketing with greater certainty. We love creating amazing integrated brand experiences for our clients that deliver real business results.

We all act as one unit and believe in â€œhaving every BIMMERâ€™s backâ€. Nice people only. Egos need not apply.

THE ROLE

Weâ€™re searching for a hard worker, who isnâ€™t afraid to roll up their sleeves. Our ideal candidate is a friendly, service-oriented individual who boasts excellent communication and language skills (familiarity with French is an asset). Motivation and a focus on product quality are required, as is the ability to work well within a team and a desire to grow

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

You will be responsible for the formatting and production of various digital design projects including email, websites, banners, social campaigns, and animation within these projects. Youâ€™ll be working with Art Directors, Designers and Copywriters. The ideal candidate is well versed in digital design systems and is on the forefront of technological advancements in this discipline.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 4 years of agency experience in a high-volume Studio environment
  • Experience in Sketch, or XD is mandatory
  • Excellent knowledge of creating animation in After Effects
  • Degree or diploma in graphic design, or the equivalent experience
  • A keen eye for detail and consistency
  • Experience maintaining, updating, and creating an efficient workflow using design systems
  • Excellent design and layout skills, using inspiration from latest design trends
  • Understanding of accessibility standards and best practices
  • Excellent communication skills

 

BIMM is committed to providing an environment that is inclusive and accessible. We are an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants for employment without discrimination. Please let us know if accommodation for the recruitment/interview process is required and we will work with you to make sure your needs are met.

title: 3D Designer (Characters) - BC
description:
At Mainframe Studios, weâ€™re creators first. We eat creative and technical challenges for breakfast and come back for more. Weâ€™ve been doing this for 25 years, and weâ€™re still going strong. Weâ€™re lucky enough to have the best team in the business. From our artists to our technical and production folks, everyone is passionate about collaborating on some kickass projects. Weâ€™ve partnered with the biggest names in the business to create a huge library of content. With partners like Mattel, Netflix, DreamWorks, Sony, Silvergate, and Nickelodeon, it's no wonder weâ€™ve established ourselves as a creative force to be reckoned with.

WE WANT YOU (and your mad skills)! 

Under the guidance of the Production Designer/Art Director, on a CG animated film, the Designer creates 2D and 3D designs and/or orthographics of characters depending on their area of expertise.

While our studio remains in beautiful Kitsilano, Vancouver, we have transitioned all of our staff to work from home during these difficult times of the COVID-19 outbreak. Our technology allows our employees to log in remotely to our on-site workstations with little or no noticeable difference from the way they worked in our studio. We now have team members working all across BC, and are happy to consider that option into the future for many positions!

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Under the leadership of the Production Designer/Art Director, the Designer creates designs that support the overall creative vision for the story based on the determined style of the project.
  • Interprets and implements notes and feedback from the Production Designer/Art Director or Lead in a timely and qualitatively acceptable way.
  • Collaborates with modelers to test efficacy of 3D elements, modifying designs as required.
  • Delivers assignments per project's schedules.
  • Adheres to digital file management protocols.
  • Aligns and engages with the values of Mainframe: a culture of community, connectivity, creativity and collaboration.
  • Interacts respectfully and professionally with colleagues, staff members and clients. 

Qualifications and Skills

  • Degree and/or diploma in fine arts or animation or equivalent experience preferred.
  • 2-3 years of experience working in a professional environment within their discipline. 
  • A keen eye for the aesthetic needs as well as diverse visual development styles as required by the project.
  • Working knowledge of anatomy, proportion, perspective and composition.  Ability to visualize perspective and 3-dimensional space.  Strong drawing, illustration and/or painting skills.
  • Understanding of CG animation, particularly in modeling and rigging.
  • Proficiency using Photoshop is required.  Familiarity with After Effects, ZBrush, Corel Painter, Illustrator and Maya is considered an asset.
  • Ability to communicate ideas clearly and concisely.
  • Proactively communicates production issues to supervisor.  Practices attentive and active listening.  Shares information, methodologies and ideas with others.  Incorporates feedback and direction received from Director/Supervisor.

--

Mainframe Studios is an Equal Opportunity Employer, which means we will not discriminate against any individual based on race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military or veteran status, disability, or any factors prohibited by applicable law. This policy applies to every aspect of employment at Mainframe Studios, including recruitment, hiring, training, advancement, and termination. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and partners. Should you require accommodation throughout the recruitment process, please let us know your requirements when contacted.

title: Senior Digital Designer - Canada
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">At Directive, we take solving complex performance marketing problems for SaaS companies seriously. We demonstrate this by only working with clients who share our values and by giving your team ample time to focus on hitting your client’s goals.

Beyond the work, we are fiercely passionate about living out a People First culture. One of the ways we act out our passion for our team is by paying a living wage at Directive. We are experiencing unprecedented growth and now expanding globally.

This role will report to the Director of Performance Creative, and be part of the Performance Creative team. Our team works with a variety of clients within the B2B SaaS space to create beautiful, high-performing digital designs that support their marketing goals.

This role will work both directly with assigned clients and as part of an interdisciplinary team of strategists specializing in Paid Media, SEO, and/or Account/Project Managers to deeply understand target audiences and identify what visual components will have the strongest impact on the client’s bottom line.

Senior Digital Designers will be expected to develop exceptional creative communication strategies and identify areas of growth for new and existing clients. You’ll also be responsible for creating content that demonstrates subject matter expertise in your field.

What we offer:
- Fully remote work environment with office locations in Orange County, California, and Toronto.
-Transparency and Humanity: No employee at Directive makes less than a living wage
-Premium Medical, Dental, Illness/Disability, Life Insurance plans through Manulife with 100% employer paid premiums and $0 deductible.
-Access to Wellness resources including individual and family access to the Manulife EAP, and Sequoia’s virtual physical wellness resources like Aaptiv, and mental health resources like SpringHealth.
-Unlimited Paid Time Off (we require taking at least 2 weeks minimum throughout the year), and your Birthday as a Day-Off!
-Office Closed between December 24 and January 1 for our annual Rest & Reflect Week
-Company provided laptop (MacBook) + C$250 ergo/home office budget
-Paid Parental Leave
- Company holidays *Canada - New Year’s Day, Good Friday, Victoria Day, Canada Day, Civic Holiday, Labour Day
,Thanksgiving Day, Remembrance Day, Christmas Day, Boxing Day 
-On-Demand and facilitator lead learning, training, development
-Company social and team-building events (virtual & in-person)

About Us:
Directive does exceptional performance marketing for software brands that share our values. We redefine the global standard for how marketers work, live, and grow. Our goal is to empower and focus so much on our people that our clients consequently get better results.

At Directive, one of our core values is to put people first. We want to stick to our values and commit to fostering a more diverse and inclusive culture in the digital landscape. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.</section>

title: Senior Visual Designer
description:
Job Description:

We are Canada Life

 

Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

 

You can be your best here. Youâ€™re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. Youâ€™ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.

 

Together, as part of a great team, youâ€™ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. Itâ€™s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company thatâ€™s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.  

â€¯  

Be your best at Canada Life.

 

Canada Lifeâ€™s Digital Hub is a team driven by customer needs. We provide expertise and strategic thought leadership thatâ€™s fueling Canada Lifeâ€™s customer experiences.
 
Our team of experts in design, technology, product and agile work collaboratively with our business partners, creating digital tools that improve our customersâ€™ lives. Come join an organization committed to delivering innovative, digital experiences.

 

We are looking for a  Senior Visual Designer

 

Given the size and scope of our organization, we have the flexibility for this position to be located in the following head office locations: Toronto or London.  

What you will do:

 

You can expect to spend part of your days:

  • Creating visual design deliverables; high-fidelity prototypes and UI components enhancing our established design system
  • Crafting original on-brand iconography, illustrations, infographics and data visualizations and contributing to shared libraries
  • Designing online marketing campaign concepts for social media, paid media, email, and onsite platforms within an agile team framework
  • Staying current on emerging trends in design, accessibility, UI design patterns and user-centered methodologies
  • Collaborating on a cross-functional team with UX, Content, Strategy, Animation, Marketing and Front-End Development experts to implement customer-centric solutions
  • Providing art direction, specifications and feedback to developers, vendors and photographers to ensure brand and AODA/WCAG accessibility standards are upheld
  • Presenting creative strategy to stakeholders that connects design concepts to user and business goals
  • Balancing passion about design with practicality about what can be achieved in realistic timelines
  • Enhancing the brand voice by iterating solutions to build upon unified look and feel across in a cohesive manner
  • Building and authoring pages in CMS to enhance written content, optimize load times and support the user experience

 What you will bring:

 

  • 4+ years of professional experience in Visual Design, Graphic Design, UI or Interaction Design role
  • A bachelorâ€™s degree or diploma program in graphic design, multimedia, or a related discipline, RGD certification
  • A demonstrable portfolio of work that exhibits your process for solving design problems in a creative and attractive method (focus on UI design, illustration, typographic and branding skills)
  • Skillswith industry tools such as Adobe CC, Sketch and InVision
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to effectively convey design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and stakeholders
  • Self-motivation and organization with strong attention to detail
  • Passion for graphic design and strategic design thinking that considers the customerâ€™s goals, business goals and creative solutions
  • Eagerness to develop your personal career and achieve your goals
  • Previous experience in agile environments and with AODA/WCAG accessibility as an asset

Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today  

#LI-Hybrid

 

We are one of Canada's top 100 employers!

 

Canada Life servesâ€¯the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, weâ€™re one of Canadaâ€™s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.â€¯  

â€¯â€¯  

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employeeâ€¯has the opportunity toâ€¯reach their potential.â€¯  

â€¯â€¯  

â€¯â€¯  

Canada Lifeâ€¯would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contactedâ€¯

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Our Story:

About You:
You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the teamâ€™s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.

If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!

About Us:
Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. Weâ€™ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.

Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on peopleâ€™s lives â€“ and weâ€™re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.

We care about each other and we have each otherâ€™s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness â€“ economic, mental and physical â€“ because whatâ€™s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.

Of course we love it here, but outsiders think weâ€™re pretty great too: Avison Young was awarded the prestigious Americaâ€™s Best Midsize Employers for 2022, presented by Forbes and Statista, Inc. Weâ€™re proud to be regularly recognized for our team, services and culture and our team members enjoy comprehensive compensation and benefit programs. Through our customized work options, we give our people the flexibility to create a work environment that puts their overall well-being first. After all, we are powered by people.

Overview:

We are seeking a talented, creative and driven Graphic Designer to work within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. An individual who thrives on maintaining responsibility for the design and visual aspects of each assignment, working closely across a variety of divisions including Investment, Office Leasing, Industrial and Retail. You will be part of the worldâ€™s fastest-growing commercial real estate services firm market with an opportunity to work alongside and learn from some of the best in the industry in an open, collaborative culture of respect and professional growth.

Responsibilities:

Primary Duties and Responsibilities

 

Reporting to the Senior Marketing Manager, the Graphic Designer is required to perform a range of duties including, but not limited to:

 

Graphic Design
â€¢ Manage the design and layout of various marketing materials (flyers, surveys, brochures, sales advertisements, proposals, presentations) in line with brand purpose and messaging
â€¢ Provide creative and innovative approaches to marketing programs for various sales teams and service lines
â€¢ Manage and prepare email marketing campaigns using marketing automation platform (Buildout and Hubspot)
â€¢ Thrive in a fast paced, dynamic and ever evolving real estate environment
â€¢ Be solution focused and able to provide creative results to unique challenges
â€¢ Other special projects as required or assigned

 

Administrative
â€¢ Provide administrative support to management and other staff
â€¢ Handle sensitive and highly confidential information
â€¢ Reception duties are minimal yet required for covering breaks and other duties:
â€¢ Prepare and review correspondence, reports and presentations

Qualifications:

Qualifications

  • Diploma or Post-Secondary education in Graphic Design or a minimum of 3 yearsâ€™ professional work experience as a Graphic Designer is required.

Proficiency in the use of specific computer programs:

 

o       Advanced knowledge of InDesign

o       Intermediate knowledge of Photoshop and Illustrator

o       Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Outlook, Excel & PowerPoint)

o       Experience using marketing automation platforms is preferred, but not required

o       Experience using Hubspot is a plus

  • Experience in the design/printing/publishing industry is an asset
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Recognized ability to work as a collaborative team member and provide support an individual or team
  • Strong organizational skills, uncanny attention to detail and ability to prioritize
  • Ability to work well under pressure, handle multiple assignments and work efficiently to meet tight deadlines  
  • Demonstrated problem solving and ability to use discretion
     

 

 

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment:

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

 

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world.   We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law. For those requiring assistance with disabilities, Information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY! To learn more about us, please visit our website: avisonyoung.ca.

title: Content Designer - 133021-1
description:
Our client, one of the largest financial industry clients in Canada, has an immediate need for a Sr. Content Designer/UX Content Writer in Toronto, ON (Temporary Remote).

What are the main responsibilities of the role?

The designer will be part of a 3-person squad (Interaction Designer, Visual Designer, Content Designer), led by a Design Lead and working on a daily basis with a number of cross-functional partners: product managers, project managers, business analysts, developers and quality assurance teams.

What capabilities makes the designer you’re replacing (or current designers on your team) successful?

A curious, strategic, and collaborative team member with an open mindset; a natural leader who ignites design conversation by inviting and responding to feedback; a self-starter with solid time management and presentation skills; a skilled designer that lives and breathes mobile-first, comfortable working on multiple projects.

What does the future state of success look like for the new designer?

Has adapted relatively quickly to our ways of working (3 months), has extensive knowledge of the app’s design system and approach to content, fully collaborates with the immediate team (squad) on a daily basis, is self-motivated, self-sufficient, understands well how to be successful in a larger team environment and with multiple cross-functional partners, can identify opportunities for improvement within the team and contributes enthusiastically.

What are the must have skills (4-5 max)?

  • Content design experience in digital product (UX writing for Apps)
  • Expert in mobile-first content
  • Experience working in Lean UX / Agile project management environments
  • Basic understanding of Interaction design, Visual Design and experience working with wireframes, workflow and Information Architecture
  • Experience with usability research (focus on content)

What are the nice to have skills (3-4 max)?

  • Has worked with large design teams and multiple stakeholders (Product/Business/Technical partners)
  • Figma, Confluence, Jira experience
  • Has worked on content strategy project

What skills would you like to build within your team?

Product & experience strategy, UX Metrics, Product design mindset with focus on business impact

What program/technology/software knowledge is essential for this role? Describe in what capacity the selected candidate will be using it?

Figma will be used the majority of the time, we also use Mural, Confluence, Jira, and Keynote.

Soft Skills:

Strong communication and presentation skills, ability to collaborate with other designers and cross-functional team members, ability to manage stakeholders and build relationships. Experience in facilitating workshops is a nice to have.

Additional Information

  • Effective Nov 1st, 2021, all employees and non-employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (2 doses required). Client requires proof of Covid-19 vaccination to access job site. Providing proof of vaccination is a condition of employment with Ian Martin for this role
  • The resource can work from home to start but will be required to work onsite in Toronto at least 2 days per week once covid worksite restrictions lifted

If you're a technical professional, you know that it can be difficult to find fulfilling work that advances your career. At the Ian Martin Group, we exist to connect professionals like you with meaningful work at industry-leading companies in your field. And we walk the walk, too: as a Certified B Corporation, we believe in using business as a force for good for people, our communities, and the environment.

We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us at 

http://recruit@ianmartin.com/

We encourage all qualified candidates to apply; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Experience in facilitating workshops is a nice to have.', 'Figma, Confluence, Jira experience', 'Basic understanding of Interaction design, Visual Design and experience working with wireframes, workflow and Information Architecture', 'Product & experience strategy, UX Metrics, Product design mindset with focus on business impact', 'Experience with usability research (focus on content)', 'Additional Information', 'Effective Nov 1st, 2021, all employees and non-employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (2 doses required). Client requires proof of Covid-19 vaccination to access job site. Providing proof of vaccination is a condition of employment with Ian Martin for this role', 'Has worked with large design teams and multiple stakeholders (Product/Business/Technical partners)', 'Content design experience in digital product (UX writing for Apps)']

title: Production Artist
description:
Company Description

Isobar is a creative experience agency that specializes in innovative design and emerging technologies. The mantra “Invent – Make – Change” defines our culture and guides our daily pursuit of creating meaningful work for our clients. A team of imaginative individuals under the dentsu umbrella, we partner with marketing, media, data and design agencies in the network to change the way everyday people interact with global brands.

We are dedicated to creating an inclusive workplace where all people can thrive. That means championing diversity and celebrating our differences as strengths through empowered teams, resulting in a positive impact on our clients and the world at large. We engage with our communities to demand equity and are committed to a digital society that serves all for good. And we’re just getting started.

Job Description

As a Production Designer, you’ll work with the creative team, as well as client services and project management to interpret creative concepts for a variety of primarily digital and web-first formats and interfaces – working within existing brand identity systems and evolving them as required.

Responsibilities:

  • Work includes websites and digital interfaces, email templates, social media, paid digital advertising, slide decks, digital and print.
  • Embrace an iterative design process and be receptive to feedback throughout the process.
  • Work efficiently on multiple projects with consistency and exemplary attention to detail.
  • Extend and translate established creative concepts into production-ready web and digital assets.
  • Able to generate pixel-perfect production assets to meet required specifications for print, web, and digital mediums
  • Collaborate and work alongside producers, creative, developers, media and account teams
  • Develop and foster strong relationships with internal team members, clients and vendors
  • Contribute to the studio culture through innovation and thought leadership.
  • You know Figma, Sketch, Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, Google Slides, and PowerPoint
  • Experience working with HTML, CSS, Jira
  • Performs other duties, as assigned
Qualifications

  • A successful candidate must possess a Bachelor’s degree in advertising, marketing, business or a similar field and
  • At least 3 years’ experience in a design role.
  • Proven experience with print, web, and digital design.
  • Degree in graphic design or a related field.
  • Strong portfolio showcasing brand and marketing experience across print, web, and digital mediums.
  • You have an eye for exemplary typography, illustration, icon design, and overall user experience.
  • Experience working with print, video and /or XM production is considered an asset
  • Auto and/or retail advertising experience is considered an assets
  • Thrives in a fast-paced environment; adapts quickly against shifting objectives, priorities and/or budgets while minimizing impact on project momentum
  • Strong analytical skills, ability to relate to results to client business objectives
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Highly adaptable and able to perform in a dynamic environment
  • Comfortable working independently with strong organizational and prioritization skills; Quick learner and detail oriented


Additional Information

We know through experience that different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds foster a stronger and more creative work environment that delivers better business results. We strive to create workplaces that reflect the clients we serve and where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.

We are committed to working with our candidates from all ability levels throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact 

Canada.Recruitment@dentsuaegis.com

 or to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.

title: Designer graphique senior / Senior Graphic Designer
description:
Job Description

Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?

Creative Design est plus qu'une équipe créative interne typique. Animés par la créativité et l'innovation, nous avons pour objectif de voir le monde différemment.

Creative Design Fin de l'année 2021

Ce poste peut être basé à Montréal.

Nous sommes sur un modèle de travail hybride.

Le rôle

Nous offrons une occasion vraiment excitante pour un designer graphique sénior de diriger et de soutenir une variété de projets interdisciplinaires et de devenir un membre influent d'une équipe interne en pleine croissance et très talentueuse. En tant que designer senior, vous travaillerez dans un environnement ouvert, progressif et au rythme soutenu, avec une réelle soif de design et de technologie.

Qu'il s'agisse de conception pour l'impression, les événements, le web, la réalité virtuelle ou le mouvement, le poste offre un grand espace de créativité pour une série de projets internationaux. Le rôle englobe la passion, les idées et les approches de résolution de problèmes pour aider l'équipe à fournir des solutions originales et créatives.

Vos efforts seront reconnus et appréciés, avec un salaire compétitif dans le secteur.

Ce poste est fait pour vous...

Si vous êtes une personne qui prend naturellement des initiatives et qui s'efforce de faire ressortir le meilleur de l'équipe. Vous avez une vision créative forte et vous êtes capable de communiquer de manière claire et convaincante avec les clients. Vous avez de l'expérience dans le développement d'une variété de résultats à travers différentes disciplines créatives et vous êtes capable de diriger des projets multidisciplinaires.

Vous disposez d'un portfolio impressionnant de travaux conceptuels de qualité, démontrant une réelle passion pour le design.

Quelle sera votre contribution dans l’équipe ?

  • Diriger de manière créative l'approche et l'orientation des équipes de projet

  • Soutenir la gestion des ressources de conception dans le cadre de projets techniques afin de promouvoir les meilleures pratiques de conception.

  • Communiquer avec les clients, nouveaux et existants, afin de maintenir un niveau de conception et de soutien technique digne d'une agence.

  • Analyser les documents de cadrage pour s'assurer que les clients reçoivent une grande valeur et un travail de conception et de création de haute qualité.

  • Sélectionner les équipes de projet et remettre en question les équipes de projet pour s'assurer que les produits sont axés sur le design

  • Avoir une connaissance de tous les projets de disciplines mixtes et être capable d'intervenir à tout moment pour donner des conseils créatifs ou un soutien pratique

  • Communiquer régulièrement avec le directeur de la création et les responsables techniques pour éclairer les décisions commerciales.

  • Une passion pour le design et la technologie numérique avec un sens du détail exceptionnel et un engagement pour un travail de haute qualité.

  • Capacité à établir d'excellentes relations avec les clients grâce à un leadership éclairé, une créativité exceptionnelle et une résolution proactive et réactive des problèmes.

  • Contribuer à l'élaboration de futurs projets en s'engageant auprès des clients, en repérant les opportunités et en maximisant le potentiel.

Que recherchons-nous ?

  • Expérience antérieure de travail dans des projets disciplinaires mixtes à grande échelle

  • Compétences excellentes et sûres en matière d'organisation et de communication

  • Connaissance approfondie de la suite Adobe Creative, en particulier InDesign, Illustrator et Photoshop.

  • Solides compétences en matière de mise en page et de typographie

  • Capacité à travailler sous pression

  • Esprit d'équipe

  • Développement agile

  • UX/UI – souhaitable

À propos de Creative Design

Nous sommes une équipe créative interne à SNC-Lavalin, qui exerce ses activités à l'échelle mondiale et qui compte plus de 80 employés, dont des concepteurs, des développeurs, des visualisateurs, des cinéastes et des spécialistes des médias immersifs.

En mettant à profit des talents exceptionnels, novateurs et créatifs, nous transformons la façon dont nos clients communiquent, se connectent et s'engagent dans leurs projets. Nous avons collaboré avec succès avec les clients de SNC-Lavalin, notamment le ministère de la Défense, EDF, Highways England, Transport for London, HS2 et l'Environment Agency, pour fournir des solutions de classe mondiale.

Nous travaillons en collaboration avec les équipes de SNC-Lavalin et les clients externes, en allant au cœur des problèmes et en ajoutant de la valeur et de l'innovation à chaque projet.

Nos principes de conception sous-tendent tout ce que nous faisons. Nous sommes des spécialistes de la résolution de problèmes qui sommes enthousiastes à l'idée de travailler ensemble pour trouver une solution. Nous créons des communications sur mesure qui s'attachent à donner du sens au contenu, à rendre les informations plus accessibles et à apporter une valeur ajoutée aux projets. Nous créons et mettons en œuvre des concepts viables qui utilisent la technologie de manière à améliorer les résultats et à créer des efficiences. Nous investissons dans l'innovation et nous nous concentrons sur les technologies à venir.

Ce que nous offrons chez SNC-Lavalin :

Chez SNC-Lavalin, vous profiterez d’une rémunération compétitive, d’un environnement de travail sain et sécuritaire, et d’une gamme complète d’avantages sociaux (assurances collectives, programme d’épargne-retraite, régime d’actionnariat, emploi permanent, programme de formation continue, etc.).

Vous pensez qu’une carrière dans notre équipe pourrait correspondre à votre profil, soumettez sans attendre votre candidature en ligne !

**************************

Le masculin est utilisé dans le seul but d’alléger le texte.

Chez SNC-Lavalin, nous cherchons à embaucher des individus possédant des caractéristiques, parcours et perspectives diversifiés. Nous croyons fermement que le talent de classe mondiale ne fait aucune distinction à l’égard du genre, de l’origine ethnique ou nationale, de l’identité et de l’orientation sexuelle, de l’âge, de la religion ou de la déficience, mais s’enrichit plutôt de ces différences. 

SNC-Lavalin se préoccupe de votre confidentialité. SNC-Lavalin et les autres filiales ou entreprises affiliées de SNC-Lavalin (communément désignées « SNC-Lavalin ») sont déterminées à protéger votre confidentialité. Veuillez consulter notre Avis de confidentialité sur notre site Carrières pour en savoir plus sur la façon dont nous recueillons, utilisons et transférons vos données personnelles.

En fournissant vos renseignements personnels à SNC-Lavalin, vous confirmez que vous avez lu notre Avis de confidentialité et que vous l’acceptez.

Fondée en 1911, SNC-Lavalin est une entreprise spécialisée en gestion de projet offrant des services professionnels entièrement intégrés, exploitant des bureaux dans le monde entier et dédiée à façonner un meilleur avenir pour notre planète et ceux qui l’habitent. Nous créons des solutions durables qui lient individus, technologie et données afin de concevoir, de réaliser et d’exploiter les projets les plus complexes. Nous déployons des capacités mondiales à l’échelle locale pour fournir à nos clients des services uniques et complets couvrant tout le cycle de vie d’un actif – consultation, services-conseils et services environnementaux, réseaux intelligents et cybersécurité, conception et ingénierie, approvisionnement, gestion de projet et de la construction, exploitation et entretien, mise hors service et capital. – et nous les offrons aux clients dans des secteurs stratégiques tels que Services d’ingénierie, Énergie nucléaire, Exploitation et entretien et Capital. D’autres nouvelles et renseignements sont accessibles sur le site snclavalin.comou suivez-nous surLinkedInetTwitter.

_____________________________________________________________________________________________________

Why join us?

Creative Design is more than your typical in-house creative team. Driven by creativity and innovation, we aim to see the world differently.

Creative Design End of Year 2021

This role can be based out of Montreal.

We are on a hybrid working model.

The Role
Presenting a truly exciting opportunity for a Senior Lead Creative to lead and support a variety of cross discipline projects and to become an influential member of a growing and highly talented in-house team. As a Senior Lead Creative, you will work in a fast paced, open and progressive environment with a real hunger for design and technology.

Whether you’re designing for print, events, web, virtual reality or motion, the role offers great scope for creativity to a range of global projects. The role encompasses passion, ideas, and problem-solving approaches to help the team deliver fresh, creative solutions.

Your efforts will be recognised and appreciated, with a competitive salary in the industry.

This role is right for you…
If you are a natural initiative taker who strives to bring out the best in the team.

You will have a strong creative vision and be able to communicate clearly and persuasively to clients. You will have experience in developing a variety of outcomes across different creative disciplines and be able to lead multi-discipline projects.

Importantly, you will have a stand-out portfolio full of great conceptual work, displaying a real passion for design.

How will you contribute to the team?

  • Creatively leading project teams' approach and direction

  • Support the management of design resources across technical projects to promote best design practices

  • Communicate with new and existing clients to maintain an agency level of design and technical support

  • Review scoping documents to ensure clients are receiving great value and high-quality design and creative work.

  • Selection of project teams and challenge to ensure projects are design-led.

  • Be hands-on with mixed discipline projects and be able to jump in to give creative guidance and support when needed.

  • Regularly communicate with Creative Director and Technical Leads to inform business decisions

  • A passion for design and digital technology with an outstanding eye for detail and a commitment to high quality work

  • Ability to build excellent client relationships through thought leadership, outstanding creativity and proactive and reactive problem solving

  • Helping develop future work pipelines through client engagement, spotting opportunities and maximizing potential

What will you contribute?

  • Previous experience working in large scale mixed discipline projects

  • Excellent and confident organizational and communication skills

  • An expert knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite, specifically InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop

  • Strong layout and typography skills

  • The ability to work well under pressure

  • Team player

  • Agile development

  • UX/UI - desirable

About Creative Design

We are a creative in-house team at SNC Lavalin operating globally, with over 80 staff ranging from designers, developers, visualisers, filmmakers, and immersive media specialists.

By harnessing outstanding, innovative, and creative talent, we transform the way our clients communicate, connect, and engage with their projects. We’ve successfully collaborated with SNC-Lavalin's clients including MoD, EDF, Highways England, Transport for London, HS2 and the Environment Agency to provide world-class solutions.

We work collaboratively with SNC-Lavalin’s teams and external clients, getting to the heart of problems and adding value and innovation to every project.
 

Our design principles underpin everything we do. We’re problem solvers who are excited by working together to find a solution. We create bespoke communications which focus on bringing meaning to content, make information more accessible and add value to projects. We create and implement viable concepts that utilise technology in a way that enhances outcomes and creates efficiencies. We invest in innovation and focus on upcoming technologies.

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin:

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!

The masculine gender is used only to simplify the wording.

*******************************************************************

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, technology and data to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. – and delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital. News and information are available atsnclavalin.comor follow us onLinkedInandTwitter.

Worker Type

Employee

Job Type

Regular

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers siteto know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Company Description

ISAAC partners with North American fleets to provide a user-friendly solution that simplifies trucking. Focused 100% on the trucking industry, we help carriers overcome challenges, while boosting driver happiness. With proven system reliability and system integration capabilities driven by our open platform, our solution helps your drivers and back-office team work smoothly.

For more information, visit www.isaacinstruments.com.

Job Description

Are you always on the lookout for new marketing trends, and have a brain boiling with imagination and creativity? If you're looking to join a thriving team with the same passion for creativity and innovation, then this is the job for you!

As the marketing team's Graphic Designer, you will be responsible for promoting ISAAC's brand to support the execution of the marketing plan and the company's growth. You will serve as a collaborative thought partner on planning and execution. With a passion for graphics, you enjoy developing an impactful brand image and see video design as a staple in today's marketing strategy.

Responsibilities

  • Enforce ISAAC’s new style guide
  • Provide artistic input for all marketing projects
  • Ensure quality control and compliance with standards for all graphic and video material
  • See to the development, optimization and implementation of graphics and video processes
  • Develop modern creative concepts that captivate and engage our clients (B2B)
  • Participate in the ideation of campaigns and provide design expertise to internal departments
  • Design mock-ups, storyboards or sketches to lead the team in the early stages of creation
  • Work in collaboration with the Product and Development teams to standardize the user interface of ISAAC’s solution
  • Develop and manage key partnerships with external suppliers for the provision of graphics, design and video services as required
Qualifications

  • 2 to 5 years of experience in a similar role (B2B experience is an asset)
  • Training in visual arts, graphic design and video is an asset
  • Video editing skills
  • Animation and motion design skills
  • Photography skills
  • Excellent knowledge of UI / UX and branding
  • Strong communication skills in French and English, both orally and in writing
  • Knowledge sharing qualities
  • Creative and innovative work approach
  • Recognized for your collaboration and ability to influence
  • Creative mind complemented by an analytical approach
  • Unparalleled attention to detail and intent on producing quality


Additional Information

Contributors are at the centre of ISAAC’s interests and values. This explains the numerous benefits of working at ISAAC, namely:

  • A large variety of career opportunities
  • A stimulating work environment focused on innovation
  • Enthusiastic and collaborative teams
  • Competitive salaries and benefits that promote work-life balance: a complete group insurance plan, group RRSP, EAP, flexible hours, 4-week vacation, etc.
  • Various social activities, free snacks and coffee every day.

title: Graphiste
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Chez Techo-Bloc, nous ne faisons pas que paver des patios – nous pavons la voie à de grandes carrières! Fondé sur une culture d'innovation, nous fabriquons des produits d'aménagement paysager axés sur la qualité, la durabilité et la beauté. Notre équipe en pleine croissance recherche des personnes passionnées et prêtes à avoir un impact. Croyez-vous être prêt à relever ce défi?  

Pourquoi travailler chez Techo-Bloc

Nous aimons nous vanter! Techo Bloc offre à ses employés un salaire compétitif et un ensemble complet d'avantages sociaux. Voici quelques-uns de nos avantages :

  • Modèle de travail hybride;
  • Des leaders qui s'investissent dans votre réussite;
  • Emploi dynamique et un cheminement de carrière évolutif;
  • Accès gratuit à un médecin de famille virtuel grâce à la télémédecine;
  • Développement professionnel;
  • Salaire concurrentiel  Boni annuel;
  • Un programme de REER disponible en 2022;
  • Barbecues et fêtes de Noël épiques;
  • Cuisine remplie de collations;
  • Stationnement gratuit;
  • Des primes de référencement généreuses;
  • Rabais pour les employés sur les produits de Techo-Bloc;
  • Programme d'aide aux employés (PAE disponible 24/7);
  • Cours d'anglais et de français disponibles (s'il s'agit d'une exigence professionnelle).

Notre équipe

Imitant la taille et la structure d’une agence avec plus d’une trentaine d’employés, nos départements marketing ont pour mission de réinventer la façon dont les aménagements paysagers sont pensés, construits et vécus. Avec une forte culture de créativité, notre équipe est composée d'une puissante combinaison d'experts en design et en contenu, d'architectes paysagistes, de leaders numériques et de penseurs stratégiques. Cela signifie que nous sommes constamment à l'affût des nouvelles technologies, tendances et de concepts stratégiques et innovateurs pour mieux soutenir nos clients durant leur conception de design. Notre créativité nous pousse à aller de l'avant pour concevoir, inspirer et créer des produits qui apportent un élément artistique à la vie en plein air, inspirant le potentiel créatif de chacun. Notre slogan : « Au-delà d’être une passion, l’art du terrain est notre raison d’être. ». 

Description du poste

Si vous avez envie de faire les choses différemment, d'innover et de contribuer à l'élaboration de nombreuses activités créatives et si vous voulez vous développer et être reconnu pour votre implication, nous avons le défi pour vous.

Nous avons de nombreux projets et beaucoup d'idées, et nous avons donc besoin des services d'un professionnel qui amènera l'entreprise encore plus loin. Êtes-vous notre prochain Graphiste?

  • Développez des concepts graphiques pour notre catalogue d'entreprise, nos brochures et autres documents imprimés et web ;
  • Concevoir et produire divers projets tels que des publicités, des dépliants, des bannières, des documents promotionnels et d'entreprise tout en veillant à ce que l'identité visuelle innovante soit cohérente et conforme aux normes de mise en page ;
  • Développer l'image de l'entreprise sur notre site web et sur d'autres plateformes électroniques ;
  • Identifier et maîtriser toutes les spécifications et les processus d'impression, corriger les épreuves et contrôler la qualité de l'impression.
Qualifications

  • Diplôme universitaire, certificat ou DEC en design graphique ;
  • Minimum de 5 à 7 ans d'expérience pertinente (imprimée et digitale) ;
  • Avoir fait preuve de créativité et d'innovation, être à l'avant-garde ;
  • Capacité à respecter les délais et à travailler avec des échéances ;
  • Capacité à gérer plusieurs projets avec autonomie et rigueur ;
  • Capacité de réflexion analytique et de conceptualisation ;
  • Proactivité et capacité à résoudre les problèmes ;
  • Grande attention aux détails ;
  • Esprit d'équipe ;
  • Maîtrise d'Adobe CC, InDesign, Photoshop et Illustrator ;
  • Excellentes aptitudes à la communication orale et écrite en français et en anglais. 

Veuillez joindre votre portfolio ou des échantillons de votre travail à votre candidature.



Informations complémentaires

Votre contribution est très précieuse pour nous, tout comme les pierres que nous produisons. Techo-Bloc favorise une culture de l'innovation où chaque individu apporte une touche particulière à son domaine d'expertise. L'entreprise est en pleine croissance, vos idées et vos talents sont requis pour contribuer au développement de l'image de marque prestigieuse que Techo-Bloc a su développer au fil des ans.

Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt, mais seules les personnes retenues seront contactées.

L'utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Overview:

Upwork has partnered with an Enterprise client and who is known to be the leader in professional creativity and productivity solutions, empowers every day by making it easier, more accessible, and more secure to put your ideas to work.  

 

Theyâ€™re seeking a talented Designer who has experience both or either in Gravit Designer Pro and PaintShop Pro to create vector and raster templates.

Benefits:* Competitive pay* 100% Remote work. Work anywhere you want! * Flexible work schedule

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Yo!

We're a small team with big dreams - building an upcoming Battle Royale game aimed at casual players.

We're looking for a full-time Graphic designer / 2D artist to join us. If you're someone who loves to work in a small team and want to have a big influence on the final game, then this opportunity is perfect for you.

We move fast and get sh*t done. Come join us before we get bought out by Tencent ;)

Check out the game we're building at https://bapbap.gg

Responsibilities:

  • Create 2D graphics, icons, avatars and banners
  • Enhance the UI with visuals
  • Assist in promotional art
  • Maintaining a style guide and visual library
  • Extremely self-motivated
  • Kickass portfolio
  • Passion for stylized art
  • Comfortable wearing multiple hats
  • Gamer with knowledge of multiplayer games (MOBAs, Battle Royales, etc)

title: Freelance Intermediate Graphic Designer
description:
Freelance Intermediate Graphic Designer

(Remote or hybrid contract until Dec 31, 2022) 

Do you dream in vectors? Do you look at websites through the ‘user experience’ lens? When you see and ad, do you think “I could’ve done that better’? If so, the Intermediate Graphic Design – Freelance position is for you!

About Us

CARFAX’s mission is to help millions of people shop, buy, service and sell used cars with more confidence. As a leader in vehicle history and valuation, CARFAX provides impartial and comprehensive information for consumers and the automotive industry. CARFAX‘s Canadian headquarters in London, Ontario supports Canadian and U.S. markets, drawing on billions of data records from thousands of sources, enabling used vehicle buyers and sellers to make informed decisions. CARFAX is consistently recognized as a top employer and business. CARFAX is a part of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI). Find out more at www.carfax.ca and connect with CARFAX on Instagram, Facebook and LinkedIn.

Position Responsibilities

  • Collaborate effectively with other graphic designers, copy writers, UX/UI team, product managers, marketing managers and other internal stakeholders to create on-brand digital and printed marketing materials/assets.
  • Conceptualize and design marketing materials including webpages, landing pages, emails, blogs, digital and print advertising, sales collateral, social media assets and other items.
  • Apply strategic thinking and take customer persona research and user feedback into consideration for effective designs.
  • Initiate and contribute creative ideas to kickoff meetings and collaborate with other graphic and UX/UI designers on the execution of projects.
  • Following the outlined process, manage assigned projects from concept development through to execution, meeting all deadlines.

Education and Experience Required:

  • Post-secondary education in graphic design or equivalent.
  • 3-5+ years professional experience with graphic design in a marketing environment.
  • Extensive skills in Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch and InVision.
  • Familiarity with HubSpot, Send Grid and Click Dimensions.
  • Must possess strong creative and conceptual vision and the ability to flawlessly execute high-quality work.
  • Effective deadline management and project management skills.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to explain the reasoning behind design decisions.
  • Bilingual is considered an asset.
  • Highly collaborative working style.
  • Operates with a positive, solution-focused mindset.

If you are interested in applying for this position, please visit our website. https://www.carfax.ca/about-carfax/work-at-carfax. Applications will be accepted until a suitable candidate is hired.

We’re committed to providing accommodations by request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. For a confidential inquiry or to request an accommodation, please contact your recruiter or email

hr@carfax.ca

.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Job Description

As the graphic designer within the marketing team, you will play a key role in the growth and evolution of Vention’s brand. Stretching beyond the creation of graphical elements, the ideal candidate will want to drive brand consistency across the company and elevate existing concepts to new heights. Leveraging their own creative skills and managerial skills of stakeholders and 3rd party contributors, the new Graphic Designer will create impactful content across a variety of digital platforms. The successful candidate will need to be comfortable receiving feedback, working collaboratively with a team, and meeting deadlines independently, while providing clear communication.

More specifically you will:

  • Develop and evolve Vention’s brand to align with the current growth of the company
  • Oversee, support, and develop graphic elements for various product launches and marketing campaigns across a variety of digital platforms (i.e., web, social media, blogs, email, etc.)
  • Leverage both 2D imagery and 3D rendering expertise to create impactful, life-like content of Vention technology
  • Coordinate with a range of 3rd party companies to assist with the creation of branded assets
  • Safeguard and promote branded across all facets of the company (including sales, management, internal comms
Qualifications

  • Strong portfolio with 3 years of experience in marketing and brand design
  • Have a minimum of 1 years of experience in marketing and campaign design within a tech company
  • Strong communication skills to help convey ideas to our stakeholders and project members
  • Superb at ideation, color theory, and conceptual skills
  • Good eye for details and stringent on maintaining a consistent style
  • Strong sense of ownership, proactivity, teamwork, coordination skills, and a high sense of responsibility


Additional Information

We stand proudly for our people and support their success through career development and advancement. We are recognized and respected for our culture of inclusion and belonging, continuously striving to do what’s good for our people and communities.

title: Graphic Artist/Designer
description:
In 1983, Choko Motorsports was established and began manufacturing snowmobile clothing. The demand for quality Choko products quickly grew and today, we are designing, manufacturing, and distributing apparel and accessories for the tractor, farming and automotive industries. We are proud of our roots and to be privately Canadian-owned and operated.

We are a team of creative, passionate, and entrepreneurial minds and are excited to grow our team with a creative Graphic Artist/Designer. If a motorsport-based, fast-paced environment excites you, we want to meet you!

As a Graphic Artist/Designer, you will help drive the design and layout of preliminary concepts through to final completion. You’ll accelerate into the design of jackets, caps, and t-shirts, along with creating our seasonal brochures and flyers.

You will:
  • Work closely with the graphic design and product development teams to discuss new design concepts considering both function and style, drawing up concepts in Illustrator.
  • Prepare pre-spec files to provide clear details for the product development department.
  • Maintain matrix files with the most recent updates.
  • Assist with the preparation of product pitches for sales, marketing, and seasonal catalogues.
  • Maintain organized, well labelled files and documents.
  • Conduct market research as required and stay up-to-date with market trends and new developments.

What you bring:
  • Post-secondary degree or certificate in Graphic Design or equivalent experience
  • Proficient in Illustrator and Photoshop software
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to think creatively
  • Highly attentive to detail
  • Goal and deadline oriented with ability to deliver quality work in a timely manner

What we offer:
  • Full-time, permanent position.
  • Weekday business hours – Monday-Friday 8 am-5 pm.
  • Benefit plan.
  • Company events such as summer BBQs, theme lunches, and annual holiday parties.
  • Discount on apparel and accessories.

We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


About Choko Motorsports:

In 1983, Choko Motorsports was established and began manufacturing snowmobile clothing. The demand for quality Choko product quickly grew and today, we are designing, manufacturing, and distributing apparel and accessories for the tractor, farming and automotive industries. We are proud of our roots and to be privately Canadian owned and operated.

title: Senior Marketing Graphic Designer - Remote
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">About KOHO
KOHO is a quickly scaling FinTech company backed by leading investors and advisors from around the world. We started KOHO because we believe in doing two things:

Democratizing access to the best financial products and giving everyone a great financial foundation.

Since our journey began 6 years ago, we’ve raised more than $340M, grown the KOHO Collective to over 250 employees, and created accounts for more than 600,000 Canadians.

About the Role

We're looking for a Senior Marketing Graphic Designer with a passion for brand to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have experience working with photography in their designs, and is a true stickler for the details. We are looking for someone who is very comfortable using colour, who can set type, and has a photography-forward design approach.

The successful candidate will work on both marketing and in-house initiatives to create a cohesive, recognizable brand statement. We are growing fast and need someone who can work cross-departmentally to maintain our brand consistency, and develop our brand awareness. We’re an energetic team who value innovation, forward-thinking, and a work environment that promotes cooperative effort.


Joining the (lovely!) KOHO Team
We invest time and resources into making sure KOHO is as good as the people we hire. Here are some of the reasons we attract the best people:

• Balance Your Life - Generous PTO, generous vacation, and a lifestyle spending account
• Work Anywhere - Permanently remote and $1,000 to set up your home office
• Level Up - Access to an in-house certified performance coach
• Reach Your Goals - Salary assessments twice a year, annual training allowance
• The KOHO Culture - We have won 6 "Great Place to Work ®" awards since 2019

The KOHO culture is one of collaboration, creativity, and diverse perspectives. We are committed to building and fostering an inclusive, accessible environment for everyone. If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding accessibility needs, please contact peopleaccessibility@koho.ca and the People and Culture team will be happy to help.

#LI-Remote #LI-NC</section>

title: Digital Developer
description:
Job Description:

IGM Financial Inc. is one of Canada's leading diversified wealth and asset management companies with approximately $271 billion in total assets under managements. The company provides a broad range of financial planning and investment management services to help more than two million Canadians meet their financial goals. Its activities are carried out principally through IG Wealth Management, Mackenzie Investments and Investment Planning Counsel.

 

Under IGM Financialâ€™s unique business model based on leading brands and multi-channel distribution strategy is Mackenzie Investments, founded in 1967.   Mackenzie Investments is a holistic asset-management partner for thousands of Canadian financial advisors and the investors they support.  

 

At Mackenzie Investments You Can Build Your Career with Confidence.

 

We have a vision and a strategy that will challenge the way business in this industry is done and help Canadians be successful in the ways that mean the most to them. As part of our team, you will do some of your best work, develop some of your most valuable skills and give back in ways that make a difference in the lives of Canadians.   We are proud to be recognized as one of Greater Torontoâ€™s Top Employers (2022) by Mediacorp Canada Inc. for empowering our employees with the tools to thrive while working remotely, while also providing resources to ensure physical and mental wellness were put front and centre.

 

Join an unstoppable team that is embedded in continuous learning, understanding, and knowledge sharing. You will thrive in our supportive environment where you can indulge your curiosity to learn, while receiving the feedback you need to refine your skills and abilities.

 

Mackenzie Investments is a diverse workplace committed to doing business inclusively - this starts with having a representative workforce! We encourage applications from all qualified candidates that represent the diversity present across Canada â€“ including racialized persons, women, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, 2SLGBTQIA+ community, gender diverse and neurodiverse individuals, as well as all who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.

 

We are currently looking for an IntermediateDigital Developer to work within our Digital Development team.   The successful candidate will be a key member who will work with UX, UI, Business stakeholders and Information Services (back end developers) to deliver industry leading websites and applications.

 

What motivates you?

  • Passionate about Front End Development best practices
  • A need for perpetual improvement and a belief that status quo is a pit stop on the way to a better place
  • Operating within an organization that is looking to transform itself
  • Finding clarity in a sea of ambiguity

 

What youâ€™ll do day-to-day:

  • Be a member of the Agile/Scrum team to develop enterprise level websites, mobile apps and other digital brand experiences using Adobe Experience Manager and Salesforce Communities
  • Write clean, modular, reusable and testable HTML, CSS, JavaScript (ES6), Angular or React code
  • Consume RESTful web APIs or web services using Angular/Vue/React
  • Troubleshoot problems with existing applications
  • Ensure Investors Group code meets our software standard
  • Work with QA to ensure our websites and apps are error free
  • Write Jasmine or Protractor tests
  • Solve complex development problems while striving to push the technical boundaries of online applications and adhering to W3C and accessibility guidelines

 

Qualifications:

  • University Degree (preferably in Computer Science, Engineering or Information Technology or equivalent experience)
  • 3 years+ experience developing responsive websites and apps using Bootstrap or Foundation in a financial services or agency setting
  • Advanced knowledge of HTML5, JavaScript (ES6), CSS3 and other client-side frameworks
  • Advanced knowledge of Angular, React or Vue JS
  • Bilingual (French and English) is not required but is considered an asset

 

Additional Information:

  • Some travel may be required

 

Please visit our career page by clicking on the following link: https://www.mackenzieinvestments.com/en/careers

 

We thank all applicants for their interest in Mackenzie Investments; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

 

Mackenzie Investments is an accessible employer committed to providing a barrier free recruitment experience. If you require an accommodation or this information in an alternate format at any stage of the recruitment process, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team who will work with you to meet your needs.

 

Please apply by May 12, 2022.

title: Senior Designer (Intermediate)
description:
• Responsible for keeping the project, or a phase of a project, on schedule.
  • Responsible for selection and specification of all interior architectural materials and finishes, furniture, lighting and artwork.
  • Develops innovative design concepts which are practical, aesthetic, safe and conducive to intended purposes and function which is reflective of client goals and within project budget.
  • Conducts programming efforts such as space planning, layout and utilization of furnishings and equipment, lighting and color coordination.
  • Coordinates color and material palettes.
  • Incorporates Integrated Sustainable Design solutions into projects.
  • Renders conceptual design ideas and prepares 2D and 3D presentation/design drawings.
  • Prepares and conducts client presentations.
  • Prepares, corrects and updates documents during schematic design and design development phases.
  • Solicits bids and assists Project Manager and client in subcontracting fabrication, installation, and arrangement of the materials, finishes, and furnishings required.
  • Responsible for communication with other disciplines, vendors, and contractors to ensure incorporation of all information into project requirements and provides support as necessary.
  • Implements and utilizes HOK Standards for all projects and processes.
  • May provide support to all team members for specific field, style, or phase of interior design expertise.
  • May mentor and direct the work of less experienced staff and deliver staff performance evaluations.
  • May participate in interviews and recruiting of professional staff.
  • Takes personal responsibility for fostering a green workplace through sustainable work practices.
  • Fosters a commitment to external and internal client service.
  • Possess creative talent in conceptual design and rendering skills of either hand or computer sketching.
  • Advanced space planning skills and an interest in programming.
  • Knowledge of design, trends, construction methodology, materials application and manufacturer-supplier appropriateness.
  • Advanced knowledge of furniture, fixture and equipment (FF&E), architectural/interior finishes, lighting, art signage, color and materials to carryout design intent.
  • Advanced knowledge of building regulations and safety codes.
  • Advanced knowledge of design techniques, tools, and principles involved in production of precision technical plans, blueprints, drawings, and models.
  • Advanced knowledge of sustainability, integrated design and LEED guidelines.
  • Knowledge of buildingSMART, Building Information Modeling (BIM) and Integrated Project Delivery (IPD).
  • Proven ability to prioritize in order to meet deadlines and provide high quality service to clients.
  • Proficiency in the basic technical skills of interior design including the following computer skills:
    • Proficiency in MS Office, including Word, Excel and Outlook.
    • Proficiency in Newforma preferred.
    • Proficiency in AutoCAD/Architectural Desktop.
    • Proficiency in Revit is preferred.
    • Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketchup, and InDesign graphic software.
    • Proficiency in 3D Modeling software such as Rhino and Grasshopper preferred.
  • Ability to effectively meet deadlines.
  • Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to work in team environment.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

  • Requires a Bachelor’s degree in interior design or foreign equivalent.
  • 5 plus years’ experience in interiors projects required.
  • LEED credential required within 12 months of employment.

OTHER:

  • Travel may be required.
  • Overtime will be required.
  • The job duties and requirements that this document describes may be altered or supplemented at any time at the sole discretion of HOK.
