title: Visual Designer and Design Researcher, Market Gravity (Montreal, Quebec, Canada)
description:
Job Type: Permanent 
Primary Location: Montreal, Quebec, Canada 
All Available Locations: Montreal 

 

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Leverage the Deloitte CPA Advantage program, a comprehensive support program for CPA modules and the CFE.
Be encouraged to deepen your technical skills…whatever those may be.
Build your leadership skills at Deloitte University.
Have many careers in one Firm.
Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems
Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness. 
Enjoy My Benefit Dollars - a flexible benefit to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. 
Experience a firm where wellness matters.
Experience MyFlex and an agile work environment where work is what you do not where you do it
Experience MyFlex where reduced hours or seasonal work allows you to meet your personal goals.
Build a network of colleagues for life
Have an impact that matters through pro bono and significant volunteer opportunities.
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.
Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.
Be part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary Canada.
Grow your network and your knowledge by joining one of our many Employee Resource Groups.

 

What will your typical day look like?

This Design Consultant (UX/UI), role sits within Deloitte Digital’s Customer Service & Applied Design – Imagine team. You will play a key role in bridging the early stages of digital product development into delivery. This means you will be responsible for not only conceptualizing new digital products, but ensuring a seamless hand-off to our product design team (e.g. UX, UI, etc) who will begin development. This role will require you to be comfortable in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment as well as possessing a broad skill-set involving strategy & research, human-centered design, and rapid prototyping.
•    Brings a product mindset to consulting, looking creatively at business and people problems to elevate the human experience. 
•    Can create user stories, personas and storyboards. Can create lo-fi and hi-fi prototypes,
•    Ability to demonstrate design craft through polished deliverables that elevate our work.
•    Appreciates and understands human-centered design and design research (and is able to execute) and is interested in learning/refining other primary research skills, frameworks and processes on the go.
•    Conduct and lead customer interviews and research, demonstrating empathy for customers and seeking to understand underlying needs.
•    Can identify, synthesize and communicate complex insights and analytics and showcase them visually and through the written word. 
•    Support in designing and facilitating engaging presentation and workshops with internal teams, clients, and other stakeholders to share and explore insights and generate new solutions. 
•    Is comfortable working with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment and is willing to learn from – and teach – others. 
 

About the team

Market Gravity, a Deloitte Business exists to bring the future forward, fast. We specialise in the journey from zero to one, from post-it to prototype, from imagining to delivering the future. At Deloitte Digital, we collaborate to bring that skillset to the full journey of business transformation, making big ideas real, fast, and we’re looking for people like you to join us!
We are committed to equity, inclusion, and diversity and encourage applications from all qualified candidates, especially those who identify as Indigenous, Black, POC, Women, Persons with Disabilities, and/or 2SLGBTQ+.


This posting is for the Montréal, Canada office. 
 

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

Successful candidates will be able to demonstrate these characteristics:
•    Minimum 1 year of relevant experience as an UX/UI and/or visual designer and conducting research (e.g., design research, UX research, or market research)
•    BA, BFA or equivalent in design, UX, UI or graphic design
•    A passion for learning and a natural curiosity about humans and what they do, complemented by a theoretical grounding in human behavior
•    Comfortable with typical qualitative methods (e.g., experience conducting interviews and ethnographic observations), ethical considerations, and project management
•    Ability to distill qualitative insights into design recommendations, to tell stories about those recommendations in ways designers can use, but based on traditional qualitative analytical rigor
•    The ability to work in dynamic conditions, and transition quickly between collaborative and individual work
•    Compelling written and spoken communication skills
•    Strong planning, organization and documentation skills
•    An interest in diverse perspectives and approaches, and the ability to quickly dive into a new domain or process
•    Must be fluent and proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign), PowerPoint, etc. 
•    Must be fluent in tools like Figma, Sketch, etc.
•    Interest in codeless development tools like Webflow, etc.
•    Entrepreneurial experience as a plus
•    Bilingual in both French & English
 

 

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
     
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
     
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
     
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
     
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.



The next step is yours
 

Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply by April 4, 2022.
 

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Graphiste
company: ACQ - Association de la construction du Québec
description:
NOUS SOMMES BÂTISSEURS D’AVENIR

Vous faites preuve de créativité et vous avez un esprit collaboratif ? Vous aimez apporter vos idées et vous faites preuve de rigueur pour mener plusieurs projets à la fois ? Faites partie de notre équipe !

Nos employés sont au cœur du succès de l’Association et c’est pourquoi nous nous faisons un devoir d’être à leur écoute et de leur offrir un environnement de travail stimulant qui répond à leurs défis  quotidiens.

Relevant de la coordonnatrice au design graphique, le graphiste développe des concepts innovateurs et créatifs, conformes à l’image de marque de lAssociation. Il devra s’assurer que les concepts atteignent les objectifs d’affaires, qu’ils sont ajustés aux besoins des clients internes et externes et déclinés dans les différents formats requis. 

RESPONSABILITÉS
• Créer des concepts visuels adaptés à différents supports numériques et imprimés
• Développer des pièces promotionnelles pour l’imprimé et le Web
(dépliant, affiche, encart, bandeau, bannière, etc.)
• Préparer des documents électroniques (gabarits, feuilles de style, etc.), traiter les images,
faire la mise en page et le photomontage selon les normes techniques
• Réaliser les montages selon les spécifications clients et les délais prescrits
• Participer à la conception du magazine Construire
• Présenter et argumenter des concepts développés
• S’assurer que le contenu créé correspond aux objectifs de communication
• Travailler en collaboration avec les parties prenantes impliquées dans les projets
• Participer aux corrections d’épreuves avant la mise en production de la documentation officielle
• S’assurer que la plateforme d’image de marque est respectée
• Assurer le suivi et le contrôle de la qualité à toutes les étapes d’un projet
• Effectuer les soumissions auprès des fournisseurs
• Gérer notre banque d’images à l’interne
• Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes reliées à ses compétences et au bon fonctionnement du service.

EXIGENCES
• Diplôme d’études collégiales (DEC) en graphisme ou scolarité équivalente
• Cinq années d’expérience pertinente
• Excellente maîtrise des logiciels de la suite Adobe dans un environnement PC
(InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop)
• Autonomie avec la suite Microsoft (outils de présentation comme PowerPoint, Word, etc.)
• Bonnes connaissances des normes d’impression ainsi que de très bonnes connaissances
dans le domaine du Web
• Sens très développé du service à la clientèle
• Maîtrise du français parlé et écrit
• Bonne connaissance de la photographie (un atout)
• Connaissance en montage vidéo (un atout)
• Connaissance des milieux associatifs et/ou de l’industrie de la construction (un atout).

HABILETÉS
• Créativité et initiative sont essentielles à ce poste
• Sens de l’organisation, autonomie, minutie, rigueur et précision
• Gestion des projets du début à la fin en respectant les priorités et les échéanciers serrés
• Rapidité dans l’exécution des tâches tout en produisant un travail de très grande qualité et ce,
même sous pression
• Capacité à reconnaître rapidement les problèmes liés aux documents électroniques
et apporter des solutions
• Excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et capacité à travailler avec une clientèle diversifiée
tant à l’interne qu’à l’externe
• Capacité de gérer plusieurs projets en même temps
• Capacité à travailler en équipe.


CONDITIONS DE TRAVAIL ET AVANTAGES SOCIAUX
Travailler à l’ACQ, c’est choisir une qualité de vie vous permettant de mieux concilier travail et vie personnelle.

• Possibilité de télétravail (être en présentiel deux journées par semaine)
• Horaire flexible ou compressé durant l’année
• Quatre semaines de vacances par année
• Douze (12) jours de congés fériés
• Congés de maladie ou pour obligations familiales (cumulables jusqu’à la création d’une banque de vingt (20) jours ouvrables au fil des années) 
• Accumulation de congés flottants (1 par année d’emploi – jusqu’à concurrence de 20 jours)
• Assurances complètes, excluant le dentaire, entièrement payées par l’employeur dès l’embauche
• Régime de retraite autogéré; contribution de 5 % du salaire entièrement payé par l’employeur
• Salle d’entraînement disponible en tout temps (siège social)
• Stationnement gratuit
• Salaire variera selon les compétences et l’expérience conformément à l’échelle prévue pour la classe.


Et bien plus, visitez notre section Carrières :


NOS VALEURS, NOTRE FIERTÉ !
INTÉGRITÉ | PROFESSIONNALISME | COLLABORATION | RESPECT

Vous avez à cœur ces valeurs ? Votre place est avec nous !

L’ACQ souscrit au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi et le masculin
est utilisé dans le but d’alléger le texte seulement.

Nous remercions tous les postulants pour leur intérêt à l’égard
de ce poste. Toutefois, seuls les candidats retenus seront contactés.

Votre place est avec nous !', 'Nous remercions tous les postulants pour leur intérêt à l’égard', 'Vous faites preuve de créativité et vous avez un esprit collaboratif ? title: Senior Product Visual Designer
description:
Hi there!  We're PAR and our purpose is:

To deliver solutions that connect people to the restaurants, meals and moments they love.

We take that responsibility very seriously.  As a leading provider of technology to the top restaurant brands in the world we're calling all rebels, instigators, idealists and builders to join our constantly growing team!

PAR invented the first standalone point of sale terminal over 40 years ago, yet we operate much like a start-up at the forefront of restaurant technology.  Today, our solutions span Customer loyalty, engagement, restaurant management, payment services, drive-thru, and full POS integrations.  These solutions are used to serve tens of millions of guests every day in over 120 countries. 

Our mission is to build the number one restaurant technology company in the world and we're off to great start.

We believe that our ambition is only limited by our ability to attract and retain great people; people who are up for the challenge to change the game with us!  If it sounds like you belong here, we should meet!

 

 

Title

Senior Product Visual Designer

Location

Toronto,Canada

About The Role

At Punchh, we are building the next generation AI-enabled marketing loyalty platform. We are looking for a talented Senior Visual Designer to own our visual design system and create best-in-class experiences that drive customer and business value. 

Our ideal candidate excels at creating elegant design systems that build trust and support the usability of our products. You have worked closely with design, research, product management, and engineering in a fast-paced, collaborative and customer-focused environment. In this role you will work with various peers and stakeholders to understand user needs, design UX concepts, prototypes, and final mock-ups, ensuring pixel-perfect implementation of your designs. 

What You'll Do

  • Develop the visual design standards and design system for our Marketing Loyalty platform to support our current and long-term strategy
  • Work closely with other designers, researchers, product managers, engineering, and customers to design simple and elegant designs and visualizations for our products
  • Work with engineering to ensure pixel-perfect implementation of your designs
  • Develop final mock-ups and prototypes to communicate designs to stakeholders
  • Drive the design review cycle with key stakeholders and customers to ensure the designs achieve the set goals
  • Lead and support multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines

What You'll Need

  • 8 - 10 years of experience as a Visual Designer for b2b web applications
  • Previous experience developing scalable design systems is a must
  • Expert in typography, color, and composition
  • An understanding of the UX design process from discovery, through definition, design, and implementation
  • A passion for creating simple and elegant solutions that drive user and business value
  • Mastery of standard UX software (we use Figma)
  • A portfolio of design work with case studies demonstrating your process and the impact of your efforts
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • A desire to work collaboratively with cross-functional teammates to deliver the best possible solution for our users

Bonus Points If You

  • Possess working knowledge of loyalty programs, CRM, and/or email marketing campaigns
  • Have experience with motion design and micro-interactions
  • Have a Master's Degree in a related field

Benefits

  • Healthcare coverage, FSA, HSA
  • Life and AD&D insurance
  • 401K
  • Competitive salaries, bonus and stock options
  • Professional development
  • EAP
  • Maternity and Paternity (Bonding) Leave
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Paid holidays
  • Free lunch in the office
  •  

 

 

PAR is proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. We also provide reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities in accordance with applicable laws. If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant, please click here.

title: Senior Graphic Designer
description:
ResQ was founded with the belief that restaurant operators and service providers should have a much better way to operate their businesses. As a first step towards our mission, we have built a SaaS-enabled marketplace that helps fast-growing restaurants manage their repairs and maintenance, empowering them to focus on their customers.

Repair and maintenance is the heartbeat of any restaurant's operations, yet the existing management methods are complex, expensive, and time-consuming. With ResQ, restaurants can simply get connected to qualified service providers, submit jobs, track progress, and pay, all in one place.

We are trusted by the world's leading restaurant brands and are venture-backed by top-tier global VCs - and we are just getting started!

 

What you will do:

We are looking for a Senior Graphic Designer to be responsible for continuously maintaining the company's visual brand internally and externally. This includes reviewing, updating, and maintaining the company's visual representation in all aspects of design including typography, composition, colour, and imagery.  

Your creative talents will be applied to digital marketing, web graphics, print, sales enablement documents, and trade show materials. You're an innovative, out-of-the-box thinker who strives for design excellence and enjoys challenges. You thrive when you collaborate with different team members and you continuously seek and take feedback to update and optimize your work. You have impeccable attention to detail even when you're moving at lightning speed on projects. You never sacrifice quality and standards over speed. 

As the dedicated designer on the marketing team, you will be responsible for bringing ResQ's marketing projects to life. To ensure brand consistency across the company, you will communicate cross-functionally with teams such as the Product Design team to give and receive feedback for ongoing projects.

As a Senior Graphic Designer at ResQ you will be contributing in the following areas:

  • Execute with excellence: Study project briefs to determine design deliverables, design marketing materials including brochures, flyers, posters, etc. Design and update the company website, source and manage vendors, manage ResQ's social media presence, create compelling designs using industry standard software including Adobe Illustrator, InDesign, and Photoshop, and review designs for errors before being sent out to publishing/printing. 
  • Manage and elevate our brand: Maintain brand standards and style, Identify the best ways to illustrate and communicate ResQ's vision, Select colours, images, typography and layout for communication materials, and stay up-to-date with the latest design trends, tools, and technologies.
  • Collaborate and iterate: Support and collaborate with the core revenue team as well as other parts of the business, Seek feedback from team members and revise or provide alternative solutions to deliver high quality design deliverables.

  About you:

  • Bachelors of Design or Arts specializing in graphic design, marketing, communications or equivalent experience
  • At least five years of graphic design experience, preferably in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
  • Experience working in a SaaS technology industry is an asset
  • Advanced knowledge of current graphic design (and related) software applications including Adobe InDesign Illustrator, Photoshop, and Acrobat
  • Expert knowledge of visual design concepts, layout, and typography
  • Demonstrated experience with commonly used tools among marketing teams including social media, email marketing platforms, and landing page and website building platforms (Pardot, Unbounce, Squarespace)
  • Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript would be considered an asset
  • Experience in setting up creative for paid advertising platforms
  • Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in online marketing and measurement
  • Ability to work unsupervised while knowing your success is also influenced by how well you collaborate with the team
  • Thrives in a collaborative environment and has excellent communication skills
  • Quick learner who continuously improves their craft with the ability to manage multiple projects and deliver quality work efficiently.
  • Strong teamwork, time management, and project management skills
  • Ability to think creatively and problem solve when faced with new set backs
  • Organized with a keen eye for detail and experience in proofreading

Why ResQ may not be the right place for you:

We are a mission-driven team and have a big vision to revolutionize the service industry. While on that journey, we recognize that building a startup is very hard. Turning vision into reality in a fast-growing environment takes superhuman efforts and is often one of the most difficult, yet rewarding, things one can do. Every day there are new sets of challenges to be solved at an unprecedented speed. While startups are hard, the opportunity to do career-defining work and create an economic impact, solve hard problems with incredible team members and make the world a better place, can be extremely satisfying.

While we make a conscious effort to balance hard work and personal life, we recognize that we may not be for everyone. Here are some reasons why:

  • We're solving hard problems, and with that comes change, priority shifts, and iteration. If formal structure and order is what you crave, this may not be a fit.
  • Execution is everything to us. Like any hyper growth startup, we will always be resource constrained and have to do more with less. We can not let that come in the way of execution as we simply must get sh*t done. If you desire an environment with ample resources at all times, we may not be for you.
  • We move fast. Very fast. We work with tight deadlines and operate with a sense of urgency in everything we do. Sometimes we make low data choices, test and retest until we succeed, and learn from our mistakes. If you're more of a 'get it perfect the first time' person, you may not thrive in our operating style.
  • With our value of 'take extreme ownership' comes a high degree of responsibility. The phrase 'that's not my job' is not part of our vocabulary. If we put our name on something, it is on us to ensure it gets completed. That can, sometimes, mean late nights or long hours. If you're looking for a structured 40 hours/week position, this may not be the place for you. 
  • ResQ operates as one team on the same path to achieve our mission. At times we have opposing views and have to disagree, and commit. There is no ego here, as we do what is best for our customers. If you're used to always getting your way, you probably won't feel comfortable with our culture. 

 

What you'll enjoy about ResQ as a Full-Time Employee: 

We believe in taking care of each other, and here are some ways we support our team to be their best selves.

 

Health & Wellness

●  Financial Health: Competitive compensation and stock option grants that encourage you to grow and stay at ResQ
●  No limit on paid sick days, we trust our employees to take the time they need to recover
●  Enhanced health & dental benefits for you and your family that start from day one
●  Top of market parental leave to help you focus on what matters the most
●  Flex-place options that balance in-office and remote working
●  All in-office employees are fully vaccinated for COVID-19

 

Paid-time off & away

●  Yes, we have Unlimited Vacation but we recognize that many Unlimited Vacation programs have the opposite result by reducing the time employees take off. This is why we have a minimum number of vacation days; all full-time ResQers are expected to take a minimum of three weeks of vacation in a year
●  PLUS another week of ResQ shut down days (2 days in summer, 3 days in December)
●  In addition to paid vacation, we also have Roam Away From Home program where you can work away from your home province/state for up to 60 days in a calendar year

 

Community & Culture

●  Culture of Freedom, Responsibility and Togetherness to make you feel like a Founder of ResQ
●  Monthly and Quarterly team events to bond and make life-long memories
●  Slack channels to make you smile and get to know everyone you work with

 

Learning & Development

●  'WOW Hours' with industry leaders and entrepreneurs for personal and professional growth
●  Company supported learning events
●  Quarterly awards that makes you shine and feel appreciated for your work
●  Weekly 1-1's with direct managers and regular 1-1s with CEO to help support growth and professional development
●  Growth programs focusing on personal and professional growth allowing you to take on new roles, responsibilities and challenges
 

Canadian headquarters:

● New office space at King & Yonge that is being renovated to our bold taste - think rich colour palettes, designed for modern collaboration, and kitchen with commercial appliances!

ResQ strongly believes that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will result in a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users. ResQ is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against applicants based on race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, or disability, or any other status or condition protected by Ontario or local law. ResQ is committed to workplace diversity and will provide accommodation to applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process.

title: Senior Digital Designer
description:
Location: Calgary, AB, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 4/25/2022Job ID: AW110863425Category: Information Technology
David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our client to seek a Senior Digital Designer who will be responsible for the conceptual development and execution of creative tasks across all channels utilizing design and art direction skills. This is a full-time, permanent position available to candidates in the Calgary, AB area.
 
Responsibilities:
  • Oversee visual concept development, graphic design, art direction, and finishing process for producing advertising, communications, and collateral materials required to meet retail, B2B, and corporate communications business requirements. Ensure on-time and on-budget delivery of creative projects for all business units
  • Develop and maintain an accessible archive system for maintaining and preserving document and project files. Ensure that all approved files, templates, and documents are updated and maintained in the Brand Resources section of the UFA intranet
  • Collaborate with other members of the Marketing Communications & Brand team and agency partners to establish and maintain appropriate standards across all UFA brands and business units.
  • You will be able to produce impactful online designs that employ best practices from a UI/UX standpoint
  • Design experiences for a variety of interfaces on a diverse range of digital platforms including websites, emails, applications, and other channels when required
  • Proven ability to translate strategy into digital design thinking
  • Consistently researching digital design best practices, educating team members and clients, and ensuring these standards are integrated into your work
  • Strong experience in responsive design as well as designing for personalization systems
  • Consistently researching digital design best practices, educating team members and clients, and ensuring these standards are integrated into your work. You will work across a variety of channels, from email campaigns to digital and social campaigns, website, and app content, and print and out-of-home campaigns
  • Work with other conceptual creatives to develop new designs and ideas for digital campaigns with direction from the creative lead and a team comprised of production, dev, motion, and copy specialists
  • As we foster a close working relationship with internal clients you must be comfortable presenting and taking client feedback. Building trust is key to producing better work and it's essential to drive our growth and success
  • You will need to proactively manage projects within agreed timelines, considering budgets, quality, and consistency
  • Have a deep knowledge of and possess a clear ability to direct and/or produce, photography, illustration, CGI, and video/motion to achieve impressive execution results
Qualifications:
  • Degree from a recognized graphic design, information design, fine arts program, or equivalent experience
  • 5+ years’ experience in retail, B2B, and corporate communications graphic design
  • A portfolio that demonstrates a proven ability to build brands and a passion for outstanding creativity that aligns with business needs
  • Ability to translate business needs into great creative concepts
  • Ability to build relationships and work collaboratively with individuals and teams from various disciplines across the organization
  • Extensive experience working with design software including all components of the Adobe Creative Suite
  • Working knowledge of traditional print and online production methods and processes
  • You will have very strong attention to detail and are able to deliver on scale
  • You are confident executing designs following strict guidelines while also being very creative in your approach.
  • Relevant experience in these channels: Paid Media, Digital/Website design, Print, Retail in-store OOH/POS, Social, Collateral and DM, OOH, Retail flyers, and Production
Job ID: AW110863425
 
If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.
 
David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Production Designer
description:
Production Designer

What we are looking for:

Valtech is seeking a motivated and practical-minded production designer to join their growing team. You will work to support UX and UI Designers in completing a variety of digital web production tasks.

Before we continue to dive into the requirements for the role let’s talk about Why you should join Valtech?

Flexibility: We trust in the expertise, skills, and actions of our colleagues. That’s why we provide a flexible work schedule that supports work/life balance.

Career Advancement: We offer a career, not just a job. We invest in the personal and professional growth of every employee because we believe growth leads to both business impact and personal fulfillment.

Learning and Development:  We foster a culture that encourages and promotes professional growth and development, with continuous learning through our in house LMS (Ask us about the Academy)

Toronto Benefits:  

  • We offer competitive compensation, Group Benefit Plan, and a Health & Wellness program  ($1000 toward mental health!) 
  • Monthly events with an active culture club
  • We close over the winter holidays and keep summer hours to help you make the most of those sunny Friday afternoons

Want to learn more about our unique culture and awesome people click here

What you will do:

  • Work hand-in-hand with Business Analyst and Project Manager to complete various production design tasks. (image conversion, resizing, asset creation and modification) to support massive enterprise digital website factory.
  • Demonstrate a solid understanding of production techniques, options, and project timing.
  • Maintain job folders and documentation.
  • User a variety of tools to complete your job, including Creative Cloud, Sketch, and JIRA
  • Work on multiple projects simultaneously.

 

What you should have:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Communication Design, Visual Arts, or related field(s). (or some other type of design-related program or boot-camp)
  • 1+ years of Digital Design experience preferably with a digital agency
  • Basic or intermediate graphic design and visual creation skills(you may even see this job as an opportunity to grow into a graphic design role.)
  • Quickly “switch hats”, shifting smoothly between multiple concurrent tasks
  • Exhibit strict attention to detail
  • Personal passion for design and creation culture.
  • Basic understanding of interactivity and creations in the digital sphere
  • Self-driven, inspired, and motivated—we seek people who take pride in their work.
  • Solid organizational skills and the ability to meet strict deadlines (efficiently and independently).
  • Must have past experience collaborating with UX / Interaction Designers.

Software Requirements

Need strong working knowledge of:

  • Adobe Creative Suite (Cloud version), including Photoshop, Illustrator & InDesign

Optional skills (but still very desired):Adobe After Effect, Adobe Premiere Pro

Very Optional skills: OmniGraffle


Here’s a little about us:

Valtech is a global digital agency that focuses on business transformation for our clients. Founded in 1993, Valtech has established itself as one of the largest independent global agency groups with more than 3.000 exceptional individuals operating out of 40+ offices in 15 countries. We work with some of the world’s best-known brands from travel to retail, connected experiences to automotive and we’re now ready to bring on even more talented colleagues to join us.

We believe diversity is essential to creating the best digital products & experiences. Valtech is committed to providing and maintaining a work environment where all employees and candidates are treated with dignity and respect and that is free of bias, prejudice, and harassment. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, ethnicity, citizenship, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected status. 

So, if you are looking for your next challenge?  Then this is your chance to join our team of exceptionally talented, creative and innovative professionals working with composable Best-of-Breed technology platforms within the large-scale digital experience and e-commerce business area.

title: Artiste prévisualisation
description:
Description de l'entreprise

En tant qu’entreprise fondée et dirigée par un artiste, notre mission est d'offrir aux talents la liberté et les ressources dont ils ont besoin afin de favoriser la réalisation de travail de qualité et de prospérer dans un environnement amusant et créatif.

Description du poste

L'artiste Previs/Postvis conceptualise des plans et des séquences entiers pour transmettre la vision du réalisateur, en travaillant à partir d'un storyboard ou d'un script, en veillant à répondre aux normes de qualité élevées de Rodeo FX. À l'aide d'éléments 2D, d'éléments 3D ou de plaques en direct, ils créent le langage visuel du film.


Principales responsabilités:

  • Créez des séquences d'animation de qualité racontant une histoire pour des projets VFX haut de gamme ;
  • Participer au développement de solutions esthétiques et techniques pour soutenir la narration;
  • Exécuter la mise en scène de la scène, l'animation de la caméra, la composition, l'objectif et le blocage d'animation avec et sans tableaux ;
  • Créer des actifs 2D et 3D nécessaires au processus de visualisation ;
  • Créez des animations 3D pour différents types d'objets, d'animaux et de personnages ;
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le superviseur CG et le responsable Previs/Postvis pour trouver des solutions et des approches créatives et techniques qui améliorent les prises de vue, tout en respectant les spécifications et les délais du projet ;
  • Peut participer au développement d'outils et de techniques pour le département;
  • Effectuer un contrôle qualité sur les plans avant qu'ils ne soient soumis pour examen/approbation, en veillant à ce que toutes les normes techniques et créatives soient respectées, et appliquer rapidement les notes reçues ;
  • Tenir la production et l'équipe de projet informés de l'état des travaux, des problèmes à résoudre, des ramifications des problèmes rencontrés et recommander des solutions potentielles ;
  • S'assurer que les délais sont respectés, en avisant rapidement l'équipe de projet si des retards sont à prévoir.
Qualifications

  • Expérience dans un poste similaire, au sein de l'industrie VFX;
  • Solide connaissance des caméras, de la mise en scène, de la composition, de la perspective, du rythme, du timing, de l'éclairage et des concepts généraux de réalisation de films dans le contexte de l'animation et de l'action en direct ;
  • La possibilité de modéliser, de texturer, d'adapter et d'éclairer les ressources pour optimiser le flux de travail en temps réel dans la fenêtre maya ;
  • Excellente connaissance des logiciels Unreal, Nuke et Maya;
  • Excellent sens de la priorisation et du respect des délais.


Informations supplémentaires

  • Contrat permanent à temps plein;
  • 5 jours de congé de maladie payé;
  • 2 jours de congé additionnel au temps des Fêtes;
  • Assurances collectives, accès au service en ligne Dialogue et à un programme d’aide aux employés;
  • REER avec cotisation de l'employeur;
  • Rabais avec Bixi, Nautilus Plus et plusieurs autres entreprises locales.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Graphic Designer, Global Advisor

As a member of Ipsos’ Global Advisor team, the Graphic Designer will support editorial teams by designing high quality graphic images, infographics, data visualizations, charts, polls, and video elements for digital media. This position requires strong knowledge of how to work with data to create visually appealing graphics for press releases, online stories and social media platforms. Experience in delivering high quality images and infographics in a news environment is preferred. The ability to work under pressure amid tight deadlines to produce high quality content is key to this role. The candidate is on the cutting edge of graphic trends online, especially on social media, and has expertise in bringing editorial content to life with images. We’re looking for a self-starter that has a lot of ideas on how to make our research visually appealing through digital graphics and video.

Required Skills:

Qualifications:

· At least 1-3 years graphic design experience. Newsroom, especially digital media, experience would be considered an asset.

· Experience with the latest graphic editing software like Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, After Effects, InDesign, Illustrator, Premiere Pro)

· Experience with photo editing or illustration

· Experience with video production and editing

· Knowledge of web design

· Degree or diploma in graphic design

· Ability to work within a team amid tight deadlines to produce graphics

· In depth knowledge of web and social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, etc.)

· Strong attention to detail and quality

· Ability to suggest efficient production methods and timelines

· On top of the latest graphic design trends

Ipsos’ Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

Ipsos recognizes the necessity of building an inclusive culture that values each employee’s individuality and diverse perspectives. For more than 40 years, our mission has been to generate and analyze data about society, markets, brands, and behaviors to provide our clients with the insights that elevate their understanding of the world. This could not be fulfilled without Ipsos’ diverse employees who compile and analyze this data—they are the essence of who we are and what we do.

We are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees, creating an environment that promotes inclusion, and allowing employees from all walks of life to flourish. Ipsos encourages our employees to act in a respectful and responsible manner, in line with codes of best practices concerning diversity and inclusion, human rights, equality, and civility for every individual.

Ipsos is An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other protected class and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Associate Production Designer
description:
As an Associate Production Designer, you are the master of digital design at high scale. You will work with an amazing team of creatives to make sure that artwork is designed at scale according to our client’s brand guidelines. You will take production design briefs and key art from the account and creative team, ensuring conceptual creative ideas are designed at scale for digital delivery to market. 

You are an ideal candidate if you come from an advertising agency or production design studio and have worked on a range of creative projects from marketing collateral, digital campaigns, print work, brand work, ads, and more.

You Will:

  • Work with internal teams, account, and creative to ensure continuity of delivery of final files within agreed timeframes and to high standards 
  • Design to pixel-perfection and translate key art into the various resizes and versions required by the digital media buy 
  • Become fully ingrained into the brand’s design templates and act as a gatekeeper of brand guidelines 

You Have:

  • Experience working as a production designer or designer who thrives in high scale output, in an advertising agency, print or design studio. 
  • Experience with high-volume design workflows.
  • Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, particularly in Photoshop.
  • Working knowledge of motion design in Premiere/After Effects is an asset.
  • The mindset to be a "doer" on the production design team.

*Please include a link to your portfolio with your application.

title: Layout Artist
description:
Rocket Science is an Emmy nominated boutique visual effects studio collaborating with filmmakers to create stunning visual imagery utilizing artistry, science and technology. Located in Toronto, Canada, notable credits include Eric Kripkeâ€™s Emmy nominated superhero series THE BOYS (Amazon), the epic video game adaptation HALO (Paramount ), the BAFTA winning mini-series TITANIC (iTV), six seasons of Naren Shankarâ€™s sci-fi series THE EXPANSE (Amazon), and features such as Neil Jordanâ€™s GRETA (Sidney Kimmel, John Leonettiâ€™s WISH UPON (Broad Green Pictures) and David Cronenbergâ€™s upcoming Cannes release CRIMES OF THE FUTURE.

RSVFXâ€™s current productions include Tim Burtonâ€™s WEDNESDAY (Netflix), THE BOYS S3 (Amazon), Steve Blackmanâ€™s UMBRELLA ACADEMY S3 (Netflix) and LOCKE AND KEY S3 (Netflix) from Carlton Cuse and Meredith Averill.

Visit us @ rsvfx.com

Responsibilities:

  • Convert background plates to different formats compatible with specific software to create digital motion files that match the plate photography; and blocking.
  • Proactively undertake complex matchmove tasks (camera tracking, character matching, resolving lens distortion, and deformation matching of surfaces.
  • Independently set up the technical and aesthetic approaches of the matchmove work for a shot, sequence, or an entire aspect of a show.
  • If required, light, render and composite files with the background to judge the move 
  • Responsible for Previz, postviz and techviz (prep for location shooting or ride development).
  • Photomodels, execute scene setup : verifying correct assets and ranges, and generating initial data for downstream artists including animation/TDs/comp, and Lidar processing.
  • Other tasks assigned by Supervisors.

Qualifications:

  • Must have 5 years' experience in film and television photo real projects.
  • Expertise using Maya.
  • Expertise in PfTrack and 3DEqualizer.
  • Knowledge of Nuke.
  • Proficiency in delivering high-quality camera tracking and layouts (both single shots & multiple camera setups).
  • Ability to interpret storyboards and pre-vis work from clients.
  • Ability to manage and QC shots from other artists or vendors, providing useful and precise feedback.
  • Ability to manage and understand lens distortion, survey geometry and set alignment.
  • Broad 3D generalist experience and comfortable matchmoving, asset build and lighting is a plus
  • Capacity to share techniques with peers and communicate effectively.
  • Excellent communication and collaborative skills to react and respond quickly to the needs of management and clients.
  • A multi-tasker, team player and a self-starter with high trouble-shooting skills.

Rocket Science VFX is an equal opportunity company which values diversity in the workplace. We would be happy to accommodate individual needs in keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you require accommodation in order to participate in our recruitment process, please contact us to make your needs known in advance. 

Thank you for your interest in Rocket Science VFX. Please note that only those who meet the requirements will be contacted for an interview. No Phone Call Please. We are always interested in meeting motivated and talented artists.

title: Graphic Designer (Multimedia)
description:
If you are looking to join one of Canada’s fastest-growing companies, goeasy Ltd. is the place for you! Certified as a Great Place to Work®, recognized as Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, GTA's Top 100 Employers, one of Canada’s Top 50 Fintech’s and North America’s Most Engaged Workplaces, we want the best and brightest to join our team.

We are a publicly-traded company on the TSX with over 4000% shareholder return since 2001. Accredited by the Better Business Bureau, goeasy Ltd is a Canadian company that provides non-prime leasing and lending services through easyhome, easyfinancial and LendCare. We offer a wide variety of financial products and services including lease-to-own merchandise, unsecured and secured installment loans, direct-to-consumer auto loans, and point-of-sale financing to over 4,000 merchants in the powersports, automotive, retail, home improvement and health sectors. With over 30 years of experience, our 2200 employees work with our customers to help them get access to the money they need today, while they rebuild their credit and graduate to prime rates. Our omnichannel model includes over 400 retail locations and digital/mobile platforms that enable our customers to transact with us through their channel of choice.

Reporting to the Manager, Creative Services, the Multimedia Graphic Designer will be a core team member in our quest to build a best-in-class in-house creative services team. Working alongside our external creative agency, you will lead and contribute to creative design to attract new customers and engage current customers – all with the goal of driving results for growth of the easyhome and easyfinancial businesses. With goeasy, you’ll get to build your portfolio with easyhome, Canada’s only lease-to-own and lending retailer, and with easyfinancial, one of Canada’s largest non-prime lenders. From designing in-store point-of-sale collateral, to creating dynamic online ads, to video creation – your role will focus on multimedia, digital and POS creative design to build our brands, captivate customers and inspire our team.

Responsibilities

  • Develop static and dynamic assets for online campaigns, email, website, in-store/branch LCD displays, point-of-sale (POS) material, print collateral, presentation designs, infographics
  • Lead videography asset development and delivery, whether creating or working with third party: develop plan, storyboarding, filming, editing, distribution
  • Develop and manage a library of photos, videos, graphics, and media assets to be used across all our marketing channels
  • Contribute to creative development and execution for promotions, from theme and concept development to asset creative for POS and online
  • Collaborate with the marketing managers and our external AOR to assist in design POS collateral
  • Design creative and manage layout for direct mail assets, including handbills and addressed mail
  • Develop and maintain a consistent brand presence throughout our marketing, content, in-store/branch, and online platforms
  • Act as a brand steward to uphold the integrity of our brands across all channels, but challenge the creative boundaries of how we engage new and current customers

Qualifications

  • Degree/diploma in Graphic Design, Multimedia Design or similar discipline
  • 1-2 years professional-level experience in a graphic design role
  • Advanced proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Animate, Premier Pro) in PC/Mac
  • Experience with content production (social media, email, dynamic online ads, video)
  • Familiarity in Premier Pro (video editing)
  • UX/UI knowledge for website design and maintenance
  • Knowledge of photography a plus
  • Sketch/illustration skills for storyboarding videos concepts/dynamic ads a plus
  • Portfolio required with submission

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

goeasy is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, goeasy is committed to providing accommodations for applicants upon request at any stage of the recruitment process in accordance with all legislative requirements throughout Canada. Please let us know if you require an accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Additional Information:

All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check, credit check, and validation of their work experience to qualify for hire.  We thank all interested applicants, however we will only be contacting those for interview who possess the skills and qualifications outlined above.

Why should you work for goeasy?

To learn more about our great company please click the links below:

http://goeasy.com/careers/

title: Graphic Designer
description:
• Execute graphic designs that inform and captivate audiences on multimedia platforms
  • Create/adapt graphic elements and creative concepts for various print, social, digital, and advertising campaigns
  • Participate and contribute in team brainstorms to develop creative yet simple solutions for communicating complex and technical information
  • Produce publication-ready final files and ensure accuracy for print and /or digital channels
  • Execute creative concepts, applying current design standards and best practices in layout, design, and composition of print and digital products
  • Create templates (for PowerPoint and internal communications), mockups, and presentation deck
  • Coordinate print production and delivery logistics 8. Support website design and management
  • Ensure the corporate brands are protected and consistent across all platforms and when used by employees
  • Photography and photo editing
  • Videography and video editing
  • Performs all other duties and tasks as assigned


Job Requirements:
  • 3+ years of graphic design experience in an agency/corporate environment
  • Post-secondary education in a related field or equivalent to visual design: Graphic Design, Fine Arts, Visual Communication 
  • Strong knowledge of layouts, graphic fundamentals, brand development, and creative process
  • Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator & InDesign)
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word & Excel)
  • Adobe Acrobat expert user
  • Extremely organized, detail-oriented, and capable of multitasking in an evolving business
  • Ability to meet deadlines in a fast and high-pressure environment
  • Strong listening and communication skills · Consistent quality of work throughout project size
  • Positive attitude and eagerness to learn

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word, and Excel)

title: Lead Level Designer
description:
Company Description

People Can Fly is one of the leading independent AAA games development studios with an international team of hundreds of talented individuals working from offices located in Poland, UK, US, and Canada, and from all over the world thanks to our remote work programs.

Founded in 2002, we made our mark on the shooter genre with titles such as Painkiller, Bulletstorm, Gears of War: Judgment, and Outriders. We are one of the most experienced Unreal Engine studios in the industry and we are expanding it with in-house solutions called PCF Framework.

Our creative teams are currently working on several exciting AAA projects with the top publishers in the industry: Project Gemini with Square Enix and Project Dagger with Take-Two (2K), in addition to a new IP to be self-published and two other games in a concept phase. One of our IPs is also being adapted for VR technology.

With over 20 years of experience, PCF sets out to explore new horizons. We aim to combine our expertise with creativity of the best and most forward-thinking talents in the industry to work together on the new generation of action games for the global gaming community.

If you decide to accompany us on this journey, you’ll have a chance to perfect your craft and expand your knowledge, working alongside leaders in the industry on bringing a brand-new unique experience to the players worldwide.

If you feel yourself able to deliver as nobody else, take ownership of your projects, and are ready to leave a mark on a game you work on, apply now!

Job Description

  • Lead entire level design team.
  • Work hand in hand with the Creative Director to iterate, implement and execute on key design and level building principles
  • Block out and build levels and iterate through playtesting and providing/implementing feedback
  • Work with the art team to make sure that levels are up to the highest visual quality while retaining the gameplay and fun as well
  • Take full level ownership – from paper design, through the whitebox phase, script, iteration, debugging, optimization – until our game ships
  • Provide mentorship, troubleshooting, debugging and problem-solving assistance to members of the level design team
  • Proactively identify cross-discipline challenges and risks to the project and offer solutions
  • Foster a culture of open, honest, and respectful communication across all disciplines
Qualifications

  • Expert in level design both in practice and theory (chokepoints, routes, lines of sight, engagement distances)
  • 7 Years of professional level design experience including leading a level design team
  • At least 2 successfully shipped AAA games on PC or console
  • Self-motivation and ability to prioritize and deliver best quality work on deadlines
  • Ability to process, understand and implement feedback
  • High work ethic and self-motivated 

PREFERENCE TO APPLICANTS WITH

  • UE4 knowledge


Additional Information

What we offer:

U.S.

  • 100% group health insurance benefit premiums paid by PCF (Medical, Dental, Vision, Group Life, and Supplemental Live) and start on day 1 of employment.
  • 401K with 100% match, up to 3% of employee salary, and vested immediately.
  • Paid week off during Winter Holidays.
  • 20 paid vacation days and 5 paid sick days.
  • Free virtual health and mental wellbeing sessions included in the plan for members and their dependents.
  • A competitive salary and performance-based annual bonuses.
  • Personal development opportunities and ability to work in a global environment.
  • Work in a creative team with people full of passion for what they do.
  • Long term disability, short term disability, travel insurance, as well as other benefits provided. 

Canada

  • Benefit package 100% paid by PCF. Insurance company reimburses 100% of claims (Up to $500 per service a year, as well as individual family coverage).
  • Full Dental coverage, including major dental and orthodontics.
  • 4% RRSP matching before tax deductions, 100% vested on day 1.
  • Paid week off during Winter Holidays.
  • 20 paid vacation days and 5 paid sick days.
  • Free virtual health and mental wellbeing sessions included in the plan for members and their dependents.
  • A competitive salary and performance-based annual bonuses.
  • Personal development opportunities and ability to work in a global environment.
  • Work in a creative team with people full of passion for what they do.
  • Long term disability, as well as other benefits provided.

title: Marketing Associate / Graphic Designer -FT
description:
Otter Co-op is now accepting applications for a full-time Marketing Associate â€“ Graphic Designer.  This position will be in person full time and based out of our Administration Office located in Langley, BC.

Who we are:

Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to serve Western Canadians, delivering profits back to our communities and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our brand to life, visit us at www.otterco-op.crs. 

What you will do:

Reporting to the Marketing & Community Relations Manager, the responsibilities for this position include the following:

  • Help to create and execute marketing materials such as, advertising copy, social media content, video content, broadcast speaking points, landing pages, internal/external promotional emails and newsletters. 
  • Design traditional and digital media campaigns aligned with business goals to grow B2C (Business to Consumer) and B2B (Business to Business) engagement.
  • Work with the team to produce print assets (brochures, handouts, banners, promotional material) for use at conferences, tradeshows, and consumer events
  • A hands-on role in the curation of content through visiting our locations, interviewing our team to communicate our story and capture product and team member video and photography.
  • Participate and attend special events as required
  • Contribute to the team in living the Corporate Values of Integrity, Community and Excellence
  • Other duties as assigned

Why it matters:

Our team provides a range of products and services to support our member-owners. Through the work that we do, we help to build and grow Western Canadian communities together.  

Who you are:

You are looking for a long term career with opportunities for growth: 

  • A minimum of one year of post-secondary education completed in a marketing, or communications field or equivalent relevant education and/or experience. 
  • Proficiency using Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office is a must
  • Experience with social media channels, particularly Facebook and Instagram, is required. 
  • A working knowledge of Hootsuite and Canva would be an asset
  • Experience with photography and video editing is an asset
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail and an excellent creative eye
  • A valid BC Divers License (to visit our local locations and curate content)
  • An ability to multitask and perform to meet tight deadlines
  • Excellent understanding of contemporary digital marketing principles, strategies and best practices
  • Ability to work within a team and take direction / constructive feedback

Whatâ€™s in it for you:

  • Competitive wages
  • Annual bonus program for all team members
  • For eligible positions: comprehensive benefits package and an employer matched pension plan
  • Team discount on Liquor, Food, Gas, Fashion, Hardware, Feed & Restaurant purchases
  • Co-op Membership with an annual dividend payment on qualified purchases
  • Learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation
  • Team events, community volunteering opportunities

Otter Co-op is committed to a diverse and supportive working environment based on our Core Company Values of Integrity, Community and Excellence. We are committed to giving back to our communities through our Corporate Social Responsibility Program. 

At Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we are working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve.  We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work.

All successful candidates will be required to undergo a background check.

We would like to thank everyone for their applications, however only candidates that will be moving forward in the interview process will be contacted.

.

.

.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
We are expanding our world-class team of changemakers. 

Manifest Climate Inc. offers the first Software as a Solution (SaaS) of its kind powered by one of the world's largest TCFD dataset and best practices repository. We empower leaders and organizations to understand, visualize and connect climate-related impacts with the specific physical and transitional risks climate disruption pose to their core business in the short, medium and long term. Powered by AI, advanced analytics, climate science, industry best practices, and much more, the platform allows companies to 'See Beyond'.

In 2020, Laura Zizzo, a climate change pioneer known for integrated legal and consulting leadership, joined forces with proven technology entrepreneur Jeremy Greven to create Manifest Climate. By early 2021, Manifest Climate completed a seed financing round of $6.5 million with an exceptional syndicate of leading technology investors and has since been certified a Great Place to WorkTM.

We are a company driven by people with a passion to make an impact and we help organizations across a broad range of industries to clarify and act confidently on the most complex business challenge today. Right now, we have an immense opportunity to scale our expertise to a global market that requires fast, flexible, and affordable climate technology solutions. If you are a forward-thinker interested in purpose-driven work that helps real-world decision-makers and influencers, we think you'd like it here. 

Who we need

Reporting to our Head of Global Marketing we are looking for a Graphic Designer to join our team - and our purpose-driven mission. You will apply a creative lens connecting business needs with visual concepts that are original, attractive, engaging and fit-for-purpose. As a hands-on designer, you will execute your ideas, take information, bring it to life, adapt, pivot, and deliver outstanding digital and print results.

This is a hybrid position based within a reasonable commuting distance to our office in Toronto.

What's in it for you

Impact. You want to channel your passion for climate consciousness into your daily work. You want the professional reward of working on the most important issues facing the world today with a diverse team of brilliant yet humble, funny yet incredibly professional collaborators and thought leaders. You want to be part of a company responding to a massive market opportunity ahead of a huge adoption curve, where soon thousands of public companies will have to disclose climate-related risks and opportunities.

Autonomy. You will embrace and excel in an agile, self-managing environment that encourages everyone to act with a sense of radical responsibility. Manifest Climate operates at the leading edge of both climate change intelligence and leadership paradigms, which offers the thrill of innovation and the challenge of ambiguity. 

Career development. You will play a vital role as a cross-team resource, working in partnership with Marketing, Communication, Sales, Product and ultimately, extending your influence beyond our North American client base to collaborate with agencies globally. You will thrive as we grow and evolve together, adding to the Manifest Climate story, building a career path to team leadership, or a move elsewhere within our organization.

How you will make an impact

  • Asset design. You will create and maintain a wide range of assets that maintain brand guidelines and consistency across all designs. These assets include: 
    • Digital and social ads as well as other media-based promotional material such as email marketing design, landing pages, white papers, etc.
    • A library of images, graphics, and icons for print, web, or email.
    • Updating our website's front-end within the existing framework.
    • Video content.
  • Sales enablement. You will design and maintain all visual materials and templates required to document, support and facilitate the sales process across the buyer's journey. You will create: 
    • Sales decks, sell sheets, white papers, case studies, prospect correspondence, etc.
    • Event materials supporting and promoting our presence at webinars, seminars, conferences, and trade shows.

What you bring to our collaborative space

  • The experience. You have a portfolio of professional design projects that includes work with websites, white papers, brochures, icons, and photo layouts. You can expertly take a technical product idea or business requirement and create impactful and effective designs and images. You have in-depth knowledge of graphic design principles, digital design principles, and web standards. Ideally, you have worked in a B2B SaaS startup environment.
  • The technical toolbox. You are highly proficient with Adobe Creative Cloud (Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, AfterEffects and Premiere), MS Office and Google Suite. You have basic coding knowledge, and you may have exposure to video editing. New ideas and new technology interest you. 
  • The interpersonal skills. You have flexible and effective communication skills. You can translate technical concepts to non-technical business leaders, incorporating feedback while shining a light on best practices and current trends. 
  • The accountability. You are purpose-driven with a desire to change the global trajectory when it comes to climate and deeply committed to our mission. You are genuinely excited to apply your talents in building our brand. You have the project management skills to balance competing priorities and deliver exceptional results. You have a willingness to persevere despite obstacles, the confidence to try and fail, and the humility to learn, grow and adapt.
  • The collaborative approach. You have the high degree of emotional intelligence and curiosity necessary to thrive in our self-managing environment. You embrace diverse perspectives and excel at building relationships. You are happy to jump in wherever and whenever needed.

Evolve, improve, and thrive with us.

We empower organizations to rapidly identify and effectively manage climate-related risks to secure and expand financial success. Our unified belief in this purpose drives our culture, the caliber of talent we attract, our work ethic, resolve, and determination.

Our values include a relentless focus on customers, making things simple and useful, and creating thriving ecosystems. We have other values too, but they're table stakes: transparency, integrity, authenticity, fairness, wholeness, open, honest communication, agility, balance, self-management, and autonomy. In short, we want to build an amazing place to work where every team member is empowered, supported, and energized.

We expect to make some mistakes along our journey, but that's all part of finding our way. We're here to learn and grow togetherâ€”to build a fantastic company that makes a difference, and hopefully, has a legacy that lasts forever.

We are always on the lookout for committed and passionate professionals interested in contributing their talents in a challenging, energetic, and inter-disciplinary environment. If you feel you meet 70% of the qualifications we are looking for and are determined to make a difference, we encourage you to apply. We promise to consider your application fully. 

We strive to build a team that reflects the diversity of the communities where we live and work. We encourage applications from traditionally underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with disabilities. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please let us know.

title: Oracle NetSuite Designer (CDC)
description:
Job Type: Permanent
Primary Location: Montreal, Quebec, Canada
All Available Locations: Montreal; Fredericton; Gatineau; Quebec City; Sherbrooke

Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Be encouraged to deepen your technical skills...whatever those may be.
Have many careers in one Firm.

Are you an experienced NetSuite systems specialist excited for a new career in consulting? Then you might be the next consultant for our Enterprise Technology & Performance Team. Interested? Look no further.

What will your typical day look like?

As a Senior Solution Designer in the Canadian Delivery Centre, you will be offering customer, supply chain, and finance transformation services, based on a leading Cloud/SaaS Application. You will lead our experienced technology professionals, offer deep techno-functional experience in their area of focus and are committed to delivering efficient, transformational and technology-based solutions to our clients. By combining our delivery capabilities with our industry experiences, we create unmatched market offerings to solve our clients' business issues. A Senior Solution Designer will work within an engagement team and is responsible for identifying business requirements, requirements management, functional design, prototyping, process design (including scenario design, flow mapping), testing, training, defining support procedures, leading work streams and supporting implementations.

About the team

The team embraces and lives the firm's purpose - to make an impact that matters - by pushing yourself and your team to identify solutions to challenges that are most important for our clients, people, and society. At Deloitte we develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities. We deliver exceptional client service by maximizing results and driving high performance from people, while also fostering collaboration across businesses and borders. We proudly influence clients, teams and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships. It's important that we understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, and align people to them to set appropriate priorities and direction.

Enough about us, let's talk about you

You are someone who is:

  • NetSuite certified (SuiteFoundation and ERP Consultant or SuiteCloud Developer)
  • A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience leading NetSuite implementation projects
  • Expertise in multiple NetSuite modules
  • Able to estimate and plan NetSuite implementation projects
  • Possess of a undergraduate/post graduate degree with outstanding academic credentials or a professional designation holder
  • Experienced with project problem diagnosis, solution development, client communications, facilitation of decision making, documentation, managing client expectations and team leadership

Why Deloitte?

Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:

  • You will lead at every level: We grow the world's best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
  • You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
  • You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.

The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You?

At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively - that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities! We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We'd love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

Job Segment: Consulting, Database, Oracle, Supply, ERP, Technology, Operations

Apply now "

title: Graphic Designer / Concepteur.trice graphique
description:
(En franÃ§ais ci-dessous)

Join a Montreal headquarter company that helps organizations around the world create a personalized journey of impact and fulfillment for their people. Explorance offers innovative Experience Management (XM) solutions because we believe that each experience matters.

We are looking for a designer whoâ€™s ready for fast-paced action in the #1 Best workplace in Canada (2021). You will work with the Marketing team and will be responsible for ensuring consistent, high-quality visual representation of the Explorance brand, internally and externally. In addition, you will work closely with other Marketing team members, such as the Web Developer, to keep our websites up-to-date and relevant to Exploranceâ€™s audience, and with the Content Specialists to ensure compelling, engaging content. A strong proficiency in graphic design, a solid understanding of branding, and a working knowledge of how to optimize website design is required.

What you will do as our new Graphic Designer:

  • Apply, modify, and maintain graphic brand content
  • Maintain Explorance brand guidelines
  • Design and refine web pages to support new initiatives and evolving brand style
  • Design UI elements and tools such as navigation menus, search boxes, and tabs, for our digital assets
  • Wireframing and page design and overall UI Design using Figma
  • Ensure visual designs work across desktop, tablet, and mobile
  • Work closely with the Graphic Designer to maintain a consistent aesthetic across all digital platforms
  • Other related duties as required

What you need to succeed in that role:

  • Outstanding and up-to-date design skills, with a portfolio to match
  • At least 2 yearsâ€™ graphic design experience in a similar role
  • Expert knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) along with the Microsoft Suite (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint)
  • Working knowledge of Figma is essential.
  • Understanding of web accessibility standards is a bonus.
  • Strong collaboration skills within the Marketing team and with stakeholders across the business.
  • Creativity and style
  • Strong organizational skills (multitask, meet deadlines, can manage tasks, time management, and prioritization)
  • Whether working independently or within a team, self-motivated with a strong work ethic.
  • Experience with re-brands a bonus.
  • Knowledge of video software is a bonus.
