title: Creative Design Lead
description:
BTS Digital

BTS is the global leader in turning strategy into action. We inspire and equip people to do the best work of their lives, creating better businesses and a better world. Within BTS digital, the Toronto office specializes in crafting highly creative self-paced customized digital learning experiences for many of the world’s leading organizations. We create impact through high creativity, meaningful design and powerful storytelling. 

The Role

The Creative Design Lead is a new and exciting addition to the Experience Design Team. Overseeing the Media Design team (comprised of Media Leads) and working closely with the Media Production team (e.g. Animation, Illustration, UX Design and Articulate Storyline 360 development), this role exists to pave a creative vision forward and support the team through this critical growth period for the business.

Reporting to the Head of Digital Learning Experience, this is a role with a dual focus – supporting a talented team to realize their potential and deliver amazing work, while supporting the business in terms of pushing creativity, improving processes, and optimizing workflows. You understand how to deliver quality within a business context.

Your Critical Skills

  • Creative Leadership - You are confident in all facets of the creative process, with the ability to transform an understanding of current and future trends in design and technology into a thoughtful creative concept and experience. You know how to solve big design challenges while sweating the smallest details of line breaks and pixel perfect layouts to create powerful experiences. You are passionate about art direction that is thoughtful, meaningful, provocative at times, and significant. You can take our creative team to the next level.
  • People Leadership – You lead with empathy in everything you do. You know how to coach others, provide strong feedback to guide their work, and support their careers. You know how to unlock the potential in others and help them do the best work of their lives.
  • A Digital Expert – You come from a strong background of digital work – using technology to create amazing experiences – and your passion for the intersection of media, design and technology is contagious. You are consistently providing thought leadership and advising peers on industry-leading practices.
  • Client-facing Skills– You have a track record of client success and are comfortable and confident with clients. You know how to understand their needs, educate them when needed and craft solutions to meet their challenges. You know how to best represent the media team in critical client interactions.
  • Business Leadership - You get the corporate world and understand the role of creative work within the reality of business. Scope management, tight timelines and strong processes do not scare you. You can balance the needs of a creative team with the needs of the business – improving quality while also improving profitability and efficiency.

What You’ll Do

Leading the Work

    • Partner with the Digital Management Team to maintain/define a cutting-edge vision for delivery of world class training services and operational best practices.
    • Direct projects from concept to completion with minimal oversight, ensuring that our projects consistently maintain a high degree of innovation and quality
    • Lead the creation of visually stunning end-to-end experience design concepts
    • Maintain a critical eye for processes and quality and lead by example for how you want the team to work
    • Work through the team to meet deadlines in a time sensitive industry
    • Collaborate with team members to produce ideas and provide the creative guidance for the new designs

Leading the Team

    • Provide regular guidance to 6+ Media Leads, ensuring that they succeed in their role, and that our creative vision is being followed
    • Support team to disrupt, improve and evolve ways of working when necessary
    • Own design principles, establishing brand, tone and manner, brand guidelines, and visual identity
    • Foster team development and improved performance. Set a vision for the team, foster further collaboration and work to unlock further creative potential in others.
    • Support individual reports through coaching, feedback and skill development.

Leading the Business

    • Identify opportunities and mitigate risk with the media conceptualization and production process
    • Prioritize needs and requests based on the needs of the business and drive those priorities within the team
    • Identify gaps in the market and spot opportunities to create value
    • Look for opportunities to scale efficiencies and new ways of working across multiple projects and environments

Your Ideal Background  

While we accept candidates from diverse backgrounds, based on experience here’s what will help you succeed in the role:

  • 5-10 years’ experience in a relevant environment
  • Experience in a management and people leadership role within an agency-like environment
  • Experience developing a large-scale vision for a creative team
  • Exceptional knowledge of storyboarding, illustration, animation and graphic design
  • Demonstrated ability to give meaningful feedback to art direction
  • A strong mentor and career coach
  • A high-level of proficiency in the Adobe Creative Suite
  • Experience with eLearning authoring tools
  • Direct experience in the field of Digital Learning

title: Designer, Information Design
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">About Klick Health
Meet a different kind of workplace. Klick Health is an ecosystem of brilliant minds working to realize the full potential of their people and clients in life sciences since 1997. And we’re still growing fast, even after two decades. What does that mean for you? As Klick experiences exponential growth year-over-year, so do the people who help make it happen. Because we’re constantly evolving and changing, we invest in talent early and often, to develop future leaders at all levels. We’re one of the country’s Top 10 Great Workplaces, 10 Most Inspiring Cultures, Best Workplace for Innovators, Best Managed, and Fastest Growing. We know that career paths are seldom simple and straightforward. And that's an asset. If you feel like you'd be a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply and take the first steps to starting your career journey at Klick!

About Our Creative Craft
The Creative team features an incredible array of experienced, fearless, smart visionaries, capable in all media and technologies, and united by a common goal: to build brands that solve a human need. It requires hard work, a healthy dose of imagination, and a passion for craft to make work that stands out in the world.We’ve got super-smart, friendly, and caring people who put their hearts and souls into the clever work that they create for our clients in order to deliver thoughtful creative messaging to the patients they serve. And the best part? We have a ton of fun while doing it.

About Klick Health

Klick Health is the world’s largest independent, full-service marketing agency and commercialization partner for life sciences. For over two decades, Klick has been laser focused on developing, launching, and supporting life sciences brands to maximize their full market potential. Klick has been named Agency of the Year six times over the last eight years by the industry’s leading publications. For the latest updates, follow Klick Health on Twitter:@klickhealth.There’s something different here.

Position: Designer, Information Design (All levels)
Reports to: Senior Director, Information Design

Role Description and Expectations

Hi there! We are looking for designers to join our Growth Design team who will craft visual presentations and long documents for business pitches. Whether seasoned in the craft or recently graduated, if you’re someone who loves all things information design, this is the job for you!

As a designer at Klick who is an expert when it comes to information design, you are a visual problem solver—you dissect complex information to simplify and abstract it. You make presentations that don’t look like presentations. You see slides as an artboard, and you are excited to convey dense information in a manner that is both visually appealing and is easily digestible for the audience.

We love passionate people and we want to see what you’re passionate about! We have created a small (completely optional) design challenge for you to show us your stuff! 

Please design a landscape sized infographic about what you love. Whether you’re passionate about sports or you’re an avid foodie that knows all the best brunch places in Toronto, we want to see this! We want to see YOU on an artboard—bonus if you do it on a powerpoint slide. If you’re up for this challenge, we would love to learn more about you via this infographic. 

Please note: All candidates must submit samples, a portfolio, or link to a personal website to be considered. Those who complete the optional design challenge will receive a call from our recruiters and feedback from one of our design leads.




What makes Klick different?
You’ll work on numerous multi-million dollar brands—the size and breadth of the accounts here are incomparable to most agencies. We believe in putting our people first, and always make that our priority. This and our other timeless principles have made all the difference in our over two decades of success. By having an entrepreneurial spirit, playing the long game, considering outcomes over optics, and solving challenging problems through our hacker roots, we live our difference in all that we do. You’ll get to experience a high level of trust and be given the freedom to make decisions, judgment calls, and function with autonomy. If you have an idea, run with it! You’ll be encouraged to let your entrepreneurial spirit flourish and you’ll work with incredible teams that you can learn from, contribute to, and who will support you every step of the way!

Klick is consciously creating a culture where everyone can thrive and grow in their careers. We believe that our best work comes from our diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We strongly encourage members of historically underrepresented communities to apply, including Black people, Indigenous peoples, and other people of colour, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and people with intersectional identities.

We’re also committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment process and work environment. Should you require any accommodation, please contact us at careers@klick.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs and ensure you have a positive experience.</section>

title: 3D Designer
description:
Jennifer Hayman Design Group, is a well-established and  award-winning , Landscape Design firm with offices in Toronto and Barrie. We are experiencing unprecedented growth, specializing in custom residential landscapes and gardens across Toronto, the GTA and cottage country.

For almost two decades, our team of  internationally  trained designers have specialized in creating  timeless  yet  multi-functional  and  luxurious  living spaces to fit the lifestyle needs of the  modern  family. We offer peace of mind for our clients by helping them  navigate , curate and  execute  the  transformation  of their new outdoor living room. We work with an extensive and multi-disciplinary group of professionals and trades for a  worry-free  implementation from planning and permits, to Design  Execution  and  Build .

We are looking for a talented 3D artist to support the Landscape Design team by creating integral CGI renderings for clients to understand design concepts and visualize the design proposal. 

Qualifications:

  • Personal Portfolio required
  • Minimum 2 years design experience and/or graduate of Landscape Design/Architecture program
  • Solid working knowledge of the principals and practices of Landscape Design an asset
  • Strong Horticulture, hardscape and grading knowledge an asset
  • Must be able to develop and draft construction details independently, or willingness to learn
  • Solid working knowledge of SketchUp and other 3D modelling software 
  • A valid Ontario drivers license and a clean drivers abstract an asset
  • Bachelor’s degree and/or a Landscape Industry Certification an asset
  • Possess a strong work ethic and highly motivated
  • Understands, follows, and communicates written and oral instructions well

The ideal candidate for this position must be self-motivated, highly organized and eager to grow in a fast-paced landscape design company.  This is a contract position to start, with option for full-time employment (40hrs/week) with benefits and office for the right candidate. Competitive Wages based on experience.   Start Date: March 21, 2022

title: Web Graphic Designer
description:
Job Description:

AmeriMark Direct is a leading direct marketer of womenâ€™s apparel, personal care products, jewelry, watches, and health care merchandise. Products are sold online and through catalogs. We are looking for hardworking, dedicated individuals to add to our teams as we drive digital growth and provide the best quality and customer service to our customers. With plenty of opportunities for advancement, the possibilities with AmeriMark are endless.

 

 

Your day to day will vary but hereâ€™s an idea of what youâ€™ll work on:

  • Creating email graphics and templates, web banners and graphical elements, banner ad designs, and various other design projects.
  • Preparing catalog images for the website.
  • Utilizing various graphical software tools and technologies to transform graphical concepts into specific web pages.
  • Making changes to web site/pages based on feedback from management and users.
  • Executing plans and meeting deadlines for website updates and email campaigns regularly.
  • Staying abreast of any industry-wide changes in design philosophy and any new tools and technologies being used for web design.
  • Working with Web Developers on web design and delivery of graphical content to end users.
  • Meeting with technical staff on projects, technical specifications, and deadlines

 

Our ideal candidate

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree or Equivalent Experience
  • Minimum of 2 years of professional experience designing email campaign creative and web graphics
  • Proficiency in Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Dreamweaver MX and FTP Pro
  • Creative design skills with ability to design to the taste of our customers
  • Working knowledge of HTML, HTML5, Java Script, and CSS
  • Ability to be collaborative in a deadline-driven environment
  • Stay current on website design and usability
  • Have strong attention to detail and effective communication skills (written and oral)
  • Experience using Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word),
  • Ability to work well with others
  • Creative problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work efficiently and accurately in a high-volume production environment

 

Whatâ€™s in it for you?

  • Massive career growth opportunities
  • Competitive compensation and benefits
  • Casual/flexible work environment, no suit or ties
  • Birthday off with pay!
  • Complimentary DirectBuy Membership!

title: Content Creator
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Hi, we’re GoodGood! We're looking for a Content Creator to lead our social media accounts and community presence.

What’s GoodGood all about?
We’re here to create a new future for local commerce, and we’re thinking big. Less selling at people, and more connecting with people. Our ultimate goal is to connect emerging makers with local neighbourhoods through authentic online and retail experiences, making their lives a little easier, a little more convenient, and a little more delightful.

GoodGood’s handpicked selection of makers reflects our community. Locally curated coffee, beverages, snacks, and everyday essentials (and okay, some non-essentials too) that are available in-store, and can be delivered to you in under an hour via our app and website? Nice.

But community is about more than just coming to you, it’s about offering a destination for discovery and connection: and that’s exactly what our neighbourhood cafés are about. Each element of the space is intentionally designed to spark curiosity. The aroma of freshly brewed coffee welcomes you, while our functional design allows communities to come together. Aspirational? Maybe. We told you we’re thinking big.

Digital storefronts via our app and website showcase our full inventory, letting guests order ahead for pick-up, or have their order delivered in under an hour. Plus, guests earn rewards via our digital loyalty program. The future of ecommerce is here, and if you ask us, it sounds GoodGood.

The Role
We're in early stages: that means you'll be GoodGood's first full-time content creator. Exciting? Yes. Daunting? That too (but we know you can handle it). You'll be responsible for defining a vision for how GoodGood can add the most value to our communities via social media. In your day-to-day, you'll work cross-functionally with multiple stakeholders, collaborating with designers, makers, and team members across the business. You'll be perfect for this role if a) your ultimate goal is to build a strong connection to our customers, b) you love a great meme, and c) your fave phrase is, "Okay, but what if we tried...?"

Compensation: $55k - $65k with a competitive equity package - that’s right, we’re all owners here
Benefits: a) Health, b) dental, and c) vision (see what we did there?)
Workspace: Your choice: Mac or PC
Perks: Unlimited coffee and discounted snacks
Environment: Casual, fun, and creative atmosphere. Help make it what you want.

It should go without saying, but here at GoodGood, we're all about being good to people. We believe in equality, respect, inclusion, and being both a speaker and a listener when the time calls for it. We're committed to creating a safe work environment for our team members and customers, regardless of gender, race, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, neurodiversity, religion, or any other aspect of what makes you you. Need assistance or accommodation to complete your application or during this process? Let us know.</section>

title: Visual Designer
description:
Reference # :22-11594Title :Visual Designer
Location :Toronto, ON
Position Type :Contract
Experience Level :6 YearsStart Date / End Date :03/08/2022 / 11/07/2022 
Description
We are currently seeking a "Visual Designer" for a contract role with one of our clients in Toronto, ON . Please apply if you would be interested and available for it.

Duration: 8 Months (Remote)

Role:  
As a member of the Experience Design team, you will extend your knowledge of human-centred design under the direction of a Design Manager. You will apply your skills to client interactions and daily operations, and advocate for the best design practices with the user in mind.

Product Design mentality - must be able to lead a team, creating solutions with Desirability, Feasibility and Business Value in mind.

We accept applications from new graduates or Designers with up to 3 years' experience in the industry.

Skills:

• Proficiency in design tools including Sketch, InVision, Adobe XD, Figma, Axure, and Adobe Suite for production and prototyping

• Work in a cross-functional team, including Line of Business, Product Owner, Business Analyst, Engineering/Development

• Work with Business Analyst, to understand, define and estimate effort based on Business Requirements

• Work with our clients' existing Design System or Style guides

• Contribute to updating/expanding a Design System, as needed

• A solid foundation of typography, layout, and colour theory

• Translate and elevate UX wireframes into UI elements that create a visual language for the client

• Familiarity with UX practices and willingness to problem solve alongside UX Designers

• Knowledge of current design trends and future design considerations


Regards,
Shubhi Kulshreshtha
Cell: 289-301-1271
email:shubhi.kulshreshtha@artech.com

title: Production Designer
description:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.

Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us. As we grow our team, the well-being of our team members remains our top priority. To ensure the health and safety of our team members, including those in the recruitment process, our team members are temporarily working from home.The Maclean’s designer will work closely with the executive editor, director of photography and the editorial team to design and produce powerful and engaging approaches to stories for both print and digital.This is a 12 month contract position for an individual who appreciates the role creative visual storytelling plays in illuminating the world we live in—and relishes that responsibility.Qualifications:Post-secondary education in editorial design or equivalent experienceFacility with creating work for both print and digital platformsIdeas-driven, positive attitude, team-oriented spirit and strong work ethicExperience withAdobe Indesign, Photoshop and IllustratorKnowledge of emerging trends and best practices for print and web design and a fascination with (or at least a healthy interest in) politics, culture and current affairsResponsibilities:Design and produce the monthly print issue of Maclean’sDesign and produce the weekly digital editionArt direct, design and produce our suite of education issuesSupport the subscription and newsletter teamsOur Maclean’s mandateCanada’s national magazine covers current affairs in the broadest sense of the term, including politics, culture, trends, ideas and personalities. At Maclean's, we are proud of the part we play in pushing Canada to be all it should be while also reflecting back to Canadians the many wonders and challenges of our evolving nation. Whether through our monthly print edition, our weekly tablet digital magazine, daily online stories or live events, Maclean's delivers new and smart ways for our audiences to appreciate the world through a Canadian lens.
 Schedule: Full timeShift: DayLength of Contract: 12 MonthsWork Location: 1 Mount Pleasant WFH(084), Toronto, ON Travel Requirements: NonePosting Category/Function: Publishing & Print ProductionRequisition ID: 213910 Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work: Our people are at the heart of our successOur customers come first. They inspire everything we doWe do what’s right, each and every dayWe believe in the power of new ideasWe work as one team, with one visionWe give back to our communities and protect our environment What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ. Posting Notes:  Corporate

title: Digital Content Designer
description:
The individual will work closely with the eCommerce Manager, Brand Teams, Customer Media teams and Perfect Digital Store Manager, US & Global eCom teams and our agency partners to identify, create, and execute programs/tools to support and accelerate the eCom ambition for the company.

  • Adapt the Design Content Strategy for all our brands for the Canadian Market
  • Define and follow the Optimum Product Shot strategy for all retailer content and for brand websites
  • Work closely with the brand teams to understand the brand positioning and guidelines and maintain consistency
  • Efficiently build additional enhanced eCommerce product images, and lifestyle assets
  • Create A++ content for Amazon product pages
  • Build Retail Digital media assets for all our key retailer campaigns
  • Coordinate with customer media team on assets and publishing
  • Build and support creative assets for social campaigns and any internal creative requirement
  • Own the Digital Transformation monthly newsletter, coordinate the content in teams, build the dynamic letter using MS Sway
  • Own and Manage the DAM for Canadian Market

What we are looking for

  • Design degree
  • Expert in Adobe Design Suite
  • Microsoft Sway
  • Web assets & Google banners (All the different resolutions
  • Experience in eCommerce landscape, familiarity working with Canadian retailers
  • Successful leadership within cross-functional setting
  • Project Management (from start to finish)
  • Experience with external agency relationships
  • Relevant experience in creating web banners and other digital assets
  • Experience In Video assets, CGI, GIF, Illustration and Animation will be considered as a value add
  • Experience working DAMs, DMEX, Salsify or ContentHub

title: Visual Designer
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Who are we?
We’re a small, diverse team working at the cutting edge of machine learning. At Cohere, our mission is to build machines that understand the world and to make them safely accessible to all. Language is at the crux of this, but it can be difficult and expensive to parse the syntax, semantics, and context that all work together to give words meaning. The Cohere platform provides access to Large Language Models through its APIs that read billions of web pages and learn to understand the meaning, sentiment, and intent of the words we use in a richness never seen before.

We recently raised our Series B, signed a multi-year partnership with Google Cloud, and we are focused on bringing our technology to market. We will partner with customers so they can build natural language understanding and generation into their products with just a few lines of code.

We’re ambitious — we believe our technology will fundamentally transform how industries interact with natural language. And we have the technical chops to back it up - Cohere’s CEO, Aidan Gomez, is a co-author of the groundbreaking paper “Attention is all you need”, (over 23k citations) and was previously part of Google Brain. Our entire technical team is world-class.

We are focused on creating a diverse and inclusive work environment so that all of our team members can thrive. We welcome kind and brilliant people to our team, from wherever they come.

Why this role?

As the first dedicated Visual Designer at Cohere, you will build the foundations of our journey of becoming a strong and well-known brand. This year we are embarking on a large rebrand across all fronts — digital, print, and spaces — and as our first Visual Designer, you will be scaling this in all that we do, in every way we show up.

We’re looking for a strategic designer who can tackle any visual endeavour at hand: whether it be typography, illustration, motion, or merchandise. A visionary who builds relationships, and brings everyone along to get where they need to go. We also believe that great designers are humble, curious, and well-rounded outside of design (yes, we’d like to hear about your latest two-week or six-year obsession ).

Please Note: We have offices in Toronto, Canada and Palo Alto, USA, but embrace being remote-first! We are open to candidates located in either Canada or the United States for this role.




If some of the above doesn’t line up perfectly with your experience, we still encourage you to apply! If you consider yourself a thoughtful worker, a lifelong learner, and a kind and playful team member, Cohere is the place for you.

We welcome applicants of all kinds and are committed to providing both an equal opportunity process and work environment. We value and celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive work environment for all.

Our Perks: 
 An open and inclusive culture and work environment
‍ Work closely with a team on the cutting edge of AI research
 Free daily lunch
 Full health and dental benefits for employees based in Canada and the US, including a separate budget to take care of your mental health
 100% Parental Leave top-up for 6 months for employees based in Canada and 12 weeks in the US
 Personal enrichment benefits towards arts and culture, fitness and well-being, quality time, and workspace improvement
 Remote-flexible, offices in Toronto and Palo Alto and coworking stipend
✈️ 6 weeks of vacation and shared Canada/US holidays

#LI-Remote</section>

title: Content Designer | Canada - Fully Remote
description:
About FFW

For over 20 years, FFW has provided significant digital experiences to the world’s largest brands many within the Fortune 50 in finance, power, media, healthcare, and pharmaceuticals. FFW is a team of more than 400 people across 11 countries and growing fast. Not only do we work with large organizations, but we have a diverse portfolio across various verticals working on a variety of mission-critical digital solutions. Learn more at https://ffwagency.com/about-ffw.

 

About the Position

As a Content Designer, you are a talented and driven UX practitioner who partners with technology to make thoughtful, customer-centered work that solves problems. You’re ready for hands-on projects at every stage of the lifecycle, from brainstorming creative concepts with the project team to participating in client presentations and ensuring deadlines are met. FFW is a seriously collaborative work environment, so Content Designers need to collaborate across disciplines daily, from research to analytics to pitching new work, all while maintaining high standards for original concepts and detailed execution.

The FFW Experience Design (XD) Team comprises talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, education, and cultures, all of whom believe that we're better together. Our team culture is rooted in collaboration and in our drive to work through problems to understand our user's context, emotions, goals, and motivations. We support each project as an advocate for the customer, establishing informed perspectives, and leading XD activities that help us design and iterate on digital product experiences that benefit our clients' businesses.

The Content Designer is responsible for contributing to the design process, including identifying pain points, defining product or platform features and functionality, generating content models, building key wireframes, and designing end-to-end user interfaces closely working with designers and other multi-disciplinary teams, including the product manager, engineering team, and user researcher.

 

You Will…

  • Plan and design content models through various methods, including wireframe, low-fidelity prototypes, sitemaps, etc.

  • Organize and architect digital content while keeping multi-channel and multi-device extensibility and SEO best practices in mind

  • Make strategic UX content design decisions related to enhancing core web components and creating new component features to expand digital experiences

  • Assist in the planning, optimizing, and facilitating the use of a library of standard web components

  • Clearly communicate the rationale behind user experience/content architecture decisions and their business value to digital team stakeholders

  • Prepare metadata strategies, develop content matrix/mapping documentation, and collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams to establish content governance models

  • Analyze analytics and other research provided to support UX efforts

  • Deliver creative, strategic, detailed solutions that sit at the user-centered intersection of design, content, business, and engineering

You Have…

  • Relevant higher education degree, or 3+ years experience creating interfaces, large-scale digital experiences, or applications

  • Experience in an agency setting

  • English fluency

  • Excellence at designing a brand experience across multiple channels, including web, mobile, and native applications – experiential, physical, and voice are a plus

  • Experience working with content and information architecture within a variety of industries, including retail, financial, travel, and healthcare

  • Direct client interaction experience with the ability to build relationships, understand client vision/direction, and present designs and concepts

  • Strong experience using various prototyping tools to help understand the problem, test concepts, and communicate experiences to internal teams and clients

  • Full understanding of how to identify the true needs of users through various methods

  • Comfort taking risks in content design, pushing past the obvious and making something you love

  • Ability to demonstrate ideas and concepts using flow diagrams, sketches, wireframes, and mid-fidelity prototypes

  • Experience collaborating with design and development teams to ensure the desired user experience is in the final product

  • Stayed, and will continue to stay, up-to-date on trends, new advances, and new platforms in the digital product space

  • Comfort diagramming and workshopping, including remotely

  • A desire to contribute to making our company a great place to work

Nice to Haves

  • Experience working on large-scale redesigns or e-commerce

  • Experience designing for a variety of industries, including retail, financial, travel, healthcare, etc.

  • Knowledge of service design, design systems, and agile methodologies

  • Experience with web content management systems, like Drupal

 

Does this sound like you? Send your resume over. We’d love to chat. NOTE: Please include a link to your portfolio or relevant project descriptions with your application.

title: World Designer
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Larian Studios are looking for a World Designer to join our studio in Guildford. We have 25 years of experience creating critically acclaimed role playing games and pride ourselves on our excellent storytelling — our most recent title, Divinity: Original Sin 2, has won over 160 awards (including the BAFTA for Best Multiplayer Game) and our next game, Baldur’s Gate 3, is currently in Early Access.

World Design is a blend of narrative, level and quest design that imagines the gameplay flow. We need people that can visualise the level and understand player motivations. You’ll be taking ownership of a section in Baldur’s Gate 3 and liaising with multiple design teams to deliver it successfully. We need strong collaborators that can communicate their visions and get buy-in from the team.

We are looking for World Designers in our St. Petersburg, Guildford, Kuala Lumpur and Quebec City offices.</section>

title: Senior Visual Designer
description:
Mogo (TSX, NASDAQ:MOGO) is empowering its more than one million members with simple digital solutions to do money like you mean it. Through the free Mogo app, consumers can access a digital spending account with Mogo Visa* Platinum Prepaid Card, the only card of its kind in Canada. The MogoCard makes it easy to enjoy spending control while doing good for the planet by planting a tree for every purchase. The Mogo app also enables you to easily buy and sell bitcoin, get free monthly credit score monitoring and ID fraud protection, and access personal loans. Mogoâ€™s wholly-owned subsidiary, Carta Worldwide, also offers a digital payments platform that powers the next-generation card programs from innovative fintech companies in Europe, North America and APAC, while Mogoâ€™s wholly-owned subsidiary Moka is bringing automated, fully-managed flat-fee investing to Canadians from coast to coast to coast. To learn more, please visit mogo.ca or download the mobile app (iOS or Android).

Are you the type of person that can turn concepts into engaging and exciting visuals? Do you have a knack for conveying complex ideas as relevant and delightful design? Weâ€™re currently looking for an experienced and conceptually strong Senior Visual Designer whoâ€™s exceptionally detail oriented and not limited by medium. 

Youâ€™re on top of the latest trends and you arenâ€™t intimidated to take on a full range of responsibilities from concept development to production. Youâ€™ve worked on bringing a variety of brand campaigns to life. Youâ€™re well connected to the creative community and can bring on external resources for specific projects when needed. If this sounds like you, check out the requirements below, we want to hear from you!

 

What you'll do:

  • Generate creative ideas and concepts independently and collaborating with peers and stakeholders
  • Understand marketing initiatives and strategic positioning to help evolve and define our brandâ€™s visual language
  • Design compelling animated and static visuals for multiple platforms, that illustrate the Mogo vision and brand
  • Continually iterate on concepts in an effort to make the brand relevant and relatable
  • Bring the Mogo brand to life through captivating visuals across our digital marketing platform, social media channels, print media, and other touch points
  • Manage design projects from the concept phase through to final delivery
  • Cooperate with the rest of the design team across different types of media
  • Act as a brand ambassador for Mogo, regularly using Mogo products, sharing the brand with friends and family, and providing feedback to the team for improvements

 

What you'll need:

  • 4 years experience agency experience or on a design team at a technology company, bonus points if youâ€™ve worked in a startup
  • Mind blowing online portfolio with examples of digital work
  • Strong network within the creative community
  • Comfortable with receiving, giving, and implementing design feedback
  • Proficiency using Illustrator, Photoshop, Indesign, and After Effects
  • Ability to solve problems using good judgment and analytical skills
  • Ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities and thrive in a dynamic environment
  • BONUS: Experience in photography and videography and/or 3D animation

title: WA Designer, Buenos Aires (Remote)
description:
The Wrk Platform is infinitely simplifying automation. We’re building a world where any process can be replicated by combining human skill sets and bots into pre-configured units of work that we call ‘Wrk Actions’. These Wrk Actions are the building blocks for processes big and small — automating the delivery of tasks from the very simple, like merging spreadsheets, to the very complex, like executing, analyzing, and escalating customer service phone calls.

 

We don’t believe automation should be scary, complicated, or confusing to deploy. We are looking for like-minded individuals to join our fast-growing remote team — motivated by strategy, empathy, and the desire to be the change.


The Role

We are looking for a highly passionate individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment. This is an ideal role for someone with a technical background and can communicate with Automation, Operations, Engineering and Sales teams, and who is looking for the opportunity to work on a platform that combines human interactions with automation for a world of limitless possibility.

 

WA Designer Responsibilities

  • Design new Wrk Actions based on our product roadmap and the requirements of our Operations team and clients

  • Test new Wrk Actions and associated bots as well as system features delivered to the Wrk community

  • Work directly with the Automation and Engineering teams to propose and document the requirements for new automations as well as required system features and enhancements

  • Coordinate the UAT testing for any new Wrk Actions


    Must Have

  • Minimum 1 years of experience in a technical role

  • Knowledge of HTTP REST APIs

  • Possess a solid understanding of data types and structured data

  • Solid understanding of JSON schema standards

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills

  • Experience with QA processes and test automation

  • Familiar with software development (SDLC) 

  • Possess a strong understanding of UML, BPMN and flow diagrams

  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

  • A methodical, investigative and inquisitive mind with strong attention to detail


Nice to have

  • Python proficiency


What’s in it for you

  • Inclusive, dedicated team of people who are passionate about their work and great at what they do

  • A comprehensive Benefits package, We want the best!

  • A great health benefits program

  • Tools and flexibility to work in the way that is best for your productivity, creativity and fulfillment, including a fully remote work environment with a budget to set up your own home office

  • Opportunity to work directly with industry leaders and experienced entrepreneurs

  • Guidance and mentorship to grow your skills and career

 

How to Apply

Please apply directly through this page with your resume and a cover letter.

 

Wrk is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with Wrk is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.

title: Créateur de contenu
description:
Tu as toujours rêvé de travailler au sein d’une organisation animée par la passion, la créativité et l’innovation? Tu as envie d’un quotidien où les projets sont stimulants et diversifiés?

Chez Premier Tech, notre équipe Communications n’a qu’une mission en tête : créer du contenu engageant et inspirant qui fait vivre notre identité unique. C’est pourquoi nous sommes à la recherche de la perle rare qui deviendra notre spécialiste en matière de création de contenu.

Faire la différence, voilà comment Premier Tech se distingue. Une équipe unique propulsée par une passion commune, celle d’offrir des solutions qui contribueront positivement à la vie des gens, des entreprises et des collectivités. Chez Premier Tech, Passion et Technologies s’unissent de façon durable et transformatrice pour donner vie à des produits et services qui aident à nourrir, à protéger et à améliorer notre planète.

Ton futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Créer du contenu riche, pertinent et engageant pour de multiples plateformes et publics, tout en respectant le ton rédactionnel et l’image de marque de Premier Tech
  • Comprendre et bien cerner le public cible de façon à transposer cette compréhension en contenu pertinent et adapté
  • Faire preuve de curiosité en restant à l’affût des dernières tendances en création de contenu
  • Mettre à profit ta créativité en participant activement aux brainstorms d’équipe
  • Utiliser tes habiletés linguistiques pour la rédaction et l’adaptation de divers textes bilingues et unilingues

Compétences requises

  • Nous n’avons pas de paradigme précis quant à ta formation initiale. Tu peux provenir du monde de la rédaction, des communications ou du journalisme. Ce qui importe, c’est que tu aies un penchant pour la rédaction!
  • Par-dessus tout, tu as un français absolument irréprochable! Tu ne laisses passer aucune faute et les erreurs grammaticales te font littéralement grincer des dents
  • Tu es curieux et n’as pas peur de proposer des stratégies de contenu créatives sortant des sentiers battus
  • Tu navigues bien dans l’incertitude et le changement. Tu sais que pour arriver à un contenu parfait, un texte peut être modulé maintes et maintes fois
  • Pour toi, ce n’est pas un problème de gérer plusieurs mandats à la fois tout en respectant des deadlines bien précis, même quand tout va vite
  • Tu maîtrises parfaitement le français et l’anglais.

Ces mots te parlent?

contenu, tendances, plateformes numériques, rédaction, création, affaires, besoins, storytelling, blogue, web, calendrier éditoriaux

Tes yeux s’illuminent à la lecture de cette offre rêvée? Postule dès maintenant, nous attendons ta candidature avec impatience!

Chez Premier Tech, Passion et Technologies s’unissent de façon durable et transformatrice pour donner vie à des produits et services qui aident à nourrir, à protéger et à améliorer notre planète.', 'Pour toi, ce n’est pas un problème de gérer plusieurs mandats à la fois tout en respectant des deadlines bien précis, même quand tout va vite', 'Utiliser tes habiletés linguistiques pour la rédaction et l’adaptation de divers textes bilingues et unilingues']

title: Senior Visual Designer
description:
What We Offer


Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!


We are looking for a Senior Visual Designer to join SAP Designs Creative Studio. The Creative Studio is responsible for building the product-driven brand expression and illustrate the narrative for largescale UX transformation. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of visual storytelling and the ability to craft compelling and perfectly executed concepts. This designer will excel at collaborating with others at implementing their designs at scale while being able to maintain a concise and controlled visual language.


Expectations and Tasks


In this role, you will lead the communications design and contribute to the storytelling both internally and externally. We are looking for a person who can both, produce great visual design and storytelling in new and inventive ways, taking advantage of technology and impact. You will partner with other designers to build the SAP Design universal expression.


+ Experiment, define, and contribute to guidelines of a new brand

+ Bring ideas to life through designs, prototypes, or specs as needed to create beautiful and on-brand experiences

+ Prioritize and execute on high-impact moments

+ Unquestionable typographic skills

+ Demonstrate and communicate clear design expertise, taste, and style

+ Create, champion, and maintain visual concepts and style guides to ensure quality and consistency across all channels and platforms

+ Leverage partnerships to create collaborative storytelling moments

+ Execute layouts, typography, iconography, color theory, and compositions to design with artistry, creativity, and mastery

+ Explore creative tech trends and styles


Education and Qualifications


+ BA/BFA in Art/Design or relevant industry experience

+ 7 years of experience in design with an emphasis on graphic design, product design, user interface, and/or motion graphics

+ Demonstrated experience in mentoring

+ Excellent communications skills, strategic thinker

+ A portfolio that showcases delightful and well-crafted experiences, with a refined understanding of systematic design

+ Great visual design skills and ability to apply and extend a design language

+ Expertise creating design systems, product guidelines, brand guidelines, mood boards and motion studies

+ Meticulous sense of detail and ability to seek out simple solutions to complex design challenges

+ Excellent professional communication, collaboration, time-management, and organizational skills

+ Product design, photography, iconography, and illustration experience

+ Presentation, interpersonal, and communication experience

+ Experience taking design feedback and incorporating it

+ Experience with 3D visualization tools (e.g., Cinema 4D, Maya, or Houdini)

+ Experience designing Mixed Reality or VR experiences

+ Experience designing UI on real-time engines

+ Able to consider candidates already located in Canada or Mexico


#SAPUXDesignCareers #CreativeStudio #LI-Remote


We are SAP


SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.


Our inclusion promise


SAPs culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone regardless of background feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.


SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com , APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com , EMEA: Careers@sap.com .


EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.


Requisition ID:324488| Work Area: Software-User Experience| Expected Travel: 0 - 10%| Career Status: Professional| Employment Type: Regular Full Time| Additional Locations:Virtual - Canada

title: Graphic Designer
description:
GRAPHIC DESIGNER ROLE

Become one of the most impactful Graphic Designer on the planet!

WHY YOU WILL LOVE FINGERPRINT FOR SUCCESS (F4S) 

We are a groundbreaking technology platform that is expanding and growing rapidly around the world.We are looking to onboard and hire the next generation of graphic designers to help our customers set and achieve their crazy big goals.

Fingerprint for Success (F4S) is the future of human development. We are on a mission to empower individuals and teams to solve the worldâ€™s biggest problems. Featuring a vast range of tools for collaboration, performance, wellbeing, diversity, and inclusion, plus a huge library of AI and human coaching programs, with F4S anyone can develop and achieve amazing things at work and in life.

Until now professional coaching has been reserved only for the elite, financially inaccessible to most of the worldâ€™s population. Driven by a scientific evidence-based methodology, F4S democratizes coaching, creating for the first time a scalable human development solution for everyone. Through predictive data, conversational A.I., and also some of the world's very best professional coaches, F4S is loved by consumers, teams, enterprises, universities, and professional coaches alike.

We are a digital-first, small but fast-growing values-led team, genuinely on a mission to change the world. We are swift, passionate, hard-working, scaling ourselves at the same pace we grow our product and customers. We invest deeply in our company culture and our teamâ€™s wellbeing, knowing this is the well from where the worldâ€™s greatest products and companies flourish. 

Who you are:

  • An open-minded person who is willing to learn and become one of the most impactful graphic designers in the world 
  • A person with an insatiable curiosity and unrelenting drive to learn, succeed and lead by example
  • A person who is a force for good and celebrate individual uniqueness
  • Be driven by helping their team meet and exceed aggressive conversion targets and individual career goals. 
  • Be passionate about creating purposeful and valuable content that helps business professionals grow better.
  • Be highly organized and have a high level of accountability for the quality and outcomes of your work and your teamâ€™s work.
  • Lead with empathy, serve as an ally for underrepresented communities, and create psychological safety to ensure the team can do their best work. 
  • Able to identify design needs to continuously elevate the quality of digital marketing and brand management
  • A keen eye for aesthetics and details
  • Effective communication skills and comfortable with candor.
  • Strong prioritization skills and ability to consistently meet deadlines.
  • Ability to work independently (while also functioning and contributing as part of a team) and efficiently manage your own time.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, interpersonal, and relationship-building skills

The Graphic Designer will assist the Marketing Team with the production and implementation of the companyâ€™s portfolio of creative requirements.

What youâ€™ll do:

  • Responsible for creative design solutions that have a high visual impact
  • Creates branding proposals, advertising materials, e-books, magazines, brochures, folders, packaging, exhibitions and display materials, flyers, and online materials such as Facebook and Instagram posts, online ads and banners, as well as company AVPs and other video material.
  • Responsible for creating branding standard guidelines for the company and ensuring all design outputs are aligned with the company's and brandsâ€™ standards
  • Prepares rough drafts of material based on an agreed brief
  • Reviews final layouts and suggests improvements if required

Qualifications (any or all):

  • Entry-level 
  • Intermediate to proficient in layout design, with at least 1 - 2 years experience in doing layouts whether in a professional or freelance capacity.
  • Candidates with more experience are welcome to apply.
  • At least basic in illustrations, 2D animation, and storyboards.
  • Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree.
  • Required skill(s): Canva or Adobe Photoshop (proficient), Adobe Illustrator (proficient), Adobe After Effects (basic - intermediate)
  • Has a creative flair in design and a good sense of art.
  • Has a strong design sense of color, layout, and typography.
  • Has strong creative skills and the ability to design ideas for a wide range of industries.
  • Has creative conceptualization ability as well as technical execution capability.
  • Can translate complex data or information into easy-to-digest designs, layouts, and infographics.
  • Has the ability to work independently or as part of a team.
  • Strong communication and organization skills.
  • Able to multi-task and can gracefully handle pressure.
  • Willing to learn other multimedia software apart from Adobe creative tools to deliver other multimedia-related work.

Software Expertise:

  • Applicants should have extensive knowledge of the use of Canva or Adobe Creative Suite, particularly:
    • Canva presentations & videos
    • Adobe Illustrator
    • Adobe InDesign
    • Adobe Premiere / After Effects
  • A plus if you have knowledge of and experience using the following programs:
    • Microsoft Office
    • Youtube and similar platforms
    • Google Suite
    • Activecampaign
    • WordPress and other CMS programs

Where?
This role is initially fully digital/remote, eventually establishing our US Hubs for regular teaming and events. Given our HQ in Sydney Australia, the ideal candidate will be based on the west coast or in Austin, Texas to benefit from the overlapping timezone windows. 

Why Join Us?

  • Empower our users with helpful content
  • Learn digital marketing and content marketing real-life skills
  • Bring direct impact to the business and see blog traffic grow with your efforts
  • Be among team members who believe in working and playing hard 
  • Flourish in a flat organizational structure with no office politics

Benefits

At F4S, we are committed to living out our mission every day and that starts with providing benefits that allow our employees to care for themselves, support their families, and give back to their community. 

  • Access to F4S coaching
  • A competitive compensation plan with opportunity for advancement
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Per year: paid holidays and leave 
  • Learning and Development stipend
  • Amazing high performing remote global team 
  • Incredible culture and community

We are hiring for many role types including Full-time, part-time, contract, internships.

We look forward to you joining us in our very real mission to make human development accessible to everyone!

hello@f4s.com

How to get started?

Go to F4S.com to complete the F4S Questionnaire (15-30 mins) to help us better understand your work-style motivations and how we can best support your onboarding. We look forward to making a positive impact with you!

title: Senior Web Graphic Designer
description:
Company Description

Who we are:

At Reitmans (Canada) Limited (RCL), every moment of every day revolves around our customers and our love of fashion. We believe fashion empowers our customers to put their best foot forward when it matters the most. From the design table to the stores and our digital channels, we are always finding new ways to create memorable customer experiences, backed by a strong brand portfolio and powered by the most passionate people in the industry.

Job Description

Reporting to the Manager Creative Direction for the RW&CO brand, you are part of the team that delivers our brand voice and vision to the customer in a compelling and aspirational way. The Web Graphic Designer is responsible for the conception and design of electronic marketing tools (newsletters, promotional banners, online contests, Facebook headers & ads, web landing and content pages, etc.).  You  provide expertise in creating design solutions that meet the brand vision that support growth and profitability across our Omni-channel eco-system.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Create the design of the seasonal emails, editorials, landing pages and guides along with all associated assets contributing to a fully Omni-channel approach to the customer experience;
  • Contribute to Creative ideation sessions and creates an 360 deployment strategy by season; 
  • Create standards seasonally on the usage of fonts, colours and other associated graphic elements to maintain consistency within a seasonal thematic direction; 
  • Partners cross company when conceptualizing all design initiatives;
  • Researches web trends seasonally and proposes solutions to increase conversation and brand presence;
  • Supports Creative Direction Manager in the deployment of seasonal assets.

Qualifications

Who you are:

  • College or university with a degree in Graphic Design or related field of study;
  • Minimum 5 years of pertinent experience ;
  • Extensive knowledge of MAC environment and multimedia software (In Design, Illustrator, Photoshop);
  • Bilingual

Additional Information

What we offer (Why work with us):

  • A competitive benefits package (Full Time Employees Only)
  • Paid Time Off ( Sick Time, Flex Days & Vacation (Full Time Employees Only)
  • Additional benefits include monthly bonus potential, opportunities for advancement and tuition reimbursement
  • 50% discount at all Reitmans (Canada) Limited brands (Penningtons, Reitmans & RW&CO.)
  • Generous Employee Referral Policy (50$-500$)

If this inspires you…let’s talk. Send us your resume today! 

By the way, did you know that Reitmans (Canada) Limited has several hundreds of stores all across Canada and three fashion apparel banners? Get ready to join the Canadian fashion retail icon, with a great success story where you can have a voice and make a real difference. 

There are many ways to wear a career at RCL! #ReadytoRCL 

Reitmans (Canada) Limited is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for providing an accessible candidate experience. 

We thank all applicants. Only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Are you a passionate designer looking to put your creativity to the test with a company that rewards your hard work? As a Graphic Designer with Brandt, you’ll take charge of key projects across a wide range of industries. And, you’ll be collaborating with our close-knit team to take your design skills to the next level. If you’re a motivated team-player who’s ready for a challenge, this is the opportunity for you.

To provide design and creative services as part of the in-house Branding and Creative Services team. The graphic designer will work with Regina-based creative team on a diverse range of projects including corporate and marketing collateral, events materials, large format graphics, advertisements and related material.

  • Create high-quality corporate and product/services marketing materials from concept to final production
  • Work closely within a creative team to ensure a collaborative/consistent approach
  • Produce finished creative and artwork for production and/or placement by ensuring that all creative material is provided in the correct format for publication including file preparation and output, prepress and proofing
  • Communicating effectively with internal clients and other team members
  • Producing attractive and effective design for digital and traditional media
  • Ensure all-round compliance of creative material to all brand elements including look and feel, brand attributes, values, corporate and visual identity
  • Provide quality control over concepts and projects to ensure brand consistency
  • Strong working knowledge of graphics and design fundamentals
  • Highest level of attention to detail with creative and artistic ability
  • Expert skills in InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop on a Mac platform.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office, After-Effects, Premiere, and Sketchup is an advantage
  • Ability to manage a diverse workload
  • Computer literate: Technical knowledge of related programs and computer software
  • Diploma or Undergraduate degree in Graphic Design

title: Senior Experiential Graphic Designer
description:
IA Interior Architects translates client goals, brand and culture into powerful environments built around people, processes, technologies and business drivers.  Our clients in diverse markets worldwide require high-performance, visually compelling and sustainable environments to move their enterprise forward, support their culture, engage their staff, integrate technology and drive efficiencies.  As architects, designers, workplace strategists and environmental specialists in the largest global architecture firm concentrating exclusively on interiors, we help clients articulate and align their business strategies and core values with the dynamic use of space.

Our team members are collaborative, creative, professional, expert and entrepreneurial.  Joining our team requires skill, daring, leadership, teaming, humor and a love of interiors.  We are presently searching for a full-time  Senior Experiential Graphic Designer in our Toronto studio. The Senior Experiential Designer leads the design and development of a variety of deliverables, including brand development, signage and experiential graphics and design programs. Responsible for design strategy and concept development, and directing support staff in refining and producing these concepts into reality; presenting to clients and interfacing with vendors; and providing marketing and work plan/scheduling support to the Director.

Responsible for maintaining client relationships and account leadership. Works under the leadership of a Director. Leads the design on local and specific account projects.

Specific responsibilities will includes:

  • Actively participates in and oversees the design, development and production of Experiential design. Manages and prepares plans, message schedules, sections, elevations and drawing packages.

  • Assists Director to manage the budget, scope and schedule for the Experiential design portion of a project.  Ensures adherence to set budget and immediately informs Manager of any potential variances to the budget.

  • Mentors the work of Junior, Intermediate, and Experiential Designers and Job Captain. Oversees tasks and provides feedback on work product.

  • Maintains key client relationships. Creates innovative, creative and complete design concepts and presents to clients. Conducts client interviews to determine Experiential design requirements.

REQUIRED EDUCATION AND WORK EXPERIENCE
• Bachelor’s degree in Graphics, Industrial Design or Interior Design, or equivalent experience
• 7+ years’ experience with 3D/2D graphics, signage, digital printing

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
• Working knowledge of the commercial interior architecture and/or design industry
• Demonstrated competency in all phases of environmental graphics
• Understanding of branding concepts and the potential for their application to, relationship with and integration into the built environment
• Skilled visual sense and understanding of typography, composition, multiple media platforms, legibility, standards development, documentation, fabrication and implementation
• Sound Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign skills
•  Knowledge of video editing, interactive design, industrial design and 3D design/visualization and softwares (Autodesk 3dsmax, Vray) will be plus.
• Excellent verbal, graphic and written communication skills.

Working Conditions:
For the majority of the time the Experiental Graphic Designer will be sitting in a studio with limited physical requirements.  This may require individuals to bend, stretch, twist and reach.  On occasion individuals will be required to visit a client site to perform site verifications and field surveys.  The position is not subject to occupational and safety risks.

Please submit a portfolio or work examples with your application 

IA Interior Architects is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veteran

See Job Description

title: Senior Graphic Designer
description:
JOB PURPOSE: To support the marketing and expansion efforts of YESA & Grant Cardone Canada by designing and creating brand aligned content to support our current clients, as well as help grow the brand across Canada via ads, promotions, social media and sales funnels. 

 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Main duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

  • Design and create new, dynamic content to support marketing efforts via social media, websites, events marketing material, etc.. 
  • Work with management to design new sales and marketing campaigns
  • Support marketing by helping build and coordinate social media programs
  • Help in other operational, marketing or sales related projects as deemed necessary
  • Help in the creation and production of promotional videos

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Graphic Design â€“ skilled background in graphic design
  • Creativity â€“ an individual who brings an exciting creativity to design
  • Videography and editing â€“ not a required skill but definitely an asset
  • Marketing â€“ an understanding of marketing and how it applies to design
  • Social Media â€“ some knowledge of social media is an asset
  • Willingness to learn â€“ we are a young, dynamic organization and we need individuals who are hungry to grow and learn in their respective field and beyond!
  • Adaptability â€“ an individual who embraces change and is open to trying new things and exploring new ways of doing things 
  • Dependable â€“ someone who can be relied on to complete projects without supervision

 

COMPENSATION:

  • Competitive annual salary with performance bonuses
  • Comprehensive benefits (health, dental & medical)
  • Complete marketing training providing via Digital Marketer(#1 marketing training in the world)
  • Free sales and business training - free access to Cardone Sales University (#1 business training platform in the world)
  • Participation in regular team events and team building excercises
  • Room for growth and expansion

 

ABOUT YESA & GRANT CARDONE CANADA: 

YESA (Young Entrepreneur's Sales Academy) is top sales organization that secures contracts with third party companies and builds a market approach and sales team for them. YESA accomplishes this by successfully training, educating and developing the sales and business leaders of tomorrow.

Grant Cardone Canada is a world class sales training and education company that is committed to transforming salespeople and businesses across the country. Through our various training platforms (Cardone University & Cardone On Demand) we train sales teams across the country to become more confident, more skilled and more competent at their roles. 

Learn more:https://grantcardone.ca/

Learn more:https://www.yesa.ca/

This is full-time position: Monday to Friday 7am - 4pm

This position is based out of our office in Port Moody, BC

YESA is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medicalâ€‹â€‹â€‹ condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity orâ€‹expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Innovatia is looking for an experienced eLearning Graphic Designer to help visualize and transform ideas into stunning eLearning content. Designs may be used on the web, or on mobile devices, as part of a learning curriculum or as a stand-alone output.

The perfect candidate must be innovative and creative, and able to work effectively with the Project Manager and Content Development team to create engaging interactive eLearning designs and video assets which may include photographs, illustrations, text, audio, custom animations, and custom interactivity.

Employment Type: Contract
Location: Work from home

Candidates must be able to provide a portfolio of work samples.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Minimum 5 years of experience designing for eLearning outputs
  • Able to work in a team environment and across multiple project teams as a creative partner
  • Ability to quickly determine customer needs and effectively represent customer brand
  • Experience with rapid development tools such as Articulate StoryLine and Vyond would be considered an asset
  • Proven record for on-time delivery, in a fast-paced environment with multiple priorities

GRAPHIC DESIGN REQUIREMENTS

Expertise using:

  • Adobe Creative Suite – Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign.
  • Powerpoint
  • MS Word
  • Web Design Tools

Capabilities include:

  • Follow client branding requirements.
  • Meet with Clients and Stakeholders.
  • Create mock-ups, design storyboards and content layouts ensuring visual continuity.
  • Develop digital graphics.
  • Produce task-based documentation, reference guides, support materials, infographics.
  • Process an in-depth understanding of visual design theory, and layout.

If you are creative, hardworking, passionate, and committed to excellence, we think you’ll fit in with us. To apply: www.innovatia.net/careers

We thank all candidates for your interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Innovatia is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Digital Design Lead, McCann Calgary
description:
The Role

In the role of Digital Design Lead you will be responsible for bringing user-centered designs to life in partnership with strategy, creatives, developers and other technology partners. You will create these unique experiences on a variety of platforms including web, mobile, social, apps and other emerging technologies. You will lead a team of digital CX specialists providing guidance, best practices and championing digital-first thinking throughout the agency.

 

The Team

The McCann Canada team is a collective of brave, nimble and smart individuals capable of rising to any occasion. Our goal is to create work that allows brands to play a meaningful role in consumers’ lives.

 

What you will do…

  • Design experiences for a variety of interfaces on a diverse range of digital platforms including websites, emails, applications and other channels when required.
  • Lead the digital CX team providing guidance and support while championing their career growth.
  • Proven ability to translate strategy into digital design thinking.
  • Experience in building user-journeys and site architectures via interactive prototypes (i.e. Figma, Adobe XD) while integrating best-in-class design principles.
  • Collaborate with agency subject matter experts in creating the optimal experience while being the voice of the end-user.
  • Partner with technical partners during the development phase to ensure the end result aligns and meets the need of the interactive designs as intended.
  • Ability to provide scope and effort to project managers to ensure estimates are accurate and reflect the need of the project.
  • Consistently researching digital design best practices, educating team members and clients and ensure these standards are integrated into your work.
  • Ability to present and clearly articulate complex concepts to various stakeholders.

 

 

Who you will be…

  • 8 plus years of professional experience in interaction design.
  • Strong background in developing user-centered designs.
  • Experience designing solutions that meet or exceed WCAG 2.0 AA standards.
  • Strong experience in responsive design as well as designing for personalization systems leveraging a CRM.
  • Proven ability in leading a team directly or in-directly.
  • Strong written and presentation skills.
  • Previous experience working within an agency an asset.
  • Demonstrated experience in collaborating and partnering with a variety of digital teams.
  • Experience in Motion Design an asset.

 

 

McCann Worldgroup Canada is committed to a diverse workforce as an Employment Equity employer (Women, People with Disabilities, Aboriginal Peoples, and Visible Minorities) and aims to maintain an inclusive and equitable workplace where employees feel valued, respected, and supported. If you require an accommodation, we would be happy to work with you to meet your needs.

title: Graphics Designer
description:
Job Responsibilities:




  • Cultivate a solid body of work

  • Take the design “brief” to record requirements and clients needs

  • Schedule project implementation and define budget constraints

  • Work with a wide range of media and use graphic design software

  • Think creatively and develop new design concepts, graphics and layouts

  • Prepare rough drafts and present your ideas

  • Amend final designs to clients comments and gain full approval

  • Work as part of a team with copywriters, designers, stylists, executives etc.





Job Skills:




  • Proven graphic designing experience

  • Possession of creative flair, versatility, conceptual/visual ability and originality

  • Demonstrable graphic design skills with a strong portfolio

  • Ability to interact, communicate and present ideas

  • Up to date with industry leading software and technologies (In Design, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, Photoshop etc)

  • Highly proficient in all design aspects

  • Professionalism regarding time, costs and deadlines
