title: Digital Designer (Test Job)
description:
Company Overview

All job descriptions should begin with an introduction to your company and your employer brand.  Open with a strong, attention-grabbing summary of your company.  Tell candidates what makes your company unique. Include details about your organizationâ€™s culture to sum up why a candidate would love to work for you.  

Job Summary

The job summary should give candidates a general idea of expectations for the position and a high level summary of the role.  Be sure to provide an exact job location so candidates know where the position will be located.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Highlight the responsibilities. Make sure your list of responsibilities is brief but comprehensive. Also emphasize the duties that may be unique to your organization.
  • Outline the day-to-day activities of the position. This will help candidates understand the work environment and activities that they will be exposed to on a daily basis. This level of detail will help the candidate determine if the role and company are the right fit, helping you attract the best candidates for your position.
  • Specify how this position fits into your organization. Indicate to whom the role reports and the function of this position within your organization. This helps candidates see the bigger picture and understand how they can impact the business.

Qualifications and Skills

  • Add a list of hard and soft skills. The job description should specify education, previous job experience, certifications, and technical skills required for the role. You may also include soft skills, like communication and problem solving.
  • Keep your list concise. While you may be tempted to list out every requirement you envision for your ideal hire, including too many qualifications and skills could dissuade potential candidates.

Benefits and Perks

  • List the benefits (non-wage compensation) that you offer. These include health care, paid time off, retirement savings plans, parental leave, tuition reimbursement, and professional development.
  • Include any â€œabove and beyondâ€ offerings that make your company stand out. This can be anything from casual dress code, in-office gaming systems, free snacks, company paid meals, corporate discounts, free parking, and even gym memberships.

title: Graphic Designer-Amico Corporation
description:
The Amico group of companies is looking for a full-time Graphic Designer who can excel in a fast-paced, demanding environment. Working as part of a marketing team, the candidate must be a positive, energetic, professional individual who has a passion for creativity and proven experience with the Adobe Creative Suite.
 
Qualifications:
 
  • Proficient in the use of the Adobe Suite of programs including InDesign, Photoshop, and Illustrator
  • Strong project management skills to work on multiple projects from concept to implementation
  • Works well under pressure, displays good organizational skills and can multitask to meet deadlines.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively interact with a variety of individuals throughout the company
  • Excellent understanding of colour, space, and print methodologies
  • Exceptional layout and typography skills
  • Able to prepare designs for digital and print publications
  • Knowledge of print production processes, developing print specifications and preparing print-ready materials
  • Photo manipulation, editing, and compositing as required
  • Expert attention to detail with an eye for catching inconsistencies
  • Continuous self-learning and keeping up to date with relevant programs
  • Fluent in English with exceptional grammar and proofreading skills
  • Post-secondary education in graphic design, with 2 years work experience
 
 
Responsibilities:
  • Design sales and marketing materials such as brochures, catalogues, flyers, signs, and large format tradeshow elements using the Adobe Creative Suite programs
  • Manage your projects from concept to completion, including: coordinating content and approvals; creating press-ready files; and checking final proofs
  • Creativity to turn basic concepts into designs
  • Follow structured file naming systems
  • Maintain brand consistency throughout all projects
  • Collaborate with multiple departments (e.g., marketing, sales, engineering)
 
Only qualified candidates will be contacted.
For more information please visit us at www.amico.com

title: Graphic Designer
description:
A permanent full time opportunity for a Senior Graphic Designer located in the Brampton area.

This is an in-house creative/design team made up of talented creative professionals who create promotional and educational communication for target market audience.

Communication includes catalogues, brochures, newsletters, online and offline campaigns, product promotions, point of purchase display graphics and more.

There is an opening for talented Senior Level Graphic Designer to join our creative team. This role would help to provide mentoring to the team, as well to drive the creative direction set by the Creative Director following established brand guidelines.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provide pre-print production design for printed media
  • Support social media
  • Collaborate with the Creative Director to develop and implement design solutions for print and digital collateral, retail, trade show and product package display designs
  • Collaborate on creative/design ideas with team while following brand guidelines
  • Support online/web creative efforts with knowledge of basic HTML, Adobe and front-end design/development

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Degree or Diploma concentrated in graphic design, visual communication, print/web design, digital marketing or equivalent
  • At least 5 or more years of working experience in creative environment, or equivalent freelance experience
  • Exceptional portfolio with demonstrated understanding of both online and offline design and campaign development
  • Experience working with Adobe Creative Suite in a Mac OS environment
  • Ability to work on both MAC and PC platforms
  • Excellent knowledge of pre-print production, and digital file development
  • Excellent knowledge of HTML and front-end web development is an asset

title: Graphic Designer
description:
As part of the Design team, you will have the opportunity to elevate the branding and creative direction within EntSoc. You will work within multidisciplinary teams to bring ideas to life and develop ideas that will impact the entrepreneurship ecosystem.


As a Graphic Designer, you will be responsible for:

  • Design marketing collateral such as event banners, stickers, clothing, business cards, and banners
  • Work with the design team to create eye-catching visual graphics
  • Create assets such as icons and visuals for projects
  • Work with the design team to create a defined illustration style


We are looking for a VP Design, Graphic Designers and Project Designers who can show us that they have:

  • 2+ years of direct work or volunteer experience as a graphic and/or visual designer

  • Intermediate knowledge in the use of Adobe Creative Suite.

  • Knowledgeable in the latest design trends, methods, and techniques.

  • Strong knowledge of online optimization best practices

  • Strong knowledge of printing/publishing procedures and standards

  • A great communicator and story-teller

  • Comfortable with iterative design with detailed discussion

  • Takes initiative and values open communication

title: Illustrator
description:
Secret Location’s Digital Preschool division is an empowered product team which values communication, collaboration, and fun. Our primary goal and purpose is to create preschool apps that boost meaningful screen time for children, parents, and caregivers. As part of the larger eOne and Hasbro family, our digital brand portfolio includes the widely popular preschool app World of Peppa Pig, which has claimed the #1 spot in its category in over 20 countries since launch, as well as superhero hit PJ Masks: Hero Academy.

About the job

Secret Location is hiring a 2D Illustrator / Animator who will work closely with product teams on numerous mobile apps to assist and develop digital learning experiences for preschoolers. Using your solid knowledge of illustration and animation and your ability to adapt to different artistic styles, you will be instrumental in delivering outstanding preschool games and apps.

Working with the Creative Director on the creative team, the role will collaborate with other team members to craft and deliver amazing mobile application experiences.

Why would you want to work with us?

We are going to have a whole lot of fun! As a 2D Illustrator / Animator, you’ll become an integral member of the creative team crafting games and activities with a hardworking group. You’ll be empowered to turn the creative strategy into fun, engaging, and relevant games for preschoolers!

Responsibilities:

  • Create visual designs and illustrations for content and align to brand style guides.
  • Work with the team to create age-appropriate game-based experiences.
  • Work cross-functionally with product design to create a seamless and pleasant and age-appropriate user experience
  • Collaborate with the product team to develop/plan and implement engaging learning experiences that align with business and product objectives.
  • Create 2D animations for games and activities.
  • Perform visual design audits, as needed.
  • Stay current on trends and methodologies designing for children, as well as relevant competitors’ products.
  • Outstanding communication skills, especially in writing, with an emphasis on clarity, organization, and precision

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree or College diploma in design or related field (or sufficient professional experience).
  • Portfolio that includes animation samples and illustrations and design samples from web or mobile games.
  • Experience using a variety of design tools and principles.

You get a gold star if you...

  • Have experience designing for preschool-aged children at different developmental stages.

Secret Location is committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment. We are committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, or any other legally protected status. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodation needed to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process.

We thank everyone for their interest but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Subway Sandwich Artist
description:
Company Description

Pilot Flying J is the 10th largest privately held company in North America with more than 28,000 team members. As the industry-leading network of travel centers, we have more than 950 retail and fueling locations in 44 states and six Canadian provinces. Our energy and logistics division is a top supplier of fuel, employing one of the largest tanker fleets and providing critical services to oil operations in our nation's busiest basins. Pilot Company supports a growing portfolio of brands with expertise in supply chain and retail operations, logistics and transportation, technology and digital innovation, construction, maintenance, human resources, finance, sales and marketing.

 

Founded in 1958, we are proud to be family owned and consider our team members to be part of the family. Our founding values, people-first culture and commitment to giving back remains true to us today. Whether we are serving guests, a fellow team member, or a trucking company, we are dedicated fueling people and keeping North America moving.

 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.


Pilot Flying J is part of the Pilot Company family of brands that keeps North America's drivers moving, including E-Z Trip, Mr. Fuel, One9 Fuel Stop, Pride, StaMart and Xpress Fuel.

Job Description

  • Provide guests fast, friendly, and clean service
  • Maintain inventory
  • Manage and prep food safely
  • Ensure top-notch quality in all our food products
  • Operate cash registers
  • Maintain the overall appearance and cleanliness of the restaurant
  • Provide excellent guest service

 

At Pilot Flying J, we fuel more than tanks – we fuel people. From our team members to our guests, we strive to make everyone’s journey better. As the largest travel center network and leading supplier of fuel, being part of the Pilot Flying J family means you are essential to keeping North America’s drivers moving.
What makes our travel centers a great place to work and shop? It starts with friendly people, a focus on teamwork and service, and a commitment to a safe and clean experience. Working together, we proudly provide the fuel, food and amenities that millions of travelers rely on to reach their destination. As a growth company, we are always looking for more incredible people to join our team. You bring the skills, drive to work hard and a friendly team spirit, and we’ll provide the training, benefits and opportunity to fuel your future.
We hope your next career stop is with us! Join our team and start your journey with Pilot Flying J. 

Pay Range: $15.75 up to $21.250000Qualifications

Required Qualifications

  • Incredible guest service skills and ability to maintain a guest focused culture
  • Ability to complete accurate sales transactions
  • Ability to cleanly and safely manage and prep food

Preferred Qualifications

title: Lookdev Artist
description:
Company Description

As a company founded and run by an artist, it's our mission to provide talented artists with the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.

Job Description

Only applicants located in the GTA or willing to relocate before their start date will be considered.

The Lookdev Artist creates shading to ensure that models and textures are combined into hyper-realistic assets, ensuring to meet the high quality standards of Rodeo FX.

Main responsibilities:

  • Develop looks to ensure assets can be properly lit and are technically correct to help create hyper-realistic passes;
  • Take assets from the texturing department and push surface qualities further in terms of realism;
  • Finalize assets technically and artistically, validating work with turntables and various tech checks;
  • Create lighting setups that become reference shots for sequences;
  • Set up Nuke scripts that will be used by the compositing and lighting department;
  • Set up and maintain a preset shader bank for different surface qualities;
  • Work closely with the CG and Asset Supervisor to find creative and technical solutions and approaches that enhance assets and shots, while meeting project specifications and deadlines;
  • May participate in the development of tools and techniques for the department;
  • Perform quality control on assets before they are submitted for review/approval, ensuring all technical and creative standards are met, and promptly apply notes received;
  • Keep Production and the project team informed of the status of work, issues to be resolved, ramifications of problems encountered and recommend potential solutions;
  • Ensure deadlines are met, advising the project team promptly if delays could be expected.
Qualifications

  • Experience in a similar position, within the VFX industry;
  • Excellent knowledge of Katana software and Nuke;
  • Good knowledge of Arnold; 
  • Excellent sense of prioritization and respect of deadlines.


Additional Information

  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Painter
description:
Looking for a reliable job with great hours? Are you looking to develop an impressive resume? Do you consider yourself a hard worker, a leader among your peers, and a competitive individual? Look no further...

I am building a team of hard working, dedicated people to assist in growing a painting business in the Simcoe-Muskoka area. 

Benefits: The position is open to individuals who are hardworking, leader mentality and interested in the business world. There is an opportunity to learn the ins and outs of the business from a management level directly from the business owner throughout the year. 

  • The position includes:
    • Full-time hours
    • Bonus incentives
    • Autonomous work culture, with the ability for more responsibility/pay
    • Training and development will be provided as long as the candidate is coachable, hard-working and willing to learn. Trained to complete professional painting work for interior and exterior painting and staining
    • FREE GAS – we will pay for all of your gas for commuting to and from job sites

Requirements:

  • Valid driver’s license
  • Access to a vehicle
  • Preferably some experience with hands-on work (No professional experience necessary), you will be trained on how to do paint/stain projects and will be a pro in no time!

  • Strong communication skills
  • Coachable

Payment Structure:

  • We offer a base rate ranging from $18-22 /hour
  • High-performance bonuses available

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the overall completion of projects. Start to finish completion at a high standard of quality
  • Daily responsible for the cleanliness of site and project
  • Delivering quality and satisfaction through constant communication with homeowners and business owner
  • Manage day to day project tasks for properly providing services to clients

title: Lead Level Artist
description:
Company Description

People Can Fly is one of the leading independent AAA games development studios with an international team of hundreds of talented individuals working from offices located in Poland, UK, US, and Canada, and from all over the world thanks to our remote work programs.

Founded in 2002, we made our mark on the shooter genre with titles such as Painkiller, Bulletstorm, Gears of War: Judgment, and Outriders. We are one of the most experienced Unreal Engine studios in the industry and we are expanding it with in-house solutions called PCF Framework.

Our creative teams are currently working on several exciting AAA projects with the top publishers in the industry: Project Gemini with Square Enix and Project Dagger with Take-Two (2K), in addition to a new IP to be self-published and two other games in a concept phase. One of our IPs is also being adapted for VR technology.

With over 20 years of experience, PCF sets out to explore new horizons. We aim to combine our expertise with creativity of the best and most forward-thinking talents in the industry to work together on the new generation of action games for the global gaming community.

If you decide to accompany us on this journey, you’ll have a chance to perfect your craft and expand your knowledge, working alongside leaders in the industry on bringing a brand-new unique experience to the players worldwide.

If you feel yourself able to deliver as nobody else, take ownership of your projects, and are ready to leave a mark on a game you work on, apply now!

Job Description

  • Creating world geometry and composition for levels in Unreal Engine
  • Working with LD to terraform the world to create worlds that are both fun to play and fits the artistic vision of the game
  • Effectively producing playable levels based on Art directors vision and Level design needs with lead cooperation
  • Working with Producer to manage LA team's schedule and give feedback on world art
Qualifications

  • 8 years of experience in creating world geometry for levels
  • Experienced leading and developing teams
  • Experience working with Unreal Engine
  • Experience with designing layout, asset breakdown, terraforming and set dressing
  • Experience creating high quality creative/visual aesthetics as well as technical knowledge
  • Ability to adapt with guidance and improve, new styles, techniques, and workflows
  • Basic understanding of the color theory
  • Good verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Open-minded team player attitude
  • Strong work ethic and self-motivated
  • Passionate about playing and making video games


Additional Information

What we offer:

U.S.

  • 100% group health insurance benefit premiums paid by PCF (Medical, Dental, Vision, Group Life, and Supplemental Live) and start on day 1 of employment.
  • 401K with 100% match, up to 3% of employee salary, and vested immediately.
  • Paid week off during Winter Holidays.
  • 20 paid vacation days and 5 paid sick days.
  • Free virtual health and mental wellbeing sessions included in the plan for members and their dependents.
  • A competitive salary and performance-based annual bonuses.
  • Personal development opportunities and ability to work in a global environment.
  • Work in a creative team with people full of passion for what they do.
  • Long term disability, short term disability, travel insurance, as well as other benefits provided. 

Canada

  • Benefit package 100% paid by PCF. Insurance company reimburses 100% of claims (Up to $500 per service a year, as well as individual family coverage).
  • Full Dental coverage, including major dental and orthodontics.
  • 4% RRSP matching before tax deductions, 100% vested on day 1.
  • Paid week off during Winter Holidays.
  • 20 paid vacation days and 5 paid sick days.
  • Free virtual health and mental wellbeing sessions included in the plan for members and their dependents.
  • A competitive salary and performance-based annual bonuses.
  • Personal development opportunities and ability to work in a global environment.
  • Work in a creative team with people full of passion for what they do.
  • Long term disability, short term disability, travel insurance, as well as other benefits provided.

title: Painters Needed for the Summer!
description:
We’re hiring full time painters for the summer!

We are looking for individuals who want to be a part of a fun, high energy team and who love being outdoors!

Why is this the perfect summer position?

  • Work with your friends and roommates.
  • 40 PLUS hours available per week, earn $11,000- $14,000 this summer!
  • Work outside and get into shape.
  • Room to advance throughout the season to crew foreman or production manager.

Duties include:

  • Preparing, cleaning and repairing interior and exterior surfaces.
  • Applying paint, stains and other finishes using brushes, rollers and spray equipment.
  • Use of ladders, must not be afraid of heights!

Previous painting experience is an asset, but not required! If you have a can-do attitude and great work ethic, we will provide all training. Labour experience such as landscaping, warehouse and heavy equipment work, grounds crew and athletics are also considered assets.

 Apply now!

title: Painter
description:
Looking for an experienced Painter. The ideal person will be able to lead a crew or work alone with little or no supervision.

Painted to Perfection is an expanding company offering a great work environment, weekends off to enjoy, and competitive wages based on experience.

About the job:
  • Experience with brush and roller.
  • Patching and repairing holes in drywall, caulking around windows, doors and trim.
  • Spray painting experiences are an asset.
  • comfortable on ladders and at heights.

Must have transportation as work is around Simcoe county.

title: Painter
description:
We are looking for motivated individuals to join our painting team! The painter role is a fun and challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to get hands-on work experience. The ideal individual is hard working, coachable, and has effective communication skills. 

Compensation: Top painters can make 20- 28$/hour; average rate is 17.50$/hour.

About the position:

  • Fast paced, fun environment
  • Hands on experience in customer service and communication
  • Work outdoors with a crew of 2-3 people
Requirements:
  • Must have own transportation (job site locations change frequently)
  • Manual labor and ladder work required

Working with friends is encouraged, so apply together if you wish!

title: Painter
description:
Love the outdoors and a job that changes from one day to the next? Hate it when you WORK HARD but make the same as the next guy? 

Then stop what you're doing, because we're hiring painters for 2022! This is a growing company based in the Georgian Bay/Muskoka region that is looking for painters to help complete projects.

Areas we Service: Penetanguishene, Midland, Tiny, Tay, Wasaga Beach, Collingwood, Parry Sound, Muskoka, Orillia, Port Severn, Shanty Bay, etc.

Benefits: The position is open to individuals who are hardworking, leader mentality and interested in the business world. There is an opportunity to learn the ins and outs of the business from a management level directly from the business owner throughout the year. 

  • The position includes:
    • Full-time hours
    • Bonus incentives
    • Autonomous work culture, with the ability for more responsibility/pay
    • Training and development will be provided as long as the candidate is coachable, hard-working and willing to learn. Trained to complete professional painting work for interior and exterior painting and staining
    • Teams bonding events (ex. paid dinners, cottage getaways, sports games, etc.)
    • Training, materials required to complete jobs, and shirts are supplied.

Requirements:

  • Valid driver’s license
  • Access to a vehicle to drive to and from sites
  • Reliable, flexible, dedicated, and possess a positive attitude
  • Ability to handle physical, labour intensive workload
  • Ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure
  • Willing to travel if required
  • Preferably some experience with hands-on work (No professional experience necessary), you will be trained on how to do paint/stain projects 
  • Full-time commitment (40-50 hours weekly)
  • Strong communication skills

Payment Structure:

  • We offer a base rate ranging from $16-30 /hour
  • High-performance bonuses available

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the overall completion of projects. Start to finish completion at a high standard of quality
  • Daily responsible for the cleanliness of site and project
  • Delivering quality and satisfaction through constant communication with homeowners and business owner
  • Manage day to day project tasks for properly providing services to clients 

Lakeridge Painting Muskoka provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Lakeridge Painting Muskoka complies with applicable provincial and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Paint and Roto Artist
description:
Paint and Roto Artists work closely with Compositors to help them integrate all elements of an image, including CG and live action, to create film visual effects shots. This includes creating mattes for CG hold-outs as well as using various techniques and software to remove items such as wires, rigs and tracking markers.


Responsibilities:

  • Analyze shots for components breakdown with minimal supervision
  • Understand feedback given by supervisors
  • Create roto mattes for Compositors to use and has a comprehensive understanding of how these mattes will be used
  • Demonstrate the ability to use different techniques to remove rigs and tracking markers
  • Strong eye for color and understand grain structure and successfully de-grains scans and re-grains paint work for further use
  • Extensive understanding of 2D and 3D tracking and is able to create accurate, steady tracks
  • Create foreground mattes for Animators to use within Maya
  • Reconstruct plates or part of the plates even if the elements do not exist
  • Research appropriate references and respect sequence continuity to ensure cohesive delivery
  • Use expressions within Nuke to help aid paint work
  • Understanding of the 3D environment within Nuke and is able to use geo data to
  • project clean plates and understand how to use UV projections
  • Accurately bid on how long paint and roto shots will take to complete
  • Proactively learn and/or develop specific Framestore gizmos and workflows
  • Complete basic composites in Nuke and demonstrate keying, grading, re-timing and screeninsertion skills
  • Demonstrate a willingness to learn new techniques and software and to share this knowledgewith other artists in the department


Essential Skills:

  • Traditional art and design skills including a knowledge of composition and colour
  • Previous use of Nuke
  • Prior knowledge of a Linux based operating system
  • An understanding of motion blur and how it affects mattes and patches
  • Prior use of a roto-scoping package, ideally Silhouette
  • A desire to learn new techniques and teach fellow artists
  • An Arts or Science degree in a moving picture or art related subject
  • Excellent organisational and communication skills
  • Team-working abilities
  • The ability to take criticism and feedback
  • Good problem solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively with other artists

Desirable Skills:

  • Prior experience in a Paint and Roto role
  • 3D Maya interface experience
  • An understanding of Python scripting and how to use this to create and edit Framestore gizmos
  • Planar and point tracking software experience
  • A general understanding of the VFX production and comp workflows
  • A knowledge of photography and practical lighting

Framestore is proud to employ extraordinary talent across all genders, races, nationalities, religions, ages, abilities and sexual preferences. We aim to encourage and support all of our current and future employees to achieve their potential. No job applicant will receive less favourable treatment on any basis when applying for a career with us.

title: Beauty Artist - Square One
description:
The Beauty Artist provides exceptional customer service by creating a unique, inviting, entertaining, and educational multi-brand shopping destination for the Morphe babe and demonstrates their artistry skills with clients upon request. In addition, this person must create a collaborative work environment on the sales floor, provide excellent service and meet and exceed store financial goals. In addition, the Beauty Artist will be responsible for operational activities as assigned.

Sales

  • Provides the full Morphe customer service experience in store, delivering sales to meet or exceed targets.
  • Meets or exceeds all personal goals to positively contribute to the team and the store.

Service

  • Provide excellent customer service and product knowledge, offering full service experience and/or simple service depending on customers’ needs.
  • Positive representative of the Morphe brand, always demonstrating professionalism and poise.
  • Support promotions, events and launches to deliver the intended experience for customers.
  • Consistently elevate own artistry skills.
  • Attends all required trainings and completes educational and developmental tools as assigned.
  • Develops knowledge of trends in industry to provide best service possible and share with the squad

Leadership

  • Contributes to a productive and dynamic Morphe squad by connecting with employees, customers, and influencers.
  • Acts with professionalism and respect in all interactions with customers, co-workers, management and business associates.

Operations

  • Must adhere to all company policies and procedures. Immediately report any variances to a Manager or a People partner.
  • Assists in execution of visual displays, merchandising and marketing standards ensuring the store is consistently replenished.
  • Assists in the preparation and completion of accurate physical inventory as assigned.
  • Assists with non-sell tasks as assigned by Management and as part of the regular daily responsibilities.
  • Accurately ring sales and use the POS correctly.
  • Arrives to work on time and consistently follows the Morphe personal appearance guidelines.
  • Follows all safety and emergency procedures.
  • Identifies potential loss prevention issues.
  • Perform additional duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • 2 years retail experience, previous sales experience required.
  • Excellent customer service, communication and organizational skills.
  • Ability to multi-task and build relationships.
  • Flexibility and the ability to handle change in a positive manner.
  • Cosmetic artistry experience a plus.
  • Demonstrated ability to support business growth and exhibit professional behavior.
  • Have and maintain flexible availability.
  • Must have open flexibility to work during peak traffic times including evenings, weekends and holidays.
  • Able to lift, push and pull up to 50 pounds.
  • Able to stand on your feet for up to 8 hours.

Must be able to perform essential functions (with or without an accommodation) without posing a "direct threat" to the health and safety to self or others.

The Company reserves the right to alter, change, abolish and even combine jobs depending upon changing conditions.

No recruitment agencies, please.

title: Previs Artist
description:
Do you love, live and breathe Marvel? 

Stellar Creative Lab is hiring top talent for a New Streaming Series for Marvel Studios. 

At Stellar Creative Lab we are animation! We hire stars â€“ work with the best in the industry - work with us!

Summary: 

Stellar Creative Lab is looking for a Previs/ Camera and Staging Artist to join our team. Previs Artists are the filmâ€™s cinematographers and are responsible for creating the cinematic language of the film. The role requires a strong understanding of the principles of cinematography as well as animation. The role of a Previs Artist is not only to translate the storyboards into a 3D world, but to use them as a foundation to further develop the story by supporting the characters, the action, and the film through the language of cinematography.
 

Your Main Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Bringing the script and storyboards into the 3D world to achieve the vision of the Director and Director of Photography.
  • Working with the Director of Photography and the Layout supervisor you are instrumental in creating the filmâ€™s shots, blocking in character staging, and animating the cameras.
  • Working with the animation team to respond to changes and challenges as needed.
  • Final camera work after animation, including any necessary revisions.
  • Composing and lensing each shot, blocking character animation for timing and staging and animating any camera movement.
  • Working with the editorial team to make sure sequences flow as intended including changes made by the editor.

Your Experience, Talents and Abilities:

  • Demonstrated understanding of the principles of cinematography.
  • Character animation and posing for compositional considerations, done to a level that is required to time a sequence as accurately as possible.
  • Ability to collaborate and problem solve, not only within the camera team, but also across other departments as needed.
  • 2 years experience as a Previs/Layout/Camera artist
  • Working experience with one or more professional graphics packages including Maya, Photoshop,Premiere, DaVinci Resolve, and/or other professional editing software
  • A keen understanding of the principles of cinematography.
  • Creative problem solving skills;  an ability to find creative solutions to blocking and staging challenges.
  • Able to follow direction, and make revisions in a timely manner.
  • Eligible to work in BC

Live in Squamish? Kelowna? Vancouver Island? Somewhere in BC with a great internet connection? We can work with that! Stellar Creative Lab encourages artists to work where they live and love where they work.  Join us - we have some amazing opportunities.

 

In response to the COVID - 19 pandemic, Stellar Creative Lab is able to offer the following benefits:

  • the option to work at the studio as well as remotely across British Columbia
  • ongoing health and safety training
  • support for your ergonomic workspace at home

title: Texture Artist
description:
The Texture Artist is responsible for the design of textures / shading that define character, objects, and environment.

In this role you will:

  • Work closely the Art Director, the Technical Art Director, Art Lead and Lighting artist to achieve the artistic vision of a new IP;
  • Organize the texture pipeline, with Technical Art Director, Art Lead and Lighting Artist;
  • Work closely with artists to understand environments needs and help them suggesting textures and technics;
  • Understand the environments and assets production pipeline;
  • Calibration and polish textures to apply them in the world;
  • Ensure clear communication with their managers to give visibility to their team and their work.

What we’re looking for:

  • 5+ years of experience  in a similar position, within the gaming industry;
  • Knowledge of constraints related to real time rendering and mastering of 2D / 3D computer graphics software - Substance Painter, Marvelous Designer / (Maya / ZBrush / Photoshop;
  • Knowledge of Unreal engine (ideally Unreal 5);
  • Proficiency in the PBR process;
  • Solid understanding of image and composition (lighting, composition, calibration, rendering);
  • Excellent english communication skills, adaptability as well as sense of organization and anticipation.

Dans ce rôle, vous devrez:

  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le directeur artistique, le directeur artistique technique, le chef d’équipe artistique et l’artiste en éclairage pour réaliser la vision artistique d’une nouvelle IP;
  • Organiser le processus d'élaboration des textures avec le directeur artistique technique, le chef d’équipe artistique et l’artiste en éclairage; 
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les artistes pour comprendre les besoins relatifs aux environnements et les aider à suggérer des textures et des techniques; 
  • Comprendre l'environnement et le processus de production des ressources;
  • Calibrage et polissage des textures pour les appliquer dans l’univers de jeu; 
  • Assurer une communication claire avec leurs responsables pour donner de la visibilité à leur équipe et à leur travail. 

Ce que nous recherchons:

  • Au moins 5 ans d'expérience en tant qu'artiste de texture;
  • Connaissance des contraintes liées au rendu en temps réel et maîtrise de logiciels artistiques : Maya / Substance Painter, Substance Designer / ZBrush / Photoshop;
  • Connaissance du moteur Unreal (idéalement Unreal 5);
  • Maîtrise du processus de PBR;
  • Bonne compréhension de l'image et de sa composition (éclairage, composition, calibration, rendu); 
  • Excellente communication orale et écrite en anglais, sens de l'organisation et de l'anticipation.
L'artiste en texture est responsable de la conception de textures/shading des modèles de personnages, décors, et accessoires en 3D, tout en respectant les règles techniques et la vision artistique établies sur le projet.

title: Lighting Artist
description:
Company Description

Mikros Animation is a global CGI animation studio located in Paris, Montreal, Los Angeles, Bangalore and London, dedicated to feature films and episodic content. Since its inception, Mikros Animation has always put creativity and CG artistry at the heart of its animation and production activities, allowing our artists to work across a great variety of stories with a high level of stylized craft. So far, Mikros Animation has contributed to ten released feature animations and to numerous high-quality animated series, for the world’s best-known animation studios, either as creative studio, line producer or executive producer. Mikros Animation has also produced more than 250 hours of programming, broadcast by notable channels including Cartoon Network, Nickelodeon, TF1, France TV, Gulli, M6, Gloob, and Super RTL. Our animated episodic content airs and streams globally, in over 180 countries.

At Mikros Animation, we believe great animation is about making real connections with real people. By partnering with filmmakers to unite their creative visions, with our industry-leading craftsmanship and artistry, we create characters that connect with audiences on an authentic and emotional level to bring powerful stories to life.

Job Description

You will be responsible for lighting and rendering plans assigned by the CG Sup, Lighting Sup, and production directors. Your main tasks will be:

  • Provide strong artistic and technical expertise   
  • Address artisitic notes and ensure follow up  
  • Ensure shots are completed in timely fashion, respecting quotas set by the production team and the supervisor  
  • Ensure artistic consistency between shots 
  • Submit shots for reviews and work closely with the team   
  • Communicate with your Lead and Supervisor
Qualifications

  • Experience as lighting artist on feature films (VFX or Animation) 
  • Good knowledge of Katana and Arnold required  
  • Knowledge of Nuke and Shotgun recommended  
  • Knowledge of Python scripting a plus  
  • Be a force for proposal, adaptation and motivation
  • Demonstrate proposal initiative, adaptation, and motivation 
  • Strong rigour, autonomy and organizational skills   
  • Basic English skills


Additional Information

Please click here to review our privacy notices for job applicants.

If you require assistance applying, please reach out to tcstalent@technicolor.com and we'll be happy to assist.

TECHNICOLOR IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
Technicolor complies and prohibits against discrimination on the basis of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, medical condition (including genetic characteristics), mental and/or physical disability or handicap, marital status, sex, age, veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity, political party preference, political belief, socioeconomic status, familial status, registered domestic partner status, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions and any other characteristic or activity protected by federal, state/provincial or local law.

title: Painter
description:
ATLANTIC HOME MAINTENANCE IS HIRING!!!

Love the outdoors and a job that changes from one day to the next? Hate it when you WORK HARD but make the same as the next guy? 

Then stop what you're doing, because we're hiring painters for 2022! This is a growing company based in Summerside, PE (Canada) that is looking for painters to help complete projects. 

Benefits: The position is open to individuals who are hardworking, leader mentality and interested in the business world. There is an opportunity to learn the ins and outs of the business from a management level directly from the business owner throughout the year. 

The position includes:
Full-time hours 
Bonus incentives 
Autonomous work culture, with the ability for more responsibility/pay 
Training and development will be provided as long as the candidate is coachable, hard-working and willing to learn. Trained to complete professional painting work for interior and exterior painting and staining 

Requirements:
Valid driver’s license 
Access to a vehicle 
High school diploma 
Preferably some experience with hands-on work (No professional experience necessary), you will be trained on how to do paint/stain projects and will be a pro in no time! 
Full-time commitment (40-50 hours weekly) 
Strong communication skills 
Coachable 

Payment Structure:
We offer a base rate ranging from $13-19 /hour 
High-performance bonuses available 

Responsibilities:
Responsible for the overall completion of projects. Start to finish completion at a high standard of quality 
Daily responsible for the cleanliness of site and project 
Delivering quality and satisfaction through constant communication with homeowners and business owner 
Manage day to day project tasks for properly providing services to clients

 

EEOC Statement: We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Painter
description:
We are looking for 8-12 motivated individuals to join our painting team!  We are looking for the hardest-working, most motivated individuals who want to be apart of a very tight-knit group of awesome people who want to earn what they are worth. This year alone, our team will be responsible for painting 100+ homes which will result in happy clients and crew members. 

Compensation: Our painting systems allow our top painters to make upwards of 22- 25$/hour, with our average painter making 20$/hour. 

About the position:

  • Fast paced, fun environment
  • Work consistent and steady hours Monday-Friday (40 hours/week)
  • Hands on experience in customer service and communication
  • Work outdoors with a crew of 2-3 people
  • Working with friends is encouraged, so apply together if you wish
  • Training is provided; therefore, no experience is necessary!

We are currently hiring Painters and Crew Managers for 2022. Both positions are full-time jobs and can lead to future promotion opportunities within the company.


Position Descriptions

 

Painter: This role is a fun and challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to get hands-on work experience and make money over the summer. The ideal individual is hard working, coachable and has effective communication skills.

 

Crew Manager: In addition to painting, in this role you would gain experience in leadership and would run a crew of 2-3 people. Ask to be considered for this if you
feel you may be a good fit.

 

We look for positive attitude and good character above all else! We provide all training on site, if you are someone that is willing to work very hard, learn a new skill, and be paid for their hard work, this IS a good job for you! 

 

Requirements:

  • Able to work full-time
  • Must have own transportation (job site locations change frequently)
  • Manual labor and ladder work required, can not be afraid of heights
  • must be able to lift 50 lbs 

Benefits:

  • Starting rate dependent on experience. Raises based on proven skill after start date.
  • Bonuses will depend on performance and the criteria established by the Manager.

title: Painter
description:
CURRENTLY HIRING FOR THE SPRING/SUMMER OF 2022*

ACT NOW TO SECURE YOUR POSITION IN ONE OF BC'S TOP  PAINTING COMPANY!

Our painting team is looking for highly-motivated individuals to join us!

We are looking for the absolute hardest-working, most efficient people in Abbotsford BC, who want to join a team of awesome staff and culture, who are also looking to earn what they are worth and optimize their cash flow!

This year we plan to paint 50+ homes in the Abbotsford area, with one strategy in mind: satisfied clients, which create a happy work atmosphere and rewards employees. 
For the Spring/Summer of 2022 we are hoping to provide an even better service than last year and employ, train and optimize an even stronger team!
We are looking to hire our team, starting in the early spring of 2022!

About this job:
*Fast paced, fun environment with incentivized pay scale.
*Hands on experience in customer service and communication
*Working outdoors with a crew of other like-minded people
*Working with friends is encouraged, so apply together and note this in your application, we love hiring teams of Rockstar’s!
*Training is provided! We teach everyone how to paint!
*We are currently hiring Painters and Site Supervisors for 2022. Both positions are full-time jobs and can lead to future promotion opportunities within the company for those with the right attitude!
*Act quickly, our summer positions will fill up fast!

What will be expected of you: 
-Positive Attitude (My team hires for attitude and trains for skill)
-Reliable Transportation (As we will be working at many different job sites you must 100% be capable of getting around town. The team may be required to move job sites mid-day and you must be able to accommodate this, no exceptions!) 
-Motivation for $$$ (With this company you truly get out what you put in)
-Ability to work from ladders (if you are afraid of heights, this job is not for you)
-Ability to work with clients and always represent our company respectably
-Ability to complete and provide certifications for required training provided
-Ability to ensure proper time management and punctuality (lateness is not tolerated)
-Referring our services to friends and family (this is not required but always appreciated)
-A strong mindset dedicated to learning and self improvement

 

What benefits will you get? 
-Full training on how to paint the interior and exterior of homes/commercial buildings as well as top notch safety training.
-Lots of opportunity to earn more with greater efficiency, as well as company offered prizes and incentives.
-Pay exceeding $20/hr for exemplary painters (Starting rate dependent on experience. Raises based on proven skill after start date. (Bonuses will depend on performance and the criteria established by the business Owner/Operator.)
-Working with other like-minded and fun individuals. 
-Excellent training and strong mentorship provided during P.A.D (performance, availability and discussion) meetings.
-Working outside in the fresh air! 
-A glowing reference to help really beef up your resume!


Position Descriptions

Painter: This role is a fun but incredibly challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to get hands-on work experience and make money reflective of their efforts. The ideal individual is hard working, coachable and has effective communication skills. You will be sometimes required to work at heights or for long hours in warm weather so needless to say endurance is also an asset.
 

Site Supervisor: In addition to painting, in this role you would gain experience in leadership and management skills. You would take on additional responsibilities for additional pay. This would include moving ladders, making trips to the paint store, motivating your team, solving client issues, training additional painters, and managing other tasks on job sites.
Ask to be considered for this if you feel you may be a good fit.
Bonuses and Incentives as well as pay increases provided for people in this position. 
 

If this job sounds like the right fit for you then please get in contact with us!
We would love to hear from you and set up an interview.

title: Painter
description:
The Role:

PWP is looking for motivated individuals who want to kick-start their painting career to join our spring/summer painting team! PWP specializes in both interior and exterior re-paints, as well as new construction, apartment buildings, townhouse complexes, and residential homes. This season alone, our team will be responsible for painting 75-100 homes, in addition to numerous other projects.

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Preparation of surfaces, including scraping, sanding, cleaning and priming surfaces
  • Site protection and masking of necessary areas prior to painting
  • Professional cutting in and edging
  • Using a sprayer or brush and roller to paint a variety of substrates including but not limited to: drywall, wood trimming and fascia, stucco, wood siding, concrete, and aluminum
  • Removal and installation of hardware and fixtures
  • General cleanup of job site
  • Converse with clients on the job site to establish needs and ensure overall satisfaction

Who You Are:

  • Positive, team player
  • Reliable transportation and the ability to travel to different job sites in the lower mainland
  • Comfortable working from ladders
  • Strong communication skills
  • Previous painting experience is an asset, but not required

Benefits:

  • Training and development – kick-start your painting career by learning how to paint the interior and exterior of homes and commercial buildings
  • Competitive wages – earn up to $25 an hour or more depending on experience, as well as performance-based promotions
  • Growth opportunities – motivated individuals have the ability to grow with us and work all year round
  • Rewarding company culture – monthly team building and marketing events
  • Work in a variety of environments, both indoor and outdoor

title: Painter - Residential
description:
SWP is looking for a motivated individual to join our painting team!

***($20-$30/hour)***

 

What will be expected of you:

-Positive Attitude

- Ability to think critically and work with a team and on your own.

- Reliable transportation, a vehicle is a must as we work at many different sites across the western communities and greater Victoria. (No bikes)

- Ability to work from ladders

- Ability to interact with clients

 

About the position:

- Fast-paced, fun environment Hands-on experience in customer service and communication

- Work outdoors with a crew of 2-3 people Working with friends is encouraged, so apply together if you wish

-Training is provided; therefore, no experience is necessary

 

Position Descriptions

Painter: This role is a fun and challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to work outside in a physical role, learn a new skill, and make good money over the summer. The ideal individual is hard-working, coachable and has effective communication skills.

Crew Manager (aka Crew Chief): In addition to painting, Crew Managers are tasked with running a crew of 2-3 people. Leadership, organization, and communication are especially important in this role.

 

What benefits will you get from SWP?

-Full training on how to paint the interior and exterior of homes & commercial buildings

-Pay is $20-$30/hour depending on experience and attitude. Top income earners last summer averaged above our pay grade and made $40/hr

-Marketing events and payroll events held by the company

-Working outside!

Compensation: Our painting systems allow our top painters to make upwards of 20- 28$/hour, with our average painter making 18$/hour.

About the position:

  • Fast paced, fun environment
  • Hands on experience in customer service and communication
  • Work outdoors with a crew of 2-3 people
  • Working with friends is encouraged, so apply together if you wish
  • Training is provided; therefore, no experience is necessary!
We are currently hiring Painters and Crew Managers for the summer of 2022. Both positions are full-time hourly summer jobs and can lead to future promotion opportunities within the company.

Position Descriptions
 
Painter: This role is a fun and challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to get hands-on work experience and make money over the summer. The ideal individual is hard working, coachable and has effective communication skills.

feel you may be a good fit.
 
Requirements:
  • Able to work full-time throughout the majority of the summer
  • Must have own transportation (job site locations change frequently)
  • Manual labor and ladder work required.
Benefits:
  • Starting rate dependent on experience. Raises based on proven skill after start date.
  • Bonuses will depend on performance and the criteria established by the Manager.

title: BC Roto & Paint Artist
description:
Roto & Paint Artist

This position is based in Vancouver. All applicants must reside in the United States or British Columbia/Ontario if applying within Canada.

Zoic Studios is an Award winning VFX company made up of accomplished artists and producers who understand story, process and relationships. Partnership, integrity and enthusiasm are our key founding principles. We have three locations, Los Angeles, New York City and Vancouver, Canada. Some of our recent credits include, Sweet Tooth, Stargirl, Legends of Tomorrow, Superman & Lois and The Haunting of Bly Mannnnno.

"Visual Evolution" is our mission; we invest in constantly improving our technological and studio processes so that our artists can focus on being creative even in the lightning fast paced world of visual effects. We apply these principles to our work on some of the most VFX intensive film and television projects out there. We like a challenge. Do you?

Zoic Studios seeks an experienced Roto & Paint Artist. They will be collaborative with colleges and adhere to schedules to complete shots as assigned.

Responsibilities:

  • Paint out
  • Rotoscoping
  • BG extension
  • 3D projection
  • Tracking marker/ wire removal
  • Outsource QC
  • De-aging / Beauty work

 Qualifications:

  • 3 years in Roto/Paint within a VFX studio
  • Proficient in Nuke
  • Strong eye for detail, colour, and composition
  • Demonstrated ability to take direction and follow through
  • Work well under tight deadlines in a team environment
  • Organized and dedicated work ethic
  • Excellent communications skills, both written and verbal
  • Working knowledge of Silhouette is an asset

Must provide a link to reel demonstrating paint / roto and 3D projection skills along with a breakdown.

Zoic is a Maya/Vray/Nuke studio.

Additional information

  • Candidates MUST be located in the United States, British Columbia or Ontario. This is a remote (work from home) position. 
  • Zoic does not cover relocation costs.
  • This job description contains the basic requirements for the position and is NOT intended to be a complete list of responsibilities; other duties may be assigned.
  • Due to the volume of applications we receive across our different openings we regret that only those selected to interview will be contact.

title: Concept Artist
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Our client, a leading AAA console/PC studio currently working on their new IP (AAA console) is on the lookout for a Concept Artist who will have a significant role in shaping the visual direction for a project. You'll help establish and convey the Art Director's vision through a wide array of concept and key art.

As a Concept Artist you will be required to visually develop and illustrate any given combination of game assets, associated game development imagery and speculative ‘pitch’ materials to a high standard and on schedule under the art direction of an art lead or art director. In order to create a believable and breathtaking game world, you will be called upon to create inspiring designs ranging from realistic to sci-fi. From initial speed sketches, through to product-defining visuals – developing imaginative visual solutions for the various aesthetic, technical, design & narrative considerations in a timely fashion.


Not your time for a move? Recommend a friend and earn 700 EUR! Contact: jobs@8bitplay.com

IMPORTANT: We will never, absolutely never send your CV and/or personal data to any of our clients without your direct consent. Submitting your CV is not equal to giving us consent to share your details with our external partners- we will always contact you upfront and ask for your agreement.

By submitting this form you give your consent for the information provided on this form to be held on computer or other relevant filing systems belonging to 8Bit Studio one and to be shared with other accredited employees in accordance with the GDPR 2018.


By submitting this form you agree that 8Bit Studio, NIP 9570949266, REGON: 36386962 processes your personal data contained in the recruitment documents supplied by you, including but not limited to your image, for the purposes of the current recruitment processes. 8Bit Studio confirms that your consent may be withdrawn anytime.

title: Lighting Artist
description:
About Pixomondo: 

Founded in 2001 by CEO and Executive Producer Thilo Kuther, Pixomondo is a solutions-oriented design company that solves creative challenges for our clients and partners. Whether we are crafting never-before-seen visual effects for a feature film or developing innovative original concepts for a global marketing campaign, we leverage our collaborative design process to develop truly award-winning work. Our passion is to deliver the best ideas at the highest levels of quality on-time and on-budget, with the outstanding service you expect from a world-class company.

Job Qualifications:

â¦3 years of Lighting experience in visual effects

â¦ Strong Knowledge of Maya, Arnold, and Nuke

â¦ Strong understanding of rendering methods (Render Setup) & shading models

â¦ Previous experience performing Look Development tasks

â¦ Experience of photo-real lighting

â¦ Good communication & interpersonal skills

â¦ Ability to work within a strong team environment

â¦ Experience with Shotgun an asset

â¦ Be comfortable with a Windows/Linux OS environment

â¦ Houdini experience (Solaris) a plus!

â¦ Unreal Engine experience a plus!

Duties & Responsibilities:

â¦ Create and design lighting for complex scenes.

â¦ Look development of assets, environments, and FX elements.

â¦ Work with supervisors, leads, and compositing team to ensure all elements reach the desired look and delivery.

â¦ Ability to self-troubleshoot renders.

â¦ Pre-composite shots in Nuke.

â¦ Sustain great team dynamics.

â¦ Maintain shot quotas set by production and leads.

â¦ Key-Lighting and templated shots for propagations and sequences (Senior.)

â¦ Ability to identify problematic shots that may affect delivery schedules and communicate concerns to leads and supervisors.

â¦ Ensure shot continuity.

Additional Requirements:

  • Must be eligible to work in Canada.
  • Include your current resume and IMDB.
  • Please make sure your resume also includes your name, address, phone, and email.

title: Painters
description:
Recognized as one of Canada's 50 Best Managed Companies, Brandt provides top quality products to its customers worldwide. As a result of continued growth, we are currently seeking Painters for our new Saskatoon Manufacturing Facility.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Must be able to perform all painting functions at an acceptable standard level
  • Operate machines, brushes and spray equipment to apply paint products
  • Select appropriate paint or mix paints as required
  • Ensure that all components are painted to a consistent high quality
  • Identify and discard defective products
  • Prepare and clean surfaces using methods such as scraping, sanding, sand-blasting, etc.
  • Operate equipment to clean, wash, strip, sand, remove corrosion, fill dents, and to prepare product for painting
  • Perform required body work to repair equipment
  • Manage the cleaning and maintenance of painting equipment, ventilation, compressed air equipment and personal protective equipment
  • Perform preventative maintenance, changeover of color's and operate control settings of paint system
  • Prepare and apply company decals, equipment instructions and safety warnings
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Must be able to read and understand shop drawings
  • Must be able to paint with electrostatic paint guns, conventional pot guns and powder painting
  • Must be able to understand and carry out written and verbal instructions
  • Has some knowledge of proper maintenance of equipment under this classification
  • Is familiar with and has understanding of most painting jobs and operations
  • Must be capable of working under minimum amount of supervision
  • Must be familiar with all shop tools related to the job
  • Knowledgeable in workplace safety and safe lifting and handling procedures
  • Able to effectively communicate in both technical and user-friendly language when appropriate, with all types of staff, including technical, professional, and upper management
  • Able to build and maintain lasting relationships with business units, corporate departments, key managers, and other stakeholders
  • Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines

title: YONA-Sistema Substitute Teaching Artist
description:
The Edmonton Symphony Orchestra is an ensemble with adventurous programming that reflects the diversity of the communities it serves and has been an anchor in Edmonton’s music community for over six decades. Our vision is to make music accessible to everyone and minimize barriers for people to access musical arts experiences.

Our Educational Outreach team is seeking multiple Substitute Teaching Artists (Strings/Woodwinds/Brass/Percussion/Choir) to join us in the YONA-Sistema program, enacting social change through music education for youth in Edmonton’s priority neighbourhoods.

We are looking for experienced musicians committed to teaching. If you have a passion for introducing the richness of music to those who might not otherwise have the opportunity, this is the job for you. If you believe that music can change lives, and that everyone deserves that chance, read on.

You will provide beginning instrumental and general music instruction (including musicianship, classroom percussion, and choral instruction) to a sectional group of up to 15 children, and work with a team of colleagues to lead larger ensemble sessions as well. You will also assist students with academic work and lead active games during break times.

title: Peintre
description:
Un emploi dans le domaine de l'aéronautique vous intéresse ?
Vous habitez à Blainville et environ ?
Vous avez un DEP ou un ASP en peinture industrielle ou aéronautique ?
Vous aimez travailler en équipe ?
Vous aimez travailler manuellement ?
Vous voulez travailler dans une entreprise qui a à cœur le bien-être de ses employés ?

Nous avons une belle opportunité d'emploi comme peintre dans une entreprise du domaine de l'aéronautique !

Voici comment nous envoyer votre candidature :

- Envoyez-moi votre cv : patricia.beaudet@randstad.ca, brigitte.dufeu@randstad.ca
- Appelez-nous directement : 450.437.3038 – demandez Patricia ou Brigitte
- Envoyez-moi un texto :438.341.0708 (en textant peinture)

Avantages
Voici les avantages de travailler comme peintre dans cette entreprise de Blainville :

- Salaire entre 20 et 24$/h selon l'expérience
- Horaire de jour du lundi au vendredi
- Assurance collective complète
- REER collective avec contribution de l'employeur
- Ambiance de travail convivial
- Esprit d'équipe
- Entreprise qui est axé sur le bien-être de ses employés
- Préparer les pièces à traiter



Responsabilités
Voici les responsabilités pour le poste de peintre à Blainville :

- Choisir et mélanger les peintures à l'aide des appareils de mélanges
- Manier l'équipement de nettoyage, lavage, décapage et ponçage
- Préparer les pièces pour l'application de la peinture
- Peindre les petites pièces et faire les retouches
- Nettoyer et entretenir les outils de peinture
- Masquage
- Compléter les documents de qualité



Qualifications
Quelles sont les qualifications pour ce poste de peintre à Blainville ?

- DEP ou ASP en peinture industrielle ou aéronautique
- Minimum de 3 années d'expériences dans le domaine de la peinture
- Connaissance des pratiques de qualité dans l'industrie de l'aviation (aout), TCCA (atout), AS9100B (atout)
- Bonne dextérité manuelle et minutieux

Sommaire
Vous croyez être le candidat parfait pour ce poste de peintre à Blainville ?

Voici comment postuler pour ce poste :

Téléphone 450-437-3038 demandez Brigitte ou Patricia
Courriel : brigitte.dufeu@randstad.ca ou patricia.beaudet@randstad.ca
Par texto : 438-341-0708 (en textant peintre)

Randstad, l'humain en tête !


Ce poste n'est pas ce que vous cherchez? Contactez-nous, nous avons assurément un autre poste qui pourrait vous convenir.

Profitez de notre programme de référencement, référez nous un ami et vous avez la chance de recevoir 100$ de plus sur votre paie.

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Senior Lighting Artist - Treyarch Vancouver
description:
Job Title: Senior Lighting Artist - Treyarch Vancouver

Requisition ID: R012819

Job Description:

Treyarch is searching for an exceptional Lighting Artist to join our team. You should have a passion for making games, a technical understanding, and a focus on realistic lighting. Additionally, our ideal candidate would also show examples of lighting they have done for other AAA titles. We will consider both senior and mid-level candidates.

What you'll do...

  • Responsible for crafting gameplay and in-game cinematic lighting based on direction from our Art Directors and Lighting Lead.
  • Ensure a high level of quality while maintaining a full production load.
  • Ensure that lighting assets meet runtime and disk budgeting requirements.
  • Anticipate, identify, and report any potential production problems and communicate those to the Lead.
  • Work collaboratively with other departments such as Design, Production, Environment Art, VFX, and Tech Art.
  • Work in and maintain an efficient organizational structure for all lighting assets.
  • Stay current with industry lighting techniques.
  • Demonstrating a high level of creativity and independence.

To succeed you must have...

  • Experience in lighting environments and characters with an understanding of gameplay implications.
  • Understanding of lighting fundamentals.
  • Knowledge of color theory and a strong understanding of light and shadow.
  • Excellent sense of composition and the ability to improve the mood with lighting.
  • Ability to follow design references and achieve realism.
  • Experience with PBR & HDR rendering.
  • Photoshop experience.
  • Must be proactive and work well in a large team environment.
  • 5 or more years of proven experience.

We'd love it if you also have...

  • Experience with Radiant.
  • A basic understanding of game scripting.
  • Effective use of Color Grading and Post FX to improve final rendered images.

About Treyarch

Founded in 1996, Treyarch is an award-winning videogame studio, driven to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. It is an approach that has helped make the studio behind the Black Ops series an industry-leading developer. Call of Duty®: Black Ops, Call of Duty®: Black Ops II, Call of Duty®: Black Ops III, Call of Duty®: Black Ops 4, and the studio's most recent release, Call of Duty®: Black Ops - Cold War, have all gone on to break industry records. Additionally, Treyarch is the birthplace of fan favorite, Call of Duty's Zombies.

Working at Treyarch means having the opportunity to work on some of the biggest videogames in the industry, all within a culture that values individual talent and the teams that bring games to life. We provide our teams with the cutting-edge development tools needed to make their most ambitious plans a reality, allowing for rapid iteration and the ability to create the kinds of memorable gameplay moments that are ultimately shared by millions of fans around the world. We also embrace challenges, knowing that together, we can overcome anything...and hopefully inspire a few new game developers along the way.

Treyarch is wholly owned by Activision. To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
