You should have a passion for making games, a technical understanding, and a focus on realistic lighting. Additionally, our ideal candidate would also show examples of lighting they have done for other AAA titles. We will consider both senior and mid-level candidates.', 'Must be proactive and work well in a large team environment.', '5 or more years of proven experience.', 'Work in and maintain an efficient organizational structure for all lighting assets.', 'Stay current with industry lighting techniques.', 'Photoshop experience.', 'Excellent sense of composition and the ability to improve the mood with lighting.', 'Effective use of Color Grading and Post FX to improve final rendered images.', 'Work collaboratively with other departments such as Design, Production, Environment Art, VFX, and Tech Art.', 'Experience in lighting environments and characters with an understanding of gameplay implications.', 'Demonstrating a high level of creativity and independence.', 'Ensure that lighting assets meet runtime and disk budgeting requirements.', 'Experience with Radiant.', 'Anticipate, identify, and report any potential production problems and communicate those to the Lead.']

title: Senior Web Visual Designer - Remote (US & CAD)
description:
This position is open to applicants in the US and Canada

ABOUT OUR COMPANY

Kanopi Studios is a Design, Development & Support Agency with a fully distributed team of people who are experts in Drupal & WordPress.

Our clients have a mission; we design, build and support websites that help their mission thrive.

But we want our employees to thrive as well. Because our team members do great work for great clients, Kanopi works hard to support them in their career as they continue to create a better web.

As a result, our business continues to grow, and so must our team. We’re excited to announce this opportunity to join our team as a Senior Web Visual Designer.

ABOUT THE JOB

We are seeking a talented Senior Web Visual Designer to join our Creative Services team. The role requires not only your impeccable design skills and passion for art & technology but also expertise in client management, problem-solving, and strategic thinking. This is a great opportunity for a creative, eloquent, and organized designer to make a large impact on a growing department, with plenty of independence and flexibility within the role.

This is a fully remote position and reports to the Manager of Creative Services.

RESPONSIBILITIES

You can expect to:

  • Generate end-to-end visual strategy and collateral for our clients including but not limited to: strategic direction, pattern libraries, mood boards, wireframes, UI visuals, and high fidelity prototypes.
  • Collaborate with our Content and UX Strategists to craft experiences that are not only visually appealing but effective at balancing user goals and business needs.
  • Assist our internal marketing team by providing design support to further our ongoing marketing objectives.
  • Be Kanopi’s advocate for design by articulating and defending your design rationale to both internal stakeholders and clients.
  • Work closely with our Project Management team to define project deliverables and delivery schedules.
  • Contribute to website visual design direction and collaboration with the creative services team.
  • Provide mentorship to intermediate and junior team members in the form of constructive feedback and recommendations on project deliverables.


ABOUT THE COMPENSATION & WORK REQUIREMENTS

This is a full-time position. The salary range for this position is $80-105k - base salary is commensurate with experience. This is a 100% remote role, but you must live and be able to work in the US or Canada.

NOW... LET'S TALK ABOUT YOU!

Requirements

We are looking for candidates who demonstrate the following skills and competencies:

  • A strong portfolio showcasing your understanding of user-centered, responsive website design.
  • 5+ years of professional experience designing responsive and mobile website products.
  • 3+ years of experience working within an agency setting.
  • Familiarity with design and communications tools including Figma, Adobe Creative Cloud, Slack, and Google suite of tools.
  • Capability to communicate ideas to a wide range of audiences while incorporating constructive feedback.
  • Comfortable working remotely within a distributed team.
  • Comfortable working in both waterfall and agile environments.
  • Able to manage multiple projects with evolving requirements.
  • Familiarity with front-end web design practices and coding is a plus but not required.
  • Experience with mission-driven and nonprofit clients is a plus.
  • Have a passion for the web, open-source development, and working with a community of fun, humorous folks!


At Kanopi, we believe a variety of backgrounds, experiences, and voices make for a better workplace. We strongly and enthusiastically encourage people of color, individuals who identify within and beyond the LGBTQ+ spectrum, women, and people with disabilities to apply.

NOW, WHAT?

If you think this post was written just for you, here’s what to do next:

  1. Submit your resume and a link to your portfolio.
  2. Answer the questions you see here on this page.
  3. Send us a cover letter.

Now… About that cover letter… This is VERY important!

Please include all of the typical reasons why you’d be an outstanding candidate for this position, plus answer this question: What is your favorite piece of technology?

Our screening process takes a bit of time because we like to ensure that you are the perfect fit for us, and we are the perfect fit for you! After we’ve taken a look at your application, we will send you a series of questions that will help us get to know you better. From there, you will engage in several interviews with members of our team. Some candidates may even do a skills assessment or paid mini-project, depending on the role you are interviewing for. We’ll be happy to explain a bit more once we’re in the interview stage.

Please note - we try to make an effort to contact every applicant to let you know the status of your application, but we are human, so if you don’t hear from us, drop us a line!

Benefits

Fully Remote: Work where and when you do your best. It’s about feeling connected to others, having a flexible schedule and staying healthy.

Top Talent: Since we are not limited by walls, our ability to hire the best is limitless. Collaborate, learn and surround yourself with a strongly skilled and diverse team.

This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by those assigned to this classification. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by those occupying this position. The job description and job functions described herein are subject to possible modification by Kanopi Studios in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

No agencies, recruiters or overseas applicants (for consideration, applicants must live in the US or Canada).


By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: U.X. (User Experience) Designer
description:
Who we are: Amilia is more than just a tech company – we’re a close-knit family made up of caring, entrepreneurial-minded individuals. Our multi-disciplinary team members will challenge and support you on every project.

What we do: We provide online registration and digital management software solutions to recreation organizations, such as cheer gyms, gymnastics clubs, dance studios, and many more.

How we do what we do: We provide all our team members with the tools and flexibility they need to succeed every day. We also put an emphasis on collaboration and encourage everyone to bring new ideas to the table, even if it’s outside of your department.

Why we do what we do: We’re not just here to sell software – we want to revolutionize the way recreation organizations leverage technology. Every Amilian is incredibly invested in our mission to disrupt the status quo and help our clients achieve great things.


What to expect:

As a member of the product team, you will be responsible for designing and expressing ideas to solve market problems. With a passion for solving core product problems, you will also be developing a deep empathy and understanding of our users, producing exceptional experiences, and becoming their voice throughout Amilia.


You’ll be responsible for:

Iterative & Collaborative design

  • Conduct collaborative design sessions with colleagues and test designs and prototypes with users; 
  • Assist development teams by identifying objectives and overcoming constraints regarding the user experience & interface; 
  • Create flows, sketches, wireframes, low and high-fidelity mock-ups; 
  • Actively participates in Sprint Planning & Reviews; and 
  • Leverage existing user experience best practices to inform design. 

Research & User empathy

  • Meet & shadow customers to develop empathy and an understanding of market problems; 
  • Conduct user interviews, and user experience experiments; 
  • Aggregate and analyze data from market research and usability experiments to validate decision making; 
  • Balance usage of primary and secondary research; 
  • Shadow front-line Amilians as they interact with leads, and users; and 
  • Use designed solutions in applied situations with users. 

User Experience Advocacy

  • in our Design System; 
  • Promote design principles and user experience best practices; 
  • Share results from usability research through presentations and blogs; and 
  • Coach software developers to use U.X. resources and become autonomous.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Our Story

About You:
You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.

If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!

About Us:
Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.

Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.

We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.

Of course we love it here, but outsiders think we’re pretty great too: Avison Young was awarded the prestigious America’s Best Midsize Employers for 2022, presented by Forbes and Statista, Inc. We’re proud to be regularly recognized for our team, services and culture and our team members enjoy comprehensive compensation and benefit programs. Through our customized work options, we give our people the flexibility to create a work environment that puts their overall well-being first. After all, we are powered by people.

Overview

We are seeking a talented, creative and driven Graphic Designer to work within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. An individual who thrives on maintaining responsibility for the design and visual aspects of each assignment, working closely across a variety of divisions including Investment, Office Leasing, Industrial and Retail. You will be part of the world’s fastest-growing commercial real estate services firm market with an opportunity to work alongside and learn from some of the best in the industry in an open, collaborative culture of respect and professional growth.

Responsibilities

Primary Duties and Responsibilities

Reporting to the Senior Marketing Manager, the Graphic Designer is required to perform a range of duties including, but not limited to:

Graphic Design

  • Manage the design and layout of various marketing materials (flyers, surveys, brochures, sales advertisements, proposals, presentations) in line with brand purpose and messaging
  • Provide creative and innovative approaches to marketing programs for various sales teams and service lines
  • Manage and prepare email marketing campaigns using marketing automation platform (Buildout and Hubspot)
  • Thrive in a fast paced, dynamic and ever evolving real estate environment
  • Be solution focused and able to provide creative results to unique challenges
  • Other special projects as required or assigned

Administrative

  • Provide administrative support to management and other staff
  • Handle sensitive and highly confidential information
  • Reception duties are minimal yet required for covering breaks and other duties:
  • Prepare and review correspondence, reports and presentations

Qualifications

  • Diploma or Post-Secondary education in Graphic Design or a minimum of 3 years’ professional work experience as a Graphic Designer is required.
  • Proficiency in the use of specific computer programs:
    • Advanced knowledge of InDesign
    • Intermediate knowledge of Photoshop and Illustrator
    • Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Outlook, Excel & PowerPoint)
      • Experience using marketing automation platforms is preferred, but not required
    • Experience using Hubspot is a plus
  • Experience in the design/printing/publishing industry is an asset
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Recognized ability to work as a collaborative team member and provide support an individual or team
  • Strong organizational skills, uncanny attention to detail and ability to prioritize
  • Ability to work well under pressure, handle multiple assignments and work efficiently to meet tight deadlines
  • Demonstrated problem solving and ability to use discretion

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law. For those requiring assistance with disabilities, Information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY! To learn more about us, please visit our website: avisonyoung.ca.

title: Production Designer (2)
description:
BIMM is booming, so weâ€™re looking for two seasoned Production Designersto join our team!

WHO WE ARE

For over 30 years, weâ€™ve crafted flawless data driven creative solutions for some of the biggest brands in Canada and across the globe. Everything we do is guided by a simple philosophy: marketing with greater certainty. We love creating amazing integrated brand experiences for our clients that deliver real business results.

We all act as one unit and believe in â€œhaving every BIMMERâ€™s backâ€. Nice people only. Egos need not apply.

THE ROLE

We're seeking a Production Artist who can design both Digital and Print communications. You are technically savvy and love world-class design. You will contribute to the team, recommending solutions that leverage the latest creative trends and technological advancements. You have the experience to own a creative product through completion across all communication platforms.

Responsibilities

  • Produce and design layouts with minimum guidance
    for both Print and Digital communications
  • Create social animations
  • Create emails, Banners and Social Ads
  • Utilize the latest automation techniques
  • Prioritize work to accommodate deadlines
  • Manage and maintain high level of responsiveness and flexibility to accommodate internal client requests and changing circumstances
  • Create Prepress-ready computer files for transmission to publications and/or clients

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Weâ€™re searching for a hard worker, who isnâ€™t afraid to roll up their sleeves. Design comes natural to you, and challenges fuel you. Our ideal candidate is a friendly, service-oriented individual who boasts excellent communication and language skills (basic familiarity with French is an asset). Motivation and a focus on product quality are required, as is the ability to work well within a team and a desire to grow.

 Must haves

  • 4 years of agency experience in a Studio environment
  • Solid portfolio of recent commercial work
  • Degree or diploma in graphic design, or the equivalent experience
  • Advanced knowledge of Adobe CC, in particular InDesign, Photoshop,
    Illustrator and After Effects.
  • Experience using Sketch or Adobe XD is a plus
  • Excellent communication skills 

BIMM is committed to providing an environment that is inclusive and accessible. We are an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants for employment without discrimination. Please let us know if accommodation for the recruitment/interview process is required and we will work with you to make sure your needs are met.

title: Senior Visual Designer
description:
Job Description

We are Canada Life

 

Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

 

You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.

 

Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing. 

  

Be your best at Canada Life.

 

Canada Life’s Digital Hub is a team driven by customer needs. We provide expertise and strategic thought leadership that’s fueling Canada Life’s customer experiences. Our team of experts in design, technology, product and agile work collaboratively with our business partners, creating digital tools that improve our customers’ lives. Come join an organization committed to delivering innovative, digital experiences.

 

We are looking for a Senior Visual Designer

 

Given the size and scope of our organization, we have the flexibility for this position to be located in the following head office locations: Toronto or London. 

What you will do:

 

You can expect to spend part of your days:

  • Creating visual design deliverables; high-fidelity prototypes and UI components enhancing our established design system
  • Crafting original on-brand iconography, illustrations, infographics and data visualizations and contributing to shared libraries
  • Designing online marketing campaign concepts for social media, paid media, email, and onsite platforms within an agile team framework
  • Staying current on emerging trends in design, accessibility, UI design patterns and user-centered methodologies
  • Collaborating on a cross-functional team with UX, Content, Strategy, Animation, Marketing and Front-End Development experts to implement customer-centric solutions
  • Providing art direction, specifications and feedback to developers, vendors and photographers to ensure brand and AODA/WCAG accessibility standards are upheld
  • Presenting creative strategy to stakeholders that connects design concepts to user and business goals
  • Balancing passion about design with practicality about what can be achieved in realistic timelines
  • Enhancing the brand voice by iterating solutions to build upon unified look and feel across in a cohesive manner
  • Building and authoring pages in CMS to enhance written content, optimize load times and support the user experience

 What you will bring:

 

  • 4+ years of professional experience in Visual Design, Graphic Design, UI or Interaction Design role
  • A bachelor’s degree or diploma program in graphic design, multimedia, or a related discipline, RGD certification
  • A demonstrable portfolio of work that exhibits your process for solving design problems in a creative and attractive method (focus on UI design, illustration, typographic and branding skills)
  • Skillswith industry tools such as Adobe CC, Sketch and InVision
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to effectively convey design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and stakeholders
  • Self-motivation and organization with strong attention to detail
  • Passion for graphic design and strategic design thinking that considers the customer’s goals, business goals and creative solutions
  • Eagerness to develop your personal career and achieve your goals
  • Previous experience in agile environments and with AODA/WCAG accessibility as an asset

Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today 

#LI-Hybrid

 

We are one of Canada's top 100 employers!

 

Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.  

   

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.  

   

   

Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted

title: Concepteur (trice) graphique
description:
Description de l'entreprise

ISAAC se fait partenaire des flottes nord-américaines pour simplifier le camionnage avec sa solution facile à utiliser. Dédiés à 100% au transport routier, nous aidons les transporteurs à surmonter leurs défis quotidiens, et à favoriser le bonheur des chauffeurs. Notre solution d’une fiabilité éprouvée s’intègre à vos systèmes existants grâce à sa plateforme ouverte, et permet à vos chauffeurs et votre équipe du bureau de travailler efficacement.

Pour plus d'informations, visitez www.isaacinstruments.com.

Description du poste

Vous êtes toujours à l'affût des nouvelles tendances marketing et vous avez un cerveau bouillonnant d'imagination et de créativité ? Si vous cherchez à rejoindre une équipe florissante avec la même passion de créativité et d'innovation, alors ce poste est fait pour vous !

En tant que graphiste de l'équipe marketing, vous serez responsable de promouvoir la marque d'ISAAC pour soutenir l'exécution du plan marketing et la croissance de l'entreprise. Doté de leadership et d'une passion pour le graphisme, vous aimez développer une image de marque percutante, vous êtes un et vous voyez le design vidéo comme un élément essentiel de la stratégie marketing moderne.

Responsabilités

  • Faire respecter le guide de style d'ISAAC
  • Fournir une vision artistique pour tous les projets marketing
  • Assurer le contrôle de qualité et le respect des normes pour tout le matériel graphique et vidéo
  • Voir au développement, à l'optimisation et la mise en œuvre des processus de production graphique et vidéo
  • Développer des concepts créatifs modernes qui captivent et engagent nos clients (B2B)
  • Participer à l'idéation de campagnes et fournir une expertise aux services internes
  • Concevoir des maquettes, des storyboards ou des croquis pour diriger l'équipe dans les premières étapes de création
  • Travailler avec les équipes Produit et Développement pour standardiser l'interface utilisateur de la solution ISAAC
  • Développer et gérer des partenariats clés avec des fournisseurs externes pour la prestation de services graphiques, de conception et de vidéo, selon les besoins
Qualifications

  • 2 à 5 ans d'expérience dans un rôle similaire (expérience B2B est un atout)
  • Une formation en arts visuels, conception graphique et vidéo est un atout
  • Compétences en édition vidéo
  • Compétences en animation et motion design
  • Compétences en photographie
  • Excellente connaissance en matière d’UI (interface utilisateur) / UX (expérience client) et d’image de marque
  • Solides compétences en communication en français et en anglais, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit
  • Qualités reconnues de leadership et de partage des connaissances
  • Approche créative et innovante du travail
  • Reconnu pour votre collaboration et votre capacité d'influence
  • Esprit créatif complété par une approche analytique
  • Attention inégalée aux détails et souci de la qualité


Informations complémentaires

Les gens sont au cœur de notre culture chez ISAAC. C’est pourquoi nous offrons ces divers avantages aux membres de notre équipe :

  • Des opportunités de carrières variées
  • Un environnement de travail stimulant axé sur l’innovation
  • Des équipes enthousiastes et collaboratives
  • Des salaires compétitifs et avantages sociaux favorisant la conciliation travail-famille : un régime d’assurances collectives complet, un REER collectif, un PAE, des horaires flexibles, 4 semaines de vacances, etc.
  • Des activités sociales variées et des collations gratuites tous les jours

title: Production Designer
description:
Company Description

We’re a creative consultancy. That means we put creativity at the center of all our thinking—be it strategic consulting, design and advertising or product and service design. If you believe in the power of creativity to transform how people think and behave, you’re in the right place.

Job Description

Leo Burnett Toronto is looking for their next Production Designer to join us, ensuring our work is pixel perfect every time. 

Day to Day: 

  • Assisting with layout (graphic and text) revisions to existing creative files and assisting with comping creative concepts.   

  • Creating templates as well as final client and internal presentations and planning tools (such as equity wheels). 

  • Image searching and editing.   

  • Working with art directors, designers and producers to prepare files to be keylined (iron out technical duties such as scaling, cropping, retouching, repositioning, converting files, etc.).   

  • Reviewing final designs, layouts and resizes to ensure the quality and accuracy of files before shipping to publications or vendors.   

Qualifications

  • 3 years of relevant agency or client side expereince 

  • Strong eye for design with production knowledge 

  • Advanced knowledge of CS5 Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign 

  • Knowledge of Keynote/PowerPoint to create presentations 

  • Ability to work under tight deadlines and handle multiple projects at once 

  • Ability to design for the digital space: mocking up Facebook apps, iMedia units 

  • Understanding of how to prep digital files to hand off to vendor: optimizing image files, using proper color settings and using layer comps to prep files for vendors 



Additional Information

Leo Burnett Toronto is an equal opportunity employer with a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Drawing on valuable perspectives and insights from our unique workforce allows us to continue sharing our creativity with the world. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals and will provide appropriate accommodation for candidates with disabilities or accessibility needs throughout the recruitment process, upon request. Please contact our recruiter for any questions, accommodations or specific requests.

title: Stagiaire en graphisme (Été 2022)
description:
Stagiaire en graphisme (Été 2022)Faites progresser votre carrière chez ABB avec une équipe mondiale qui alimente la transformation de la société et de l'industrie afin de bâtir un avenir plus productif et durable.Chez ABB, nous avons l'objectif précis de favoriser la diversité et l'inclusion dans tous ses aspects : genres, LGBTQ+, facultés, ethnicités, générations, etc. Ensemble, nous entreprenons un parcours où chacun d'entre nous, respecte et célèbre les différences individuelles

Le segment d'affaires Bâtiments intelligents transforme les bâtiments commerciaux, industriels et résidentiels de manière numérique afin d'en optimiser le confort, l'efficacité, la sûreté et la sécurité, et ainsi améliorer la qualité de vie dans les bâtiments de l'avenir grâce à des solutions, des services et des produits d'électrification sûrs, intelligents et durables.
Vos responsabilités

  • Travailler avec les gestionnaires de produits pour soutenir les initiatives liées à la création ou à la révision des outils de vente.
  • Créer ou réviser les catalogues de produits.
  • Créer et mettre à jour la documentation et effectuer la saisie de données.

Votre parcours professionnel
  • Étudiant(e) en graphisme au CÉGEP ou à l'université.
  • Capacité à travailler avec le logiciel Adobe InDesign.
  • Maîtrise des applications Microsoft (Excel/Word/PowerPoint).
  • Bonne capacité de communication.
  • Bilingue français et anglais (parlé et écrit).

En savoir plus sur nous
Nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre candidature. Si vous souhaitez en savoir plus sur ABB, consultez notre site web www.abb.com.Pour la quatrième année consécutive, ABB Canada a été reconnue comme l'un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada par le magazine Forbes et s'est classée au premier rang dans la catégorie de l'industrie. Également nommée parmi les 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada, les meilleurs employeurs de Montréal, les meilleurs employeurs pour les jeunes au Canada et le prix de la meilleure expérience du candidat (CandE Award), la culture et l'engagement d'ABB consistent à offrir un milieu de travail bienveillant où chacun collabore, se sent valorisé, respecté, inclus et soutenu. Nous nous engageons également à veiller à ce que toutes les politiques et pratiques respectent le Programme d'équité en matière d'emploi, nous visons à ce que notre main-d'œuvre soit réellement représentative des quatre groupes désignés : les femmes, les autochtones, les membres des minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées. ABB fournira des accommodements adéquats aux candidats handicapés et les encouragera à s'identifier dans le processus de candidature.#LI-Hybrid

title: Graphic Designer (Multimedia)
description:
If you are looking to join one of Canada’s fastest-growing companies, goeasy Ltd. is the place for you! Certified as a Great Place to Work®, recognized as Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, GTA's Top 100 Employers, one of Canada’s Top 50 Fintech’s and North America’s Most Engaged Workplaces, we want the best and brightest to join our team.

We are a publicly-traded company on the TSX with over 4000% shareholder return since 2001. Accredited by the Better Business Bureau, goeasy Ltd is a Canadian company that provides non-prime leasing and lending services through easyhome, easyfinancial and LendCare. We offer a wide variety of financial products and services including lease-to-own merchandise, unsecured and secured installment loans, direct-to-consumer auto loans, and point-of-sale financing to over 4,000 merchants in the powersports, automotive, retail, home improvement and health sectors. With over 30 years of experience, our 2200 employees work with our customers to help them get access to the money they need today, while they rebuild their credit and graduate to prime rates. Our omnichannel model includes over 400 retail locations and digital/mobile platforms that enable our customers to transact with us through their channel of choice.

Reporting to the Manager, Creative Services, the Multimedia Graphic Designer will be a core team member in our quest to build a best-in-class in-house creative services team. Working alongside our external creative agency, you will lead and contribute to creative design to attract new customers and engage current customers – all with the goal of driving results for growth of the easyhome and easyfinancial businesses. With goeasy, you’ll get to build your portfolio with easyhome, Canada’s only lease-to-own and lending retailer, and with easyfinancial, one of Canada’s largest non-prime lenders. From designing in-store point-of-sale collateral, to creating dynamic online ads, to video creation – your role will focus on multimedia, digital and POS creative design to build our brands, captivate customers and inspire our team.

Responsibilities

  • Develop static and dynamic assets for online campaigns, email, website, in-store/branch LCD displays, point-of-sale (POS) material, print collateral, presentation designs, infographics
  • Lead videography asset development and delivery, whether creating or working with third party: develop plan, storyboarding, filming, editing, distribution
  • Develop and manage a library of photos, videos, graphics, and media assets to be used across all our marketing channels
  • Contribute to creative development and execution for promotions, from theme and concept development to asset creative for POS and online
  • Collaborate with the marketing managers and our external AOR to assist in design POS collateral
  • Design creative and manage layout for direct mail assets, including handbills and addressed mail
  • Develop and maintain a consistent brand presence throughout our marketing, content, in-store/branch, and online platforms
  • Act as a brand steward to uphold the integrity of our brands across all channels, but challenge the creative boundaries of how we engage new and current customers

Qualifications

  • Degree/diploma in Graphic Design, Multimedia Design or similar discipline
  • 1-2 years professional-level experience in a graphic design role
  • Advanced proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Animate, Premier Pro) in PC/Mac
  • Experience with content production (social media, email, dynamic online ads, video)
  • Familiarity in Premier Pro (video editing)
  • UX/UI knowledge for website design and maintenance
  • Knowledge of photography a plus
  • Sketch/illustration skills for storyboarding videos concepts/dynamic ads a plus
  • Portfolio required with submission

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

goeasy is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, goeasy is committed to providing accommodations for applicants upon request at any stage of the recruitment process in accordance with all legislative requirements throughout Canada. Please let us know if you require an accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Additional Information:

All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check, credit check, and validation of their work experience to qualify for hire.  We thank all interested applicants, however we will only be contacting those for interview who possess the skills and qualifications outlined above.

Why should you work for goeasy?

To learn more about our great company please click the links below:

http://goeasy.com/careers/

title: Intermediate Graphic Designer
description:
ResQ was founded with the belief that restaurant operators and service providers should have a much better way to operate their businesses. As a first step towards our mission, we have built a SaaS-enabled marketplace that helps fast-growing restaurants manage their repairs and maintenance, empowering them to focus on their customers.

Repair and maintenance is the heartbeat of any restaurant's operations, yet the existing management methods are complex, expensive, and time-consuming. With ResQ, restaurants can simply get connected to qualified service providers, submit jobs, track progress, and pay, all in one place.

We are trusted by the world's leading restaurant brands and are venture-backed by top-tier global VCs - and we are just getting started!

 

What you will do:

We are looking for an Intermediate Graphic Designer to be responsible for continuously maintaining the company's visual brand internally and externally. This includes reviewing, updating, and maintaining the company's visual representation in all aspects of design including typography, composition, colour, and imagery.  

Your creative talents will be applied to digital marketing, web graphics, print, sales enablement documents, and trade show materials. You're an innovative, out-of-the-box thinker who strives for design excellence and enjoys challenges. You thrive when you collaborate with different team members and you continuously seek and take feedback to update and optimize your work. You have impeccable attention to detail even when you're moving at lightning speed on projects. You never sacrifice quality and standards over speed. 

As the dedicated designer on the marketing team, you will be responsible for bringing ResQ's marketing projects to life. To ensure brand consistency across the company, you will communicate cross-functionally with teams such as the Product Design team to give and receive feedback for ongoing projects.

As an Intermediate Graphic Designer at ResQ you will be contributing in the following areas:

  • Execute with excellence: Study project briefs to determine design deliverables, design marketing materials including brochures, flyers, posters, etc. Design and update the company website, source and manage vendors, manage ResQ's social media presence, create compelling designs using industry standard software including Adobe Illustrator, InDesign, and Photoshop, and review designs for errors before being sent out to publishing/printing. 
  • Manage and elevate our brand: Maintain brand standards and style, Identify the best ways to illustrate and communicate ResQ's vision, Select colours, images, typography and layout for communication materials, and stay up-to-date with the latest design trends, tools, and technologies.
  • Collaborate and iterate: Support and collaborate with the core revenue team as well as other parts of the business, Seek feedback from team members and revise or provide alternative solutions to deliver high quality design deliverables.

  About you:

  • Bachelors of Design or Arts specializing in graphic design, marketing, communications or equivalent experience
  • At least five years of graphic design experience, preferably in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
  • Experience working in a SaaS technology industry is an asset
  • Advanced knowledge of current graphic design (and related) software applications including Adobe InDesign Illustrator, Photoshop, and Acrobat
  • Expert knowledge of visual design concepts, layout, and typography
  • Demonstrated experience with commonly used tools among marketing teams including social media, email marketing platforms, and landing page and website building platforms (Pardot, Unbounce, Squarespace)
  • Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript would be considered an asset
  • Experience in setting up creative for paid advertising platforms
  • Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in online marketing and measurement
  • Ability to work unsupervised while knowing your success is also influenced by how well you collaborate with the team
  • Thrives in a collaborative environment and has excellent communication skills
  • Quick learner who continuously improves their craft with the ability to manage multiple projects and deliver quality work efficiently.
  • Strong teamwork, time management, and project management skills
  • Ability to think creatively and problem solve when faced with new set backs
  • Organized with a keen eye for detail and experience in proofreading

Why ResQ may not be the right place for you:

We are a mission-driven team and have a big vision to revolutionize the service industry. While on that journey, we recognize that building a startup is very hard. Turning vision into reality in a fast-growing environment takes superhuman efforts and is often one of the most difficult, yet rewarding, things one can do. Every day there are new sets of challenges to be solved at an unprecedented speed. While startups are hard, the opportunity to do career-defining work and create an economic impact, solve hard problems with incredible team members and make the world a better place, can be extremely satisfying.

While we make a conscious effort to balance hard work and personal life, we recognize that we may not be for everyone. Here are some reasons why:

  • We're solving hard problems, and with that comes change, priority shifts, and iteration. If formal structure and order is what you crave, this may not be a fit.
  • Execution is everything to us. Like any hyper growth startup, we will always be resource constrained and have to do more with less. We can not let that come in the way of execution as we simply must get sh*t done. If you desire an environment with ample resources at all times, we may not be for you.
  • We move fast. Very fast. We work with tight deadlines and operate with a sense of urgency in everything we do. Sometimes we make low data choices, test and retest until we succeed, and learn from our mistakes. If you're more of a 'get it perfect the first time' person, you may not thrive in our operating style.
  • With our value of 'take extreme ownership' comes a high degree of responsibility. The phrase 'that's not my job' is not part of our vocabulary. If we put our name on something, it is on us to ensure it gets completed. That can, sometimes, mean late nights or long hours. If you're looking for a structured 40 hours/week position, this may not be the place for you. 
  • ResQ operates as one team on the same path to achieve our mission. At times we have opposing views and have to disagree, and commit. There is no ego here, as we do what is best for our customers. If you're used to always getting your way, you probably won't feel comfortable with our culture. 

 

What you'll enjoy about ResQ as a Full-Time Employee: 

We believe in taking care of each other, and here are some ways we support our team to be their best selves.

 

Health & Wellness

●  Financial Health: Competitive compensation and stock option grants that encourage you to grow and stay at ResQ
●  No limit on paid sick days, we trust our employees to take the time they need to recover
●  Enhanced health & dental benefits for you and your family that start from day one
●  Top of market parental leave to help you focus on what matters the most
●  Flex-place options that balance in-office and remote working
●  All in-office employees are fully vaccinated for COVID-19

 

Paid-time off & away

●  Yes, we have Unlimited Vacation but we recognize that many Unlimited Vacation programs have the opposite result by reducing the time employees take off. This is why we have a minimum number of vacation days; all full-time ResQers are expected to take a minimum of three weeks of vacation in a year
●  PLUS another week of ResQ shut down days (2 days in summer, 3 days in December)
●  In addition to paid vacation, we also have Roam Away From Home program where you can work away from your home province/state for up to 60 days in a calendar year

 

Community & Culture

●  Culture of Freedom, Responsibility and Togetherness to make you feel like a Founder of ResQ
●  Monthly and Quarterly team events to bond and make life-long memories
●  Slack channels to make you smile and get to know everyone you work with

 

Learning & Development

●  'WOW Hours' with industry leaders and entrepreneurs for personal and professional growth
●  Company supported learning events
●  Quarterly awards that makes you shine and feel appreciated for your work
●  Weekly 1-1's with direct managers and regular 1-1s with CEO to help support growth and professional development
●  Growth programs focusing on personal and professional growth allowing you to take on new roles, responsibilities and challenges
 

Canadian headquarters:

● New office space at King & Yonge that is being renovated to our bold taste - think rich colour palettes, designed for modern collaboration, and kitchen with commercial appliances!

ResQ strongly believes that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will result in a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users. ResQ is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against applicants based on race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, or disability, or any other status or condition protected by Ontario or local law. ResQ is committed to workplace diversity and will provide accommodation to applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process.

title: Senior Designer (Contract)
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Bounteous is looking for aContract Senior Designerto join our fast-growing design practice. The Senior Designer designs and contributes to creative concepts, detailed design, enhancements, and execution of digital media (websites, mobile applications, social media assets, email templates, etc.) for a wide variety of clients. The ideal candidate must be able to design, develop, or enhance existing graphic/identity branding that meets marketing objectives, integrates customer usability best practices, and address client brand standards. This is a hands-on opportunity ideal for an organized and detail-oriented individual who can consistently deliver high quality, data-driven solutions. The ideal candidate is a naturally engaging storyteller who works closely with cross-disciplinary teams to further best practices at every opportunity.

#LI-Remote

We invite you to subscribe to our monthly and quarterly newsletters to stay up to date with the latest job openings as well as resources and tips for job seekers here.

Research shows that women and other underrepresented groups apply only if they meet 100% of the criteria of a job posting. If you have passion and intelligence, and possess a technical knack (even if you’re missing some of the above), we encourage you to apply.

Bounteous is focused on promoting an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate the different viewpoints and experiences our diverse group of team members bring to Bounteous. title: Graphic/Visual Design Specialist
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview

 

The successful candidate will be a brand ambassador involved in creatively designing visual materials to tell our company’s stories internally and externally (graphics and short videos).

Responsibilities

 

  • Design graphics for our internal channels (newsletter, magazine, intranet, email templates), and external channels (social media posts, press releases, marketing materials) etc.
  • Create multimedia content for Lafarge Canada’s internal and external platforms (short videos with leadership team and employees).
  • Participate in creative ideation and brainstorming sessions.
  • Monitor internet culture and online trends to cooperate with social media management and overall corporate communications.

Relationship with Others

  • Executive Committee 
  • Internal departments, such as Marketing, HR, Environmental & Public Affairs, Sales, Operational Managers and Teams, etc.

Specific Accountabilities:

  • The Communications Team drives Lafarge Canada storytelling strategy with compelling content and visuals. The successful candidate will be a brand ambassador involved in creatively designing visual materials to tell our company’s stories internally and externally (graphics and short videos). If you are looking for a place where you can make an impact with your work and consequently grow your career, join us.
  • In this role, you will have the opportunity to do more than developing day-to-day assets, you will be able to be part of the strategy and planning behind creating compelling communications with an exceptional visual identity for Lafarge Canada. Although based on a framework, there will be room for innovation and creativity. 
Dimensions
  • The person will be evaluated on their ability to put together creative and compelling graphics/visuals, time management, organization, discipline, ability to work independently and in a team setting.

Qualifications

 

  • Bachelor Degree or College diploma in Graphic Design, Visual Communications or related discipline
  • Creative mind with an eye for aesthetics, creative and social trends, and brand personality
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, After Effects, Premiere, Illustrator & InDesign).
  • Detailed oriented with excellent organization, project and time management
  • Self-starter with ability to work independently in a fast-paced and deadline sensitive environment
  • Creative portfolio (you’ll be asked to share it)
  • Hootsuite and social media experience and knowledge an asset
  • French language skills an asset
  • Flexible work – part remote/part at the office in Mississauga

 

Competency

  • Creativity
  • Action oriented
  • Approachability
  • Composure
  • Timely Decision making
  • Decision quality

LafargeHolcim

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs. 

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Senior Production Designer
description:
As a Designer, you are excited to contribute to the development of creative concepts that translate visually. You are an original thinker and a team player—matching strategic direction with appropriate design results across digital experiences. There’s a line between creative expression and commercial reality—but you’ve got that covered. You’ve tackled the basics of design-related applications—and a keen attention to detail is what makes your work stellar. Most importantly, you are driven by a passion for design.

You will:

  • Design solutions that meet or exceed strategic objectives.
  • Create interactive design concepts.
  • Design mood boards, storyboards, interactive page layouts, site grids and interface demos, photo retouches and enhancements, and animated GIFs.
  • Provide quality assurance on creative deliverables.
  • Build and maintain a rapport with creative team, account managers, and project managers.

You have:

  • 1+ years design and interactive work experience.
  • Strong design portfolio.
  • Strong visual, interactive and graphic design skills.
  • Solid working knowledge of the latest design toolsets.
  • Time management skills to manage responsibilities and to always be prepared.
  • An ability to brainstorm and contribute to the bigger idea.
  • Developed and diverse communication skills to articulate creative ideas.
  • A proven aptitude for fast-paced creative thinking with acute attention to detail within demanding deadlines.
  • A self-motivated and accountable attitude.
  • Experience in the latest versions of Mac OS, Photoshop, and Illustrator.
  • An understanding of the strengths and limitations of After Effects, QuickTime, Director, and ImageReady, as well as information architecture and hierarchy.
  • Comprehensive understanding of interactivity and the Web.Illustration in both electronic and traditional media.
  • Motion graphics experience for the Web and video

title: Marketing Assistant / Graphic Designer
description:
Location: Edmonton, AB, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 3/31/2022Job ID: 9S267944331Category: Marketing
If you are a talented and experienced Marketing Assistant / Graphic Designer, David Aplin Group has the right opportunity for you!  Our client, a Fortune 500 company, and a leader in their field has partnered with David Aplin Group to grow their team in Edmonton, AB.
 
They are a large, stable multi-national commercial company and hiring a Marketing Assistant to create internal and external marketing material. If you are looking to make an impact, work with a fun group and build your career, this opportunity is for you!
 
Benefits & Perks:
  • $50,000 - $55,000 Compensation
  • Health and dental plan (tailored to individual needs)
  • RRSP
  • 3 weeks’ vacation
  • Prefer in office but open to a hybrid position
Responsibilities:
  • Responsible for preparing proposals, presentations, and communication materials, as well as other administrative duties. Coordinate the distribution of internal and external marketing information
  • Work in InDesign and/or Illustrator to develop a wide range of communication materials for internal and external marketing purposes
  • Create a wide variety of templated, company-sanctioned marketing materials that may include maps, advertisements, demographic reports, and executive summary brochures for in-house and client presentations using advanced desktop, graphic, and mapping software
  • Follow marketing parameters set by head office, follow guidelines, colors, fonts
  • Interact with sales professionals, client services assistants, and researchers regarding marketing and client requirements. Gather the necessary information to complete marketing tasks
  • Work across teams to determine the appropriate methodology for creating marketing and presentation materials
  • Work with ream to complete multiple projects related to responding to proposals and tracking their success, as well as creating collateral
  • Regularly create and distribute property listing information, invitations, and announcements via email
  • Create presentation materials such as poster boards and presentation binders
  • Other duties may be assigned
Qualifications:
  • Degree of Diploma in one of the following; Marketing, Graphic Design, Drafting, Industrial Design, Interior Design, Architectural Design etc.
  • A minimum of 1 year of experience in Adobe InDesign and Illustrator
  • Proven experience in design with a portfolio or samples to review
  • Detail-oriented and the ability to work in a busy environment, juggle a few projects with tight deadlines
Job ID: 9S267944331
 
 If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.
 
David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Graphic Designer
description:
The Graphic Designer is responsible for creating and editing a variety of marketing materials through various digital and print projects. He must ensure that all pertaining work respects Behaviour standards and its corporate identity as well as any brand associated with the project.  

|In this role, you will:

  • Create and maintain various marketing assets, including presentations, logos, advertising (digital & print), tradeshow signs, assets for video, web promotional elements and all collateral images.  
  • Design and produce marketing graphic for the various internal brands and licensed products.  
  • Creative thinking to produce new ideas and concepts.  
  • Present finalized ideas and concepts to internal clients. 
  • Take work from concept to final execution within deadlines.  
  • Update collateral and assets with new material or modified layouts.  
  • Collaborate with the different departments to develop creative solutions for their specific needs.  

|What we're looking for:

  • Degree in graphic design in a recognized institute. 
  • 5+ experience in digital design (agency or studio) 
  • Comfortable on a Windows PC platform.  
  • Well versed in the Adobe Suite, mostly Photoshop, Illustrator 
  • Experience in designing and prototyping using Adobe Xd 
  • Knowledge of MailChimp 
  • Experience with responsive web and interface design 
  • Basic understanding of HTML, CSS, and current web design trends 
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (PowerPoint, Word, etc.) 
  • Strong attention to detail.  
  • Creative, conscientious, methodical, and organized. 
  • Willing to learn and grow within the team.  
  • Positive team player, ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced team environment. 
  • Ability to work with multiple internal clients and projects simultaneously, prioritize projects and meet deadlines.  
  • Bilingual: French and English, written and spoken.  
  • A portfolio is obligatory with your application. 

|Dans ce rôle, vous aurez à :

  • Créer et maintenir divers outils de marketing, y compris des présentations, des logos, des publicités (numériques et imprimées), des enseignes commerciales, des éléments promotionnels Web et toutes les images collatérales; 
  • Concevoir et produire des supports marketing pour les différentes marques internes et les produits sous licence; 
  • Pensée créative pour produire de nouvelles idées et concepts; 
  • Présenter les idées et les concepts finalisés aux clients internes; 
  • Mettre à jour les assets avec du nouveau matériel ou de nouveaux agencements; 
  • Collaborer avec les différents départements pour développer des solutions créatives répondant à leurs besoins spécifiques. 

|Ce que nous recherchons:

  • Diplôme en graphisme dans un institut reconnu; 
  • Confortable sur une plateforme Windows; 
  • Connait bien Adobe Suite, principalement Photoshop, Illustrator; 
  • Connaissance des applications Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word, etc.) 
  • Une grande attention aux détails; 
  • Créatif·ve, consciencieux·se, méthodique et organisé·e; 
  • Esprit d'équipe positif, capacité à travailler en collaboration dans un environnement d'équipe dynamique; 
  • Volonté d’apprendre et de grandir au sein de l’équipe 
  • Capacité à travailler simultanément avec plusieurs clients et projets internes, à hiérarchiser les projets et à respecter les échéances; 
  • Bilingue: français et anglais, écrit et parlé;
  • Un portfolio est obligatoire lors de votre application.
Responsable de la création et de l'édition de différentes pièces de marketing à travers divers projets numériques et imprimés, vous vous assurez que tout travail concerné respecte les normes de Behaviour et son identité d'entreprise ainsi que toute marque associée au projet.

title: Lead Level Designer
description:
Company Description

People Can Fly is one of the leading independent AAA games development studios with an international team of hundreds of talented individuals working from offices located in Poland, UK, US, and Canada, and from all over the world thanks to our remote work programs.

Founded in 2002, we made our mark on the shooter genre with titles such as Painkiller, Bulletstorm, Gears of War: Judgment, and Outriders. We are one of the most experienced Unreal Engine studios in the industry and we are expanding it with in-house solutions called PCF Framework.

Our creative teams are currently working on several exciting AAA projects with the top publishers in the industry: Project Gemini with Square Enix and Project Dagger with Take-Two (2K), in addition to a new IP to be self-published and two other games in a concept phase. One of our IPs is also being adapted for VR technology.

With over 20 years of experience, PCF sets out to explore new horizons. We aim to combine our expertise with creativity of the best and most forward-thinking talents in the industry to work together on the new generation of action games for the global gaming community.

If you decide to accompany us on this journey, you’ll have a chance to perfect your craft and expand your knowledge, working alongside leaders in the industry on bringing a brand-new unique experience to the players worldwide.

If you feel yourself able to deliver as nobody else, take ownership of your projects, and are ready to leave a mark on a game you work on, apply now!

Job Description

  • Lead entire level design team.
  • Work hand in hand with the Creative Director to iterate, implement and execute on key design and level building principles
  • Block out and build levels and iterate through playtesting and providing/implementing feedback
  • Work with the art team to make sure that levels are up to the highest visual quality while retaining the gameplay and fun as well
  • Take full level ownership – from paper design, through the whitebox phase, script, iteration, debugging, optimization – until our game ships
  • Provide mentorship, troubleshooting, debugging and problem-solving assistance to members of the level design team
  • Proactively identify cross-discipline challenges and risks to the project and offer solutions
  • Foster a culture of open, honest, and respectful communication across all disciplines
Qualifications

  • Expert in level design both in practice and theory (chokepoints, routes, lines of sight, engagement distances)
  • 7 Years of professional level design experience including leading a level design team
  • At least 2 successfully shipped AAA games on PC or console
  • Self-motivation and ability to prioritize and deliver best quality work on deadlines
  • Ability to process, understand and implement feedback
  • High work ethic and self-motivated 

PREFERENCE TO APPLICANTS WITH

  • UE4 knowledge


Additional Information

What we offer:

U.S.

  • 100% group health insurance benefit premiums paid by PCF (Medical, Dental, Vision, Group Life, and Supplemental Live) and start on day 1 of employment.
  • 401K with 100% match, up to 3% of employee salary, and vested immediately.
  • Paid week off during Winter Holidays.
  • 20 paid vacation days and 5 paid sick days.
  • Free virtual health and mental wellbeing sessions included in the plan for members and their dependents.
  • A competitive salary and performance-based annual bonuses.
  • Personal development opportunities and ability to work in a global environment.
  • Work in a creative team with people full of passion for what they do.
  • Long term disability, short term disability, travel insurance, as well as other benefits provided. 

Canada

  • Benefit package 100% paid by PCF. Insurance company reimburses 100% of claims (Up to $500 per service a year, as well as individual family coverage).
  • Full Dental coverage, including major dental and orthodontics.
  • 4% RRSP matching before tax deductions, 100% vested on day 1.
  • Paid week off during Winter Holidays.
  • 20 paid vacation days and 5 paid sick days.
  • Free virtual health and mental wellbeing sessions included in the plan for members and their dependents.
  • A competitive salary and performance-based annual bonuses.
  • Personal development opportunities and ability to work in a global environment.
  • Work in a creative team with people full of passion for what they do.
  • Long term disability, as well as other benefits provided.

title: P2 - Bilingual Graphic Designer
description:
Are you creative and have strong editing skills? Are you looking for a long-term contract assignment with the possibility of an extension? Can you start immediately?

We're currently looking for a Bilingual Graphic Designer in Montreal.


Advantages
- Work for a top-tier organization in the Global Corporation
- Montreal location
- $24.38/hour
- Monday to Friday
- 9am to 5pm
- 12-month assignment

Workers placed through Randstad are eligible for preferred rates on health, dental, and life insurance. This Value-add program will provide a wide range of options to suit your needs.

Responsibilities
• Providing graphic and digital document design services from concept to print management
• Photo retouching using Photoshop
• Working with other designers in a team environment
• Creative and design on projects
• Other duties as required


Qualifications
* Bilingual in French and English
* 2+ years of graphic design experience
* Graphic design/fine arts diploma/degree
* Experience in Adobe Suite, including Acrobat Pro is a must\
* Strong working knowledge of Word, PPT and Excel
* Understand digital colour environment and requirements,
* Working knowledge of multimedia software
* Strong leadership and ability to work with others in a team environment

Summary
If you have Graphic Design experience and available to start immediately, apply now at www.randstad.ca.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Designer graphique / Graphic designer
description:
Company Introduction:


At MicroHabitat, we implement urban agriculture to improve the urban environment, the lifestyles of city dwellers and encourage a better understanding of environmental issues. We install urban farms on the roofs of businesses and schools to reconnect people to nature and their food.

With offices in Montreal, Toronto, Vancouver and New York, MicroHabitat plans to be in all major North American cities by 2030.
An ambitious, but realistic plan, which is being realized thanks to a dynamic, visionary and close-knit team.

_____________
Chez MicroHabitat, nous implantons l'agriculture urbaine pour améliorer l'environnement urbain, les habitudes de vie des citadins et encourager une meilleure compréhension des enjeux environnementaux. Nous installons des fermes urbaines sur les toits des entreprises et écoles afin de reconnecter les gens à la nature et à leur alimentation.

Avec des bureaux à Montréal, Toronto, Vancouver et New York, MicroHabitat a comme plan d'être dans toutes les grandes métropoles de l'Amérique du Nord d'ici 2030.
Un plan ambitieux, mais réaliste, qui se réalise grâce à une équipe dynamique, visionnaire et soudée.

Overview:


Tu cherches à travailler dans une entreprise qui a les valeurs à la bonne place et qui contribue à bâtir des villes et communautés plus durables?



Nous recherchons une personne à l'esprit créatif, capable de sortir des sentiers battus afin d'élever notre marque et de nous aider à développer une histoire visuelle convaincante qui résonne sur tous les canaux et toutes les plateformes.



Chez MicroHabitat, nous implantons l'agriculture urbaine pour améliorer l'environnement urbain, les habitudes de vie des citadins et encourager une meilleure compréhension des enjeux environnementaux. Nous installons des potagers sur les toits des entreprises, institutions et écoles afin de reconnecter les gens à la nature et à leur alimentation.


Rôles et responsabilités:


En tant que graphiste à temps partiel de MicroHabitat, vous ferez partie intégrante de l'équipe de marketing et vous contribuerez à donner vie à la créativité de notre marque en créant des ressources web, des banques d'icônes, du contenu visuel numérique qui constitue une image de marque propre à la compagnie. Le ou la candidat.e idéal.e doit faire preuve d'ingéniosité, être à l'aise avec la technologie et avoir le souci du détail. Il ou elle doit communiquer efficacement et coordonner avec les membres de l'équipe de marketing pour s'assurer que la conception visuelle transmet efficacement le message et le produit livrable souhaités.


Votre rôle consistera à:


- Inspirer un contenu de marque créatif, innovant et axé sur le rayonnement.


- Concevoir et développer des actifs marketing


- Assurer la cohérence de la marque et de la création entre les différents points de contact.


- Participer à l’élaboration des supports de présentation pour les événements 


- Apporter un design innovant aux discussions sur les besoins visuels de la marque


Exigences:


∙ Détenir une expérience  dans le domaine de la conception graphique ou web, avec un solide   portefeuille d'exemples à partager.


∙ Expertise en matière d'identité visuelle, de marketing numérique et de conception publicitaire


∙ Esprit d'entreprise : curiosité, créativité et capacité à sortir des sentiers battus.


∙ Être bilingue et à l'aise autant à l'oral et à l'écrit en français et en anglais.


∙ Être résident Canadien et habiter au Canada


Compétences recherchées:


• Passion pour le design et l’influence


• Organisé.e, autonome, stratège, esprit d’équipe, prise d’initiative, créatif.ve   


• Curiosité et créativité


• Autonomie, excellent sens de l'organisation, de gestion du temps et des priorités


• Sens de l’esthétisme, de la précision et du détail


•Bonne capacité de vulgarisation et de transmission de connaissances.


•Patience, empathie et générosité.


Plus de détails:


∙Début d'emploi: Dès que possible


∙Sur appel


∙ Heures flexibles


Pour toutes questions en lien avec le poste, n'hésitez pas à nous contacter sur info@microhabitat.ca

Nous installons des potagers sur les toits des entreprises, institutions et écoles afin de reconnecter les gens à la nature et à leur alimentation.", "Nous recherchons une personne à l'esprit créatif, capable de sortir des sentiers battus afin d'élever notre marque et de nous aider à développer une histoire visuelle convaincante qui résonne sur tous les canaux et toutes les plateformes."]

title: Graphic Designer Level 1-25701
description:
Description:
Desktop Publishing -Marsh Communications Team

This role will report to the  National Creative Lead supporting Marsh & McLennan in Canada.

Marsh Canada is a PC based client with the majority of the work produced using corporate templates in various Microsoft programs. This is not a creative role. Our primary focus is Desktop Publishing, layout, text formatting and brand management.
• The ability to build client relationships and a focus on superior customer service is a key requirement of all applicants.
• Applicant needs to be professional, energetic and able manage numerous demands nationally.
• Only looking for applicants who are seeking a long term position.
• Experience in a corporate environment and using Word and PPT to create and format documents is required.
• Experience in Adobe Suite, including Acrobat Pro is a must.
• In office position only - not a remote work position

title: Artiste prévisualisation
description:
Description de l'entreprise

En tant qu’entreprise fondée et dirigée par un artiste, notre mission est d'offrir aux talents la liberté et les ressources dont ils ont besoin afin de favoriser la réalisation de travail de qualité et de prospérer dans un environnement amusant et créatif.

Description du poste

L'artiste Previs/Postvis conceptualise des plans et des séquences entiers pour transmettre la vision du réalisateur, en travaillant à partir d'un storyboard ou d'un script, en veillant à répondre aux normes de qualité élevées de Rodeo FX. À l'aide d'éléments 2D, d'éléments 3D ou de plaques en direct, ils créent le langage visuel du film.
Principales responsabilités:

  • Créez des séquences d'animation de qualité racontant une histoire pour des projets VFX haut de gamme ;
  • Participer au développement de solutions esthétiques et techniques pour soutenir la narration;
  • Exécuter la mise en scène de la scène, l'animation de la caméra, la composition, l'objectif et le blocage d'animation avec et sans tableaux ;
  • Créer des actifs 2D et 3D nécessaires au processus de visualisation ;
  • Créez des animations 3D pour différents types d'objets, d'animaux et de personnages ;
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le superviseur CG et le responsable Previs/Postvis pour trouver des solutions et des approches créatives et techniques qui améliorent les prises de vue, tout en respectant les spécifications et les délais du projet ;
  • Peut participer au développement d'outils et de techniques pour le département;
  • Effectuer un contrôle qualité sur les plans avant qu'ils ne soient soumis pour examen/approbation, en veillant à ce que toutes les normes techniques et créatives soient respectées, et appliquer rapidement les notes reçues ;
  • Tenir la production et l'équipe de projet informés de l'état des travaux, des problèmes à résoudre, des ramifications des problèmes rencontrés et recommander des solutions potentielles ;
  • S'assurer que les délais sont respectés, en avisant rapidement l'équipe de projet si des retards sont à prévoir.
Qualifications

  • Expérience dans un poste similaire, au sein de l'industrie VFX;
  • Solide connaissance des caméras, de la mise en scène, de la composition, de la perspective, du rythme, du timing, de l'éclairage et des concepts généraux de réalisation de films dans le contexte de l'animation et de l'action en direct ;
  • La possibilité de modéliser, de texturer, d'adapter et d'éclairer les ressources pour optimiser le flux de travail en temps réel dans la fenêtre maya ;
  • Excellente connaissance des logiciels Unreal, Nuke et Maya;
  • Excellent sens de la priorisation et du respect des délais.


Informations complémentaires

  • Contrat permanent à temps plein;
  • 5 jours de congé de maladie payé;
  • 2 jours de congé additionnel au temps des Fêtes;
  • Assurances collectives, accès au service en ligne Dialogue et à un programme d’aide aux employés;
  • REER avec cotisation de l'employeur;
  • Rabais avec Bixi, Nautilus Plus et plusieurs autres entreprises locales.

La diversité est une valeur fondamentale chez Rodeo FX. Créer et maintenir un environnement de travail inclusif et équitable où la diversité est célébrée et valorisée nous tient à coeur. Nous croyons que chaque membre de notre équipe enrichit notre travail en nous exposant à un large éventail de façons de percevoir et d'interagir avec le monde, d'identifier les défis, et de concevoir et réaliser des projets.
skills: ["Créez des animations 3D pour différents types d'objets, d'animaux et de personnages\xa0;", "Solide connaissance des caméras, de la mise en scène, de la composition, de la perspective, du rythme, du timing, de l'éclairage et des concepts généraux de réalisation de films dans le contexte de l'animation et de l'action en direct\xa0;", 'Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le superviseur CG et le responsable Previs/Postvis pour trouver des solutions et des approches créatives et techniques qui améliorent les prises de vue, tout en respectant les spécifications et les délais du projet\xa0;', 'Excellent sens de la priorisation et du respect des délais.', "La diversité est une valeur fondamentale chez Rodeo FX.
