title: Visual Designer
description:
Reference # :22-08308Title :Visual Designer
Location :Toronto, ON
Position Type :Contract
Experience Level :Start Date / End Date :02/21/2022 / 08/26/2022 
Description
We are currently seeking a Visual Designer for a contract role with one of our clients in Toronto, ON . Please apply if interested and available for it.

Duration: 06+ Months
Location: Toronto, ON
Role- Visual Designer

Requirement-
  • Intake assets, findings, current state wireframes to inform visual designs
  • Generate high fidelity designs for desktop screens based on an established design system
  • Understand current design system used and implement system on net new designs
  • Review and incorporate stakeholder feedback on the designs
  • Frame and rationalize design solutions, both verbally and visually
  • Review designs with key project stakeholders and refine based on feedback
  • Create visual specifications intended for development teams
  • Work closely with development teams to ensure that design specifications are implemented
  • Collaborate effectively with remote and onsite team members, including but not limited to designers, researchers, project/product managers, QA, developers, and technical architects
  • Proficient in producing development ready designs using Adobe XD and Axure
Mohammad Wasif Farooqui
Associate Recruiter
Direct: 289.274.2099
Email:

Mohammad.Farooqui@artech.com

title: Créateur de contenu
description:
Tu as toujours rêvé de travailler au sein d’une organisation animée par la passion, la créativité et l’innovation? Tu as envie d’un quotidien où les projets sont stimulants et diversifiés?

Chez Premier Tech, notre équipe Communications n’a qu’une mission en tête : créer du contenu engageant et inspirant qui fait vivre notre identité unique. C’est pourquoi nous sommes à la recherche de la perle rare qui deviendra notre spécialiste en matière de création de contenu.

Faire la différence, voilà comment Premier Tech se distingue. Une équipe unique propulsée par une passion commune, celle d’offrir des solutions qui contribueront positivement à la vie des gens, des entreprises et des collectivités. Chez Premier Tech, Passion et Technologies s’unissent de façon durable et transformatrice pour donner vie à des produits et services qui aident à nourrir, à protéger et à améliorer notre planète.

Ton futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Créer du contenu riche, pertinent et engageant pour de multiples plateformes et publics, tout en respectant le ton rédactionnel et l’image de marque de Premier Tech
  • Comprendre et bien cerner le public cible de façon à transposer cette compréhension en contenu pertinent et adapté
  • Faire preuve de curiosité en restant à l’affût des dernières tendances en création de contenu
  • Mettre à profit ta créativité en participant activement aux brainstorms d’équipe
  • Utiliser tes habiletés linguistiques pour la rédaction et l’adaptation de divers textes bilingues et unilingues

Compétences requises

  • Nous n’avons pas de paradigme précis quant à ta formation initiale. Tu peux provenir du monde de la rédaction, des communications ou du journalisme. Ce qui importe, c’est que tu aies un penchant pour la rédaction!
  • Par-dessus tout, tu as un français absolument irréprochable! Tu ne laisses passer aucune faute et les erreurs grammaticales te font littéralement grincer des dents
  • Tu es curieux et n’as pas peur de proposer des stratégies de contenu créatives sortant des sentiers battus
  • Tu navigues bien dans l’incertitude et le changement. Tu sais que pour arriver à un contenu parfait, un texte peut être modulé maintes et maintes fois
  • Pour toi, ce n’est pas un problème de gérer plusieurs mandats à la fois tout en respectant des deadlines bien précis, même quand tout va vite
  • Tu maîtrises parfaitement le français et l’anglais.

Ces mots te parlent?

contenu, tendances, plateformes numériques, rédaction, création, affaires, besoins, storytelling, blogue, web, calendrier éditoriaux

Tes yeux s’illuminent à la lecture de cette offre rêvée? Postule dès maintenant, nous attendons ta candidature avec impatience!

Chez Premier Tech, Passion et Technologies s’unissent de façon durable et transformatrice pour donner vie à des produits et services qui aident à nourrir, à protéger et à améliorer notre planète.', 'Pour toi, ce n’est pas un problème de gérer plusieurs mandats à la fois tout en respectant des deadlines bien précis, même quand tout va vite', 'Utiliser tes habiletés linguistiques pour la rédaction et l’adaptation de divers textes bilingues et unilingues']

title: Graphic Designer
description:
GRAPHIC DESIGNER ROLE

Become one of the most impactful Graphic Designer on the planet!

WHY YOU WILL LOVE FINGERPRINT FOR SUCCESS (F4S) 

We are a groundbreaking technology platform that is expanding and growing rapidly around the world.We are looking to onboard and hire the next generation of graphic designers to help our customers set and achieve their crazy big goals.

Fingerprint for Success (F4S) is the future of human development. We are on a mission to empower individuals and teams to solve the worldâ€™s biggest problems. Featuring a vast range of tools for collaboration, performance, wellbeing, diversity, and inclusion, plus a huge library of AI and human coaching programs, with F4S anyone can develop and achieve amazing things at work and in life.

Until now professional coaching has been reserved only for the elite, financially inaccessible to most of the worldâ€™s population. Driven by a scientific evidence-based methodology, F4S democratizes coaching, creating for the first time a scalable human development solution for everyone. Through predictive data, conversational A.I., and also some of the world's very best professional coaches, F4S is loved by consumers, teams, enterprises, universities, and professional coaches alike.

We are a digital-first, small but fast-growing values-led team, genuinely on a mission to change the world. We are swift, passionate, hard-working, scaling ourselves at the same pace we grow our product and customers. We invest deeply in our company culture and our teamâ€™s wellbeing, knowing this is the well from where the worldâ€™s greatest products and companies flourish. 

Who you are:

  • An open-minded person who is willing to learn and become one of the most impactful graphic designers in the world 
  • A person with an insatiable curiosity and unrelenting drive to learn, succeed and lead by example
  • A person who is a force for good and celebrate individual uniqueness
  • Be driven by helping their team meet and exceed aggressive conversion targets and individual career goals. 
  • Be passionate about creating purposeful and valuable content that helps business professionals grow better.
  • Be highly organized and have a high level of accountability for the quality and outcomes of your work and your teamâ€™s work.
  • Lead with empathy, serve as an ally for underrepresented communities, and create psychological safety to ensure the team can do their best work. 
  • Able to identify design needs to continuously elevate the quality of digital marketing and brand management
  • A keen eye for aesthetics and details
  • Effective communication skills and comfortable with candor.
  • Strong prioritization skills and ability to consistently meet deadlines.
  • Ability to work independently (while also functioning and contributing as part of a team) and efficiently manage your own time.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, interpersonal, and relationship-building skills

The Graphic Designer will assist the Marketing Team with the production and implementation of the companyâ€™s portfolio of creative requirements.

What youâ€™ll do:

  • Responsible for creative design solutions that have a high visual impact
  • Creates branding proposals, advertising materials, e-books, magazines, brochures, folders, packaging, exhibitions and display materials, flyers, and online materials such as Facebook and Instagram posts, online ads and banners, as well as company AVPs and other video material.
  • Responsible for creating branding standard guidelines for the company and ensuring all design outputs are aligned with the company's and brandsâ€™ standards
  • Prepares rough drafts of material based on an agreed brief
  • Reviews final layouts and suggests improvements if required

Qualifications (any or all):

  • Entry-level 
  • Intermediate to proficient in layout design, with at least 1 - 2 years experience in doing layouts whether in a professional or freelance capacity.
  • Candidates with more experience are welcome to apply.
  • At least basic in illustrations, 2D animation, and storyboards.
  • Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree.
  • Required skill(s): Canva or Adobe Photoshop (proficient), Adobe Illustrator (proficient), Adobe After Effects (basic - intermediate)
  • Has a creative flair in design and a good sense of art.
  • Has a strong design sense of color, layout, and typography.
  • Has strong creative skills and the ability to design ideas for a wide range of industries.
  • Has creative conceptualization ability as well as technical execution capability.
  • Can translate complex data or information into easy-to-digest designs, layouts, and infographics.
  • Has the ability to work independently or as part of a team.
  • Strong communication and organization skills.
  • Able to multi-task and can gracefully handle pressure.
  • Willing to learn other multimedia software apart from Adobe creative tools to deliver other multimedia-related work.

Software Expertise:

  • Applicants should have extensive knowledge of the use of Canva or Adobe Creative Suite, particularly:
    • Canva presentations & videos
    • Adobe Illustrator
    • Adobe InDesign
    • Adobe Premiere / After Effects
  • A plus if you have knowledge of and experience using the following programs:
    • Microsoft Office
    • Youtube and similar platforms
    • Google Suite
    • Activecampaign
    • WordPress and other CMS programs

Where?
This role is initially fully digital/remote, eventually establishing our US Hubs for regular teaming and events. Given our HQ in Sydney Australia, the ideal candidate will be based on the west coast or in Austin, Texas to benefit from the overlapping timezone windows. 

Why Join Us?

  • Empower our users with helpful content
  • Learn digital marketing and content marketing real-life skills
  • Bring direct impact to the business and see blog traffic grow with your efforts
  • Be among team members who believe in working and playing hard 
  • Flourish in a flat organizational structure with no office politics

Benefits

At F4S, we are committed to living out our mission every day and that starts with providing benefits that allow our employees to care for themselves, support their families, and give back to their community. 

  • Access to F4S coaching
  • A competitive compensation plan with opportunity for advancement
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Per year: paid holidays and leave 
  • Learning and Development stipend
  • Amazing high performing remote global team 
  • Incredible culture and community

We are hiring for many role types including Full-time, part-time, contract, internships.

We look forward to you joining us in our very real mission to make human development accessible to everyone!

hello@f4s.com

How to get started?

Go to F4S.com to complete the F4S Questionnaire (15-30 mins) to help us better understand your work-style motivations and how we can best support your onboarding. We look forward to making a positive impact with you!

Powered by JazzHR

title: Designer | Canada - Fully Remote
description:
About FFW

For over 20 years, FFW has provided significant digital experiences to the world’s largest brands many within the Fortune 50 in finance, power, media, healthcare, and pharmaceuticals. FFW is a team of more than 400 people across 11 countries and growing fast. Not only do we work with large organizations, but we have a diverse portfolio across various verticals working on a variety of mission-critical digital solutions. Learn more at https://ffwagency.com/about-ffw.

 

About the Position
FFW is looking for a Designer to join the Experience Design (XD) Team to support creative outputs across a range of digital projects. You are a talented designer, with a passion for making delightful, ground-breaking work, and committed to producing exceptional experiences. You’re ready for hands-on projects at every stage of the lifecycle, from brainstorming creative concepts with the project team and developing original campaigns to participating in client presentations and ensuring deadlines are met all the way to launch.

FFW is a seriously collaborative work environment, so Designers need to collaborate across disciplines daily, from developers to analytics to client services, while maintaining high standards for original concepts and detailed execution. This is an opportunity to define and reinvent the digital space, and a passion for doing just that is critical.

The FFW XD Team comprises talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, education, and cultures, all of whom believe that we're better together. Our team culture is rooted in collaboration and in our drive to work through problems to understand our user's context, emotions, goals, and motivations. We support each project as an advocate for the customer, establishing informed perspectives, and leading XD activities that help us design and iterate on digital product experiences that benefit our clients' businesses.

As a Designer at FFW, you must demonstrate strong conceptual thinking and the technical expertise and attention to detail that bring those creative ideas to life. Whether it is color, typography, or usability, you will constantly strive for the perfect balance to enhance the expression. Brand guidelines are your friend—from developing them to ensuring they’re consistently followed in each and every project you touch. Your design execution and aesthetic choices elevate the experiences you are designing. You thrive working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, frequently moving from project to project. You are inspired by new innovations and follow the latest design trends. Above all, you are a talented, fun, curious person.

 

You will…

  • Produce meticulous, beautiful experiences that consider business and user objectives, brand guidelines, and channel specifications or requirements (websites, mobile applications, email, etc.)

  • Create and present design deliverables with limited oversight, including design concepts, comps, experience strategy documentation, prototypes, style guides, pattern libraries, deliverable styling, etc.

  • Prototype complex interactions with high standards of usability in mind

  • Serve as a resident expert of digital tools and be skilled in developing digital design concepts.

  • Be well-versed with web technology, usability, and core development tools, understanding web design constraints and how to design for a CMS

  • Foster the great creative culture and talent we have across FFW, including outside of the XD team

  • Learn to design not only for the handoff but for the presentation

You Have...

  • 2+ years of relevant applied digital design

  • Experience in an agency setting

  • English fluency

  • Experience working collaboratively with UX, Designers, and Developers to build great user and brand experiences and products that consider innovation, business impact, and user needs

  • Highly conceptual thinking skills in both visual and interaction design and a solid understanding of designing intuitive site functionality, interaction, user interfaces, and navigation

  • A drive to generate great ideas and see them through execution

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills

  • Excellent, structured, and confident workshopping skills, including the ability to design and lead engaging workshops focused on moving forward in decisions with clarity and focus

  • Engaging presentation styles and visual communication skills

  • Enthusiasm for the work that you can spread to others

  • Experience with digital design products, such as Figma, InVision, Photoshop, Sketch, etc.

  • Ability to execute under tight deadlines while managing multiple projects

  • Excellent time-management skills necessary for this 100% remote role

  • A desire to contribute to making our company a great place to work

Nice to have

  • Experience with web content management systems, like Drupal

  • Experience with HTML/CSS/JS prototyping (though we use InVision)

 

Does this sound like you? Send your resume over. We’d love to chat. NOTE: Please include a link to your portfolio or relevant project descriptions with your application

  • Experience with digital design products, such as Figma, InVision, Photoshop, Sketch, etc.

title: Experiential Graphic Designer
description:
IA Interior Architects translates client goals, brand and culture into powerful environments built around people, processes, technologies and business drivers.  Our clients in diverse markets worldwide require high-performance, visually compelling and sustainable environments to move their enterprise forward, support their culture, engage their staff, integrate technology and drive efficiencies.  As architects, designers, workplace strategists and environmental specialists in the largest global architecture firm concentrating exclusively on interiors, we help clients articulate and align their business strategies and core values with the dynamic use of space.

Our team members are collaborative, creative, professional, expert and entrepreneurial.  Joining our team requires skill, daring, leadership, teaming, humor and a love of interiors.  We are presently searching for a full-time  Experiential Graphic Designer in our Toronto studio. Working under general supervision of a Senior EGD or Director of EGD, the Experiential Graphic Designer designs and develops a variety of deliverables, including brand development, signage and environmental graphics programs.

Specific responsibilities will includes:

• Actively participates in and oversees the design, development and production of environmental graphics
• Creates innovative, creative and complete design concepts and presents to clients
• Prepares plans, message schedules, sections, elevations and detailed drawing packages
• Manages the budget, scope and schedule for the environmental graphic design portion of projects
• Creates and maintains effective key agency relationships

REQUIRED EDUCATION AND WORK EXPERIENCE
• Bachelor’s degree in Graphics, Industrial Design or Interior Design, or equivalent experience
• 5+ years’ experience with 3D/2D graphics, signage, digital printing

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
• Working knowledge of the commercial interior architecture and/or design industry
• Demonstrated competency in all phases of environmental graphics
• Understanding of branding concepts and the potential for their application to, relationship with and integration into the built environment
• Skilled visual sense and understanding of typography, composition, multiple media platforms, legibility, standards development, documentation, fabrication and implementation
• Sound Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign skills
•  Knowledge of video editing, interactive design, industrial design and 3D design/visualization and softwares (Autodesk 3dsmax, Vray) will be plus.
• Excellent verbal, graphic and written communication skills.

Working Conditions:
For the majority of the time the Experiental Graphic Designer will be sitting in a studio with limited physical requirements.  This may require individuals to bend, stretch, twist and reach.  On occasion individuals will be required to visit a client site to perform site verifications and field surveys.  The position is not subject to occupational and safety risks.

Please submit a portfolio or work examples with your application 

IA Interior Architects is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veteran

title: Senior Graphic Designer
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Senior Graphic Designerfor our Regina, SK location.

This position is to provide expert design (digital and print) and creative services as part of Brandt’s in-house Branding and Creative team. The senior graphic designer will work with Creative Managers, Art Directors, Account Managers, and other creative team members on a diverse range of projects including corporate and marketing collateral, events materials, large format graphics, advertisements and related materials. The senior designer will provide design services and design leadership within project teams, delivering consistently effective and brand consistent solutions.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Designing graphic content, illustrations, and infographics
  • Managing graphic design work from conception to delivery
  • Guiding and nurturing designers and junior designers
  • Generating fresh and original concepts
  • Ensuring brand consistency throughout various marketing projects.
  • Communicating well with account and design team members to manage expectations
  • Keeping up-to-date with industry developments
  • Building constructive and collaborative relationships with other Marketing Team members
  • Investing in product and business category knowledge
  • Strong working knowledge of graphic production and design fundamentals
  • Highest level of attention to detail with creative and artistic ability
  • Expert skills in InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop on a Mac platform.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office, After-Effects, Premiere, and Sketchup is an advantage
  • Ability to manage a diverse workload
  • Computer literate: Technical knowledge of related programs and computer software

Core Competencies

  • Working well with others
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Presenting and communicating information
  • Achieving personal work goals and objectives
  • Planning and organizing
  • A determination to achieve and succeed
  • Meeting deadlines under pressure
  • Ability to work independently
  • Willingness to seek and listen to feedback, and use it to improve
  • Diploma or Undergraduate degree in Graphic Design
  • Minimum of 5 years of applicable experience
  • Current portfolio of work samples

To apply for this position, please submit an online portfolio in addition to a resume.

title: Content Creator
description:
The Acquisition Group is a marketing consulting firm that introduces businesses to new opportunities for growth and expansion. We find opportunities for our clients and design unique marketing and direct-to-consumer campaigns to generate sales.

The ideal candidate will be experienced with the latest social media trends and content creation. You will be working closely with our marketing team and VP in a fast-paced environment.

Perks

title: Graphic Designer-Amico Corporation
description:
The Amico group of companies is looking for a full-time Graphic Designer who can excel in a fast-paced, demanding environment. Working as part of a marketing team, the candidate must be a positive, energetic, professional individual who has a passion for creativity and proven experience with the Adobe Creative Suite.

Qualifications:
  • Proficient in the use of the Adobe Suite of programs including InDesign, Photoshop, and Illustrator
  • Strong project management skills to work on multiple projects from concept to implementation
  • Works well under pressure, displays good organizational skills and can multitask to meet deadlines.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively interact with a variety of individuals throughout the company
  • Excellent understanding of colour, space, and print methodologies
  • Exceptional layout and typography skills
  • Able to prepare designs for digital and print publications
  • Knowledge of print production processes, developing print specifications and preparing print-ready materials
  • Photo manipulation, editing, and compositing as required
  • Expert attention to detail with an eye for catching inconsistencies
  • Continuous self-learning and keeping up to date with relevant programs
  • Fluent in English with exceptional grammar and proofreading skills
  • Post-secondary education in graphic design, with 2 years work experience


Responsibilities:
  • Design sales and marketing materials such as brochures, catalogues, flyers, signs, and large format tradeshow elements using the Adobe Creative Suite programs
  • Manage your projects from concept to completion, including: coordinating content and approvals; creating press-ready files; and checking final proofs
  • Creativity to turn basic concepts into designs
  • Follow structured file naming systems
  • Maintain brand consistency throughout all projects
  • Collaborate with multiple departments (e.g., marketing, sales, engineering)

Only qualified candidates will be contacted.
For more information please visit us at www.amico.com

title: Lookdev Artist
description:
Company Description

As a company founded and run by an artist, it's our mission to provide talented artists with the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.

Job Description

The Lookdev Artist creates shading to ensure that models and textures are combined into hyper-realistic assets, ensuring to meet the high quality standards of Rodeo FX.

Main responsibilities:

  • Develop looks to ensure assets can be properly lit and are technically correct to help create hyper-realistic passes;
  • Take assets from the texturing department and push surface qualities further in terms of realism;
  • Finalize assets technically and artistically, validating work with turntables and various tech checks;
  • Create lighting setups that become reference shots for sequences;
  • Set up Nuke scripts that will be used by the compositing and lighting department;
  • Set up and maintain a preset shader bank for different surface qualities;
  • Work closely with the CG and Asset Supervisor to find creative and technical solutions and approaches that enhance assets and shots, while meeting project specifications and deadlines;
  • May participate in the development of tools and techniques for the department;
  • Perform quality control on assets before they are submitted for review/approval, ensuring all technical and creative standards are met, and promptly apply notes received;
  • Keep Production and the project team informed of the status of work, issues to be resolved, ramifications of problems encountered and recommend potential solutions;
  • Ensure deadlines are met, advising the project team promptly if delays could be expected.
Qualifications

  • Experience in a similar position, within the VFX industry;
  • Excellent knowledge of Katana software and Nuke;
  • Good knowledge of Arnold; 
  • Excellent sense of prioritization and respect of deadlines.


Additional Information

  • Full-time contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution;

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Painters Needed for the Summer!
description:
We’re hiring full time painters for the summer!

We are looking for individuals who want to be a part of a fun, high energy team and who love being outdoors!

Why is this the perfect summer position?

  • Work with your friends and roommates.
  • 40 PLUS hours available per week, earn $11,000- $14,000 this summer!
  • Work outside and get into shape.
  • Room to advance throughout the season to crew foreman or production manager.

Duties include:

  • Preparing, cleaning and repairing interior and exterior surfaces.
  • Applying paint, stains and other finishes using brushes, rollers and spray equipment.
  • Use of ladders, must not be afraid of heights!

Previous painting experience is an asset, but not required! If you have a can-do attitude and great work ethic, we will provide all training. Labour experience such as landscaping, warehouse and heavy equipment work, grounds crew and athletics are also considered assets.

 Apply now!

title: Level (Environment) Artist
description:
Company Description

People Can Fly is one of the leading independent AAA games development studios with an international team of hundreds of talented individuals working from offices located in Poland, UK, US, and Canada, and from all over the world thanks to our remote work programs.

Founded in 2002, we made our mark on the shooter genre with titles such as Painkiller, Bulletstorm, Gears of War: Judgment, and Outriders. We are one of the most experienced Unreal Engine studios in the industry and we are expanding it with in-house solutions called PCF Framework.

Our creative teams are currently working on several exciting AAA projects with the top publishers in the industry: Project Gemini with Square Enix and Project Dagger with Take-Two (2K), in addition to a new IP to be self-published and two other games in a concept phase. One of our IPs is also being adapted for VR technology.

With over 20 years of experience, PCF sets out to explore new horizons. We aim to combine our expertise with creativity of the best and most forward-thinking talents in the industry to work together on the new generation of action games for the global gaming community.

If you decide to accompany us on this journey, you’ll have a chance to perfect your craft and expand your knowledge, working alongside leaders in the industry on bringing a brand-new unique experience to the players worldwide.

Project Gemini is a yet unannounced AAA game developed with Square Enix – the publisher of our recent AAA title, Outriders. The game development involves primarily our Europe based teams.

If you feel yourself able to deliver as nobody else, take ownership of your projects, and are ready to leave a mark on a game you work on, apply now!

Job Description

  • Creating world geometry and composition for levels in Unreal Engine
  • Effectively producing playable levels based on Art directors vision and Level design needs with lead cooperation
  • Redesigning existing assets to new forms
  • Blocking out modules and levels, creating first materials
  • Maintaining production and workflow pipelines within given deadlines
Qualifications

  • 3 years of experience in creating world geometry for levels
  • Experience working with Unreal Engine
  • Ability to use PBR shaders and normal maps on a daily basis
  • Experience creating high quality creative/visual aesthetics as well as technical knowledge
  • Being able to adapt fast to a specific art style
  • Ability to adapt with guidance and improve, new styles, techniques, and workflows
  • Basic understanding of the color theory
  • Good verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Open-minded team player attitude
  • Strong work ethic and self-motivated
  • Passionate about playing and making video games

Nice to have

  • Shipped-title experience
  • Shader setting experience
  • Experience with industry-standard software packages for 3D modeling, high poly sculpting, and texture painting (Maya, Max, ZBrush, Photoshop, or their equivalents)
  • Experience creating photorealistic set pieces, props, textures, and materials on next-gen console platforms
  • Ability to show examples of top-notch props and textures made for next-gen console games
  • Making high poly meshes and baking them down on a low poly
  • Creating high-quality environment assets and gadgets suitable technically and artistically to project universe


Additional Information

What we offer:

U.S.

  • 100% group health insurance benefit premiums paid by PCF (Medical, Dental, Vision, Group Life, and Supplemental Live) and start on day 1 of employment.
  • 401K with 100% match, up to 3% of employee salary, and vested immediately.
  • Paid week off during Winter Holidays.
  • 20 paid vacation days and 5 paid sick days.
  • Free virtual health and mental wellbeing sessions included in the plan for members and their dependents.
  • A competitive salary and performance-based annual bonuses.
  • Personal development opportunities and ability to work in a global environment.
  • Work in a creative team with people full of passion for what they do.
  • Long term disability, short term disability, travel insurance, as well as other benefits provided. 

Canada

  • Benefit package 100% paid by PCF. Insurance company reimburses 100% of claims (Up to $500 per service a year, as well as individual family coverage).
  • Full Dental coverage, including major dental and orthodontics.
  • 4% RRSP matching before tax deductions, 100% vested on day 1.
  • Paid week off during Winter Holidays.
  • 20 paid vacation days and 5 paid sick days.
  • Free virtual health and mental wellbeing sessions included in the plan for members and their dependents.
  • A competitive salary and performance-based annual bonuses.
  • Personal development opportunities and ability to work in a global environment.
  • Work in a creative team with people full of passion for what they do.
  • Long term disability, as well as other benefits provided.

title: Storyboard Artists
description:
Calling all Storyboard Artists! Is comedy your jam? We are looking for talented storyboard artists to join us on Seth Rogen's Animated Project for Amazon Studios! Come and work for Stellar, where we hire exactly that - STELLARS!

About Us:

At Stellar Creative Lab we live, breathe, and dream animation. We foster a creative and collaborative culture where we face challenges as a team and flourish together.  Stellar is a thriving company that will support and mentor your objectives. Curious? - Contact us!

Summary:

In your role as a Storyboard Artist, you will collaborate with the Directors and the Storyboard team to bring these hilarious stories to life! A partner who works well in a team environment enjoys bringing ideas to the table and is passionate about storytelling. 

What We Need:

  • Think outside the box! What can we try that nobody else has? We want to experiment and explore these ideas with you! 
  • Collaborate with the Directors, Supervisors, and Client to discuss storytelling direction, design requirements, and expected level of polish for each episode.
  • Provide 3 stages of Storyboards - from thumbnails to roughs, to digitally polished storyboard panels, with attention to clarity and entertainment value.
  • Talent for staging, shot composition, screen direction, and cutting for effective Storytelling.
  • Ensuring continuity from shot-to-shot in assigned sequences, as well as collaborating with other story artists to ensure continuity from sequence to sequence.
  • Ensure storyboards align with the creative goals of the leadership team, deadlines, and storytelling objectives.
  • Provide status updates, troubleshoot, and review potential changes on a regular basis with production staff.
  • Strong ability to work as a team with directors and supervisors, accepting creative criticism and feedback where needed with the knowledge that the creative process is all about development.
  • A great sense of humor is ideal.

Your Experience, Talents, and Abilities:

  • Industry experience as a storyboard artist with a focus on action and/or comedy.
  • Experience boarding for 3D CG-series is a definite asset.
  • Excellent drawing and staging skills with a demonstrated sense of storytelling, staging, composition, camera work and character acting
  • Proven ability to manage time and meet deadlines
  • Advanced knowledge of Storyboard Pro
  • Understanding digital file management protocols.
  • Able to work efficiently on a timeline, while maintaining consistency and quality
  • Eligible to work in B.C.

Live in Squamish? Kelowna? Vancouver Island? Somewhere in BC with a great internet connection? We can work with that! Stellar Creative Lab encourages artists to work where they live and love where they work.  Join us - we have some amazing opportunities.

 

 

In response to the COVID - 19 pandemic, Stellar Creative Lab is able to offer the following benefits:

  • the option to work at the studio as well as remotely across British Columbia
  • ongoing health and safety training
  • support for your ergonomic workspace at home

title: Painter
description:
About us

Georgian Bay Painting is a small business in Thornbury, ON. We are rewarding, autonomous, and professional, and our goal is to provide opportunities to develop individuals into professional painters .

Our work environment includes:

  • Safe work environment
  • Casual work attire
  • Regular social events
  • On-the-job training
  • Growth opportunities

At Georgian Bay Painting we produce interior/exterior paint and staining projects to local residents and commercial spaces. Our team is filled with a great group of individuals that create an amazing culture to work in.

Location

You are never at a fixed location, sites vary from day to day ranging from Meaford to the Blue Mountains.

Work Experience

No previous painting experience is required. We train painters to be precise and hardworking. You gain all the fundamentals needed to complete both interior and exterior paint jobs from start to finish.

Compensation

Pay ranges from $20-$23/hr and if you are hired as a crew manager you have the opportunity to make commission from every job on top of your hourly rate. This job is also piece work, meaning you get paid per job (e.g - you make $20/hr and it's a 4 hour budget but you complete it in 2 hours you would make $40/hr)

Benefits

  • Working outdoors
  • Autonomy and responsibility of job sites
  • Learn the ins and outs of a growing business
  • An easy path to promotions and management roles

Please reach out if you are interested, we would be more than happy to add you to our team.

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary

Salary: $20.00-$23.00 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
We take all the necessary COVID-19 protocols needed to protect both our clients and employees. This includes wearing face masks when inside and sanitizing frequently on the job site.

We train painters to be precise and hardworking. You gain all the fundamentals needed to complete both interior and exterior paint jobs from start to finish.']

title: Painter
description:
We are looking for motivated individuals to join our painting team! The painter role is a fun and challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to get hands-on work experience. The ideal individual is hard working, coachable, and has effective communication skills. 

Compensation: Top painters can make 20- 28$/hour; average rate is 17.50$/hour.

About the position:

  •  Fast paced, fun environment
  • Hands on experience in customer service and communication
  • Work outdoors with a crew of 2-3 people
Requirements:
  • Must have own transportation (job site locations change frequently)
  • Manual labor and ladder work required

Working with friends is encouraged, so apply together if you wish!

title: Painter
description:
The Role:

PWP is looking for motivated individuals who want to kick-start their painting career to join our spring/summer painting team! PWP specializes in both interior and exterior re-paints, as well as new construction, apartment buildings, townhouse complexes, and residential homes. This season alone, our team will be responsible for painting 75-100 homes, in addition to numerous other projects.

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Preparation of surfaces, including scraping, sanding, cleaning and priming surfaces
  • Site protection and masking of necessary areas prior to painting
  • Professional cutting in and edging
  • Using a sprayer or brush and roller to paint a variety of substrates including but not limited to: drywall, wood trimming and fascia, stucco, wood siding, concrete, and aluminum
  • Removal and installation of hardware and fixtures
  • General cleanup of job site
  • Converse with clients on the job site to establish needs and ensure overall satisfaction

Who You Are:

  • Positive, team player
  • Reliable transportation and the ability to travel to different job sites in the lower mainland
  • Comfortable working from ladders
  • Strong communication skills
  • Previous painting experience is an asset, but not required

Benefits:

  • Training and development – kick-start your painting career by learning how to paint the interior and exterior of homes and commercial buildings
  • Competitive wages – earn up to $25 an hour or more depending on experience, as well as performance-based promotions
  • Growth opportunities – motivated individuals have the ability to grow with us and work all year round
  • Rewarding company culture – monthly team building and marketing events
  • Work in a variety of environments, both indoor and outdoor

title: Painter
description:
Our painting team is looking for motivated individuals to join our spring/summer painting team going into the season of 2022!

We are looking for the absolute hardest-working, most motivated people in Cochrane ,AB who want to join a team of top performers who want to earn what they are worth and optimize their cash flow over a summer!

This season alone, our team has set the goal of providing 100+ top-quality paint jobs in the Cochrane area, with one strategy in mind: satisfied clients that create a happy work atmosphere and reward employees. 

About this job:

  • Fast-paced, fun environment 
  • Hands-on experience in customer service and communication
  • Working outdoors with a crew of 2-3 people
  • Working with friends is encouraged, so apply together and note this in your application, we love hiring teams of rockstars!
  • Training is provided; therefore, no experience is necessary!
  • We are currently hiring Painters and Crew Chiefs for this season. Both positions are full-time summer jobs and can lead to job security in the years to come and future promotion opportunities within the company for those with the right attitude!

What will be expected of you: 

  • Positive Attitude (My team hires for attitude and trains for skill)
  • Reliable Transportation (As we will be working at many different job sites you must 100% be capable of getting around town. The team may be required to move job sites mid-day and you must be able to accommodate this, no exceptions!) 
  • Motivation for $$$ (With this company you truly get out what you put in)
  • Ability to work from ladders (if you are afraid of heights, this job is not for you)
  • Ability to work with clients and always represent our company respectably
  • Ability to complete and provide certifications for required training provided
  • Ability to ensure proper time management and punctuality (lateness is not tolerated)
  • Referring our services to friends and family.
  • A strong mindset dedicated to learning and self-improvement


What benefits will you get? 

  • Full training on how to paint the interior and exterior of residential/commercial buildings as well as top-notch safety training.
  • Lots of opportunities to earn more with greater efficiency, as well as company-offered prizes and incentives.
  • Pay exceeding $20-30/hr for exemplary painters (Starting rate dependent on experience. Raises based on proven skill after the start date. (Bonuses will depend on performance and the criteria established by the business Owner/Operator.)
  • Working with other like-minded and fun individuals. 
  • Excellent training and strong mentorships are provided during bi-weekly P.A.D meetings.
  • Working outside in the fresh air! 
  • A glowing reference to help beef up your resume!


Position Descriptions

  • Painter: This role is a fun but incredibly challenging position that is ideal for someone wanting to get hands-on work experience and make money reflective of their efforts over the summer. The ideal individual is hard-working, coachable, and has effective communication skills. You will be sometimes required to work at heights or for long hours in warm weather so needless to say endurance is an asset.
  • Crew Chief: In addition to painting, you would gain experience in leadership and management while running a crew of 2-3 people in this role. This would include motivating your team, solving client issues, training additional painters, managing other tasks on job sites, and conveying that information to the company owner.

Bonuses and Incentives, as well as pay increases, are provided for people willing to show exceptional initiative.
 

If this job sounds like the right fit for you then please get in contact with us! We would love to hear from you and set up an interview.  Please email your RESUME and COVER LETTER to Mackenzie Chisholm or call 403-813-1875 to set up an interview!

Currently Hiring for Summer painting season beginning in MAY 2022.

title: Paint and Roto Artist
description:
Paint and Roto Artists work closely with Compositors to help them integrate all elements of an image, including CG and live action, to create film visual effects shots. This includes creating mattes for CG hold-outs as well as using various techniques and software to remove items such as wires, rigs and tracking markers.


Responsibilities:

  • Analyze shots for components breakdown with minimal supervision
  • Understand feedback given by supervisors
  • Create roto mattes for Compositors to use and has a comprehensive understanding of how these mattes will be used
  • Demonstrate the ability to use different techniques to remove rigs and tracking markers
  • Strong eye for color and understand grain structure and successfully de-grains scans and re-grains paint work for further use
  • Extensive understanding of 2D and 3D tracking and is able to create accurate, steady tracks
  • Create foreground mattes for Animators to use within Maya
  • Reconstruct plates or part of the plates even if the elements do not exist
  • Research appropriate references and respect sequence continuity to ensure cohesive delivery
  • Use expressions within Nuke to help aid paint work
  • Understanding of the 3D environment within Nuke and is able to use geo data to
  • project clean plates and understand how to use UV projections
  • Accurately bid on how long paint and roto shots will take to complete
  • Proactively learn and/or develop specific Framestore gizmos and workflows
  • Complete basic composites in Nuke and demonstrate keying, grading, re-timing and screeninsertion skills
  • Demonstrate a willingness to learn new techniques and software and to share this knowledgewith other artists in the department


Essential Skills:

  • Traditional art and design skills including a knowledge of composition and colour
  • Previous use of Nuke
  • Prior knowledge of a Linux based operating system
  • An understanding of motion blur and how it affects mattes and patches
  • Prior use of a roto-scoping package, ideally Silhouette
  • A desire to learn new techniques and teach fellow artists
  • An Arts or Science degree in a moving picture or art related subject
  • Excellent organisational and communication skills
  • Team-working abilities
  • The ability to take criticism and feedback
  • Good problem solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively with other artists

Desirable Skills:

  • Prior experience in a Paint and Roto role
  • 3D Maya interface experience
  • An understanding of Python scripting and how to use this to create and edit Framestore gizmos
  • Planar and point tracking software experience
  • A general understanding of the VFX production and comp workflows
  • A knowledge of photography and practical lighting

Framestore is proud to employ extraordinary talent across all genders, races, nationalities, religions, ages, abilities and sexual preferences. We aim to encourage and support all of our current and future employees to achieve their potential. No job applicant will receive less favourable treatment on any basis when applying for a career with us.

title: Senior Roto-Paint Artist
description:
About Pixomondo: 

Founded in 2001 by CEO and Executive Producer Thilo Kuther, Pixomondo is a solutions-oriented design company that solves creative challenges for our clients and partners. Whether we are crafting never-before-seen visual effects for a feature film or developing innovative original concepts for a global marketing campaign, we leverage our collaborative design process to develop truly award-winning work. Our passion is to deliver the best ideas at the highest levels of quality on-time and on-budget, with the outstanding service you expect from a world-class company.

â€¢ Good written and oral communication skills.

â€¢ Work hand in hand with Comp for basic to advanced paint tasks. 

â€¢ Provide estimates and deliver quality work within established deadlines.

â€¢ Share knowledge and help members of the team with their tasks.

 

Additional Requirements:
Ideal candidate will be eligible to work in Canada/already present in Canada.

title: Senior Web Visual Designer - Remote (US & CAD)
description:
This position is open to applicants in the US and Canada

ABOUT OUR COMPANY

Kanopi Studios is a Design, Development & Support Agency with a fully distributed team of people who are experts in Drupal & WordPress.

Our clients have a mission; we design, build and support websites that help their mission thrive.

But we want our employees to thrive as well. Because our team members do great work for great clients, Kanopi works hard to support them in their career as they continue to create a better web.

As a result, our business continues to grow, and so must our team. We’re excited to announce this opportunity to join our team as a Senior Web Visual Designer.

ABOUT THE JOB

We are seeking a talented Senior Web Visual Designer to join our Creative Services team. The role requires not only your impeccable design skills and passion for art & technology but also expertise in client management, problem-solving, and strategic thinking. This is a great opportunity for a creative, eloquent, and organized designer to make a large impact on a growing department, with plenty of independence and flexibility within the role.

This is a fully remote position and reports to the Manager of Creative Services.

RESPONSIBILITIES

You can expect to:

  • Generate end-to-end visual strategy and collateral for our clients including but not limited to: strategic direction, pattern libraries, mood boards, wireframes, UI visuals, and high fidelity prototypes.
  • Collaborate with our Content and UX Strategists to craft experiences that are not only visually appealing but effective at balancing user goals and business needs.
  • Assist our internal marketing team by providing design support to further our ongoing marketing objectives.
  • Be Kanopi’s advocate for design by articulating and defending your design rationale to both internal stakeholders and clients.
  • Work closely with our Project Management team to define project deliverables and delivery schedules.
  • Contribute to website visual design direction and collaboration with the creative services team.
  • Provide mentorship to intermediate and junior team members in the form of constructive feedback and recommendations on project deliverables.


ABOUT THE COMPENSATION & WORK REQUIREMENTS

This is a full-time position. The salary range for this position is $80-105k - base salary is commensurate with experience. This is a 100% remote role, but you must live and be able to work in the US or Canada.

NOW... LET'S TALK ABOUT YOU!

Requirements

We are looking for candidates who demonstrate the following skills and competencies:

  • A strong portfolio showcasing your understanding of user-centered, responsive website design.
  • 5+ years of professional experience designing responsive and mobile website products.
  • 3+ years of experience working within an agency setting.
  • Familiarity with design and communications tools including Figma, Adobe Creative Cloud, Slack, and Google suite of tools.
  • Capability to communicate ideas to a wide range of audiences while incorporating constructive feedback.
  • Comfortable working remotely within a distributed team.
  • Comfortable working in both waterfall and agile environments.
  • Able to manage multiple projects with evolving requirements.
  • Familiarity with front-end web design practices and coding is a plus but not required.
  • Experience with mission-driven and nonprofit clients is a plus.
  • Have a passion for the web, open-source development, and working with a community of fun, humorous folks!


At Kanopi, we believe a variety of backgrounds, experiences, and voices make for a better workplace. We strongly and enthusiastically encourage people of color, individuals who identify within and beyond the LGBTQ+ spectrum, women, and people with disabilities to apply.

NOW, WHAT?

If you think this post was written just for you, here’s what to do next:

  1. Submit your resume and a link to your portfolio.
  2. Answer the questions you see here on this page.
  3. Send us a cover letter.

Now… About that cover letter… This is VERY important!

Please include all of the typical reasons why you’d be an outstanding candidate for this position, plus answer this question: What is your favorite piece of technology?

Our screening process takes a bit of time because we like to ensure that you are the perfect fit for us, and we are the perfect fit for you! After we’ve taken a look at your application, we will send you a series of questions that will help us get to know you better. From there, you will engage in several interviews with members of our team. Some candidates may even do a skills assessment or paid mini-project, depending on the role you are interviewing for. We’ll be happy to explain a bit more once we’re in the interview stage.

Please note - we try to make an effort to contact every applicant to let you know the status of your application, but we are human, so if you don’t hear from us, drop us a line!

Benefits

Fully Remote: Work where and when you do your best. It’s about feeling connected to others, having a flexible schedule and staying healthy.

Top Talent: Since we are not limited by walls, our ability to hire the best is limitless. Collaborate, learn and surround yourself with a strongly skilled and diverse team.

This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by those assigned to this classification. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by those occupying this position. The job description and job functions described herein are subject to possible modification by Kanopi Studios in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

No agencies, recruiters or overseas applicants (for consideration, applicants must live in the US or Canada).


By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Our Story

About You:You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!About Us:Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.Of course we love it here, but outsiders think we’re pretty great too: Avison Young was awarded the prestigious America’s Best Midsize Employers for 2022, presented by Forbes and Statista, Inc. We’re proud to be regularly recognized for our team, services and culture and our team members enjoy comprehensive compensation and benefit programs. Through our customized work options, we give our people the flexibility to create a work environment that puts their overall well-being first. After all, we are powered by people.

Overview

We are seeking a talented, creative and driven Graphic Designer to work within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. An individual who thrives on maintaining responsibility for the design and visual aspects of each assignment, working closely across a variety of divisions including Investment, Office Leasing, Industrial and Retail. You will be part of the world’s fastest-growing commercial real estate services firm market with an opportunity to work alongside and learn from some of the best in the industry in an open, collaborative culture of respect and professional growth.

Responsibilities

Primary Duties and Responsibilities

 

Reporting to the Senior Marketing Manager, the Graphic Designer is required to perform a range of duties including, but not limited to:

 

Graphic Design
• Manage the design and layout of various marketing materials (flyers, surveys, brochures, sales advertisements, proposals, presentations) in line with brand purpose and messaging
• Provide creative and innovative approaches to marketing programs for various sales teams and service lines
• Manage and prepare email marketing campaigns using marketing automation platform (Buildout and Hubspot)
• Thrive in a fast paced, dynamic and ever evolving real estate environment
• Be solution focused and able to provide creative results to unique challenges
• Other special projects as required or assigned

 

Administrative
• Provide administrative support to management and other staff
• Handle sensitive and highly confidential information
• Reception duties are minimal yet required for covering breaks and other duties:
• Prepare and review correspondence, reports and presentations

Qualifications

Qualifications

  • Diploma or Post-Secondary education in Graphic Design or a minimum of 3 years’ professional work experience as a Graphic Designer is required.

Proficiency in the use of specific computer programs:

 

o    Advanced knowledge of InDesign

o    Intermediate knowledge of Photoshop and Illustrator

o    Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Outlook, Excel & PowerPoint)

o    Experience using marketing automation platforms is preferred, but not required

o    Experience using Hubspot is a plus

  • Experience in the design/printing/publishing industry is an asset
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Recognized ability to work as a collaborative team member and provide support an individual or team
  • Strong organizational skills, uncanny attention to detail and ability to prioritize
  • Ability to work well under pressure, handle multiple assignments and work efficiently to meet tight deadlines 
  • Demonstrated problem solving and ability to use discretion 

 

 

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

 

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world.  We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law. For those requiring assistance with disabilities, Information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY! To learn more about us, please visit our website: avisonyoung.ca.

title: Lead Designer (Contract)

<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Bounteous is looking for a Contract Lead Designer to join our team. The Lead Designer is responsible for leading and contributing to the quality, creativity and delivery of projects. The ideal candidate must be able to establish design direction and take ideas from concept to execution, for campaigns and/or digital experiences (websites, mobile applications, digital marketing, social media assets, email, etc.) for a wide variety of clients across industry verticals. 

The Lead Designer ensures work upholds brand identity standards, meets business objectives and user expectations, and integrates usability best practices. This position works closely with Experience Designers, Front- and Back-End Developers, Content Specialists, Project Managers, and clients. Being user and client -focused, the ability to work well independently and confidently lead in a team environment is a must!




#LI-Remote

We invite you to subscribe to our monthly and quarterly newsletters to stay up to date with the latest job openings as well as resources and tips for job seekers here.

Research shows that women and other underrepresented groups apply only if they meet 100% of the criteria of a job posting. If you have passion and intelligence, and possess a technical knack (even if you’re missing some of the above), we encourage you to apply.

Bounteous is focused on promoting an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate the different viewpoints and experiences our diverse group of team members bring to Bounteous. Bounteous does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. 

Bounteous is willing to sponsor eligible candidates for employment visas.

We welcome applications from all qualified candidates.

**Must be legally eligible to work in Canada.</section>

title: Concepteur∙trice graphique Production - Stage- Été 2022
description:
The Production Graphic Designer is responsible for creating and editing various marketing materials through various digital and print projects. The Production Graphic Designer must ensure that all pertaining work respects Behaviour standards and its corporate identity and any brand associated with the project. 

To be considered for this internship, you must:
- Submit your portfolio along with your resume;
- Be eligible to work in Canada at the time of your application;
- Be available to work 37.5 hours a week.

Internships dates are flexible, depending on the business needs and the candidate’s availabilities.

What you will do:

  • Under the supervision of the Art Director, create and maintain various marketing assets, including presentations, logos, advertising (digital & print), tradeshow signs, assets for video, web promotional elements, and all collateral images;
  • Design and produce marketing graphic for the various internal brands and licensed products;
  • Update collateral and assets with new material or modified layouts;
  • Responsible for the quality and accuracy of content, ensuring proper sign-off and final approvals from the Art Director;
  • Collaborate and support other members of the team for their specific design needs. 

What we're looking for:

  • Degree in graphic design;
  • Comfortable on a Windows platform;
  • Well versed in the Adobe Suite, mainly Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects and XD will be an asset;
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (PowerPoint, Word, etc.);
  • Strong attention to details;
  • Creative, conscientious, methodical, and organized;
  • Willing to learn new design methodologies;
  • Team player with the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced team environment;
  • Ability to work with multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize projects and meet deadlines;
  • Bilingual (French and English) written and spoken.

Ce que vous ferez:

  • Sous la supervision du∙de la directeur∙trice artistique, créer et maintenir différents éléments marketing tels des présentations, des logos, de la publicité (numérique et imprimée), des visuels pour les expositions commerciales, des vidéos, des éléments promotionnels pour le web et des images connexes;
  • Conceptualiser et produire des éléments de marketing graphiques pour différentes marques internes et produits sous licence;
  • Mettre à jour les images connexes et autres éléments en harmonie avec le nouveau matériel ou avec la nouvelle mise en page;
  • Superviser la qualité et l’exactitude du contenu, notamment son approbation initiale et son approbation finale par le∙la directeur∙trice artistique;
  • Collaborer et offrir un soutien aux autres membres de l’équipe pour leurs besoins spécifiques en termes de design.

Ce que nous recherchons :

  • Diplôme en conception graphique;
  • À l’aise dans l’environnement Windows;
  • Excellentes connaissances de la Suite Adobe (Photoshop, Illustrator; After Effects et XD) un atout;
  • Connaissance des applications de Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word, etc.);
  • Souci du détail;
  • Créatif∙ve, consciencieux∙se, méthodique et organisé∙e;
  • Désir d’apprendre de nouveaux concepts et méthodologies;
  • Joueur∙euse d’équipe ayant la capacité de travailler de façon collaborative dans un environnement au rythme rapide;
  • Capacité à travailler sur de multiples projets de façon simultanée et à prioriser les projets selon les échéanciers;
  • Bilinguisme (français et anglais) à l’oral et à l’écrit.
Le∙la concepteur∙trice graphique, Production, est responsable de créer et d’itérer différents éléments marketing destinés à des projets numériques et imprimés. Le∙la concepteur∙trice graphique doit assurer que l’ensemble des éléments sur lesquels il∙elle travaille respectent les normes de Behaviour en ce qui a trait à son image de marque, et celles des autres marques associées au projet.

Pour être considéré.e pour cette opportunité de stage tu dois :  
- Joindre un portfolio à ton application;
- Être éligible à travailler au moment de soumettre ta candidature;
- Être disponible pour travailler 37.5 heures par semaine.

Les dates de stage sont flexibles, dépendamment des besoins d’affaires ainsi que des disponibilités des candidats.

title: Lead Level Designer
description:
Company Description

People Can Fly is one of the leading independent AAA games development studios with an international team of hundreds of talented individuals working from offices located in Poland, UK, US, and Canada, and from all over the world thanks to our remote work programs.

Founded in 2002, we made our mark on the shooter genre with titles such as Painkiller, Bulletstorm, Gears of War: Judgment, and Outriders. We are one of the most experienced Unreal Engine studios in the industry and we are expanding it with in-house solutions called PCF Framework.

Our creative teams are currently working on several exciting AAA projects with the top publishers in the industry: Project Gemini with Square Enix and Project Dagger with Take-Two (2K), in addition to a new IP to be self-published and two other games in a concept phase. One of our IPs is also being adapted for VR technology.

With over 20 years of experience, now PCF sets to explore new horizons. We aim to combine our expertise with creativity of the best and most forward-thinking talents in the industry to work together on the new generation of action games for the global gaming community.

If you will decide to accompany us on this journey, you’ll have a chance to perfect your craft and expand your knowledge, working alongside leaders in the industry on bringing a brand-new unique experience to the players worldwide.

If you feel yourself able to deliver as nobody else, take ownership of your projects, and ready to leave a mark on a game you work on, apply now!

Job Description

 

  • Lead entire level design team.
  • Work hand in hand with the Creative Director to iterate, implement and execute on key design and level building principles
  • Block out and build levels and iterate through playtesting and providing/implementing feedback
  • Work with the art team to make sure that levels are up to the highest visual quality while retaining the gameplay and fun as well
  • Take full level ownership – from paper design, through the whitebox phase, script, iteration, debugging, optimization – until our game ships
  • Provide mentorship, troubleshooting, debugging and problem-solving assistance to members of the level design team
  • Proactively identify cross-discipline challenges and risks to the project and offer solutions
  • Foster a culture of open, honest, and respectful communication across all disciplines
Qualifications

  • Expert in level design both in practice and theory (chokepoints, routes, lines of sight, engagement distances)
  • 7 Years of professional level design experience including leading a level design team
  • At least 2 successfully shipped AAA games on PC or console
  • Self-motivation and ability to prioritize and deliver best quality work on deadlines
  • Ability to process, understand and implement feedback
  • High work ethic and self-motivated 

PREFERENCE TO APPLICANTS WITH

  • UE4 knowledge


Additional Information

U.S

  • 100% group health insurance benefit premiums paid by PCF (Medical, Dental, Vision, Group Life, and Supplemental Live) and start on day 1 of employment.
  • 401K with 100% match, up to 3% of employee salary, and vested immediately.
  • 20 paid vacation days, 9 paid holidays, plus a week during Winter Holidays, and 5 sick days per year.
  • Free virtual health care and mental wellbeing counseling.
  • A competitive salary and performance-based bonuses based on role.
  • Personal development opportunities and ability to work in a global environment.
  • Work in a creative team with people full of passion for what they do.

Canada

  • 20 paid vacation days, plus a week during Winter Holidays, and 5 sick days per year.
  • Benefit package 100% paid by PCF. Insurance company reimburses 100% of claims (Up to $500 per service a year, as well as individual family coverage).
  • Full Dental coverage, including major dental and orthodontics.
  • Free virtual health care and mental wellbeing counseling.
  • Long term disability, salary matching life insurance, as well as other benefits provided.
  • 4% RRSP matching before tax deductions, 100% vested on day 1.
  • A competitive salary and performance-based bonuses based on role.
  • Personal development opportunities and ability to work in a global environment.
  • Work in a creative team with people full of passion for what they do.

title: Actual Job Title - Visual Product Designer
description:
Are you looking to gain experience within a top 5 bank? Do you have visual designing experience? If so,
this is a great opportunity for you!

Our client, a top 5 bank, is looking for a Visual Product Designer for a 12 months contract in Toronto.
This position is working onsite.

Work Week: 37.5 hours per week

The client requires the candidate to be fully vaccinated in order to join.

Advantages
● Gain experience within a top 5 bank
● Opportunity to work with in a mature and cutting edge design group
● Strong chance of extension, and potential to flip to fulltime
● Start date is ASAP
● Competitive pay rate

Responsibilities
As a Visual Product Designer, your duties will include but not be limited to:
● Understanding visual-spatial displays, and use that understanding to improve user
comprehension, and improve task performance
● Creating visual components considering the broader context, to be used in multiple situations,
to bring about efficiency and consistency
● Using dynamic visualizations to support analytic thinking with large data sets
● Facilitating ideation sessions and collaborative work activities
● Presenting visual design work to more senior stakeholders
● Using a comprehensive understanding of visual design theory, research data and best practices
to inform design decisions
● Designing high complexity visual artifacts for digital media (web or native app) to exchange
information, elicit emotion and facilitate interaction
● Creating complex low-fidelity sketches, hi-fidelity mock-ups and prototypes to communicate
intent, or delivery specifications for development
● Facilitating design critique, evaluating visual designs for inclusivity and provide expert advice
and guidance to cross-functional teams
● Contributing practical direction to the larger design team on Client’s visual communication
standards, tools, channels, and processes
● Facilitating usability testing
● Participating in or initiate research activities
● Researching visual design and communication strategies in the financial services sector and
perform competitive audits pertinent to specific design or business goals
● Performing visual design audits where appropriate

Qualifications
● BA/BS degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial),
HCI, CS, or a related field or equivalent experience
● Portfolio that includes web and/or mobile design samples
● Solid knowledge of design tools (Sketch, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, and presentation
software) and principles (typography, grid systems, visual hierarchy, colour, white space, etc.)
● Understanding of responsive design
● Experience in the agile process

Nice to have:
● Experience designing outstanding digital products and experiences
● Proven ability to communicate conceptual ideas and design rationale, all within a user-centered
design process
● Excellent problem-solving skills
● Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build good working relationships
● Knowledge and/or experience in the agile process

Summary
Interested in the Visual Product Designer role in Toronto? Apply online today!
Candidates moving towards the next step of the recruitment process will be contacted.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Senior Production Designer, Digital
description:
As a Senior Production Designer, you are the master of digital design at high scale. You will work with an amazing team of creatives to make sure that artwork is designed at scale according to our client’s brand guidelines. You will take production design briefs and key art from the account and creative team ensuring conceptual creative ideas are designed at scale for digital delivery to market.  

You are an ideal candidate if you come from an advertising agency or production design studio and have worked on a range of creative projects from marketing collateral, digital campaigns, print work, brand work, ads and more.

You Will:

  • Work with internal teams, account and creative to ensure continuity of delivery of final files within agreed timeframes and to high standards
  • Design to pixel-perfection and translate key art into the various resizes and versions required by the digital media buy
  • Become fully ingrained into the brand’s design templates and acting as gatekeeper of brand guidelines. 
  • Mentor junior Production Designers to facilitate their development, including but not limited to their production design and technical design skills, so as to increase productivity and enhanced staff morale.

 

You Have

  • 4+ years of experience working as a production designer or designer who thrives in high scale output, in an advertising agency, print or design studio. 
  • Experience with high-volume design workflows.
  • Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, particularly in Photoshop.
  • Working knowledge of building and editing keynote & powerpoint decks is an asset
  • Working knowledge of motion design in Premiere/After Effects is an asset.
  • The mindset to be a "doer" on the production design team.

title: Visual Designer/Illustrator (Toronto)
description:

As part of this innovative design team, you will be responsible for creating the on-brand design elements to support our marketing campaigns and programs that will set StackAdapt apart.

description:

for print or electronic materials * Complete all pre-flight requirements as needed * Use customer feedback to improve performance graphics services at the site * Demonstrates knowledge of industry
