customers to provide strategic input and concept development for major projects * Develop creative concepts from vague, broadly defined customer input * Establish guidelines and coordinate all aspects of third party contracting as required (may include photographers, illustrators, etc.) * Provide recommendations to customer as to best medium to produce desired visual effect and most appropriate vehicle for communication of message * Provide guidance and input to less experienced designers * Estimate cost of materials and time to complete graphic design * Assume expert knowledge of the brand Creative talent as evidenced by a portfolio of completed work. Build and maintain relationships with customers and identify areas where relationships need to be built to increase use of design services. title: Créateur de contenu
description:
Tu as toujours rêvé de travailler au sein d’une organisation animée par la passion, la créativité et l’innovation? Tu as envie d’un quotidien où les projets sont stimulants et diversifiés?

Chez Premier Tech, notre équipe Communications n’a qu’une mission en tête : créer du contenu engageant et inspirant qui fait vivre notre identité unique. C’est pourquoi nous sommes à la recherche de la perle rare qui deviendra notre spécialiste en matière de création de contenu.

Faire la différence, voilà comment Premier Tech se distingue. Une équipe unique propulsée par une passion commune, celle d’offrir des solutions qui contribueront positivement à la vie des gens, des entreprises et des collectivités. Chez Premier Tech, Passion et Technologies s’unissent de façon durable et transformatrice pour donner vie à des produits et services qui aident à nourrir, à protéger et à améliorer notre planète.

Ton futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Créer du contenu riche, pertinent et engageant pour de multiples plateformes et publics, tout en respectant le ton rédactionnel et l’image de marque de Premier Tech
  • Comprendre et bien cerner le public cible de façon à transposer cette compréhension en contenu pertinent et adapté
  • Faire preuve de curiosité en restant à l’affût des dernières tendances en création de contenu
  • Mettre à profit ta créativité en participant activement aux brainstorms d’équipe
  • Utiliser tes habiletés linguistiques pour la rédaction et l’adaptation de divers textes bilingues et unilingues

Compétences requises

  • Nous n’avons pas de paradigme précis quant à ta formation initiale. Tu peux provenir du monde de la rédaction, des communications ou du journalisme. Ce qui importe, c’est que tu aies un penchant pour la rédaction!
  • Par-dessus tout, tu as un français absolument irréprochable! Tu ne laisses passer aucune faute et les erreurs grammaticales te font littéralement grincer des dents
  • Tu es curieux et n’as pas peur de proposer des stratégies de contenu créatives sortant des sentiers battus
  • Tu navigues bien dans l’incertitude et le changement. Tu sais que pour arriver à un contenu parfait, un texte peut être modulé maintes et maintes fois
  • Pour toi, ce n’est pas un problème de gérer plusieurs mandats à la fois tout en respectant des deadlines bien précis, même quand tout va vite
  • Tu maîtrises parfaitement le français et l’anglais.

Ton futur environnement de travail

  • Le Campus Premier Tech à Rivière-du-Loup, notre Siège mondial où travaillent 1 400 équipiers.
  • Le mode de vie des équipiers ressemble à celui des chefs de file de la Silicon Valley : petits cafés, boutique Premier Tech, conciergerie d’entreprise, salles de formation, architecture favorisant l’innovation et les liens entre les équipiers, cours de yoga et bien plus! 

Ces mots te parlent?

contenu, tendances, plateformes numériques, rédaction, création, affaires, besoins, storytelling, blogue, web, calendrier éditoriaux

Tes yeux s’illuminent à la lecture de cette offre rêvée? Postule dès maintenant, nous attendons ta candidature avec impatience!

title: Graphic Designer
description:
GRAPHIC DESIGNER ROLE

Become one of the most impactful Graphic Designer on the planet!

WHY YOU WILL LOVE FINGERPRINT FOR SUCCESS (F4S) 

We are a groundbreaking technology platform that is expanding and growing rapidly around the world.We are looking to onboard and hire the next generation of graphic designers to help our customers set and achieve their crazy big goals.

Fingerprint for Success (F4S) is the future of human development. We are on a mission to empower individuals and teams to solve the worldâ€™s biggest problems. Featuring a vast range of tools for collaboration, performance, wellbeing, diversity, and inclusion, plus a huge library of AI and human coaching programs, with F4S anyone can develop and achieve amazing things at work and in life.

Until now professional coaching has been reserved only for the elite, financially inaccessible to most of the worldâ€™s population. Driven by a scientific evidence-based methodology, F4S democratizes coaching, creating for the first time a scalable human development solution for everyone. Through predictive data, conversational A.I., and also some of the world's very best professional coaches, F4S is loved by consumers, teams, enterprises, universities, and professional coaches alike.

We are a digital-first, small but fast-growing values-led team, genuinely on a mission to change the world. We are swift, passionate, hard-working, scaling ourselves at the same pace we grow our product and customers. We invest deeply in our company culture and our teamâ€™s wellbeing, knowing this is the well from where the worldâ€™s greatest products and companies flourish. 

Who you are:

  • An open-minded person who is willing to learn and become one of the most impactful graphic designers in the world 
  • A person with an insatiable curiosity and unrelenting drive to learn, succeed and lead by example
  • A person who is a force for good and celebrate individual uniqueness
  • Be driven by helping their team meet and exceed aggressive conversion targets and individual career goals. 
  • Be passionate about creating purposeful and valuable content that helps business professionals grow better.
  • Be highly organized and have a high level of accountability for the quality and outcomes of your work and your teamâ€™s work.
  • Lead with empathy, serve as an ally for underrepresented communities, and create psychological safety to ensure the team can do their best work. 
  • Able to identify design needs to continuously elevate the quality of digital marketing and brand management
  • A keen eye for aesthetics and details
  • Effective communication skills and comfortable with candor.
  • Strong prioritization skills and ability to consistently meet deadlines.
  • Ability to work independently (while also functioning and contributing as part of a team) and efficiently manage your own time.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, interpersonal, and relationship-building skills

The Graphic Designer will assist the Marketing Team with the production and implementation of the companyâ€™s portfolio of creative requirements.

What youâ€™ll do:

  • Responsible for creative design solutions that have a high visual impact
  • Creates branding proposals, advertising materials, e-books, magazines, brochures, folders, packaging, exhibitions and display materials, flyers, and online materials such as Facebook and Instagram posts, online ads and banners, as well as company AVPs and other video material.
  • Responsible for creating branding standard guidelines for the company and ensuring all design outputs are aligned with the company's and brandsâ€™ standards
  • Prepares rough drafts of material based on an agreed brief
  • Reviews final layouts and suggests improvements if required

Qualifications (any or all):

  • Entry-level 
  • Intermediate to proficient in layout design, with at least 1 - 2 years experience in doing layouts whether in a professional or freelance capacity.
  • Candidates with more experience are welcome to apply.
  • At least basic in illustrations, 2D animation, and storyboards.
  • Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree.
  • Required skill(s): Canva or Adobe Photoshop (proficient), Adobe Illustrator (proficient), Adobe After Effects (basic - intermediate)
  • Has a creative flair in design and a good sense of art.
  • Has a strong design sense of color, layout, and typography.
  • Has strong creative skills and the ability to design ideas for a wide range of industries.
  • Has creative conceptualization ability as well as technical execution capability.
  • Can translate complex data or information into easy-to-digest designs, layouts, and infographics.
  • Has the ability to work independently or as part of a team.
  • Strong communication and organization skills.
  • Able to multi-task and can gracefully handle pressure.
  • Willing to learn other multimedia software apart from Adobe creative tools to deliver other multimedia-related work.

Software Expertise:

  • Applicants should have extensive knowledge of the use of Canva or Adobe Creative Suite, particularly:
    • Canva presentations & videos
    • Adobe Illustrator
    • Adobe InDesign
    • Adobe Premiere / After Effects
  • A plus if you have knowledge of and experience using the following programs:
    • Microsoft Office
    • Youtube and similar platforms
    • Google Suite
    • Activecampaign
    • WordPress and other CMS programs

Where?
This role is initially fully digital/remote, eventually establishing our US Hubs for regular teaming and events. Given our HQ in Sydney Australia, the ideal candidate will be based on the west coast or in Austin, Texas to benefit from the overlapping timezone windows. 

Why Join Us?

  • Empower our users with helpful content
  • Learn digital marketing and content marketing real-life skills
  • Bring direct impact to the business and see blog traffic grow with your efforts
  • Be among team members who believe in working and playing hard 
  • Flourish in a flat organizational structure with no office politics

Benefits

At F4S, we are committed to living out our mission every day and that starts with providing benefits that allow our employees to care for themselves, support their families, and give back to their community. 

  • Access to F4S coaching
  • A competitive compensation plan with opportunity for advancement
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Per year: paid holidays and leave 
  • Learning and Development stipend
  • Amazing high performing remote global team 
  • Incredible culture and community

We are hiring for many role types including Full-time, part-time, contract, internships.

We look forward to you joining us in our very real mission to make human development accessible to everyone!

hello@f4s.com

How to get started?

Go to F4S.com to complete the F4S Questionnaire (15-30 mins) to help us better understand your work-style motivations and how we can best support your onboarding. We look forward to making a positive impact with you!

title: Digital Production Artist - Contract
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">About Klick Health
Meet a different kind of workplace. Klick Health is an ecosystem of brilliant minds working to realize the full potential of their people and clients in life sciences since 1997. And we’re still growing fast, even after two decades. What does that mean for you? As Klick experiences exponential growth year-over-year, so do the people who help make it happen. Because we’re constantly evolving and changing, we invest in talent early and often, to develop future leaders at all levels. We’re one of the country’s Top 10 Great Workplaces, 10 Most Inspiring Cultures, Best Workplace for Innovators, Best Managed, and Fastest Growing. We know that career paths are seldom simple and straightforward. And that's an asset. If you feel like you'd be a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply and take the first steps to starting your career journey at Klick!

About Our Creative Craft
The Creative team features an incredible array of experienced, fearless, smart visionaries, capable in all media and technologies, and united by a common goal: to build brands that solve a human need. It requires hard work, a healthy dose of imagination, and a passion for craft to make work that stands out in the world.We’ve got super-smart, friendly, and caring people who put their hearts and souls into the clever work that they create for our clients in order to deliver thoughtful creative messaging to the patients they serve. And the best part? We have a ton of fun while doing it.

As a Digital Production Artist at Klick, you will be responsible for the
formatting and production of various digital design projects including email,
websites, banners, and other digital projects. Within the Studio team, you will
collaborate with Art Directors, Designers, Copywriters, UX, Developers, CRM
Operations and the Science Regulatory team to create flawless digital files.
For this position, the ideal candidate will have excellent digital production
design, an understanding of development, design systems, accessibility.
Knowledge of coding would be an asset.


Klick embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We're committed to 
building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and 
skills. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to 
race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, 
sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, or family status. If you 
require disability-related accommodation during the application or interview
process, simply let us know and we’ll work with you to ensure you have a 
positive experience.


What makes Klick different?
You’ll work on numerous multi-million dollar brands—the size and breadth of the accounts here are incomparable to most agencies. We believe in putting our people first, and always make that our priority. This and our other timeless principles have made all the difference in our over two decades of success. By having an entrepreneurial spirit, playing the long game, considering outcomes over optics, and solving challenging problems through our hacker roots, we live our difference in all that we do. You’ll get to experience a high level of trust and be given the freedom to make decisions, judgment calls, and function with autonomy. If you have an idea, run with it! You’ll be encouraged to let your entrepreneurial spirit flourish and you’ll work with incredible teams that you can learn from, contribute to, and who will support you every step of the way!

Klick is consciously creating a culture where everyone can thrive and grow in their careers. We believe that our best work comes from our diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We strongly encourage members of historically underrepresented communities to apply, including Black people, Indigenous peoples, and other people of colour, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and people with intersectional identities.

We’re also committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment process and work environment. Should you require any accommodation, please contact us at careers@klick.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs and ensure you have a positive experience.</section>

title: Lookdev Artist
description:
Company Description

As a company founded and run by an artist, it's our mission to provide talented artists with the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.

Job Description

The Lookdev Artist creates shading to ensure that models and textures are combined into hyper-realistic assets, ensuring to meet the high quality standards of Rodeo FX.

Main responsibilities:

  • Develop looks to ensure assets can be properly lit and are technically correct to help create hyper-realistic passes;
  • Take assets from the texturing department and push surface qualities further in terms of realism;
  • Finalize assets technically and artistically, validating work with turntables and various tech checks;
  • Create lighting setups that become reference shots for sequences;
  • Set up Nuke scripts that will be used by the compositing and lighting department;
  • Set up and maintain a preset shader bank for different surface qualities;
  • Work closely with the CG and Asset Supervisor to find creative and technical solutions and approaches that enhance assets and shots, while meeting project specifications and deadlines;
  • May participate in the development of tools and techniques for the department;
  • Perform quality control on assets before they are submitted for review/approval, ensuring all technical and creative standards are met, and promptly apply notes received;
  • Keep Production and the project team informed of the status of work, issues to be resolved, ramifications of problems encountered and recommend potential solutions;
  • Ensure deadlines are met, advising the project team promptly if delays could be expected.
Qualifications

  • Experience in a similar position, within the VFX industry;
  • Excellent knowledge of Katana software and Nuke;
  • Good knowledge of Arnold; 
  • Excellent sense of prioritization and respect of deadlines.


Additional Information

  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution;
  • Discounts with Bixi, Nautilus Plus and many more local businesses.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Painters Needed for the Summer!
description:
We’re hiring full time painters for the summer!

We are looking for individuals who want to be a part of a fun, high energy team and who love being outdoors!

Why is this the perfect summer position?

  • Work with your friends and roommates.
  • 40 PLUS hours available per week, earn $11,000- $14,000 this summer!
  • Work outside and get into shape.
  • Room to advance throughout the season to crew foreman or production manager.

Duties include:

  • Preparing, cleaning and repairing interior and exterior surfaces.
  • Applying paint, stains and other finishes using brushes, rollers and spray equipment.
  • Use of ladders, must not be afraid of heights!

Previous painting experience is an asset, but not required! If you have a can-do attitude and great work ethic, we will provide all training. Labour experience such as landscaping, warehouse and heavy equipment work, grounds crew and athletics are also considered assets.

 Apply now!

title: Level Artist
description:
Company Description

People Can Fly is one of the leading independent AAA games development studios with an international team of hundreds of talented individuals working from offices located in Poland, UK, US, and Canada, and from all over the world thanks to our remote work programs.

Founded in 2002, we made our mark on the shooter genre with titles such as Painkiller, Bulletstorm, Gears of War: Judgment, and Outriders. We are one of the most experienced Unreal Engine studios in the industry and we are expanding it with in-house solutions called PCF Framework.

Our creative teams are currently working on several exciting AAA projects with the top publishers in the industry: Project Gemini with Square Enix and Project Dagger with Take-Two (2K), in addition to a new IP to be self-published and two other games in a concept phase. One of our IPs is also being adapted for VR technology.

With over 20 years of experience, now PCF sets to explore new horizons. We aim to combine our expertise with creativity of the best and most forward-thinking talents in the industry to work together on the new generation of action games for the global gaming community.

If you will decide to accompany us on this journey, you’ll have a chance to perfect your craft and expand your knowledge, working alongside leaders in the industry on bringing a brand-new unique experience to the players worldwide.

If you feel yourself able to deliver as nobody else, take ownership of your projects, and ready to leave a mark on a game you work on, apply now!

Job Description

  • Creating world geometry and composition for levels in Unreal Engine
  • Working with LD to terraform the world to create worlds that are both fun to play and fits the artistic vision of the game
  • Effectively producing playable levels based on Art directors vision and Level design needs with lead cooperation
  • Working with Producer to manage LA team's schedule and give feedback on world art
Qualifications

  • 5 years of experience in creating world geometry for levels
  • Experience working with Unreal Engine
  • Experience with designing layout, asset breakdown, terraforming and set dressing
  • Experience creating high quality creative/visual aesthetics as well as technical knowledge
  • Ability to adapt with guidance and improve, new styles, techniques, and workflows
  • Basic understanding of the color theory
  • Good verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Open-minded team player attitude
  • Strong work ethic and self-motivated
  • Passionate about playing and making video games


Additional Information

What we offer:

  • Paid holidays, plus the week between Christmas and New Year, and 5 sick days paid.
  • Free virtual health and mental wellbeing sessions included in the plan for members and their dependents.
  • A competitive salary and performance-based annual bonuses.
  • Personal development opportunities and ability to work in a global environment.
  • Work in a creative team with people full of passion for what they do.
  • In-company English, French, and Polish language classes.
  • Long term disability, short term disability, travel insurance, as well as other benefits provided.

U.S

  • 100% group health insurance benefit premiums paid by PCF (Medical, Dental, Vision, Group Life, and Supplemental Live) and start on day 1 of employment.
  • 401K with company match.

Canada

  • Benefit package 100% paid by PCF. Insurance company reimburses 100% of claims (Up to $500 per service a year, as well as individual family coverage).
  • PCF offers a coverage of $1500 per year for dentals and reimburse 100% of the cost.
  • 4% RRSP matching before tax deductions, 100% vested immediately.

title: Senior Asset Artist
description:
About Pixomondo: 

Founded in 2001 by CEO and Executive Producer Thilo Kuther, Pixomondo is a solutions-oriented design company that solves creative challenges for our clients and partners. Whether we are crafting never-before-seen visual effects for a feature film or developing innovative original concepts for a global marketing campaign, we leverage our collaborative design process to develop truly award-winning work. Our passion is to deliver the best ideas at the highest levels of quality on-time and on-budget, with the outstanding service you expect from a world-class company.

title: Senior Concept Artist
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Our client, a leading AAA console/PC studio currently working on their new IP (AAA console) is on the lookout for a Senior Concept Artist, a champion in the Art Team who will have a significant role in shaping the visual direction for a project.
You'll help establish and convey the Art Director's vision through a wide array of concept art, key art & style guides. As a Senior Concept Artist you will be required to visually develop and illustrate any given combination of game assets, associated game development imagery and speculative ‘pitch’ materials to a high standard and on schedule under the art direction of an art lead or art director.
In order to create a believable and breathtaking game world, you will be called upon to create inspiring designs ranging from realistic to sci-fi. From initial speed sketches, through to product- defining visuals – developing imaginative visual solutions for the various aesthetic, technical, design & narrative considerations in a timely fashion.

Not your time for a move? Recommend a friend and earn 700 EUR! Contact: jobs@8bitplay.com

IMPORTANT: We will never, absolutely never send your CV and/or personal data to any of our clients without your direct consent. Submitting your CV is not equal to giving us consent to share your details with our external partners- we will always contact you upfront and ask for your agreement.

By submitting this form you give your consent for the information provided on this form to be held on computer or other relevant filing systems belonging to 8Bit Studio one and to be shared with other accredited employees in accordance with the GDPR 2018.


By submitting this form you agree that 8Bit Studio, NIP 9570949266, REGON: 36386962 processes your personal data contained in the recruitment documents supplied by you, including but not limited to your image, for the purposes of the current recruitment processes. 8Bit Studio confirms that your consent may be withdrawn anytime.

For more insight about game jobs and recruitment for game industry visit our homepage</section>

title: Content Designer
description:
Job Details:
Job Title: Content Designer
Location: Toronto, ON
Duration: 12 months
Position Type: Full-time, Contract
Perks: This is an exciting opportunity to join a customer service-driven, team-focused company known for its supportive culture!

Job Description:
Our client, a highly reputable financial firm, is seeking an experienced Content Designer to shape the development of branded digital products. This is a full-time contract position offering competitive hourly pay based on experience. Responsibilities center on collaborating cross-functionally produce content that is tailored to the client’s needs and interests. If you are a problem-solver who excels in a collaborative, team-focused environment AND you are excited to create products that will be used by millions of people, apply now! * Portfolio demonstrating Portfolio demonstrating copywriting work required for consideration.

Responsibilities:
  • Create strategies for using content to support clients' needs.
  • Facilitate collaborative design activities and ideation sessions.
  • Provide practical direction to the larger design team on Content Design communications standards, tools, channels, and processes.
  • Champion client needs and interests in discussions about the role of content in company products.
  • Create client-focused textual content, including labels, explanatory text, hidden or alternative text, metadata, and support content as well as go-to-market content.
  • Apply the principles of Inclusive Design in content design and creation.
  • Work with Legal, Compliance, and Regulatory teams to ensure that our digital conversations satisfy our legal and regulatory responsibilities.
  • Manage the documentation and sharing of content throughout its lifecycle.
  • Research content and messaging strategies in the competitive landscape and perform competitive audits pertinent to specific design or business goals.
  • Perform content audits where appropriate.

Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.
  • Experience writing for a mobile product.
  • Experience writing for loyalty and rewards programs.
  • Minimum 5+ years prior writing experience at a creative agency or in-house creative team required.
  • Portfolio demonstrating copywriting work.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and critical thinking skills.
  • A working knowledge of accessibility standards and methods to address them is preferred.
  • Must remain up to date on current and emerging design and technology trends.
  • Experience developing and working with design systems

Mindlance is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in employment on the basis of – Minority/Gender/Disability/Religion/LGBTQI/Age/Veterans.

title: Senior Level Designer - Mobile
description:
Behaviour Interactive is seeking a talented Senior Level Designer to work on our next wave of successful F2P titles on mobile platforms. As level designer, you will create a large set of levels for an upcoming mobile game based one of the world’s biggest brands. Your levels will exploit and make best use of all gameplay features, mechanics, characters, and resources at your disposal to provide a consistently fun and challenging experience for players. You will coordinate with the other team disciplines by clearly communicating your intentions and following through the implementation of your work into the game to ensure its quality.
Ideally you have experience in console or mobile game development, a strong understanding of level composition, gameplay flow and pacing, and a passion for creating fun and exciting experiences.

In this role you will :

  • Create grey block level layouts, and place enemies, obstacles, props, rewards, and other interactive triggers as first pass level designs
  • Playtest and refine level layouts, and embrace feedback to ensure the desired experience is met
  • See through the evolution of your levels as they pass through other disciplines, and ensure the level design intentions are respected towards final delivery
  • Establish conventions for level sizes, boundaries, distances, paths, chokepoints, etc.
  • Help establish player abilities and enemy difficulty
  • Implement scripted story sequences or events in levels when conditions are met
  • Provide time estimates as necessary
  • Contribute to and create design support documentation as necessary
  • Mentor others on the team to positively contribute to the growth and development of the design group

What we're looking for :

  • Good understanding of tactile mobile gameplay
  • 3+ years of game industry experience as a level designer
  • Strong understanding of gameplay flow, pacing, encounter setups
  • Ability to write detailed design documents describing the above
  • Proficient with Unity Engine and related tools
  • Experience with Unity Timeline, Cinemachine is a plus
  • Experience with 3D modeling software (Maya, 3DS Max)

Dans ce rôle vous devrez :

  • Créer des dispositions de niveaux en blocs gris, placer les ennemis, obstacles, accessoires, récompenses et autres déclencheurs interactifs dans les versions initiales des designs de niveaux;
  • Effectuer les test de jeu et polir les niveaux, accueillir la rétroaction positivement afin d’assurer la meilleure expérience possible;
  • Effectuer le suivi de l’évolution de vos niveaux lorsqu’ils passent entre les mains des autres disciplines et assurer le respect des intentions de conception jusqu’à la livraison finale;
  • Déterminer les conventions en ce qui a trait à la taille des niveaux, distances, parcours, goulets d’étranglement etc.;
  • Aider à déterminer le niveau d’habileté des joueur·euse.s et le niveau de difficulté du combat;
  • Lorsque les conditions le permettent, intégrer des séquences de l’histoire ou des événements scénarisés dans les niveaux;
  • Fournir des estimations au besoin;
  • Contribuer à la rédaction et rédiger de la documentation de conception;
  • Agir à titre de mentor.e auprès des autres membres de l’équipe afin de contribuer positivement à leur développement, ainsi qu’à celui de l’ensemble du groupe Design.

Ce que nous recherchons :

  • Bonne compréhension de la jouabilité tactile mobile;
  • Minimum de 3 ans d’expérience comme concepteur·trice de niveaux au sein de l’industrie du jeu;
  • Excellente compréhension du flow de jouabilité, de la cadence et des déclencheurs;
  • Capacité à rédiger des documents de conception détaillés qui décrivent les points énumérés ci-haut;
  • Expérience avec le moteur Unity et outils connexes;
  • Expérience avec Unity Timeline et Cinemachine, un atout;
  • Expérience avec des outils de modélisation 3D tels Maya et 3ds Max;
  • Expérience avec Unity ProBuilder, un atout;
  • Expérience avec les outils de création de scripts visuels et de séquences, un plus;
  • Capacité et volonté de s’adapter à un environnement en constant changement.
  • Bonnes aptitudes en communication tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit en français et/ou en anglais.
Behaviour Digital cherche un·e concepteur·trice de niveaux de jeu sénior de talent pour travailler sur notre prochaine vague de titres F2P à succès pour plateformes mobiles. À titre de concepteur·trice de niveaux de jeu, vous créerez un vaste ensemble de niveaux pour notre prochain jeu mobile inspiré d’une des marques les plus connues au monde. Vos niveaux exploiteront pleinement toutes les fonctionnalités de jouabilité, la mécanique des personnages et autres ressources à votre disposition afin d’offrir continuellement à nos joueur·euse.s des défis et expériences uniques. Vous coordonnerez votre travail avec les autres disciplines de l’équipe, communiquerez clairement votre vision et effectuerez le suivi de la mise en œuvre de vos initiatives dans le jeu tout en assurant leur qualité.
Idéalement, vous avez de l’expérience avec le développement de jeux mobiles ou pour consoles, une excellente compréhension de la composition de niveaux, du flow et de la cadence et du rythme de la jouabilité et une passion pour la création d’expériences excitantes et divertissantes.

title: Digital Content Designer - 128262
description:
Are you looking to gain experience within a top 5 bank? Do you have writing experience at a creative
agency or in-house creative team? If so, this is a great opportunity for you!

Our client, a top 5 bank, is looking for a Content Designer for a 12 months contract in Toronto. This
position is working onsite.

Work Week: 37.5 hours per week

The client requires the candidate to be fully vaccinated in order to join.

Advantages
 Gain experience within a top 5 bank
 Opportunity to work with in a mature and cutting edge design group
 Start date is ASAP
 Competitive pay rate
Strong chance of extension, and potential to flip to fulltime

Responsibilities
As a Content Designer, your duties will include but not be limited to:
Collaborating with colleagues in other disciplines to define the core value of the digital products
we design and build.
Making sure that every experience – from the overtly promotional to the purely transactional –
embodies its core value as our clients move through and engage with it.
Using content to connect what our digital products can do with what truly matters to our
clients.
Creating strategies for using content to support our clients' needs for information and
understanding in the digital products we design.
Facilitating collaborative design activities and ideation sessions and collaborative work activities.
Articulating the rationale behind a content strategy and provides design advice or guidance to
other product team members.
Providing practical direction to the larger design team on clients Content Design communications
standards, tools, channels and processes.
Acting as an advocate for our clients, representing their needs and interests in discussions about
the role of content in the products we design and how that role may affect other aspects of a
product’s design.
Creating client-focused textual content ensuring that it supports clients design principles and the
team’s design and product strategies, including labels, explanatory text, hidden or alternative
text, metadata, and support content internal to a digital product, as well as external (go-to-
market) content.
Partnering with peers to shape or develop other (non-textual) content: iconography,
information graphics, imagery, and data.
Applying the principles of Inclusive Design in content design and creation.
Collaborating with Legal, Compliance, and Regulatory teams to ensure that our digital
conversations satisfy our legal and regulatory responsibilities.
Managing the documentation and sharing of content throughout its lifecycle.
Working with a designated Design Researcher to facilitate team agreement on the questions it
needs to answer through its Research and Testing activities.
Partnering with the team’s designated Testing and/or Design Lead to initiate tests of the
effectiveness of specific content strategies and specific content executions.
Researching content and messaging strategies in the competitive landscape and perform
competitive audits pertinent to specific design or business goals.
Performing content audits where appropriate.

Qualifications
A post-secondary education, ideally with a university degree or college diploma
At least 4 years of writing experience at a creative agency or in-house creative team
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically about the challenge at hand
Proficiency in English
A portfolio of work samples showcasing your copywriting work

Nice to have
Facility in French
A working knowledge of accessibility standards and methods to address them A knowledge of design and technology trends

Summary
Interested in the Content Designer role in Toronto?  Apply online today!
Candidates moving towards the next step of the recruitment process will be contacted.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Visual Designer/Illustrator (Toronto)
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">StackAdapt is hiring a Visual Designer/Illustrator to join our growing marketing team. If you have a passion for the advertising industry, along with the ability to grasp and translate technical capabilities into visual masterpieces, then keep on reading! 

As part of this innovative design team, you will be responsible for creating the on-brand design elements to support our marketing campaigns and programs that will set StackAdapt apart.

#LI-KU



About StackAdapt

StackAdapt is a self-serve programmatic advertising platform used by the most exceptional digital marketers. This state-of-the-art platform is where some of the most progressive work in machine learning meets cutting-edge user experience. Ad buyers plan, execute, and manage data-driven digital advertising campaigns across all devices, inventory, and publisher partners.StackAdapt is a Top 100 Software Product on G2, being the only DSP on theBest Software ProductsandHighest Satisfactionlists.

We've been recognized for our high performing campaign conversion rates, award-winning customer service, and innovation by numerous industry publications including:

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Responsibilities:

As a Graphic Designer, your tasks will be, but not limited to, the following:

  • You will conceive, develop, and implement design solutions in all media.
  • You would understand and turn statistical information into opportunities for visual storytelling.
  • Design and present complex data sets in compelling visual formats.
  • Partner with stakeholders to set clear business KPIs and build dashboards that provide timely and strategic insights.
  • Craft the right narrative dependent on the data analysis and client’s brand positioning.

 

Qualifications:

  • You have the ability to take a list of data and transform it into data visualization graphics.
  • You are skilled at creating/designing PowerPoint presentations.
  • You bring a strong graphic design skillset, understanding and proficiency with current Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign and Photoshop), and Presentation Software (such as Prezi, PPT).
  • Knowledge of BI tools (such as Power BI, Tableau) is a strong asset.
  • Knowledge of web design, UX, UI, HTML5, etc. is an asset.
  • Within your submission, please share a portfolio outlining key experience to provide examples of your Graphic Designer work.
  • Bilingualism is an asset (French and English).

title: Graphic Designer
description:
GRAPHIC DESIGNER ROLE

Become one of the most impactful Graphic Designer on the planet!

WHY YOU WILL LOVE FINGERPRINT FOR SUCCESS (F4S) 

We are a groundbreaking technology platform that is expanding and growing rapidly around the world.We are looking to onboard and hire the next generation of graphic designers to help our customers set and achieve their crazy big goals.

Fingerprint for Success (F4S) is the future of human development. We are on a mission to empower individuals and teams to solve the worldâ€™s biggest problems. Featuring a vast range of tools for collaboration, performance, wellbeing, diversity, and inclusion, plus a huge library of AI and human coaching programs, with F4S anyone can develop and achieve amazing things at work and in life.

Until now professional coaching has been reserved only for the elite, financially inaccessible to most of the worldâ€™s population. Driven by a scientific evidence-based methodology, F4S democratizes coaching, creating for the first time a scalable human development solution for everyone. Through predictive data, conversational A.I., and also some of the world's very best professional coaches, F4S is loved by consumers, teams, enterprises, universities, and professional coaches alike.

We are a digital-first, small but fast-growing values-led team, genuinely on a mission to change the world. We are swift, passionate, hard-working, scaling ourselves at the same pace we grow our product and customers. We invest deeply in our company culture and our teamâ€™s wellbeing, knowing this is the well from where the worldâ€™s greatest products and companies flourish. 

Who you are:

  • An open-minded person who is willing to learn and become one of the most impactful graphic designers in the world 
  • A person with an insatiable curiosity and unrelenting drive to learn, succeed and lead by example
  • A person who is a force for good and celebrate individual uniqueness
  • Be driven by helping their team meet and exceed aggressive conversion targets and individual career goals. 
  • Be passionate about creating purposeful and valuable content that helps business professionals grow better.
  • Be highly organized and have a high level of accountability for the quality and outcomes of your work and your teamâ€™s work.
  • Lead with empathy, serve as an ally for underrepresented communities, and create psychological safety to ensure the team can do their best work. 
  • Able to identify design needs to continuously elevate the quality of digital marketing and brand management
  • A keen eye for aesthetics and details
  • Effective communication skills and comfortable with candor.
  • Strong prioritization skills and ability to consistently meet deadlines.
  • Ability to work independently (while also functioning and contributing as part of a team) and efficiently manage your own time.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, interpersonal, and relationship-building skills

The Graphic Designer will assist the Marketing Team with the production and implementation of the companyâ€™s portfolio of creative requirements.

What youâ€™ll do:

  • Responsible for creative design solutions that have a high visual impact
  • Creates branding proposals, advertising materials, e-books, magazines, brochures, folders, packaging, exhibitions and display materials, flyers, and online materials such as Facebook and Instagram posts, online ads and banners, as well as company AVPs and other video material.
  • Responsible for creating branding standard guidelines for the company and ensuring all design outputs are aligned with the company's and brandsâ€™ standards
  • Prepares rough drafts of material based on an agreed brief
  • Reviews final layouts and suggests improvements if required

Qualifications (any or all):

  • Entry-level 
  • Intermediate to proficient in layout design, with at least 1 - 2 years experience in doing layouts whether in a professional or freelance capacity.
  • Candidates with more experience are welcome to apply.
  • At least basic in illustrations, 2D animation, and storyboards.
  • Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree.
  • Required skill(s): Canva or Adobe Photoshop (proficient), Adobe Illustrator (proficient), Adobe After Effects (basic - intermediate)
  • Has a creative flair in design and a good sense of art.
  • Has a strong design sense of color, layout, and typography.
  • Has strong creative skills and the ability to design ideas for a wide range of industries.
  • Has creative conceptualization ability as well as technical execution capability.
  • Can translate complex data or information into easy-to-digest designs, layouts, and infographics.
  • Has the ability to work independently or as part of a team.
  • Strong communication and organization skills.
  • Able to multi-task and can gracefully handle pressure.
  • Willing to learn other multimedia software apart from Adobe creative tools to deliver other multimedia-related work.

Software Expertise:

  • Applicants should have extensive knowledge of the use of Canva or Adobe Creative Suite, particularly:
    • Canva presentations & videos
    • Adobe Illustrator
    • Adobe InDesign
    • Adobe Premiere / After Effects
  • A plus if you have knowledge of and experience using the following programs:
    • Microsoft Office
    • Youtube and similar platforms
    • Google Suite
    • Activecampaign
    • WordPress and other CMS programs

Where?
This role is initially fully digital/remote, eventually establishing our US Hubs for regular teaming and events. Given our HQ in Sydney Australia, the ideal candidate will be based on the west coast or in Austin, Texas to benefit from the overlapping timezone windows. 

Why Join Us?

  • Empower our users with helpful content
  • Learn digital marketing and content marketing real-life skills
  • Bring direct impact to the business and see blog traffic grow with your efforts
  • Be among team members who believe in working and playing hard 
  • Flourish in a flat organizational structure with no office politics

Benefits

At F4S, we are committed to living out our mission every day and that starts with providing benefits that allow our employees to care for themselves, support their families, and give back to their community. 

  • Access to F4S coaching
  • A competitive compensation plan with opportunity for advancement
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Per year: paid holidays and leave 
  • Learning and Development stipend
  • Amazing high performing remote global team 
  • Incredible culture and community

We are hiring for many role types including Full-time, part-time, contract, internships.

We look forward to you joining us in our very real mission to make human development accessible to everyone!

hello@f4s.com

How to get started?

Go to F4S.com to complete the F4S Questionnaire (15-30 mins) to help us better understand your work-style motivations and how we can best support your onboarding. We look forward to making a positive impact with you!

Powered by JazzHR

title: Créateur de contenu
description:
Tu as toujours rêvé de travailler au sein d’une organisation animée par la passion, la créativité et l’innovation? Tu as envie d’un quotidien où les projets sont stimulants et diversifiés?

Chez Premier Tech, notre équipe Communications n’a qu’une mission en tête : créer du contenu engageant et inspirant qui fait vivre notre identité unique. C’est pourquoi nous sommes à la recherche de la perle rare qui deviendra notre spécialiste en matière de création de contenu.

Faire la différence, voilà comment Premier Tech se distingue. Une équipe unique propulsée par une passion commune, celle d’offrir des solutions qui contribueront positivement à la vie des gens, des entreprises et des collectivités. Chez Premier Tech, Passion et Technologies s’unissent de façon durable et transformatrice pour donner vie à des produits et services qui aident à nourrir, à protéger et à améliorer notre planète.

Ton futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Créer du contenu riche, pertinent et engageant pour de multiples plateformes et publics, tout en respectant le ton rédactionnel et l’image de marque de Premier Tech
  • Comprendre et bien cerner le public cible de façon à transposer cette compréhension en contenu pertinent et adapté
  • Faire preuve de curiosité en restant à l’affût des dernières tendances en création de contenu
  • Mettre à profit ta créativité en participant activement aux brainstorms d’équipe
  • Utiliser tes habiletés linguistiques pour la rédaction et l’adaptation de divers textes bilingues et unilingues

Compétences requises

  • Nous n’avons pas de paradigme précis quant à ta formation initiale. Tu peux provenir du monde de la rédaction, des communications ou du journalisme. Ce qui importe, c’est que tu aies un penchant pour la rédaction!
  • Par-dessus tout, tu as un français absolument irréprochable! Tu ne laisses passer aucune faute et les erreurs grammaticales te font littéralement grincer des dents
  • Tu es curieux et n’as pas peur de proposer des stratégies de contenu créatives sortant des sentiers battus
  • Tu navigues bien dans l’incertitude et le changement. Tu sais que pour arriver à un contenu parfait, un texte peut être modulé maintes et maintes fois
  • Pour toi, ce n’est pas un problème de gérer plusieurs mandats à la fois tout en respectant des deadlines bien précis, même quand tout va vite
  • Tu maîtrises parfaitement le français et l’anglais.

Ton futur environnement de travail

  • Le Campus Premier Tech à Rivière-du-Loup, notre Siège mondial où travaillent 1 400 équipiers.
  • Le mode de vie des équipiers ressemble à celui des chefs de file de la Silicon Valley : petits cafés, boutique Premier Tech, conciergerie d’entreprise, salles de formation, architecture favorisant l’innovation et les liens entre les équipiers, cours de yoga et bien plus! 

Ces mots te parlent?

contenu, tendances, plateformes numériques, rédaction, création, affaires, besoins, storytelling, blogue, web, calendrier éditoriaux

Tes yeux s’illuminent à la lecture de cette offre rêvée? Postule dès maintenant, nous attendons ta candidature avec impatience!

Une équipe unique propulsée par une passion commune, celle d’offrir des solutions qui contribueront positivement à la vie des gens, des entreprises et des collectivités. Chez Premier Tech, Passion et Technologies s’unissent de façon durable et transformatrice pour donner vie à des produits et services qui aident à nourrir, à protéger et à améliorer notre planète.', 'Pour toi, ce n’est pas un problème de gérer plusieurs mandats à la fois tout en respectant des deadlines bien précis, même quand tout va vite', 'Utiliser tes habiletés linguistiques pour la rédaction et l’adaptation de divers textes bilingues et unilingues']

title: Designer, Information Design
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">About Klick Health
Meet a different kind of workplace. Klick Health is an ecosystem of brilliant minds working to realize the full potential of their people and clients in life sciences since 1997. And we’re still growing fast, even after two decades. What does that mean for you? As Klick experiences exponential growth year-over-year, so do the people who help make it happen. Because we’re constantly evolving and changing, we invest in talent early and often, to develop future leaders at all levels. We’re one of the country’s Top 10 Great Workplaces, 10 Most Inspiring Cultures, Best Workplace for Innovators, Best Managed, and Fastest Growing. We know that career paths are seldom simple and straightforward. And that's an asset. If you feel like you'd be a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply and take the first steps to starting your career journey at Klick!

About Klick Health

Klick Health is the world’s largest independent, full-service marketing agency and commercialization partner for life sciences. For over two decades, Klick has been laser focused on developing, launching, and supporting life sciences brands to maximize their full market potential. Klick has been named Agency of the Year six times over the last eight years by the industry’s leading publications. For the latest updates, follow Klick Health on Twitter:@klickhealth.There’s something different here.

Position: Designer, Information Design (All levels)
Reports to: Senior Director, Information Design

Role Description and Expectations

Hi there! We are looking for designers to join our Growth Design team who will craft visual presentations and long documents for business pitches. Whether seasoned in the craft or recently graduated, if you’re someone who loves all things information design, this is the job for you!

As a designer at Klick who is an expert when it comes to information design, you are a visual problem solver—you dissect complex information to simplify and abstract it. You make presentations that don’t look like presentations. You see slides as an artboard, and you are excited to convey dense information in a manner that is both visually appealing and is easily digestible for the audience.

We love passionate people and we want to see what you’re passionate about! We have created a small (completely optional) design challenge for you to show us your stuff! 

Please design a landscape sized infographic about what you love. Whether you’re passionate about sports or you’re an avid foodie that knows all the best brunch places in Toronto, we want to see this! We want to see YOU on an artboard—bonus if you do it on a powerpoint slide. If you’re up for this challenge, we would love to learn more about you via this infographic. 

Please note: All candidates must submit samples, a portfolio, or link to a personal website to be considered. Those who complete the optional design challenge will receive a call from our recruiters and feedback from one of our design leads.




Klick is consciously creating a culture where everyone can thrive and grow in their careers. We believe that our best work comes from our diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We strongly encourage members of historically underrepresented communities to apply, including Black people, Indigenous peoples, and other people of colour, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and people with intersectional identities.

We’re also committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment process and work environment. Should you require any accommodation, please contact us at careers@klick.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs and ensure you have a positive experience.</section>

title: Painters Needed for the Summer!
description:
We’re hiring full time painters for the summer!

We are looking for individuals who want to be a part of a fun, high energy team and who love being outdoors!

Why is this the perfect summer position?

  • Work with your friends and roommates.
  • 40 PLUS hours available per week, earn $11,000- $14,000 this summer!
  • Work outside and get into shape.
  • Room to advance throughout the season to crew foreman or production manager.

Duties include:

  • Preparing, cleaning and repairing interior and exterior surfaces.
  • Applying paint, stains and other finishes using brushes, rollers and spray equipment.
  • Use of ladders, must not be afraid of heights!

Previous painting experience is an asset, but not required! If you have a can-do attitude and great work ethic, we will provide all training. Labour experience such as landscaping, warehouse and heavy equipment work, grounds crew and athletics are also considered assets.

 Apply now!

If you have a can-do attitude and great work ethic, we will provide all training. Labour experience such as landscaping, warehouse and heavy equipment work, grounds crew and athletics are also considered assets.']

title: Crowd Artist
description:
Company Description

As a company founded and run by an artist, it's our mission to provide talented artists with the freedom and resources they need to deliver quality work and to thrive in a fun and creative environment.

Job Description

The Crowd Artist creates simulation setups to compose crowds, ensuring to meet the high quality standards of Rodeo FX.

Main responsibilities:

  • Create simulation setups to compose realistic crowds;
  • Run simulations in shots and address any notes;
  • Work closely with the CG and the Head of Crowd to find creative and technical solutions and approaches that meet project requirements and deadlines;
  • May participate in the development of tools and techniques for the department;
  • Perform quality control on shots before they are submitted for review/approval, ensuring all technical and creative standards are met, and promptly apply notes received;
  • Keep Production and the project team informed of the status of work, issues to be resolved, ramifications of problems encountered and recommend potential solutions;
  • Ensure deadlines are met, advising the project team promptly if delays could be expected.
Qualifications

  • Experience in a similar position, within the VFX industry;
  • Excellent knowledge of Maya;
  • Excellent knowledge of Crowd software (Houdini crowd, Golaem);
  • Excellent sense of prioritization and respect of deadlines.


Additional Information

  • Full-time, Permanent Contract;
  • 5 paid sick days;
  • 2 additional statutory holidays in the winter holidays;
  • Group Insurance, access to Dialogue online support and to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP);
  • RRSP with employer contribution;
  • Discounts with Bixi, Bota Bota Spa, Nautilus Plus and many more local businesses.

Diversity is a core value at Rodeo FX. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. We believe every member on our team enriches our work by exposing us to a broad range of ways to perceive and interact with the world, identify challenges, and to design and deliver projects.

title: Lead Character Artist
description:
Company Description

People Can Fly is one of the leading independent AAA games development studios with an international team of hundreds of talented individuals working from offices located in Poland, UK, US, and Canada, and from all over the world thanks to our remote work programs.

Founded in 2002, we made our mark on the shooter genre with titles such as Painkiller, Bulletstorm, Gears of War: Judgment, and Outriders. We are one of the most experienced Unreal Engine studios in the industry and we are expanding it with in-house solutions called PCF Framework.

Our creative teams are currently working on several exciting AAA projects with the top publishers in the industry: Project Gemini with Square Enix and Project Dagger with Take-Two (2K), in addition to a new IP to be self-published and two other games in a concept phase. One of our IPs is also being adapted for VR technology.

With over 20 years of experience, now PCF sets to explore new horizons. We aim to combine our expertise with creativity of the best and most forward-thinking talents in the industry to work together on the new generation of action games for the global gaming community.

If you will decide to accompany us on this journey, you’ll have a chance to perfect your craft and expand your knowledge, working alongside leaders in the industry on bringing a brand-new unique experience to the players worldwide.

If you feel yourself able to deliver as nobody else, take ownership of your projects, and ready to leave a mark on a game you work on, apply now!

Job Description

  • Creating high-quality characters, complex creatures, and weapons both technically and artistically
  • Creating and tuning surface shaders for in-game characters
  • Working with Animators to ensure the character can be rigged and animated properly
Qualifications

  • 7 years of experience in developing character models and textures as a Senior Character Artist
  • Shipped game title experience (credits in at least one AAA title as a Character Artist)
  • Ability to create believable characters that are full of life and personality
  • Ability to create complex creature types from bipeds to quadrupeds and beyond
  • Ability to create highpoly and lowpoly models as well as textures.
  • Ability to adapt to, and innovate new styles and techniques
  • Experience with blendshapes
  • Strong organic modeling skills (human faces, clothing, believable creatures)
  • Strong hard-surface modeling skills (armor, weapons)
  • Very good knowledge of major 3D software packages (Maya, Max, ZBrush, Marvelous Designer, Substance)
  • High work ethic and self-motivated
  • Passion for Games


Additional Information

What we offer:

  • 20 paid vacation days, plus a week during Winter Holidays, and 5 sick days per year.
  • Free virtual health and mental wellbeing sessions included in the plan for members and their dependents.
  • A competitive salary and performance-based annual bonuses.
  • Personal development opportunities and ability to work in a global environment.
  • Work in a creative team with people full of passion for what they do.
  • Long term disability, short term disability, travel insurance, as well as other benefits provided.

 U.S

  • 100% group health insurance benefit premiums paid by PCF (Medical, Dental, Vision, Group Life, and Supplemental Live) and start on day 1 of employment.
  • 401K with 100% match, up to 3% of employee salary, and vested immediately.

 Canada

  • Benefit package 100% paid by PCF. Insurance company reimburses 100% of claims (Up to $500 per service a year, as well as individual family coverage).
  • Full Dental coverage, including major dental and orthodontics.
  • 4% RRSP matching before tax deductions, 100% vested on day 1.

title: Content Designer
description:
Job Details:
Job Title: Content Designer
Location: Toronto, ON
Duration: 12 months
Position Type: Full-time, Contract
Perks: This is an exciting opportunity to join a customer service-driven, team-focused company known for its supportive culture!

Job Description:
Our client, a highly reputable financial firm, is seeking an experienced Content Designer to shape the development of branded digital products. This is a full-time contract position offering competitive hourly pay based on experience. Responsibilities center on collaborating cross-functionally produce content that is tailored to the clients needs and interests. If you are a problem-solver who excels in a collaborative, team-focused environment AND you are excited to create products that will be used by millions of people, apply now! * Portfolio demonstrating Portfolio demonstrating copywriting, digital product and design work required for consideration.

Responsibilities:
  • Create strategies for using content to support clients' needs.
  • Facilitate collaborative design activities and ideation sessions.
  • Provide practical direction to the larger design team on Content Design communications standards, tools, channels, and processes.
  • Champion client needs and interests in discussions about the role of content in company products.
  • Create client-focused textual content, including labels, explanatory text, hidden or alternative text, metadata, and support content as well as go-to-market content.
  • Apply the principles of Inclusive Design in content design and creation.
  • Work with Legal, Compliance, and Regulatory teams to ensure that our digital conversations satisfy our legal and regulatory responsibilities.
  • Manage the documentation and sharing of content throughout its lifecycle.
  • Research content and messaging strategies in the competitive landscape and perform competitive audits pertinent to specific design or business goals.
  • Perform content audits where appropriate.

Requirements:
  • Bachelors degree or equivalent.
  • Experience writing for a mobile product.
  • Experience writing for loyalty and rewards programs.
  • Minimum 5+ years prior writing experience at a creative agency or in-house creative team required.
  • Portfolio demonstrating copywriting work.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and critical thinking skills.
  • A working knowledge of accessibility standards and methods to address them is preferred.
  • Must remain up to date on current and emerging design and technology trends.
  • Experience developing and working with design systems

Mindlance is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in employment on the basis of Minority/Gender/Disability/Religion/LGBTQI/Age/Veterans.

title: Actual Job Title - Visual Product Designer
description:
Are you looking to gain experience within a top 5 bank? Do you have experience managing a research
road map? If so, this is a great opportunity for you!

Our client, a top 5 bank, is looking for a Visual Product Designer for a 12 months contract in Toronto.
This position is working onsite.

Work Week: 37.5 hours per week
The client requires the candidate to be fully vaccinated in order to join.

Advantages
 Gain experience within a top 5 bank
 Opportunity to work with in a mature and cutting edge design group
 Strong chance of extension, and potential to flip to fulltime
 Start date is ASAP
 Competitive pay rate

Responsibilities
As a Visual Product Designer, your duties will include but not be limited to:
Working within agile team environments and an iterative process, collaborating with
interdisciplinary team members and stakeholders as you analyze, design and convey your
mobile and responsive design vision.
Involving in every step of the process from idea generation to implementation.
Understanding visual-spatial displays, and use that understanding to improve user
comprehension, and improve task performance
Creating visual components considering the broader context, to be used in multiple situations,
to bring about efficiency and consistency
Using dynamic visualizations to support analytic thinking with large data sets
Facilitating ideation sessions and collaborative work activities
Presenting visual design work to more senior stakeholders
Using a comprehensive understanding of visual design theory, research data and best practices
to inform design decisions
Designing high complexity visual artifacts for digital media (web or native app) to exchange
information, elicit emotion and facilitate interaction
Creating complex low-fidelity sketches, hi-fidelity mock-ups and prototypes to communicate
intent, or delivery specifications for development
Facilitating design critique, evaluate visual designs for inclusivity and provide expert advice and
guidance to cross-functional teams
Contributing practical direction to the larger design team on Company’s visual communication
standards, tools, channels, and processes
Facilitating usability testing
Participating in or initiate research activities
Researching visual design and communication strategies in the financial services sector and
perform competitive audits pertinent to specific design or business goals
Performing visual design audits where appropriate

Qualifications
BA/BS degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial),
HCI, CS, or a related field or equivalent experience
Portfolio that includes web and/or mobile design samples
Solid knowledge of design tools (Sketch, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, and presentation
software) and principles (typography, grid systems, visual hierarchy, colour, white space, etc.)
Understanding of responsive design
Experience in the agile process

Nice to have
Experience designing outstanding digital products and experiences
Proven ability to communicate conceptual ideas and design rationale, all within a user-centered
design process
Excellent problem-solving skills
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build good working relationships
Knowledge and/or experience in the agile process

Summary
Interested in the Visual Product Designer role in Toronto?  Apply online today!
Candidates moving towards the next step of the recruitment process will be contacted.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Visual Designer 2 - 17015
description:
Intermediate Visual Designer - Create awesome experiences for our customers.


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together
The Brand Experience team is seeking a Visual UI designer to deliver world-class experiences to our customers for all pages across telus.com/about, telus.com/impact, telus.com/wise and friendlyfuture.com. Working within a highly collaborative team, you will use your experience to develop UI components and user experiences in order to bring our web experiences to the next level,

As a Visual Designer, you will work closely with the Senior UX Designer to play a key role in crafting digital experiences for T customers in collaboration with cross-functional teams. As an advocate for customer-centric design, you will be a champion for visual design quality across initiatives through the consistent application of our digital standards and guidelines on both small and large scale projects.

As an advocate for customer-centric design, our digital standards and guidelines, you would be a champion for visual design quality across initiatives, small and large scope. You will be responsible for crafting visual concepts in response to new valuable services and marketing campaigns.

Here’s how
  • Resize image files with optimal web, mobile and tablet standards.
  • Collaborate closely with the UX designer, copywriters and content managers
  • Understand and utilize principles of visual design to create on-brand experiences
  • Visual QA of design mock-ups and staging environments
  • Cleaning up design files
  • Review and understand analytics and heat maps
  • Design landing and marketing pages from wireframes
  • Taking UX and interaction considerations for visual designs
  • Work with content managers and developers to ensure integrity of hi-fi mockups that match implementation
  • Solving design problems around the customer journey
  • Listen in to user testing and reviewing user testing reports
  • Make all content and state changes visibly distinct for people with disabilities
  • Attend design reviews and showcases to gain insight on best practices on other team
Must to have skills:
1. 2+ Years Visual Design Experience
2 Experience with Visual Design tools (such as Figma, Sketch, etc..)
3. Previous stakeholder interaction experience

Nice to have skills:
1. Previous branding experience
2. Previous Telecom Experience
3. Experience in an Agile Environment
